Job Summary:
The Data Analyst will be responsible for supporting the data and reporting needs of the Brokerage. This role will involve interacting with internal stakeholders for business problem formulation, requirements gathering, identifying relevant data sources or sub-processes in which to deploy new KPIs, communicating new data extract requirements, analyzing and synthesizing data from multiple sources, and ultimately producing high-quality insights that demonstrate a full narrative. This role requires a significant amount of collaboration. The successful person will be highly adaptable and able to prioritize multiple critical projects.
We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace.
Position Overview:
Advanced skills in data analysis and profiling, data mapping, data modeling, data lakes, and analytics
Data Analytics: AWS Quicksight and Redshift
Data Migration: solid in SQL and ETL
Scripting and Integration: REST APIs, GraphQL, Nodejs, AWS Lambda/API Gateway
Detailed Duties:
Applies scripting/programming skills to assemble various types of source data (unstructured, semi-structured, and structured) into well-prepared datasets with multiple levels of granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).
Lead the development of standard and customized reporting, dashboards, and analysis of information
Lead the development of tools, methodologies, and statistical models.
Provide hands-on development and support in creating and launchingvarious tools and reporting methods.
Develops analytical solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Works with various data owners to discover and select available data from internal sources to fulfill analytical needs.
Summarizes statistical findings and draws conclusions, presents actionable business recommendations. Presents findings & recommendations in a simple, clear way to drive action.
Uses the appropriate algorithms to discover patterns.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Job Requirments:
Education, Certification:
Post Secondary Degree – Computer Science, Information Technology or other relevant degrees with curriculum related to data structures and analysis
Minimum 5 years of experience as an analyst
Minimum 5 years of knowledge of business intelligence tools and programming languages
Advanced skills in data analysis and profiling, data mapping, data modeling, data lakes, and analytics
Data Analytics: AWS Quicksight and Redshift
Data Migration: solid in SQL and ETL
Scripting and Integration: REST APIs, GraphQL, Nodejs, AWS Lambda/API Gateway
Experience working with data mining and performing quantitative analysis
Experience with Machine Learning algorithms and associated data sets
Knowledge & Skills:
Business acumen results-oriented
Proactive/takes initiative/self-starter
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to create, coordinate and facilitate presentations
Time management, highly organized
Collaboration and Team Engagement
Analytical and Problem Solving
Data-driven/Metrics Driven

Who we are
Moneris was created as a joint investment between RBC and BMO Bank of Montreal (including Harris Bank) in December 2000. By maintaining the tradition of security and strength of our parent banks, today we are Canada's #1 processor, and one of North America's largest.
We are re-imagining commerce and shaping the future of FinTech. To do that, we empower our teams to redefine what's possible, enable them with the right tools and resources, and support them every step of the way.
Connect. Impact. Grow. Join one of Canada's top employers and make your mark at Moneris.
What you'll do
This role exists in order to analyze, design, develop, manipulate, business and financial data to influence and drive decision making as well as produce models to support business operations and business insight.
You will be accountable for:
Eliciting, analyzing and understanding business and data requirements to develop complete reporting and analytics solutions.
Executing on special projects / ad-hoc assignments as required with the ability to assume assignments that are moderate- to highly-complex and multi-faceted, to be performed under management guidance.
Conducting regular, on-going evaluation of current processes and provide guidance and recommendations to enhance the team’s overall performance.
Extensive SQL query skills to produce tableau dashboard reporting as well as ad-hoc analytics.
Design and development of data sources based on business requirements for reporting objects.
What you bring
Must-have experience, knowledge, skills & abilities
Undergraduate Degree, Technical Certificate or equivalent business experience.
5-7 years of experience working with various data sources and relational databases.
Must be able to clearly articulate analytical findings.
Must have superior skills in SQL
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) with proven ability to communicate technical and highly complex information.
Strong time management skills ability to prioritize and manage own workload in order to deliver quality results and meet timelines.
Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills with proven ability to interpret data, spot patterns and anomalies and provide insight.
What you get
Emphasis on Wellness - Meeting Free Fridays (MF2), company-wide holiday closure, just to name a few
Thrive in a Hybrid or Remote Model
Learning & development programs and resources - plus unlimited free access to LinkedIn Learning
EAP (Employee Assistance Program), Educational Assistance and Recognition Program
Employee perk program with incredible discounts for over 2,400 vendors and exclusive banking offers from BMO and RBC
Get involved in one or many of our Employee Inclusive Groups (EIGs) including Black Employee Network, Moneris Immigrants Society, 2SLGBTQIA+ EIG, just to name a few
Who you'll work with
As an integral part of the Moneris team, our Finance Department is made up of analytical and critical thinkers within five key functions: Controllership, Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), Corporate Data Analytics, Treasury. We are united by our mission to provide insights on key analytics and trends to support our teams in making the right business decisions. We are responsible for protecting the assets of Moneris and ensuring there are sufficient funds to support operations, merchant settlements, and growth.
Check out our careers hub to learn more about life at Moneris!
Note: We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

EXTERNAL JOB POSTING #124
Posted: 04 October 2022– 18 October 2022
Data Analyst
Clinical Services
One (1) Non-Unionized,
Permanent, Full Time Role
About Cota
Cota is an accredited, not-for-profit, community-based organization that has been supporting adults with mental health and cognitive challenges to live well within their communities for over 45 years. We provide person-centred support to help individuals find inspiration and hope in themselves, so they are better able to pursue meaningful change in their lives. We also work collaboratively with our funders, our partners and other stakeholders, across the provincial health and social service systems, to inspire positive change in the way services are delivered to individuals living with mental health and cognitive challenges.
Role Overview
We are seeking a dynamic and innovative professional. You should be passionate about supporting the delivery of safe, recovery oriented, client & family centered comprehensive services in manner that meets client needs. You will be excited to work within a quality improvement framework to identify opportunities for enhancing client outcomes as we continue to inspire and provide excellent support to our clients.
About the Team and Role Overview
The Data Analyst will be responsible for data collection, analysis and report generation in order to support various aspects of Cota’s operations, funder compliance obligations, quality improvement ambitions and strategic planning. While this position will prioritize the tracking, analysing and reporting on pertinent information pertaining specifically to Cota’s Transition Aged Youth (TAY) program, it is also expected to assist with other Cota-wide data analyst tasks and/or projects as may be requested by senior leadership, supported by the Director-MCCSS Funded Services and formally authorized by the Chief Executive Officer.
Summary of Duties:
Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to those below:
TAY Specific Tasks such as:
Produce analytics to determine capacity and demand in the transfer payment sector
Data collection per TAY service location/region
Produce key data sets to present client profile demographics
Development of a prioritization tool to assist in prioritizing TAY clients for transition to adult services
Report on program flow through to consistently meet targets for TAY client transitions to adult services
Develop data elements to present average costs per placement and report placement breakdowns
Responsible for the modification and enhancement of Cota’s current Quality Assurance Measure Audit Tool
Support Quality and Risk Specialist to collect and report data and trends from Serious Occurrence Reports to private operators and external stakeholders
Generate quarterly TAY performance dashboard report
Other Cota-wide tasks such as:
Creating and/or populating reports related to various performance indicators and/or outcome measures
Compiling data and/or generating statistical reports for funders and/or to inform programmatic and/or strategic decisions
Supporting quality improvement initiatives of the organization
Liaising with Cota’s electronic health record vendor(s) to recommend design improvements and resolve data integrity issues, ensuring the system is meeting the needs of the Agency
Conducting regular electronic health record data audits to ensure data integrity is maintained, timely resolution of any data inconsistences and implementation of mitigation strategies to avoid future errors
Maintaining thorough documentation of system standards, practices, processes
Other duties as assigned
Other Responsibilities:
Adheres to all Cota’s policies and procedures and follows established applicable program guidelines, procedures and practices.
Adheres to all applicable legislation, in particular, the Ontario Human Rights Code
Complies with all Health and Safety policies and procedures to ensure the protection of workers and clients and that health and safety concerns or incidents are responded to promptly.
Works cooperatively, respectfully and constructively with clients, team members, management, other service providers, and external stakeholders
Ensures that confidentiality of clients, employees and Cota information is maintained at all times.
Undertakes other related and/or delegated duties, as assigned
Summary of Qualifications:
Knowledge and Skills:
Understanding of health policy environment in the not-for-profit sector
Knowledge of Management Information Systems (MIS) software and Ontario Health Reporting System (OHRS). - Demonstrated ability to carry out special studies / projects that require independent judgment and initiative.
Proficient in the use of all corporate productivity tools including O365 package
Strong data reporting, statistical analysis and presentation skills
Proven ability to work effectively with internal and external stakeholders
Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills with proven ability to work effectively at an individual, organizational and systems level
Sound problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with experience translating technical information into practical language for stakeholders with varying degrees of technical proficiency
Advanced Microsoft Office skills required
Education and Experience:
A Minimum of 2 years of experience with statistical analysis, measurement and evaluation
Successful completion of either an undergraduate degree or college diploma in computer science or related field- Health Information Management preferred, or equivalent experience
Experience working with complex information systems, data analytics, business intelligent tools
Previous experience with client statistical reporting
Other Requirements:
The majority of working hours fall within regular business hours. Flexibility is required to ensure reports are generated in accordance with due dates
· Adhere to Cota’s COVID-19 Vaccination Status Disclosure policy
Proof of Full COVID-19 Vaccination status is required as a pre-condition of employment
Application Details:
Please forward a cover letter and your current resume (in one file) on or before October 18th, 2022 by 4:00pm to Human Resources via e-mail with the reference #124.
Cota’s Values & Commitment
Cota’s core values of Hope, Respect, Dedication, Collaboration and Innovation are at centre of who we are and what we do.
As an equal opportunity employer, we remain dedicated to sustaining an experienced workforce that reflects Cota’s commitment to recognizing everyone’s contributions, respect of everyone’s dignity, unique experience and potentials.
Cota will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout the course of employment.
Cota’s Accessibility Statement
Cota is committed to the principles of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). As such, we strive to make our entire hiring process as accessible as possible and provide accommodations as required for applicants with disabilities. For any recruitment related accommodation needs and/or requests please contact the HR Department via e-mail.
Additional Information:
COVID-19 announcement: Due to the current pandemic, Cota may choose to conduct parts/all of the hiring process virtually. Please note that as part of maintaining an agile workforce, all Cota staff may be required to be reasonably reassigned to support the operational needs of our essential services.
Scent Free: Cota encourages a scent-free environment. Any staff or visitor attending any of our sites should please refrain from wearing fragrances and other scented personal care products (i.e. perfumes, deodorants, lotions, hairspray, etc.)
We would like to thank all those that apply; however, due to high volumes of interests, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Thank you, Cota’s HR Department.

Ontario Health actively seeks candidates who are First Nations, Métis, Inuit, and urban Indigenous; Francophone; Black and racialized; members of 2SLGBTQIA+ communities; trans and nonbinary; and disabled.
Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity.
The Analyst is responsible for supporting the development of primary data analysis using Ontario’s health administrative databases and a concise set of evidence-based guidance with associated quality indicators that Ontario Health develops for topics identified as high priority areas for quality improvement. The Analyst will support in defining quality indicators, map them against currently available provincial datasets and provide advice around local measurement and new data collection where provincial data elements are insufficient.
The Analyst will use their research and data analytical skills and their knowledge of Ontario health care data to support the analyses of administrative and clinical data to identify areas in the Ontario health system that suggest quality gaps between current practice and optimal care. The Analyst will provide descriptive analyses on populations and service areas of interest, examine and interpret regional and institutional variations in utilization and outcomes, and compare data on practice patterns and performance with other health systems. The Data Analyst will identify and leverage the findings of relevant existing published research and combine this with their own primary data analysis.
The Analyst will be responsible for supporting the development of analytical methodology using health administrative and clinical data sources, creating internal and external-facing informational products, and deriving actionable insights to support quality improvement and performance management. As part of the role, the Analyst will work in cross-functional teams with stakeholders who have varying technical knowledge to identify analysis requirements, inform indicator development, prepare and analyze data to support other initiatives within the quality division. In collaboration with the Lead and Senior Analyst, the Analyst may be responsible for communicating information to program areas across Ontario Health and with external stakeholders, subject matter experts and organizations.
Here is what you will be doing:
Overall:
Contributes to Ontario Health’s mission to bring about meaningful improvement in health care by providing and supporting the use of analytics and evidence to identify unwarranted variation in care
Provide expert guidance on health care administrative databases in Ontario and provides advice on measurable areas for quality improvement related to Quality Standard topics or other projects
Analysis and Content Development:
Conduct the analysis of different sources of administrative and clinical data related to a broad spectrum of health care topics foci
Conduct quantitative analysis using Ontario’s Health administrative data and Intellihealth and/or CIHI portal applications
Inform and contextualize primary Ontario data analysis using peer-reviewed research and grey literature published in the topic area
Develop accessible presentations on analysis methods, results and conclusions for a wide range of audiences (including clinicians, administrators, policy makers, patients, families and caregivers)
Work with experts and available information to assess available provincial data sources in key areas and their suitability for measurement of key quality statements; identifies gaps in available data elements and measurement and options for filling these gaps at the provincial and local levels

Coordination/Collaboration:
Collaborates with Quality division colleagues:
Integrate analytics with colleagues’ work synthesizing clinical guidelines and other literature to develop quality statements
Summarize, analyze and assist with the preparation of documents and presentation material
Integrate data analysis and measurement-related content into presentations, reports and other documents
Develop other tools and products related to the quality standards and to support their implementation
Supports development of recommendations on quality indicators
Supports mapping of recommended indicators to existing data sources and make recommendations on data collection and reporting
Support calculation and reporting quality indicators selected for Ontario Health and external reporting platforms (e.g., public reporting, Quality Improvement Plans, personalized reporting vehicles)
Relationship Management:
Develops relationships with colleagues within team, across the organization and externally to understand business/operations activities and research needs, shares information, and provides assistance in understanding methodologies and results
Coordinates with internal and external stakeholders to execute project activities
Collaborates with internal colleagues to ensure projects are delivered on time and on budget
Here is what you will need to be successful:
Undergraduate degree in health services research, epidemiology, social or health sciences, biostatistics, mathematics, statistics, or another relevant discipline, Master’s preferred
3 years of experience using research analytical techniques
Experience working with statistical packages (SAS, Stata, R, etc.) is preferred
Experience with administrative and/ or clinical data in the Ontario setting
Experience working with IntelliHealth, CIHI Portal or similar health care data analysis platforms
Knowledge of health indicators (e.g., definitions, reporting periods, populations) preferred
Knowledge of data quality methodologies
Experience working with Microsoft Office software and applications, Excel, Word and Powerpoint
Knowledge and Skills
Expert knowledge of Ontario’s health care data to design and conduct analyses of administrative and clinical data to identify areas in the Ontario health system that suggest quality gaps between current best practice and optimal care
An understanding of health equity, including the social determinants of health and their impacts on health outcomes for different populations.
Experience with health equity data, patient experiences, and outcomes for specific populations would be an asset.
Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills, with demonstrated experience engaging and building relationships and consensus among diverse stakeholders
A novel thinker who enjoys generating and exploring innovative ideas and solutions
Strong attention to detail to ensure accuracy
Demonstrated initiative and independence to take appropriate action and anticipate organizational needs
Ability to seek and weigh opinions and evidence, compromising where necessary on ways and means but not on principles or goals
Ability to deal effectively with colleagues, stakeholders, and the public from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience
Capacity to work effectively in a rapid-pace work environment
Ability to complete tasks, as assigned, in a timely manner with high-quality results
Employment Type: Permanent Full-Time
Paygrade and Zone: 4B
Location: Ontario (currently virtual; subject to change)
All applicants must be a resident of Ontario to be considered for roles at Ontario Health.
Internal Application Deadline Date: September 19 2022
We encourage applicants with accessibility needs to notify us if they have any accommodation needs in the application and/or interview process.

We are looking for someone that can follow instructions well with a high level of attention to detail. Within your cover letter, please include your experience with Microsoft Excel.
A local market research start-up is looking for a jr research analyst, who possesses strong Excel skills, in downtown Toronto.
We are a team of 10 full-time employees + several part-time remote workers. We have built a solid customer base and are looking to expand and grow our brand in the coming years. Get in at the ground floor with room for advancement and the opportunity to develop your personal skills.
The role will involve working on projects for a wide variety of tier 1 & 2 companies across North America. We offer an array of survey consulting services and develop reporting models/frameworks to turn their data into actionable results.
Job Description Position:
Some of your contributions will include:
- Participating in program developments, questionnaire design and sample selection
- Managing online surveys for our clients
- Update clients on their survey progress
- Assist/Troubleshoot on any inquiries from survey participants
- Translating complex data and research outcomes into engaging and actionable formats for clients.
- Demonstrating exceptionally strong research design and core analytical skills
- Filter and “clean” data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
- Work closely with a small team to prioritize business and information needs
- Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
About you:
* University Degree (Preferably in Business, Economics, Information Management or Statistics)
* Solid working knowledge of Excel (Pivot Tables, VLooksUps, Filters, Graphing & Picture Tools, Macros, etc.)
* Strong report writing, analyzing, and attention to detail
* Detail & quality oriented
* Proven organizational skills and ability to prioritize / manage multiple tasks across simultaneous projects
* Great communication and storytelling skills, both verbal and written
* Any HTML/CSS coding skills is an added bonus

JOIN OUR TEAM

Metro Supply Chain is a strategic supply chain solutions partner for some of the world’s fastest growing and most recognizable organizations. We advance our customers’ business through innovative, real-world solutions within a culture that supports our communities, protects our environment and enables our team to thrive. Over the past 40+ years, we’ve grown into a significant operation of more than 80 sites across North America and Europe and 6,000 team members.

Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and attracting the best talent to drive the company forward.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Produce insightful business intelligence related to the Supply Chain Distribution Centres, Transportation teams, and Time Critical businesses globally
Strong strategic thinking and execution skills.
Effective communication style with a demonstrated ability to work with teams.
Produce insightful business analytics related to the distribution centres, transportation, contract packaging, and time critical teams.
Use historical data for decision and descriptive analytics transitioning to predictive modeling as a competitive advantage.
Using customer data to visualize, analyze, and simplify the performance picture it is not just boxes going from point A to point B.
Work proactively with key business partners to identify opportunities and to drive transformational business growth initiatives, which deliver customer and shareholder value and meet targets as agreed with company senior leadership.
Qualifications:
University/College degree in Data Science/Analytics, Engineering, or related field
Recent graduate OR 1-3 years of relevant experience with exposure to data visualization tools such as PowerBI and Tableau, building interactive reports, complex dashboards for different audiences, creating calculated KPIs or metrics by writing complex formulas
Data-mining capabilities with ability to evaluate data and derive actionable insight and make recommendations for continuous improvement
Problem solver with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives
CORE COMPETENCIES:
A high performing and motivated individual who is:
Creative, agile, and innovative, able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help shape our evolving strategy through building, launching, and managing initiatives/strategies producing results for our organization and customer.
Effective communication style with a demonstrated ability to work with teams.
Strategic thinker with strong execution skills
Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives
A strong business acumen and thrives on bringing data and numbers to life with excellent analytical and visualization skills
Project management skills
Humble intelligence and confidence
Great attitude and demonstrated ability to roll-up sleeves and work with team members in a hands-on capacity
Why Join Us
The opportunity to build a career with a growing company
Medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family
Life and disability insurance
Wellness programs to support your family’s well-being
A Retirement Savings Program with a company match
Employee Appreciation Day
Company sponsored social events
Community volunteering
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work & to take on progressively greater accountabilities
We are committed to building and fostering a diverse workplace where people feel included and valued. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals.
Should you require accommodation for a special ability or need during the recruitment process, please reach out to a member of our Human Resources Team. #HP

For the past 12 months, the Toronto Foundation for Student Success (TFSS) has been implementing a digital transformation to:
Strengthen its data management capabilities to support insight driven strategies and actions
Implement a digitally-enabled technology architecture
Provide staff with the digital tools and data to be aligned and empowered to deliver our services during and after the pandemic.
Overview of the Opportunity
This is a full-time position starting immediately. We continue to grow and with that growth comes the need to manage and analyze its data to support insight-driven strategies and actions. To fulfill that need we are looking for a data analyst to work with our Digital Transformation and Services Director, as well as management, to provide not only the right technical capabilities, including business requirements and data analysis, but also the right values and mindset to design, operate and improve the resulting digital data analysis and reporting services using an Agile-influenced approach to digital transformation.
We currently use the following cloud-based platforms to digitize its business operations and meet its data management needs:
Microsoft 365 Business Premium
Microsoft Power Apps and Dataverse platform
Microsoft Power BI
Blackbaud Raiser’s Edge and Financial Edge
What you will do
As our Data Analyst, you will report to the Digital Transformation and Services Director, to analyze business and data requirements and execute on a digital transformation plan you co-create with key stakeholders. You will work with team members to:
Create documentation for existing and new technologies implemented;
Manage Microsoft 365 Users;
Training Staff in better practices on cloud storage and document sharing;
Assess the organization’s requirements for digitally enabled processes and data analytics and reporting services;
Design the required business processes, user stories, data models, reports, dashboards and impact infographics;
Understand regulatory compliance requirements for the management of sensitive personal data;
Support the design and testing of digital solutions;
Support the project management office to schedule and prioritize user stories and solution enhancements; and
Train and support users to apply the digital solution and tools to meet their data management, reporting and analytic needs.
You will be working alongside a skilled and dedicated team with roles across the organizational functions. Core to your success will be:
Quickly understanding the organization, how it works and its strategy;
Working with stakeholders in the organization to create a set of business processes, data management and reporting requirements;
Up-to-date knowledge of relevant data modeling techniques and data analytics tools using Microsoft Dataverse platform and Power BI or equivalent low code, no code data management, reporting and analysis solutions;
The ability to analyze and tell a story with data to inform key strategic and day-to-day decision making in the organization; and
The ability to communicate your work and its value to others, to drive organization-wide engagement and excitement in what you are doing.
What you bring to the role
The position will require you to be self-directed, creative, innovative and flexible. We are looking for someone who has displayed strong leadership throughout their career to date.
You will think holistically about the organization and its data management and analytics needs to achieve our goals of rapidly identifying student needs that funders can support and providing the evidence of the impact of programs and services in meeting these needs.
It is important to us that you have done this before – meaning 1-3 years of relevant data analysis experience is required.
You are quick to pick up new technologies and tools. You ask questions and listen intently to establish organizational requirements and you consider and balance the needs of the organization and those that it serves with the most technologically sensible data management and analytics solutions.
You understand that training and organizational change is required during our digital transformation and that it is a process that requires you to bring others on the journey with you.
Qualifications and Skills
Microsoft 365 apps knowledge (SharePoint, PowerPoint, Advanced Excel) is a must. Computer literacy and fluency with systems such as Microsoft Office applications, especially data management in MS Excel, are must-haves for this position.
Writing skills: Must be able to create clear and consistent procedures to formalize business processes and to document analyses and track solutions.
Detail-oriented: It is essential to provide quality work at every stage of the process and to be organized.
Creativity: Creativity is encouraged to find solutions that will simplify the process, which will support operations, and maximize the use of tools.
Communication skills: Must be able to express ideas clearly to transmit the business requirements, operational, and functional requirements to development teams.
Awareness of emerging IT trends and directions.
Assets
Experience with Microsoft Power Apps, Dynamics 365 and Power Automate is a plus.
Working knowledge of Agile project methodology.
How to Apply
TFSS is committed to a policy of access and equity in its hiring practices. To learn more about who we are and what we do, please visit our website at www.tfss.ca.
Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No phone inquiries.
Please send a cover letter and a resume to the email listed.

Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity
This is a strategic and hands-on operational role, in which the individual provides analytical support for an integrated provincial network of over 60 public, hospital, and community laboratories.
Here is what you will be doing:
Here is what you will need to be successful:
Supports key metrics reporting as part of performance management for the labs in the Network
Tracks key performance metrics in order to develop reports that highlight insights and surface common trends from across regions for COVID-19 testing
Coordinates the completion of report materials, minutes, status updates, and provincial and regional dashboards of operational key performance indicators (KPIs) for the Lab Network
Collects daily data from laboratories and assists with data analysis to communicate performance and supply-related insights, trends, and findings to support operational and strategic decision-making
Builds relationships with Ontario Health stakeholders and coordinates the successful resolution of issues related to reporting within the Network
Collaborates with team members and uses best available information to ensure key senior stakeholders’ senior stakeholders in OH, MOH, and other agencies have the most accurate, clean, and timely information
Education and Experience
Post-secondary degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, Health Informatics, Data Analytics or a related health care field; Master’s degree preferred
2+ years of experience in the provision of expertise and services in the area of performance management, reporting and/or data analytics within the health care sector
Laboratory-related experience is an asset

Demonstrated ability to work alongside complex stakeholder groups, solve issues as they arise and help implement change

The Transportation Services Division is seeking seven Research Analyst 1 to join the Data & Analytics Unit. As part of the Policy & Innovation Section, the Data & Analytics Unit acts as a hub for data analytics and data management within the Transportation Services Division. The Unit is comprised of four teams: Data Operations (Emerging Mobility), Data Science (Safety & Mobility), Data Collection and Digital Products (MOVE).

The Unit is hiring for each of the following teams:

Data Operations - 2 positions: responsible for the Data & Analytics Unit's digital infrastructure including pulling, hosting, transforming, cleaning, validating, and publishing transportation data, as well as the testing and evaluation of new sources of data. The team additionally conducts analysis of Emerging Mobility such as car share and the vehicle-for-hire industry.
Data Science - 2 positions: responsible for using advanced data analysis, machine learning, and statistical methods to conduct analyses and build data tools to drive the development of and evaluation priority Divisional programs and projects with a focus on road safety and multi-modal network monitoring and performance.
Data Collection – 3 positions: responsible for designing and implementing multi-modal data collection and analysis projects, researching and integrating emerging data collection technologies and methods, managing and analysing cycling and other transportation data, developing processes and procedures to expand and modernize the data collection program, and assisting with the day-to-day operations of the data collection program.

Major Responsibilities:


Research Analyst 1 will apply their strong analytical skillset to a range of transportation problems. These are exciting opportunities to conduct research at the intersection of transportation and urban planning, big data, data analytics, data science, machine learning, data visualization, and smart cities topics to help the City of Toronto build and operate a better, safer, and more equitable transportation network for all road users.

Successful candidates will develop data analysis and digital infrastructure projects, support projects related to safety & mobility, emerging mobility, and critical Divisional programs such as ActiveTO, Vision Zero, the Cycling Network Plan, the Congestion Management Plan, Micromobility, Vehicle for Hire, and the Surface Transit Network Plan.

Data Analytics
Conducts statistical data analysis using a range of modern analytical techniques with programming languages and tools such as: Python, R, SQL, Jupyter Notebooks and JavaScript.
Processes, cleans, and manages spatial data using spatial databases (PostgreSQL/PostGIS) and GIS to support the development of web mapping applications.
Develops interactive web-based visualizations, reporting tools and dashboards.
Collects, analyzes, evaluates and synthesizes data to develop recommendations for improvements to existing Divisional projects, policies and services.
Identifies, monitors and interprets information on traffic and transportation networks to forecast problematic areas and future needs.
Actively searches out opportunities for process automation through the use of programming languages and tools.
Develops and administers reports on the performance of the transportation network using Prepares collision diagrams, flow maps, graphs, charts, and statistical reports for circulation throughout the Division
Provides evidence-based policy analysis support on a broad range of transportation topics and issues which may include economic, business and strategic infrastructure aspects.
Processes, cleans, and maintains transportation data, and manages data collection and analysis requests.
Develop recommendations for improvement by conducting pilot studies to assess transportation data collection technologies, software, methodologies, data management and/or computer systems.
Analyzes and evaluates collision, volume, speed and other transportation datasets.

Research
Conducts research relating to transportation, traffic, big data, data analytics, data science, machine learning, data visualization and smart cities topics in order to build an understanding of best practices.
Identifies and monitors emerging transportation data sources, including those with potential applications in current and future Divisional projects and programs.
Keeps abreast of current and emerging techniques and technologies in the fields of big data, data science and data visualization.
Prepares abstracts, reports, technical memos, maps, presentations of analyses and studies.
Summarizes findings by preparing static and interactive visualizations including maps, tables, graphs, charts, diagrams and graphics.
Researches best practices on transportation analytics and big data initiatives from academia and other municipalities and levels of government and prepares briefing notes, presentations and technical documentation.
Maintains an electronic library/catalogue of applicable research data, statistics, books, periodicals and reference material.
Plans, evaluates and conducts pilot studies to assess transportation analytics and big data technology, software, methodologies, data management and/or computer systems.

Communication
Prepares documentation on queries, routines and processes/procedures in support of initiatives, programs and day-to-day functions of the Data & Analytics Unit to facilitate the transfer of knowledge and consistent practices.
Attends meetings with staff, including the preparation of presentations for stakeholders on transportation statistics; networks with other Departments/Divisions, different levels of government, consultants, contractors and vendors to assess options and determine best solutions.
Liaise with and respond to inquiries from the public, City staff, consultants, contractors, external government agencies, elected officials, Toronto Police Service, etc.
Assists in the procurement of services and goods, including the preparation of Request for Proposals/Quotations and the evaluation of bids and proposals.
Writes reports, including the preparation of budgets and tracking of expenditures.

Key Qualifications:
Post-secondary degree or diploma in Civil or Transportation Engineering, Planning, Computer Science, Project Management with relevant experience and/or an approved equivalent combination of education and experience. A post-graduate degree would be considered an asset.
Considerable experience in research, data collection, or interpreting, summarizing and visualizing data.
Considerable experience using Python, R, SQL or other equivalent tools for advanced data analytics, interpretation of data, statistical modelling, or other equivalent tools.
Experience with databases and data warehousing including organizing, compiling, manipulating, analyzing and summarizing large datasets.
Experience using the Microsoft Office Suite (i.e., Excel, Powerpoint, Access, Word).

You must also have:
Knowledge in urban planning, traffic engineering and/or transportation planning.
Experience with GIS (Geographic Information Systems), spatial analysis, spatial databases, cartography and mapping.
Knowledge of machine learning including supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, pattern recognition, artificial neural networks, and deep learning.
Experience with interactive data visualization, interactive mapping, web development, data product and dashboard development.
Excellent oral and written ability to communicate effectively and the ability to present research and analysis findings effectively.
Strong analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills, together with an ability to take initiative, multi-task, and work under time constraints, and exercise good judgement. Ability to provide excellent customer service and liaise with the public, contractors, and staff in other service areas.

Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!
The opportunity
Our Data Solutions team in Toronto is looking for a new Data Analyst to join us in a hybrid position. You will be part of a highly motivated, multi-disciplinary team of professionals focusing on developing key commercial and residential trends across Canada. You will leverage our proprietary data to provide market intelligence that will guide internal and external decision-making. You will support the generation of monthly and quarterly reports related to Canada's housing markets by preparing the background files and associated analytics. You will liaise and collaborate with industry professionals and information partners to achieve objectives and maintain the consistent and timely provision of market trends.
What's in it for you
Exposure and career growth. You will be part of an organization that works on an exciting range of commercial property projects across the country, a place recognized at the top of our industry. You will gain access to our proprietary databases used by the global industry and gain insights into our services and the Canadian development market. You will be mentored and grow your knowledge as you foster relationships with internal team members and have the chance to work on a variety of deliverables from research to data entry, from report writing to drafting property descriptions.
What you will do:
Analyze. You will develop quality assurance procedures for data, evaluating for completion and accuracy. You will process and analyze data sets, synthesize information for market research, create dashboards, and develop models and charts. You will play a key role in expanding our commercial and residential real estate market analytics .
Collaborate. You will work with the research consulting and marketing teams in developing, visualizing and writing periodic market trend reports covering various real estate sectors. You will support the Manager, Research Insights, with the market forecast initiative.
Grow your knowledge. You will attend industry events and meetings, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, and benchmark best practices.
You will have:
The education and experience. You have a university degree or college diploma in Urban Planning, Geography, Economics, Finance, Business, Real Estate or a related field and 1+ years of experience in real estate research. Ideally, you have exposure to both the Canadian housing market and the commercial real estate or development industry. You have professional writing skills to competently author trend reports.
The technical skills. You are proficient in MS Office and Tableau. You have excellent research, and analytical skills. You can process and analyze data sets, synthesize information for market research, create dashboards, and develop models and charts.
The drive. You can take the initiative and be resourceful, operating with a high degree of integrity, honesty, and ethics.

The Operations Analyst is accountable for providing ERP, Planning, Scheduling, and Inventory Management related assistance as needed to support activities at the CSG Toronto site and is responsible for ERP maintenance related activities such as product part and structure management. Work in conjunction with supply and demand teams to identify opportunities for improvement. Areas of opportunity may include gaps in ERP functionality related to Planning/Scheduling and Supply Chain, process documentation, data quality management and metric/health check development.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
A) Day to Day Management:
Provide ERP planning, scheduling and inventory management support to the operations team.
ERP (IFS) product structure management: Part setup, structure/routings adjustment (ie. BOMs, work guidelines, planning parameters), troubleshooting/training, document management, sales inquiries (ie. sizes/cut lengths) and cost adjustments in alignment with engineering consultation as needed
Provide supply chain support as needed: manage Purchase Orders (POs) and Distribution Orders (DOs) to intercompany sites

Data quality management: review ERP system data to increase data accuracy, validity, and reliability of information. Review health of planning system as per the defined health checks/metrics
Provide planning & scheduling support in the absence of other planning & scheduling team members as needed (ie. create FPOs)
B) Continuous Improvement:
Continuous improvement (CI) and standardization of the “end to end” planning, scheduling and inventory management practices in the Americas region.
Maintain robust tools/processes for;CO/DO/SO dating
CO/DO/SO ERP exception managementS&OP ProcessCO to DO to SO process flowInventory managementCapacity Planning & Management
Develop and maintain planning & scheduling process documentation (ie. SOPs, process flows)

Develop and implement inventory strategies to optimize inventory levels of FG/SFG and lead-time
Identify opportunities for improvement to utilize the ERP system more effectively and to minimize non-value-added activities used in executing the planning and scheduling function
C) Human Resource Management:
Interface and collaborate with personnel and functional groups effectively to determine areas of opportunity
Ensure positive employee relations and a commitment to safety
Develop and maintain positive relations with all customers (internal/external) for any process changes and implementations

Less than 6 months experience in a relavant role

Experience with ERP system implementation is an asset

Strong data management skills
Solid understanding of manufacturing operations and methodologies
Must be well organized and have strong interpersonal skills
Highly developed analytical abilities
Continuous improvement mindset

Canada Goose isn't like anything else. We've built something great, something special - an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. Job Description

Job Purpose:
The Analyst, Research & Insights assists with the execution of all primary and secondary consumer research at Canada Goose. Leveraging technical expertise in qualitative and quantitative research, the Analyst assists the delivery of meaningful consumer-driven insights to the organization.
The Analyst is part of a team that acts as the ‘face of’ consumer research at Canada Goose and is required to assist the Research & Insights (R&I) team with the creation and delivery of actionable reports, presentations, and recommendations to internal audiences. The Analyst will also be part of a team that partners with internal stakeholders to understand key business questions, and drive engagement, understanding, and action through consumer insights.
Key Responsibilities:
Assist the R&I team with all ad hoc/custom research projects conducted on an ongoing basis that supports marketing, product, and commercial priorities. These projects encompass the following areas:
Brand health tracking
Consumer segmentation
Marketing effectiveness tracking
Creative testing
Market scoping and understanding
Cultural deep dives of key Canada Goose markets
Shopper and retail research
Consumer trends
Product testing
Assist with the day-to-day management of multiple custom research projects (both quantitative and qualitative research studies)
Assist the development of research plans to match business objectives outlining methodology, timing, deliverables
Assist with writing questionnaires for ad-hoc research studies, program basic surveys, and test survey links
Assist in conducting secondary research related to business questions
Pull data for research reports
Conduct quality assurance tasks, including number checking reports to ensure accuracy
Code open-ended/qualitative data for themes
This is a very hands-on position with executional accountabilities

Experience, Education and Designations:
Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree in business, consumer behavior, market research or quantitative discipline an asset
2+ years experience working in a consumer insights position within the consumer brands and retail industry
Knowledge and experience with a variety of qualitative and quantitative research methods and techniques across multiple markets
Exposure to customer driven, service oriented, entrepreneurial environments
High proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel) and Outlook
Proficiency in SPSS or other data analysis software
Proficiency in Qualitative analysis software
Experience both on client and supplier side of consumer insights an asset
Knowledge of fashion and apparel industry an asset

Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:
Deliverable Development: able to create simple, compelling, and visual deliverables that assist in communication of research & insights to business audience
Research Methodology & Expertise: awareness of and experience with a broad range of research methodologies and technique
Project Management: able to manage multiple projects, internal and external stakeholders, competing priorities. Highly organized.
Analytics & Insight Development: able to understand business research objective, interpret consumer research data, and develop actionable insights for the business
Communication & Presentation: able to verbally communicate research and insights to executive business audiences in a succinct and inspirational manner
Proactive Attitude: Entrepreneurial, creative, and resourceful; Self-starter with exceptional work ethic
Collaborator: An effective listener who seeks to understand first and offers positive/flexible solutions; High degree of emotional intelligence and able to build effective working relationships

Working Conditions:
Office environment (hybrid work model)

The Performance Analyst is responsible for evaluation of health and service provider performance (financial, service activity and local performance outcomes) in accordance with performance/accountability agreements for both Performance and Ministry defined goals.
Here is what you will be doing:

Analyzes provider planning submissions, and supports development and negotiation of Service Accountability Agreements with providers.
Assists in monitoring HSP compliance with Ontario Health reporting requirements and enforces the Ontario Health policy for non-compliant providers.
Monitors data quality of submissions and works with health service providers to improve overall data quality.
Assists with financial and statistical data extracts, data analysis and interpretation.
Performs analysis of assigned Health Service Providers (HSP) financial and statistical performance by validating and reviewing financial and statistical reports, flagging key issues and risks, and escalating follow up recommendations.
Monitors health service provider’s financials to identify surplus for reallocations, or flag other key financial concerns.
Collaborates to monitor health service providers’ service activity and performance, and flags key issues, concerns, and required escalations.
Benchmarks and analyzes relevant outcome, financial and statistical indicators for Health Service Providers to identify and escalate risk as appropriate through the Quarterly Review and Escalation process in an effort to generate improvement.
Prepares user friendly reports and utilizes feedback for improvements.
Performs risk management analysis, based on sample data, and extrapolates and summarizes information.
Develops or assists in the creation of SQL reports, analysis, dashboards and other reports/ scorecards as required;
Leverages OCDM and HBAM impact on Hospital Health Service provider operations.
Participates in data collection and analysis to support evaluation of the impact of Ontario Health investments.
Provides education and guidance to HSPs on OHRS standards and reporting requirements.
Prepares and makes presentations to large audiences.
Provides support and/or makes contributions as part of the Quarterly Review and Escalation Process in order to determine solutions for system improvements;
Consults with various department managers to ensure continuity of service across all sites and ensures efficient support requirements are being met;
Provides contract expertise and interpretation to staff, management, and health service providers to ensure contract compliance;
Collaborates with Senior Management to identify strategies and solutions to non-routine problems where information and precedence are not available;
Other duties as assigned

Here is what you will need to be successful:
Education and Experience
Post-secondary/Master’s degree in business administration, health analytics or the equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Bachelor’s degree required.
Minimum of 1-2 years relevant experience carrying out performance and financial data analysis, utilization analysis, and evaluation and reporting. Preferably in the health-care sector.
Intermediate to Advanced knowledge of Excel, including usage of pivot table; advanced formulas.
Intermediate knowledge of MS Office · Detailed oriented and problem solver
Excellent customer service skills
Knowledge and Skills
Good knowledge of performance improvement approaches used in healthcare and community care settings.
Good knowledge of analysis methods, and performance management, and risk management applications.
Proficient knowledge of Microsoft applications including the ability to design complex spreadsheets and databases
Good knowledge of technology products and services regarding quality analysis and data collection
Knowledge of MOH legislation and guidelines related to Ontario Health mandates,
Knowledgeable about local Ontario Health Service Provider and Supplier contracts related to patient services processes, community resources and community health partners
Knowledge of CHRIS, Health Partner Gateway, Fortis/Document Management Systems, ETMS, Policy Tech, Quadrant, other internal systems software as applicable.
Previous experience in a quality analysis and improvement environment
Strong knowledge of outcome measurement and proven ability in using statistical approaches to data analysis
Knowledge of healthcare reporting requirements, and CIHI guidelines regarding the Home Care Reporting System (HCRS)
Effective problem solving skills, organizational, time management, analytical and ability to multi-task and co-ordinate
Solid project management skills
Maintains positive relationships with colleagues and external stakeholders
Good negotiation, collaboration and mediation skills
Works cooperatively as a member of the Corporate Services Team with minimum supervision
Effective oral and written communication skills
Listens closely to requests for information, confirms understanding and purpose, assists in providing options to extract and analyze data, communicates results while ensuring customer understands the limitations on how the information can be used
Good relationship building skills to work effectively with internal and external stakeholders and to participate effectively as a member of a project team
Exercises tact and discretion in handling sensitive and confidential information and issues
Communicates complex information in a meaningful way to managers, staff, and service providers

Who we are
As the Working and Learning Company, we at Staples Canada, are dynamic, inspiring partners to our customers and the communities in which we live. At Staples, we inspire people to work smarter, learn more and grow every day. We look for people who are curious, approachable and passionate, and who enjoy finding solutions.
If that’s you, let’s work, learn and grow together.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team
Staples Canada is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do
As the Pricing Analyst, you will support the execution of Staples Canada’s pricing strategy and ensure that pricing best practices and policies are consistently adhered to. You will be required to work with complex data sets to help Staples determine and set competitive prices to gain market share and achieve revenue goals while maintaining a keen attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced environment. This role requires strong analytics to consider data from multiple sources and support complex pricing models that reflect margins for promotional and seasonal pricing based on competitor and market. You will work collaboratively with various departments to support strategies and enhance process and procedures related to pricing.

Specifically, you will:
Perform in depth data analysis and financial modelling scenarios for pricing profitability initiatives, driving the company’s long-term growth profitability strategy.
Complete analysis and make recommendations to optimize retail pricing and promotions, improve financial results, processes and business improvements.
Maintain regular retail pricing strategy.
Utilize quantitative and qualitative methods to analyze and monitor market conditions, competitor price positioning and promotional trends.
Ensure adherence to pricing policies, rules and guidelines.
Support the development of metrics, data and reporting for pricing, markdowns and promotions to measure impacts and performance.
Provides analysis and insight to merchants on markdown effectiveness.
Coordinate, collect and analyze competitive retail prices.
Continually improve support to the business through assessing needs and providing forward looking insight to assist in the development of standardized reports and ad hoc requests.
Run price optimization scenarios and make recommendations to business partners to maximize sales and profitability.
Collaborate with the various departments to translate complex data into actionable strategies and techniques to drive sales.
Continuously looks for opportunities to improve processes and deliver more meaningful insights.

Some of what you need
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Finance, Economics, Analytics or related field
2-3 years of large retailer experience in merchandising, pricing or promotional planning
Knowledge of retail pricing psychology and fundamentals
Ability to analyze big datasets and interpret data to provide actionable insight.
In depth knowledge of SQL, advanced knowledge of Excel and excel automation using VBA
Proficiency in building dashboards using Microsoft Power BI
Exposure to coding and Machine Learning in Python would be a plus
A creative problem solver with the ability to work independently and be self motivated in a fast-paced, often ambiguous and rapidly changing environment.


Additional information
Hybrid work Environment

Vaccine Requirement
Staples is committed to taking every reasonable precaution to protect our associates, our customers and the communities we operate in. To support the health and safety of our associates, COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this position. As such, all offers of employment will be conditional upon either (i) proof of full COVID-19 vaccination or (ii) proof of need for accommodation under relevant human rights legislation, and Staples determination that the requested accommodation can be provided without undue hardship. You will be required to submit proof of full vaccination or proof of need for accommodation during our background screening process.

Job Description:
Do you have a passion for data? Do you like analyzing numbers to provide meaningful insights? Do you like making an impact on the business around you? A role as Data Analyst at Sun Life Financial might be right for you!
We are looking for a Data Analyst in the Business Intelligence team. The Data Analyst will support the development of new reports/tools, recurring report generation, analysis of key results, and ad hoc investigation for the Client Engagement teams, providing actionable insights to drive the business forward.
The incumbent will also provide project support, acting as an advocate for data issues as well as representing the business needs for our stakeholders. The Business Intelligence team comprises of business data analysts at various levels of increasing responsibility and scope, providing a great career path for the right candidate
What will you do:
Work closely with business stakeholders to transform complex business problems into addressable analytical questions and queries
Operationalize reporting processes and synthesize key metrics into impactful and insightful dashboards to monitor and assess the success of the business initiatives
Ensure the accurate and timely completion of all baseline reporting, ad-hoc requests and project initiatives.
Prioritize projects on a monthly basis and align with leaders of the business team
Stay abreast of Client Engagement processes and results, raising emerging trends and continuous improvement ideas to Management
Enable leaders to make timely data-driven product, market-development, and distribution decisions.
What do you need to succeed?
3+ years’ experience in a Data Analyst or Performance Analyst role
Advanced SAS Enterprise Guide or SQL Server/ MySQL
Advanced experience with visual analytics tools e.g. Tableau
Advanced Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Access, Visual Basic
Experience/exposure to Big Data tools (i.e. Hive, Python)
Customer and results focused, with an ability to work with stakeholders to understand and act based on their needs, assess risks, and achieve a valued result
Comfortable with ambiguity and able to operate in a matrix environment with complex tasks
Proven problem solving skills with the ability to break down high-level data into easily communicated information
In-depth prioritization, planning, and change management skills to stay within time/scope of a task in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new applications and processes quickly with minimal direction
Proven client orientation, strong interpersonal skills
Undergraduate in Business, Statistics, Computer Science (or equivalent university degree or college diploma)
Experience in assessing marketing campaigns in various channels (establishing control, measuring ROI)
Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)
What's in it for you?
Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US.
Named 2021 “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor
Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021
Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer.
Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture
Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.

The main function of a Data Analyst is to coordinate changes to computer databases, and test, and implement the database by applying knowledge of database management systems.
A typical Data Analyst is responsible for planning, coordinating, and implementing security measures to safeguard the computer database.

Review project requests describing database user needs to estimate the time and cost required to accomplish the project.

The Product Analyst role is designed to help improve TELUS Cloud Collaboration and Conferencing product performance. The analyst will be analyzing product data, sales enablement content, processes and tools. This analysis will support informed change management and decision-making. The analyst will not only analyze but also execute on changes to content, processes, and tools. Qualifications

Analyze financial and contract data to identify billing and revenue assurance improvements supporting profitability. Report on findings on data analysis and recommended solutions. Execute on approved solutions
Analyze product sales enablement, and process content posted online within the corporate intranet, and within google g-suite, and SharePoint. Report on findings on data analysis and recommended solutions. Execute on approved solutions
Analyze sales enablement tools, and models. Report on findings on data analysis and recommended solutions. Execute on approved solutions

Job Description

Job Purpose:
Along with the newly developed consumer-centric strategy to put our customers at the centre of what we do, we are looking for an Analyst to join our growing team. The Analyst, Customer Analytics will support, discover, and communicate valuable insights across the entirety of the business: with a focus on analyzing data on our customers at various commercial channels. This position will support the Customer Analytics Manager with developing and managing consumer cohorts and creating further value creation from Customer Machine Learning models to enabling consumer centric applications for the organization. Working across a multitude of stakeholders, this role will additionally support current measurement and reporting and own the delivery of future insights.
Key Responsibilities:
Consumer Centricity
Collaborate, develop and execute consumer centric initiatives
SME for analytics to participate and offer guidance/ recommendations on inception of KPI development to implementation and performance analysis
Provide data driven insights to various stakeholders proactively to offer value addition to the organisation.
Customer Analytics
Support development of Customer Analytics roadmap of Canada Goose
Manage access, configuration, and maintenance of customer data platform (CDP) and bi-directional data integration for external applications
Liaise with operations, logistics, finance and supply chain teams frequently for on-going business processes and optimization projects
Coordinate on-going data lake development via ingesting new data sources, managing legal compliance (GDPR, CCPA) and assisting in quality assurance
Work with various stakeholders to ensure that data is up to date, accurate and compliant with all data protection and governance.
Create, develop and track various models built within the Customer Data Platform.
Reporting and Adhoc Analysis
Develop and operationalize data into reporting platforms for stakeholders via adhoc and automated reports from multiple data sources
Manage and provide accessible insights using various visualization software at multiple timeframe cadences
Process mapping various internal best practices and coordinating collaboration sessions across various stakeholders.
Understand business challenges and opportunities and identify where the use of customer data can support the business.
Problem Solving and Consultative Projects
Support think-tank based gathering of data and delivery of insights
Prime cross-departmental projects as per department/organization vision
Revenue Gain and Protect deliverables to futureproof commercial delivery and mitigate risks
Analyze industry trends from various sectors and anticipate further opportunities or concerns.
Experience, Education and Designations:
Bachelor or Diploma Education in Business/Economics/Computer Science/Math or relevant experience
Preferred 2+ years’ experience in Retail or eCommerce working environment (product development analytics, pre/post purchase customer journey, customer analysis)
Preferred 2+ years’ experience in data project management and insights delivery via various communication channels (i.e. data visualizations, in-person presentations etc.)
Required experience using SQL or logic queries and intermediary level in statistics (T-Test, Z-test, ANOVA, Linear regression, Chi-square test)
Experience with following tools: Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, customer data platforms
Experience with visualization software: Google Data Studio, PowerBI, Looker, Tableau
Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:
Ability to translate data into information via various communication techniques
Problem solver and willingness to take on challenges in unfamiliar territories
Neutral/unbiased view of data and objectively offer guidance with context
Attention to detail and time/priority management
Presentation and Data Story telling
Working Conditions:
Office environment (with multiple screens)
Limited Travel

The Business Intelligence Analyst will work as a partner with our cross functional teams to provide day-to-day analytical support to solve problems, ensure successful financial performance, challenge the status quo, and communicate risks. This role will also work closely with key stakeholders to develop/maintain financial forecasts (monthly/quarterly/annual) and assist in the development of the annual budget.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Responsible for maintaining the integrity and performance of BI Data Warehouse/Databases. This will include the ETL of raw data, cleansing and processing the data for reporting and analytics
Design, create and manage a BI process to support responsive and proactive decision making
In partnership with business SME's, acquire, connect, manage, and analyze various data sources with the objective of developing intelligence reports, analytics sharing business recommendations
Ensure meeting all response time SLAs with internal stakeholders
Partners proactively with key stakeholders for the annual business planning process for financial budgets including Revenue, SG&A, Payroll planning & forecasting
Conduct analysis, forecasts, and develop insights to manage company performance against objectives
