Centennial College recognizes and affirms Diversity, Equity and Inclusion and Indigenous ways of knowing as central to the vibrancy and uniqueness of its learning and working academic mission. We strongly encourage applications from members of Indigenous communities and all equity-deserving groups including Women, Racialized, Persons with Disabilities, and LGBTQ+ communities.
We also recognize that Centennial is situated on the Treaty Lands of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and pay tribute to their legacy as well as that of all First Peoples that have been and remain present here in Toronto. We recognize that First Peoples come from sovereign Nations and that part of understanding our responsibilities of residing on this territory are understanding the true history, circumstances and legacy of the Treaties signed here (such as the Toronto Purchase, Robinson-Huron Treaty and Williams Treaties) and including pre-contact Treaties and Agreements between sovereign Nations and that all peoples in this area are therefore Treaty people with obligations and responsibilities to all our relations.

Position Summary
The Strategic Research & Data Analyst - Program Quality supports all research activities undertaken for program review in the Centre for Academic Excellence and Program Quality (AEPQ). This includes conducting primary and secondary research activities, data input and analysis, and creating data visualizations for the Annual Program Review (APR) and Comprehensive Program Quality Review (CPQR) processes for Centennial College’s academic programs. Using an evidence-based approach, this position supports academic program teams in ensuring their academic programs meet institutional, ministry and college quality assurance expectations.
Working with the Manager and Program Quality team, the Strategic Research & Data Analyst - Program Quality identifies, sources, collects, prepares, and analyzes information from multiple sources and data sets relevant to each program under APR and CPQR. This includes creating visualizations from quantitative and qualitative data, preparing surveys and facilitating focus groups to gather stakeholder feedback for use in the review processes. Upon completion of the APR and CPQR cycles, the Strategic Data Analyst – Program Quality executes program, school and college level analysis of the aggregate data, creating reports and/or dashboards. The incumbent will also liaise with the Data Analytics and Research Office (DARO) on institutional level data required for quality assurance processes.
The Strategic Research & Data Analyst - Program Quality assists the APR and CPQR Leads in understanding data provided, identifying trends affecting the program’s enrolment and quality, and in understanding how to use the collected data in their analysis and final report, reviewing sections of draft CPQR reports to identify inaccuracies and/or gaps in the analysis of the data collected. This requires a strong background, understanding and competency with research design, statistical analysis, competitive market behaviours, benchmarking, and applicant search processes.
The Strategic Research & Data Analyst – Program Quality also provides research and data support for projects and reports to the AEPQ and various academic departments within the College.

Responsibilities
Provides support to program teams, CPQR Leads and academic leadership; reviews and updates APR and CPQR report templates, provides guidance on the development of survey templates, identifies relevant data sources, and creates and presents slides for APR and CPQR information sessions
Conducts data searches to collect relevant data to support program teams as they complete the APR and CPQR reports to meet college, CQAAP and PEQAB requirements. This includes KPI enrolment, retention and attrition data from defined sources, as well as sourcing data from undefined sources as applicable
Conducts data analysis activities at the program, department, school and college level, creates visualizations to represent and illustrate findings and trends, and provides recommendations
Prepares, plans and coordinates surveys and focus groups with program team leads, including reviewing and guiding question creation, preparing and providing survey links, corresponding with focus group participants, collecting, analysing, interpreting and packaging the results for program team leads, and posting results and raw data for program teams to use in quality processes.
Identifies other sources of information and data, such as comparator programs, program competitive advantage, market demand, etc., through internet searches, Centennial offices, and other organizations and professional accreditation associations.
Presents information and data to CPQR and APR Leads, assists with the identification of trends and important issues for consideration in developing action plans in their reports.
Develops and facilitates training sessions and one-on-one meetings with program quality Leads and faculty teams focused on data interpretation and evidence-based response writing.
Reviews CPQR draft reports to identify gaps in the data analysis and suggest improvements, tracks the APR completion status. Maintains currency of available data sources, both internally and externally to the college, and their alignment to QA processes, as well as best practices in qualitative and quantitative data analysis.
Identifies gaps in college processes or systems, and suggests appropriate software and systems to improve data analytical capacity in the department
Provides research support such as literature reviews, data collection and analysis and conducting research as directed by Manager, Program Quality in accordance with defined requirements, prepares draft reports based on analysis of research conducted.
Creates and maintains reporting dashboards, as appropriate

Qualifications/Experience
4-year degree related to Data Analytics, Quantitative/Qualitative Research Methods, Market Research and Analytics, or equivalent combination of education and work experience
Completion of a post-graduate Research Analyst program an asset
Minimum three (3) years’ experience with
Coordinating and facilitating meetings/presentations,
Conducting research analysis (including stakeholder satisfaction surveys and focus groups)
Qualitative and quantitative research methodologies
Market research and analytics
Interpreting and presenting data and information for use by others, including creating data visualizations and dashboards
Experience with academic program review processes and familiarity with college systems preferred
Highly developed working knowledge of research/analytical skills/reporting functions preferably in a post-secondary educational institution to identify related issues, develop draft reports.
Extensive experience in a computer-networked environment/with various microcomputer applications to develop information systems and conduct database research.
Demonstrated advanced knowledge of statistical packages including qualitative and quantitative data analysis software, survey software packages, and Microsoft Excel
Experience with SPSS, R Programming and Qualitative data analysis software an asset
Superior communication (oral, written and presentation) and relationship management skills
Strong understanding and commitment to working within a highly diverse and inclusive work environment
High attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to work under pressure managing and capable of leading multiple projects in a highly diverse, agile and deadline-oriented environment
Self-directed with high initiative and ability to work independently

Apply online: www.centennialcollege.ca/careers
Proof of credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post secondary institutions and/or their foreign equivalents will be required at the time of job offer.
When applying, your cover letter and résumé must include examples that reflect all of the requested skills and qualifications and must be submitted online by October 21, 2022 at 11:59 PM EST. Please quote Job ID J0922-2095. Misrepresentation of applicant information will be grounds for your exclusion from the competition or for dismissal should you subsequently be hired for the position. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
We are committed to providing persons with disabilities equal opportunities regarding all employment activities, including access to jobs and accommodations during employment as required, in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC) and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Job Description
The Wealth Investment Office (WIO) team is TD Wealth’s source for investment management and strategy. We empower advisors and portfolio managers across TD Bank Group’s Wealth Management division — including Financial Planning, Private Investment Advice and Private Investment Counsel — by giving them the knowledge and tools they need to execute a scalable and consistent approach to portfolio management. WIO is a place for professionals who love to manage money and get excited about the opportunity to consult with others on how to build and manage investment portfolios. This is not a place for people stuck in neutral. WIO is a dynamic, multifaceted, multi-channel group working on numerous priorities and initiatives in a fast-paced environment.

The group provides holistic investment advice, portfolio construction, management and across a broad range of investment methodologies including traditional, endowment and risk-aware allocations. WIO is the engine behind the Wealth's investment strategy process and allocations. WIO also manages the Risk Priority Portfolios, Core Quant Portfolio, and the investment manager behind the TD Core Managed Equity Portfolio. In addition, WIO plays a role in the education and ongoing support of TD Wealth advisors through numerous internal and client-facing publications, as well as conferences, presentations, seminars and one-on-one communications to advisors.

The successful candidate will:
Understand the managed assets product spectrum
Develop a deep understanding of the firm's fee-based and managed account platforms as well as the recommended managed products and portfolio solutions.
Support WIO’s delivery of managed investment solutions to TD Wealth's Canadian advisors through its portfolio consultancy team.
Provide portfolio construction guidance and support for advisors requiring customized solutions. There will also be a requirement to assist with Requests for Proposals and conduct portfolio reviews for advisors
Interpret managed product research from TD's internal investment manager research group.
Be the first responder to advisor managed investment inquiries and provide investment guidance and portfolio construction advice.
Be able to manipulate data from a variety of sources, using Excel and other software, to provide insights and action plans on Advisor portfolios and books' if business.

Key accountabilities include:
Be a first responder to field inquires and Portfolio Review requests.
Contribute to a daily conference call highlighting relevant research and market-related news for the advisors
Field and respond to advisor inquiries and requests for information regarding managed investments
Participate in advisor training and branch presentations as required
Support the building of and follow-up on Request for Proposals
Develop a deep understanding of TD Wealth's fee-based and managed account platforms as well as the recommended portfolio solutions and products to support the delivery of these solutions to the advice channels
Support, as needed, the Portfolio Construction Consultants with data retrieval, report building and Advisor follow-up.
Provide holistic investment management consultation to deliver and coach to a professional portfolio construction process and outcome
Deliver managed investment guidance to TD Wealth’s advice channels by leveraging WIO's tools and resources.
Support WIO initiatives that may not be directly related to managed investments
Job Requirements
Education/Accreditations:
Undergraduate degree - majoring in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Quantitative Analysis, Statistics, Data Analytics or a related field. Investment industry accreditation (e.g., CSC, CIM)
Completion of or working towards completion of the CFA Institute’s Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation would be an asset

Other Qualifications/Skills/Experience:
3-5 years of experience in the financial services industry
Strong knowledge of Investment management concepts financial markets, and portfolio construction techniques
Strong understanding of managed products including mutual funds, ETFs, and SMAs
Strong time management, prioritization and organizational skills are required to manage multiple deadlines and priorities
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills needed to effectively work with other members of the team and other areas of TD Wealth
Excellent technical skills and a strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office are required; strong Microsoft Excel skills are essential. Alteryx and/or SQL,and Tableau exposure is also beneficial.
Experience with VBA, Python, or other programming languages is a plus
Knowledge and understanding of Bloomberg and Morningstar is preferable
Ability to work both independently and as a team player
Outgoing individual who demonstrates keen initiative, flexibility and ability to react quickly to changing needs, positively rising to challenges presented.
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Mircom is looking to hire a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst with experience in business analysis or related academic experience. The successful candidate will work closely with the Production and Product Management team to provide analyses on various Mircom life safety products.
Key Responsibilities:

column2: Business Process Analyst, Organizational Process Governance
column7:
Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.
Synopsis of the role
The Business process Analyst will be part of a newly formed Organizational Process Governance team, who will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design processes and document standard operating procedures while managing transition from current to future state.
The purpose of the Business Process Analyst is to work in the plan and implementation of process improvement initiatives. The BPA will interact with internal stakeholders to review existing documentation and release information to develop a deep knowledge base content. This includes documenting and auditing existing operations processes, and analyzing data for process improvement and identifying indicators for future improvement opportunities. The BPA will provide consultation on the use of re-engineering techniques to improve process performance and product quality.
What You’ll Do
Facilitate and organize internal stakeholder sessions/workshops to understand processes, map out end to end flow, identify dependencies and resolve gaps.
Document current and future state processes for cross-functional teams across organization
Document standard operating procedures for operation and delivery teams to adopt with new ways post transformation
Instill process design thinking in individuals across teams and preach process mapping standards
Work across cross-functional teams to coordinate successful completion and sign-off of all processes and procedures.
Plan and deliver documentations, trainings and necessary help to critical stakeholders
Develops strong credible working relationships with internal stakeholders, working proactively to provide solutions.
What experience you need
2-5 years’ experience in fast paced matrix environment with transformation projects
Process analysis and process documentation
Experience with Lean methodology and change management
SOP and Process documentation
Experience working in a fast paced matrix environment
Experience working with multiple stakeholders
What could set you apart
Process Mapping and RACI
Lean Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt Certifications
Experience working with technical platforms
Knowledge of Equifax products and systems
General knowledge of Equifax policies and procedures
Knowledge of JIRA, Confluence and G-Suite preferred
We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, paid time off, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.

Are you ready to power your possible? Apply today, and get started on a path toward an exciting new career at Equifax, where you can make a difference!

Equifax is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Business Analyst I, Consumer Clarity
Mastercard’s Cyber and Intelligence organization develops and delivers world-class security products and services for customers across the globe. C&I was established to safeguard all aspects of safety and security in payments with new products, services, and standards.

Fraud and chargebacks disrupt the entire payments ecosystem, driving both card issuers and merchants to focus on resolving disputes instead of increasing card acceptance and revenue. Ethoca Consumer Clarity (“Clarity”) changes the dialogue, creating a rich environment for issuers and merchants to engage cardholders post-transaction, reducing frustration and driving repeat spend.

The Business Analyst I, Consumer Clarity will work closely with members of the Product Management team to perform analysis in a wide range of areas, including product strategy, competitive intelligence, market assessment, build/buy assessment, product adoption and usage, business success, and others. In this role, you will document business and functional requirements, monitor and report on KPIs and metrics, and perform Root Cause Analysis when needed. This position reports to the VP of Product.

Role Overview:

This role requires a curious, thoughtful, and analytical person with drive and passion for payments, fraud, and customer experience:
Perform analysis in alignment with established protocols
Assist Product Managers in the development of business cases and solutions
Assist with the creation and documentation of requirements for components of applications or projects
Manage smaller projects/initiatives as an experienced individual contributor with specialized knowledge
Use tools and an understanding of data collection / sampling techniques to extract data from primary and secondary sources, then identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for diagnosis and prediction
Perform analysis on data and measurement systems to validate accuracy and assess quality & meaning of results
Use data to tell a story by preparing final analysis reports and data visualizations for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to make important decisions based on various facts and trends

All About You:

The ideal candidate will have broad and extensive experience with:
Prior Business Analyst experience required, experience in Payments, Card Fraud, E-commerce, or Financial Services is desired
Strongly proficient with Microsoft Excel, particularly in the creation and manipulation of pivot tables and graphs, and skilled with PowerPoint and Word
Experience with Data Analysis tools and techniques, and in analysis of operational data to support business decisions
Applying expertise of principles theories and concepts plus broad knowledge of business/function and development life cycle
Self-starter with ability to hit the ground running, adapt quickly and take an action-oriented, roll-up-your-sleeves approach to execution that focuses on measurable results
After receiving direction, require minimum supervision and assistance
Strategic, analytical, and systematic thinker who consistently drives continuous improvement
Broad technical knowledge
Verbal and written communication is clear and concise
COVID-19 Considerations
In many locations, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in our NYC offices, as required by law, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 will be permitted inside Mastercard offices unless a reasonable accommodation has been approved in advance.
Corporate Security Responsibility
All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

column2: GBM - COO Analyst, Client Insights & Analytics - 12 Month Co...
column7:
Requisition ID: 164804

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term length: 12 Months
Start date: January 2023

There's no better way to find your dream job than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

Who We Are:
Global Banking and Markets (GBM) provides corporate and institutional clients with lending and transaction services, investment banking, advice, and access to capital markets. GBM is a full-service wholesale bank in the Americas, with operations in 21 countries, serving clients across Canada, the United States, Latin America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific.

Client Insights and Analytics is part of the COO (Chief Operating Officer’s) office in Global Banking and Markets. Our mandate is to lead the execution of our business strategies through powerful reporting and analytics. We are closely integrated with our business partners to drive adoption, and client strategies/insights and opportunities.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:
Assist our teams in report engineering, data analytics and data engineering and business relationship management.
Work with our relationship managers for business lines including Corporate & Investment Banking, Capital Markets, Global Business Payments and International Corporate and Commercial Banking.
Help leverage internal and external client data to facilitate opportunity identification.
Support adoption, change management and enhancement of our CRM (client relationship management) system.
Attend program meetings, and facilitate organization and follow-up as required.
Carry out ad-hoc projects and tasks as required.

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:
You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and competitions/hackathons.
You are interested in or have knowledge of the capital markets and wholesale banking business.
You have experience working on a major project and/or initiative in a team.
You are comfortable dealing with ambiguity and a matrix-based environment.
You have excellent written and oral communication skills.
You have advanced experience with Excel.
You have considerable initiative, curiosity, creativity, and attention to detail.
You have a high level of energy, commitment, and a strong sense of teamwork.

What’s in it for you?
You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.
You will be provided with an excellent opportunity for learning and personal development, especially if you wish to gain exposure to global capital markets, and the critical real-time financial data needed and utilized to move key business lines forward.

How do I apply?
Please complete the steps below:
Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
Apply to the role through our career site and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.
To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete both steps above.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

column2: Data Analyst (Power BI, Commercial Real Estate, Yardi)
column7:
THE ROLE
Join Triovest as a Data Analyst in either our Calgary or Toronto location. In this role, you will work in a team environment and will be responsible for ensuring Triovest business functions maintain data integrity across core business applications and steward for the company’s Data Excellence COE. You will work closely with our business leaders to turn data into information, information into insight for business decisions. If this is a role that interests you, we look forward to hearing from you!
WHY CHOOSE TRIOVEST?
At Triovest, we have clear guiding core values and principles, and we live by them every day in everything we do. When you join us, you will find that collaboration and trust go hand-in-hand, creating genuine relationships with colleagues, leaders, shareholders, and clients.
As we grow and evolve, you can too. There is ample opportunity to build your skills and grow in your career while working on exciting, industry-leading projects. Your potential is limitless.
Here is some of the great benefits that our employees enjoy:
A comprehensive health benefits package, including a health spending account and personal spending account, access to virtual health, and an employee and family assistance program (EFAP)
Pension plan with company matching
Personal & sick days
National and local social committees – fun events, webinars and team building activities held throughout the year for employees
Speaker Series to support diversity, equality, and inclusion
Corporate Charity Program – making a positive difference and supporting our communities through paid volunteering days and charity matching
Tuition for training & development
Employee Referral Program – our people are our greatest asset, we’re always looking to grow our teams, and we offer a substantial Employee Referral Program
Discounted membership fees with GoodLife
Cell phone plan discounts with Rogers
WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?
Acquire, transform and analyze data from multiple sources ensuring data quality.
Implement databases, data warehouse and data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Design and maintain dashboards in PowerBI for departments and internal/external stakeholders.
Develop or work with 3rd parties to implement and support data analytic and reporting solutions and processes.
Develop new process o collect and report data and leas implementation throughout the company.
Evaluate, implement and support system integration solutions, vendor API’s and ETL (extract, transform and load) tools.
Monitor and assist business functions with data maintenance.
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Design and develop reports, dashboards, KPI scorecards, aggregating data from multiple sources.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Collaborate with Business Systems Analysts and Subject Matter Experts on projects and support work related to data analytics.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
We believe success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills:
The ideal candidate is highly organized with a keen eye for detail, a high level of business maturity and solid decision-making skills.
The successful person will possess deeply rooted emotional intelligence and be a thoughtful and humble collaborator. As well, they must be self-starter, a strategic thinker and have a service-oriented attitude that will encourage continuous improvement of service and performance.
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills with an outstanding level of integrity that will gain the trust and respect of staff and external stakeholders.
Demonstrated organizational skills, and the ability to effectively prioritize in a demanding, high paced environment.
Ability to resolve complex issues and unforeseen obstacles quickly and efficiently.
Must be inclusive and supportive of the diversity within the Triovest team.
A strong communicator who can effectively address both small and large groups with empathy, credibility and trust.
To fulfill this role successfully, you should demonstrate the following minimum qualifications:
3+ years of working experience in data analytics and business reporting.
Post-secondary education in the field of Business Administration, Finance or Management Information Systems or equivalent combination of training and experience.
Experience in the commercial real estate industry is considered an asset.
Experience preferred in Yardi SQL Database tables.
Experience building dashboards in common visualization tools (preferably PowerBI).
Ability to grasp the essence of large data sets with advanced excel modeling skills.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets.
Demonstrated ETL skills/experience (Extract, Transform, Load).
ABOUT TRIOVEST
Triovest is a Canadian investment manager and developer of institutional-quality commercial and residential properties. The company offers a full suite of complementary real estate services, including asset management, leasing, property management, sustainability, and risk-mitigation services. Its portfolio of office, industrial, residential, retail, and mixed-use properties is valued at over $12 billion, with $2 billion currently under development. With more than 45 million square feet of real estate assets under management on behalf of individual and institutional investors,
Triovest is one of the largest privately-owned commercial real estate companies in Canada.We believe that the quality of our people directly impacts the quality of our work, therefore we place a high value on attracting and retaining exceptional individuals. Triovest fosters a hands-on approach to value creation for our clients through innovation and collaboration. Learn more about Triovest by visiting our website.
Triovest is an Equal Opportunity Employer
We believe in the power of diversity and we are dedicated to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment at Triovest. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request during the recruitment and selection process.
Vaccination Policy
Triovest requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. An exemption from this requirement is provided on an exceptional reason, such as medical, creed or religious reasons in accordance with the relevant Human Rights legislation in the province in which you work.
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

column2: Data Analyst – Product and Partner Management
column7:
Bring your ambition, talents and data analytics experience to CDW, where you can have a greater impact, be inspired by our mission and be excited about your job and future. A Fortune 200 leader, we're the driven professionals and technology experts' Canadian companies turn to most to solve all their IT challenges.
The Product and Partner Management (PPM) Analyst role is responsible for the data strategy within the PPM team. They are focused on building and sharing data expertise including sources and practices and ensures consistency and accuracy. The PPM Analyst works closely with PPM Management to understand data needs, and then works with others on the development of reporting to support decision making.
What you'll do:
Champions internal data needs and communications: addressable market, regional data comparisons, sales data, forecasting, among others
Creates reports and dashboards using thoughtful practices and data methodologies to directly impact the success of PPM
Uncovers and communicates available external data sources
Assists with data errors and maintenance correction
Engages with others on building reports (definitions, maintenance, error correction, evolutions)
Builds expertise and cadence with other CDW regional analytics teams for best practices.
Initiates and drives projects related to the betterment of PPM business analysis practices and category expertise
Works cross departmentally to ensure data needs are aligned
Develop and manage centralized partner and product reporting to support other PPM functions like Marketing and E-Commerce.
Coordinate and guide stakeholders through a process of creating reports and data models that successfully address business issues. Provide ongoing support for these reports.
Produce sound analysis in support of Product and Partner Management decision makers to drive tactical and strategic departmental objectives.
Assess existing reports, data sources, business processes and initiatives. Identify improvement opportunities and strategies to evolve the current capabilities. Facilitate effective communication with vendors including compliance audits.
Design actionable reporting tools that support effective financial management of cost control, revenue generation and partner profitability.
Maintain standard monthly reports and metrics used to measure Partner Controllable Margin (PCM), Partner Designation, and improve overall department efficiency.
What you need to succeed:
Must-have
Bachelor's degree in Business or an IT related field with minimum of 2+ years of work experience in an analytical position
Advanced analytical skills and data application
Advanced user of Excel and SQL query writing
Experience with data visualization platforms, most preferred Power BI
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (especially Excel), and other BI tools
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate across company and department boundaries at all levels
Demonstrated ability to work independently with little direction and make sound business decisions
History of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously with the ability to quickly adapt to the changing needs of the business and meet deadlines
Demonstrated ability to critically evaluate information, identify risks and opportunities, while possessing creative problem-solving skills with an understanding of business concepts and models
Nice-to-have
Working knowledge of database query language(s)
Demonstrated ability to effectively facilitate and lead meetings, tailoring messages to the given audience.
Proven ability to elicit project and system requirements
2-3 years' experience working in the IT channel
Who we are:
CDW is a leading technology solutions provider to business, government, education and healthcare organizations in Canada, the United States, and the United Kingdom. Our fingerprints can be found on technology in workplaces of more than 250,000 companies; from fresh-faced startups to international conglomerates. With the breadth of products and services we offer, there is no request too big or too small.
What you can expect from us: Culture, coworkers, careers.
CDW is not only the People Who Get IT, but the People who get People. Our relationships are fueled by our deep expertise and grounded in the CDW Way. Our empowering leadership makes things happen and inspires their teams to do the same. From the teammates beside us to the leaders who guide us, we move forward together. At CDW, you'll work with people who inspire you. People with positive, success-driven attitudes who you will learn from and forge strong relationships with. Bring your best true self-and your best ideas-to CDW. Because diverse perspectives bring forth better problem solving-and better solutions for our customers on a rapidly evolving technology landscape.
The well-being of our employees is essential to us. CDW offers a comprehensive benefits package, which includes health, dental and vision coverage, coworker stock purchase program, paid vacation time and sick days, RRSP/DPSP and DPSP match, tuition reimbursement, coworker discounts and other generous perks.

Position Title: Senior Replenishment Analyst
Requisition ID: 29634
Career Group (ADSP): Administrative
Division: Qc - Centrale d'Achats - Périssables (80069159)
Department: Procurement
Work Location: 5559 Dundas Street West, Etobicoke ON M9B 1B9
Province: Canada : Ontario METRO ON - 25 VICKERS ROAD BUILDING C (#A-VICC)
Position Type: Permanent

Summary:
The primary responsibility of the Senior Replenishment Analyst is to assure that stores are always replenished and have an in-stock position with minimal waste. This will be accomplished by using system tools that assess sales trends, promotional requirements, and current supply and demand vs. forecast. These tools will also be used to provide requirements for plant production. The incumbent will focus on reviewing data from SAP, EXE and BW systems and is accountable for completion of all replenishment department reports, analyzing and monitoring purchases, inventory and service level.

Specific Responsibilities:
o Prepare purchase orders and liaise with stores ensuring department objectives including service level, waste reduction and product quality are met
o Practices “just in time” inventory to maximize freshness and minimize shrink and waste
o Regularly liaise with stores to ensure review of merchandising plans, inventory levels, and product quality
o Maintain ordering criteria such as consumption, MRP and forecasting profiles in SAP
o Analyze data from SAP, EXE and BW systems to maximize sales, inventory turns and gross margin
o Liaise with merchandising team ensuring appropriate responses to changing market conditions and promotional plans are executed appropriately
o Keep informed with regards to supply market conditions, market opportunities and competitor activities
o Ensures that every store requirement is fulfilled daily with the freshest and highest quality product being procured
o Identifies potential overstock situations proactively
o Ensuring every effort is made to ship product to stores with regular vendor communication, including contingency deliveries if necessary
o Works with Inventory Managers to continually improve the logistics process in order to reduce distribution costs and/or inventory levels
o Liaise with Vendors and Metro I.T. teams to identify specific system adaptations required around holiday scheduling
o Participates in weekly meetings with internal production teams discuss promotional volumes
o Additional system accesses used to compile distribution and Promotional planning reports for the Replenishment Analyst team
o Provides holiday coverage for direct manager
o Front page feature forecasting and planning-including raw material planning

Qualifications:
o Post Secondary education in Supply Chain, Retail Management, Business or industry experience and knowledge
o 1–3 years previous replenishment and/or grocery retail work
o Knowledge of perishable food products replenishment
o Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
o Strong decision making and problem-solving skills
o Good verbal and written communication skills
o Ability to identify problems and draw upon a range of choices to formulate solutions
o Knowledge in inventory and supply chain concepts
o Superior time management, priority management and organizational skills
o Knowledge of SAP – Replenishment module and BW is a definite asset
o Excellent skills in Excel, Word, and Outlook
o Flexibility to adapt to changing customer demands, schedules, and working under the challenge of tight timelines
o Ability to work independently and within a team
o Self motivated with the ability to possess a great sense of urgency

Relationships:
Provides results to and receives direction from Manager of Category Replenishment and Director

IND1
#ZR1
#LI-Hybrid

Metro values, respects and leverages the differences and competences of all employees from a variety of different backgrounds. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment.
Metro is committed to accommodating applicants and employees with disabilities. Should you require an accommodation or wish to receive this application in an accessible format, please advise.
Only applicants that meet the qualifications will be contacted.
We respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from agencies.

55 Bloor Street West Toronto Ontario,M4W 3N5
The Financial Crimes Unit (FCU) brings together our Cybersecurity, Fraud, Physical Security and Resilience Planning capabilities to address the ever-growing and increasingly complex global security environment. It is a highly collaborative effort that greatly enhances BMO’s ability to rapidly prevent, detect, respond to, and recover from all security & crisis threats. This position offers a unique experience to learn from experienced leaders in the industry, join a team building the 21st century model for security and helping grow the good by protecting our customers and communities.
Fraud experience – required
Online Banking Fraud experience – asset
Interac EMT experience – asset
Conducts investigations to identify, assess, decision and report on activity that indicates an exposure to financial crimes. Ensures potential threats and investigations are evaluated, documented, managed and escalated by following standard operating procedures. Provides subject matter expertise and oversight of criminal risk by following a disciplined and intelligence-based approach to detection and research of activities and events in alignment with criminal risk frameworks and standards to ensure compliance as well as support trending, analysis and insights generation.
Provides input and develops recommendations for process and customer service improvements.
Stays abreast of financial crimes risk trends, relevant regulations and compliance standards.
Monitors and analyzes various information provided through detection systems, tools, reports, or manually to evaluate, investigate and determine required actions.
Supports the collection of evidence and information to be used for multiple purposes including incident reports/filings, loss prevention, litigation and criminal prosecution, management information and statistics, and process improvements.
Documents actions and information found throughout the investigation to develop and maintain account/case files.
Develops and maintains an understanding of the financial crime management processes, frameworks and techniques.
Gathers and formats data into regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Executes routine tasks such as service requests, transactions, queries etc. within relevant service level agreements.
Provides notification, information and instructions to internal/external stakeholders related to incidents as necessary.
Completes complex & diverse tasks within given rules/limits and may include handling escalations from other employees.
Analyzes issues and determines next steps.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Knowledge of risk and regulatory requirements as they apply to financial crimes is an asset.
Knowledge of banking products, services, processes, and organization is an asset.
Specialized knowledge.
Verbal & written communication skills - Good.
Organization skills - Good.
Collaboration & team skills - Good.
Analytical and problem solving skills - Good.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

column2: Senior Analyst, Client Onboarding Reporting & Analytics
column7:
Requisition ID: 164438

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Why work for Scotiabank?

Scotiabank is among the largest banks in the world and the most international bank in Canada. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services. Together with our Digital Factories around the world, we are dedicated to helping our 25 million customers become better-off.
This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy. Say hello to a career at Scotiabank!

Global Banking and Markets

Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange, and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

Purpose

The Senior Analyst, Client Onboarding Analytics & Reporting supports the KYC/AML regulatory onboarding teams (as well as other internal stakeholders) by querying and processing data from various sources, and producing reports, summaries, and visualizations to support data-driven decision making. This role supports the Associate Director, Client Onboarding Reporting and Analytics, to provide timely, relevant and accurate data analytics & MIS to assist with ongoing design and coordination of KYC and Regulatory onboarding activities and ensure ensuring business strategies, plans and initiatives in GWO Onboarding & Static Data are supported.

Accountabilities

Support the design, testing, and production of regular client data reports from the GBM Client Onboarding system of record.
Deliver data-based solutions to complex business problems that are multi-dimensional and often unstructured / without precedent.
Identify, acquire and transform large volumes of primarily qualitative data from various internal sources to provide business value through analytical tools and techniques.
Create, develop, and enhance visual BI dashboards suitable for a Senior/Executive Management audience.
Identify, analyze and interpret trends in complex date sets that pertain to client and regulatory data.
Manage multiple data analysis projects simultaneously; may be required to meet tight deadlines.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to gather and document business requirements; present reports, gather feedback and pivot accordingly.
Perform data reconciliation, cleansing and migration as required.
Continually acquire and enhance knowledge of both the Bank’s and the Division's business strategies, shifting regulatory environment, evolving risk management practices and methodologies, new products, updated operational processes, and rapidly changing technology to be able to drive effective business solutions.
Support any requests for the development of audit and regulatory documentation which may be required on an ad-hoc basis. Draft, edit and coordinate approvals on business requirement documents governing relevant reports produced.
Contributes to and champions a customer focused culture throughout the GWO Onboarding & Static Data team to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge. Supports an environment in which the GWO Onboarding & Static Data team pursues effective and efficient operations.
Maintain current industry knowledge of data analytics tools and best practices.
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursue effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
Champions a high performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.

Requirements

A recognized undergraduate degree preferably degree (or equivalent work experience) in statistics, mathematics or computer science
2-3 years experience in a similar role, preferably at a global financial institution
Technical skills: Advanced MS Excel & Access; Intermediate experience R, Python, and SQL; Intermediate to Advanced experience using and implementing visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI or Tableau. Experience with SharePoint and Microsoft PowerApps a plus.
Experience manipulating and synthesizing large and complex data sets— specifically, client lists, AML/KYC data attributes, Salesforce/CRM data
Highly motivated self-starter with good problem-solving skills
Must be accurate and thorough
Effective time, project management, teamwork and communication skills
Possesses working knowledge of the Capital Markets and Corporate Banking business
Willingness to jump in and learn new tools & skills as required
Willingness to participate in conference calls during Asian and European business hours
Must have excellent interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills in order to build consensus and obtain co-operation from a multitude of stakeholders, including: business users, technology and operations partners, compliance, and management.
Prior working experience in BI/data analytics in a Consulting firm, bank and/or in a Business Analysis role is preferred.

Working Conditions

Work in a standard office-based environment; non-standard hours are a common occurrence.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

column2: eCommerce Merchandising Analyst - Canadian Tire Corporation
column7:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
As a member of the eCommerce Merchandising team, you will help run the day-to-day operations of the eComm Homepage Team at CTR and focus on the development and strategy direction for the Canadian Tire website as eCommerce continues to grow at a rapid pace. The analyst on the team is responsible for weekly briefings, seasonal changeover landing pages and the data analytics summarizing the performance of our various pages.
Acting as a centralized hub for the homepage planning and online events, the eCommerce Homepage team aims to improve the digital experience and develop online events to draw customers to ct.ca. The eCommerce Homepage team is responsible for helping drive sales growth for CTC by working collaboratively across the organization to execute a strong digital strategy that addresses both business and customer needs.
What you’ll do:
As a member of this team, you will be responsible for delivering sales, generating innovative changes to the website, ensuring alignment between all CTR marketing campaigns, and developing a winning strategy for the future. This role will require collaboration amongst several cross-functional stakeholders to integrate marketing plans, improve processes and streamline executions. As the website transitions to the new ODP platform, you will be involved in the transition from the old site to new.
Brief creative teams for the weekly website orientation
Work cross functionally with the collective CTR marketing group
Quality check homepage (pre-publish and post-publish) and resolve identified issues with appropriate stakeholders
Generate SKU lists for Home Page and eFlyer Planning
Check Weekly In-Stock Reporting for Homepage SKUs
Boosting products for Homepage
Assist with reporting on homepage performance
Provide insights on competitive analysis
Support ad hoc execution and deep dive requests
Who you are:
Organized and detail oriented
Exceptional communication skills with the confidence and passion to share knowledge
Creative thinker who is observant to seek new opportunities and perceptive to abstract ideas
Team player who enjoys working cross-functionally
Goal driven individual to seek out continuous improvement opportunities
The ability to take a collaborate approach to build strong relationships and have positive team experiences
Flexible and dynamic individual who can adjust and prioritize accordingly to adapt to business demands and requirements
Solid foundation of relevant technical skills
Demonstrates behaviours of transparency, accountability agility and learning from others that will support your success
Interested in tracking industry trends and deep-diving into analytics to suggest improvements to the business
What you’ve done:
Experience working with Excel (vlookups, pivot tables, etc.)
Comfortable working with data
Exposure to Marketing or eCommerce principals
Experience organizing, analyzing, and presenting data
Highly organized and strong communication skills
Nice to have: Experience working with Google Analytics, Microsoft Access, Retail experience, SEO
#LI-RM1
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of
Canada’s Best Managed Companies
.
To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on
LinkedIn
.
Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

***This role is open for Internships and Full-Time Permanent campus hires. Deadline for submission of application is June 20, 2022.

Fueled by strategic investment in technology and innovation, Client Technology seeks to drive growth opportunities and solve complex business problems for our clients through building a robust platform for business and powerful product engine that are integral to innovation at scale. You will work with technologists and business specialists, blending EY’s deep industry knowledge and innovative ideas with our platforms, capabilities, and technical expertise. As a champion for change and growth, you will be at the forefront of integrating emerging technologies from AI to Data Analytics into every corner of what we do at EY. That means more growth for you, exciting learning opportunities, career choices, and the chance to make a real impact.

The opportunity

Rotational program where you will have the opportunity to tackle different roles and develop Analyst skills in the areas of Project Management, Business Analysis, and Product Management. By the end of the program, you will be mapped to the role that best aligns to your skills and interests.

Your key responsibilities

Project Management, you will support the project team with the delivery of small to medium projects within planned scope, schedule and budget while developing technical capabilities.

Analyze, review and document the requirements of a project throughout its lifecycle and monitor progress, costs and timescales. We have established processes and tools that you will use to support the execution of project deliverables and raise risks and issues where required
Develop your skills in communication, leadership and risk management as you manage the project through its lifecycle

Business Analysis, you will plan, collect, analyze and interpret business situation, challenges, models, processes and operations to develop an understanding of business needs and requirements.

Develop your skills in business analysis knowledge areas encompassing of business analysis planning, elicitation, requirements analysis and design definition, requirements lifecycle management, solution validation and strategy analysis
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to assemble, understand, document and analyze business situations and challenges to identify business requirements and value
Develop and apply your interpersonal skills to engage with different functions within EY and negotiate various aspects of work effort to enable the business future state

Product Management, you will be aligned to specific products and are responsible for daily activities, including requirement development and socialization, understanding design methodologies, and interpreting data and metrics of product performance.

Support the product management team with daily activities aligned to a specific product, such as analyzing requirements and assisting with product selection, development and socialization
Build relationships across the wider product delivery team and other roles to assist with the definition of product features and requirements
Develop market awareness and apply creative thinking to identify market potentials where research and analysis of qualitative and quantitative data are encouraged to provide insights to the product group

Note: These are global roles and may require travel and/or working across time zones.

Ideally, you’ll also be able to:

Demonstrate an understanding of business ideas and articulate different business dynamics in the current market (ex. why driverless cars matter?)
Demonstrate general knowledge and interest in technology and how it is being used in regular life (ex. converse on AI and how companies like Amazon uses it to improve customer experience)
Demonstrate ability to engage and collaborate in diverse settings of people, approach and experience

What we look for

Results-oriented individuals with diverse skillsets and technological emerging competencies, like analytics, blockchain, artificial intelligence and cybersecurity. We are looking for individuals with initiative, creativity, and a growth mentality. Individuals with the ability to learn new skills and adapt quickly are far more valuable to us in a dynamic technological environment.

Bachelor's degree in business, computer science or related field preferred
Zero to one year of relevant work experience
Ability to meet deadlines while simultaneously working on multiple projects
Exceptional active listening skills with strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience with analyzing and solving problems of a complex nature
Experience working with business, management, and technology concepts

What we offer

As part of this role, you'll work in a highly integrated, global team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here’s a snapshot of what we offer:

Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

Please apply to this role only through the ‘Apply’ link (not through the local office). Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

column2: Analyst, Sustainability Disclosure & Impact (18 Month Contra...
column7:
100 King Street West Toronto Ontario,M5X 1A1
This role is enterprise-wide in scope and reports to the Director, Sustainability Strategy, Disclosure & Impact. The Analyst supports the Sustainability team with quantitative and qualitative research, analysis, reporting and communications across a broad range of sustainability topics including sustainability disclosures, sustainability strategy, climate change, environmental and social risk, sustainable finance, operational sustainability, and emerging sustainability topics. The holder of the role has subject matter expertise in sustainability/Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) and draws on knowledge and experience in sustainability and climate change, or in research-focused roles with a demonstrated interest in sustainability. A technical and research background is preferred. The role requires someone with strong problem solving, communication and project management skills.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Sustainability and climate reporting and communications
Monitoring external sustainability reporting frameworks and standards (e.g. Global Reporting Initiative, SASB, Integrated Reporting, Taskforce on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD, regulatory disclosure requirements) and identifying areas of opportunity.
Preparing, as part of a broader team, content for BMO’s sustainability and climate disclosures, including the implementation of identified changes and/or improvements and incorporating best practices.
Maintaining strong disclosure procedures and controls and supporting implementation of sustainability reporting software solutions.
Implementing processes for coordinating an enterprise response to information requests from sustainability rating agencies and/or analysts who assess BMO’s sustainability performance (e.g. DJSI, CDP, Sustainalytics, ISS, MSCI, Moody’s, FTSE4Good, Corporate Knights and others).
Supporting development of public facing statements and policies on sustainability and climate matters informed by research and in collaboration with internal subject-matter experts, to satisfy market expectations.
Development of thought leadership and publications, including support with the BMO Sustainability Leaders podcast and marketing.
Sustainability and climate analytics
Managing data and information, conducting data analysis and providing insights to support business decision making processes. Includes strong data management practices and the ability to communicate quantitative analysis internally and externally through written, visual and verbal presentation.
Assisting with greenhouse gas (GHG) accounting for scope 1, scope 2 and scope 3 emissions quantification using methodologies from the GHG Protocol.
Assisting with GHG accounting and methodology development for BMO’s scope 3 “financed emissions” using methodologies from the Partnership for Carbon Accounting Financials. Includes manual data collection, validation, development of excel-based models and partnering with Technology & Operations to automate established calculations.
Working with external assurance providers in relation to sustainability and climate reporting and GHG quantification.
Sustainability and climate strategy and program governance
Monitoring sustainability and climate trends and emerging topics to identify areas for improvement of BMO’s sustainability program and performance and to develop strategies to ensure consistency with market practice, and to communicate with stakeholders both internal and external, maintaining BMO’s leadership position in sustainability and ESG.
Researching sustainability and climate topics to support development of policies, programs, strategies, monitoring, reporting, thought leadership and/or marketing.
Actively participating in and representing BMO in international industry associations such as the UNEP FI and working groups such as Partnership for Carbon Accounting Financials (PCAF).
Supporting with administration of BMO’s sustainability program and governance of internal management committees and forums including developing meeting agendas, compiling meeting materials and taking and distributing meeting minutes.
Developing strong relationships and collaborating with internal stakeholders (e.g. LOBs and Corporate Areas) in order to enhance internal awareness of the value of sustainability and advance sustainability and climate-related practices.
Assistance in developing and executing such other sustainability related programs as may be needed.
Qualifications:
Minimum requirements are a degree in a related field such as sustainability, business, economics, engineering, accounting. Masters-level preferred
Minimum 1-3 years’ experience in sustainability, ESG or a related field
Experience and/or advanced knowledge in GHG quantification, sustainability reporting, impact measurement and data analytics.
Experience in banking or finance sector an asset
Strong technical and research background
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong Excel, PowerPoint and Word skills
Strong relationships management skills
Strong critical thinking, problem solving skills and ability to navigate ambiguous situations.
Self-starter and motivated
Ability to work independently with little oversight
Organized working style
Results oriented and goal driven
Politically astute, diplomatic and able to navigate complex corporate and external environment with numerous stakeholders on highly sensitive and controversial topics
Strong change management skills
Well-developed negotiation skills and ability to influence decision making
Operates effectively in fast paced high stress environment with evolving expectations
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Discover Your Impact
You know those big cities that still feel like small towns? Where everyone’s friendly and helps each other out? That’s like Grant Thornton. Except here we’re all professionals and there isn’t a mayor or a general store. What we’re trying to say is that we’re a large and growing professional services firm that still feels like a community. We employ over 2500 people across Canada, and we truly care about our colleagues, our clients and the communities where we work and live. That’s what’s most important to us. We’re building a thriving organization that’s purpose driven and still want to remember what your favourite milkshake flavour is.
Discover what success feels like here
If you’re a bit like us, you’re driven to connect with how others are feeling and thinking. Here we walk in others shoes before taking action. Just imagine being part of a team that puts “we before me”, where flexAbility is a mindset, and where you trust your colleagues to have your back. At Grant Thornton, you’ll work with inspiring leaders who support your development, both personally and professionally. This is a place where your insatiable curiosity enables you to think, see and hear from a variety of perspectives, a place where every day is different and having the courage to grow is part of who you are. And when all this comes together, well that’s when the magic happens!

Discover your voice within an award-winning culture
Grant Thornton has been recognized by the Great Place To Work Institute for 15 years in a row as one of Canada’s best workplaces We were also recognized as a Great Place to Work in 2020 for Today’s Youth. This is your opportunity to experience what our culture is like for yourself!
We believe flexibility in our way of working is essential to creating a culture and environment that enables our firm to achieve our Purpose to help our clients, colleagues and communities thrive.
Discover Your Best Self
Imagine working for an organization that believes in the power of authenticity in everything that we do. Whether you’re working on a client file, lobster fishing in Nova Scotia or rock-climbing in the Rockies we want you to bring your whole self to work.
You’ll be a part of a team where leadership is shared, and your colleagues at all levels are fiercely committed to your development. As part of a global organization, with offices in more than 130 countries and across Canada, you’ll have opportunities to connect and learn globally.
As an Analyst, Tax - Transfer Pricing [Co-op Spring 2023] some of your responsibilities will include:
• Participating in fact gathering and undertake industry research
Analyzing financial statements
Analyzing financial statements and assist the team with economic analyses
Writing reports and other business communication
Working with large sets of accounting and transactional data
Supporting the team in the resolution of transfer pricing audits by tax authorities
Staying abreast of global transfer pricing, tax and business developments
Developing presentations for clients, colleagues and other teams within the firm

Think you’ve got what it takes to be an Analyst, Tax - Transfer Pricing [Co-op Spring 2023]? Like the colour purple? Great. Here's a few more boxes we’re also hoping you can tick:
You are currently pursuing your post-secondary degree and have demonstrated academic excellence
You are committed to pursuing the CPA designation and completing the relevant pre-requisites

Join our team!
To become a member of one of the most dynamic firms in Canada, please submit:
Your resume
Cover letter
A copy of your most recent transcripts

The application deadline is: Sunday, October 30, 2022 at 11:59 PM (ET)

At Grant Thornton we’re focused on making a difference in the lives of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. That’s our purpose. Or, as we like to say, living our purple.

Are you ready to Discover Your Purple?

Digital interviewing is a modern way to interview which sets a level playing field for all candidates.
