column5: Hybrid remote in North York, ON
column7:
About GTC
GlobalTrade Corporation (GTC) provides technology solutions for the world’s largest corporations to digitally manage their Trade Finance transactions (i.e. Letters of credit) across all of their banking relationships and business units worldwide. GTC is headquartered in Toronto, Canada with personnel in Vancouver, Paris, Finland, Portugal, Singapore, and Hong Kong.
Job description
GTC is a growing financial technology company and, is looking for a Business Analyst who will be the vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives. As a Business Analyst, you will help GTC to improve efficiency by identifying areas that can be developed, strengthening processes where necessary, and communicating findings with those you work closely with throughout different levels at GTC.
Duties and responsibilities
Requirements Analysis
· Gather client requirements via meetings or during on-site workshops
· Create client business requirements documents
· Configure client environments in the GTC platform
· Perform client data transformation and upload to the GTC platform
Client Support
· Answer client support emails in a timely and professional manner
· Create tickets for client support issues using GTC’s issue-tracking system
· Follow up with the development team on client support tickets
End-User Training
· Create training plans based on the client’s requirements
· Train clients on the use of software via MS Teams and during on-site workshops
Product Development
· Create functional specifications for new development
· Create tickets in GTC’s issue-tracking system for system enhancements and bugs
· Review tickets in GTC’s issue-tracking system for completeness and appropriateness
Skills Required:
Excellent verbal and written (English) skills
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work independently
Strong Microsoft Office Skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.)
Education and Experience:
2-5 years of relevant business analyst experience in a software company
Experience drafting requirements for web-based software applications
Familiar with software design and development lifecycle
Experience with JIRA and/or Freshdesk ticketing systems is a plus
Knowledge of trade and supply finance concepts and products is a strong plus
COVID-19:
At GTC, we are committed to putting our people first. Our priority is to optimize the health and productivity of our team. In light of COVID-19, we continue to monitor the global situation and follow local guidance to ensure the health and well-being of our employees. Safety is our highest priority, and while the goal is ultimately to have a hybrid schedule, we are currently working remotely. We are excited to connect with you and look forward to receiving your application.
DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND ACCOMMODATION:
GTC is committed to having a workforce that is reflective of the diversity of the City of Toronto in general and of our participants in particular. We strongly encourage applications from racialized persons, indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity, and gender expression, and all those who can provide and contribute to the diversification of perspective at GTC.
GTC is committed to hiring practices that are inclusive and barrier-free. GTC will provide reasonable and appropriate accommodation during all stages of the hiring process following the Ontario Human Rights Code to ensure all job applicants' equal and fair assessment. Applicants are asked to make any accommodation requests in advance.
This is an excellent opportunity to join a winning international team. GTC offers a competitive compensation package with benefits and opportunities for growth and professional development.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Dental care
Extended health care
Flextime
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision care
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Supplemental pay types:
Bonus pay
Experience:
Business analysis: 2 years (required)
software company: 2 years (required)
drafting requirements for web-based software applications: 2 years (required)
Work Location: Hybrid remote in North York, ON

At Intelliware, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a top-notch team and work on a wide range of complex custom software solutions. We have a collaborative team-based Agile environment where you’ll find learning opportunities and challenging work. Our project teams work closely with client subject matter experts, end users and technology teams to deliver everything from proof-of-concept prototypes to bulletproof, long living, high volume production applications.

The Business System Analyst (BSA) guides product development from conception to launch while collaborating closely with technical leads, delivery managers, business sponsors and subject matter experts.
Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
Meeting with clients to understand business and systems requirements, documenting them, and translating them into functional and system requirement specifications that can be used by developers to build the solution and for testers to validate functionality
Applying knowledge of systems and technology to enhance solutions and manage data quality
Orchestrating backlog refinement, prioritizing/updating requirements, and writing quality, detailed user stories
Gathering and processing business information related to procedures and data to clarify business issues/requirements
Developing alternative solutions based on business drivers and impact/cost analysis
Supporting scope management
Collaborating directly with development team to deliver projects on time and to the client’s satisfaction
Ensuring quality of the developed solution: that it meets the business functional requirements and is production-ready
Managing relationships with team and clients
‘Must Have’ Skills/Experience:
5+ years of business analysis experience
Solid understanding of software development
Ability to consolidate diverse business and systems requirements and facilitate realistic, common sense solutions
Ability to analyze business functions, workflows, inputs and outputs
Understanding of Integration patterns including REST APIs and event mechanisms
UML and flow diagrams
Experience data mapping
Hands-on experience working with SQL databases (i.e., performing queries, data analysis)
Proven client-facing, partnership and presentation skills
Familiarity with and enthusiasm for Agile approaches to software development
Strong problem-solving skills
Technical writing skills/experience
Curiosity and a desire to learn
‘Nice to Have’ Skills/Experience:
Project management skills/experience
Product development/ownership experience
Cloud platform experience, preferably Azure
We are now working as a remote first organization and will continue to do so for the foreseeable future. As a result, all of our interviews will also be conducted remotely.

For more info on Intelliware, check out our Careers Page and Instagram.

Intelliware is committed to diversity in the workplace. We are an inclusive employer and welcome and encourage applications from all qualified candidates. Applicants’ needs will be accommodated during our recruitment and selection process so please advise us if you require accommodation.

Job ID #347318

Business Intelligence Analyst, Fundraising Insights

The Position
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Insights & Analytics for Marketing, Philanthropy and Communications, this role is a key contributor to our organizational efforts to enabling a robust view of our constituents, partners, programs, and internal performance by fostering a data-driven culture through providing the right insights, to the right people, at the right time. This role will specialize in Philanthropy and Fundraising domain knowledge but will also support those team members who specialize in marketing and communications analytics.
You will translate briefs into quantitative questions that can be answered with our available data using sound methodologies
You will collaborate with Prospect Managers, Prospect Researchers, and portfolio owners on the Philanthropy team to assist in the development of segmented donor analysis, ensuring a consistent and integrated approach to donor segmentation and reporting throughout the donor lifecycle
You will be responsible for analyzing Philanthropy campaigns, pipeline and portfolio performance, as well as identifying trends within the donor base. Working with large data sets, you will extract, prepare and analyze data, and report back on key insights to improve performance and effectiveness
You will lead the integration and operationalization of our Voice of Donor-initiatives, working with our internal stakeholder, vendors and IT-partners to elevate our stakeholders’ voice in our decision-making
You will proactively identify opportunities to use data, analytics and insights to generate improved results and efficiency for the Philanthropy team
You will be working in our primary enterprise applications Salesforce CRM and Marketing Cloud, various internal data integrations, and our cloud data platform, Snowflake
What does success look like?
Translate functional requirements into technical specifications needed to implement and deliver required reports and data extracts
Visualize data and conduct written and verbal presentations to share insights and recommendations to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication
Coordinate with other team members to deliver cross functional solutions and data integrations
Keep abreast of product functionality and relevant industry trends in philanthropy, including donor segmentation, pipeline management, donor stewardship, planned giving and donor screening
Develop and implement systems to monitor strategic donor KPIs across the donor lifecycle including donor retention, migration, lapsed, and opportunity identification
Pro-actively provide actionable fundraising data analysis, reporting and insights to answer key business needs within the Philanthropy team
Develop strong relationships with internal stakeholders through clear understanding of evolving business needs
As our ideal candidate you will have:
An intellectual curiosity and drive related to using data to solve business problems
Strong critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills, and a drive to generate continuous improvement
Experience supporting Philanthropy and Fundraising departments, and solid understanding of the fundraising or sales best practices, the donor lifecycle and pipeline development methodologies
A solution-oriented approach, experience telling stories that connect the dots between the business and its data, working with a wide range of stakeholders, and communicate the value of data and challenges to using it well
Experience developing and working with complex SQL-queries developed by others
Certificates in Data Analysis, Data Visualization and Business Intelligence an asset
Previous experience with Salesforce applications and Snowflake and exposure to applications such as Power BI, Tableau, or other BI solutions a significant asset
Familiarity with designing and implementing research projects from inception to completion: writing proposals, drafting the questionnaires, and deploying surveys, analyzing the data, reporting, and presenting the findings to internal stakeholders
Personal values consistent with those of Plan International’s organizational values

Summary Of Day-To-Day Responsibilities:
Provide support and produce detailed system requirements and technical / functional specifications in alignment with standards and frameworks.
The Business Systems Analyst will work in close partnership with business partners / technology / project teams and stakeholders to elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications.
The Business Systems Analyst will develop effective and efficient solutions by researching/analyzing current state system capabilities and defining technology solutions options / recommendations working closely with key technology partners (e.g., Solution Architects and Quality Assurance staff).
Define, document, and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications and non-functional specifications.
Support testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
Support and contribute to project management activities by participating in the scoping and estimating of project efforts, risks identification and mitigation measures recommendation, communicating activity status and providing timely notification and escalation of possible issues/problems to the Project Manager.
Participate in quality management reviews, in particular reviews of the designs, prototypes and other requirements work products to ensure they fulfil the requirements.
Support collaboration with key stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and how to manage the integration.
May provide operational / process related analysis and support to various extents.
Ensure best practices related to the BSA discipline are adhered to and enforced within project processes and deliverables.
Adhere to existing processes/standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, well-defined enterprise technology delivery practices and standards, and business technology architecture, escalating escalate issues as required.
Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise in own area and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends/developments and develop expertise in our client services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools, and techniques that can contribute to effective solution development/delivery. Continuously enhance knowledge of business domains and their products/services.
Support the development of business cases including benefits identification, RFI/RFP, and service level agreements with vendors/suppliers consistent with technology requirements/guidelines.
Maintain ongoing communication with all stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. Able to perform BSA tasks effectively while assigned to a single project or multiple concurrent projects. Prioritize and manage own workload to deliver quality results and meet timelines.
Support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation, and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest.
Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business units, Coach new or less experienced colleagues and act as a reference for the requirements management lifecycle.
Identify and recommend opportunities to enhance productivity, effectiveness, and operational efficiency of the business unit and/or team Additional Information.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and comfortable working with both Business and Technical teams. Self-starter with the ability to multi-task effectively and independently within a fast-paced environment. Able to gauge the appropriate level of priority and detail and/or effort on any given project. Able to adapt quickly to changing priorities.
Highly motivated with a proven track record of delivering results. Exhibit effective problem-solving skills with a high degree of attention to detail.
Excellent time management and prioritization skills. Demonstrated ability to follow-up on issues independently and ensure they are resolved promptly, escalating when necessary.
Expert knowledge of system analysis process and techniques.
Expert knowledge of systems and applications supported by the team including system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows, and business rules.
Expert knowledge of enterprise technology delivery practices and standards and related expertise including design, development, testing and project management.
Advanced to Expert understanding of business supported and broader organization.
Works independently as the senior or lead system analyst and coaches/ guides members within area of expertise.
Subject matter expert and consults with clients and/or project teams and may be involved in the assessment of potential projects.
Generally, reports to Senior Manager or above.

Trade life cycle experience

About Klick Health
Get your start somewhere different. Klick Health is an ecosystem of brilliant minds working to realize the full potential of their people and clients in life sciences since 1997. And we're still growing fast, even after two decades. We're one of the country's Top 10 Great Workplaces, 10 Most Inspiring Cultures, Best Workplace for Innovators, Millennials, and Today's Youth. Whether you’re a current student or a new graduate looking for that first role, Klick is a powerful launching pad for any career. If you feel like you'd be a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply and take the first steps to starting your career journey at Klick!

About Our Analytics Craft
The Analytics team assists with planning, executing and optimizing digital marketing campaigns for our clients. Their work ranges from web analytics to marketing mix optimization to predictive modeling and including pulling data, analyzing it and creating reports or data visualizations. Get to know this team at careers.klick.com/analytics

Job Description

Work Term: Permanent, Full-time
Work schedule: 40 hours per week
Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid)

Klick Health is looking for a Marketing Analyst to support our work with our pharmaceutical client. This position will be focused on supporting reporting and insight generation activities with a variety of in-house data management and reporting tools. You will work closely with marketing strategy and activation colleagues to support measurement planning, business intelligence and optimization of in-market programs.
If you describe yourself as someone who:
Be graduating by April 2023 or has graduated from a post-secondary program within the past two years in any of the following fields of study: Math, Engineering, Computer Sciences, Decision Science, Data Analytics, or related field
Grounds your thinking in quantitative analysis
Welcomes ambiguity, thinks critically, and teaches those around youIs solution-focused and business-oriented
Has a desire to master tools such as Excel and Tableau
Has intellectual curiosity, data management skills and meticulous attention to detail
Enjoys data visualization and storytelling
Then your day to day would include:
Developing and maintaining on going client reports
Designing and conducting analyses for client recommendations
Collaborating with other capabilities to provide integrated, analytic marketing solutions and optimizations to improve client decision-making
Analyzing data to understand what is happening online and identify patterns of changes
Applying quantitative techniques to uncover hidden patterns in the data
This experience leads to opportunities focused in:
Developing industry leading analytical and marketing science solutions for healthcare clients
Working in close collaboration with colleagues across agency disciplines to develop innovative, highly effective, data powered marketing activations for our clients
Learning innovative technological and analytical techniques for the future

Klick is consciously creating a culture where everyone can thrive and grow in their careers. We believe that our best work comes from our diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strongly encourage members of historically underrepresented communities to apply, including Black people, Indigenous peoples, and other people of colour, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.

We’re also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. Should you require any accommodation, please contact us at careers@klick.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs and ensure you have a positive experience.

Questrade Financial Group (QFG) of Companies is committed to helping Canadians become much more financially successful and secure. We are everything a traditional financial institution is not. Our vision is to revolutionize financial services for the benefit of Canadians by providing the most innovative and cost efficient financial services online.

That’s why we empower our employees to continuously grow their professional careers with QFG. We believe in having a diverse, inclusive place to work and our flexible working arrangements brings that to life so you can unleash your creativity. Our values are a part of our DNA, and we care deeply about our people helping us fulfill our mission and become an important part of our community. We are always looking for like-minded professionals to join our team. Come grow with us.

We’re looking for our next Customer Experience Research Analyst – Could It Be You?
The purpose for this role is to support and build feedback measurement programs, leveraging technology and delivering strategic insights using real time dashboards and reporting.

As part of Questrade's CX team the CX VoC Analyst will help carry out quantitative research through various customer outreach initiatives, including surveying, a Voice of the Customer (VoC) program, and other channels by collecting, monitoring and managing feedback.

What’s it like working as an Customer Experience Research Analyst at Questrade?
The CX Voice of Customer (VoC) Analyst will manage the execution of all aspects of the quantitative research process from survey design, field management, analysis and interpretation of results through to preparation of standardized, ongoing reporting to be delivered to stakeholders throughout the organization. You will manage CXM platform programs from implementation through to ongoing managed services support to create robust measurement through Qualtrics foundational and digital CX solutions to optimize insight delivery processes. You will work with cross-functional teams to streamline the operational processes through the integration between internal automation platforms and Qualtrics to optimize current feedback measurement and quantitative research studies. You will manage programming and/or testing of web surveys using Qualtrics platform. You will perform analysis on available data including Voice of the Customer (VoC) programs (such as surveys) and operational metrics to identify relationships, trends, and opportunities for improvement for the various products and lines of business. You will manage ad hoc reporting requests and act as a subject matter expert on ongoing feedback measurement projects. You will work with cross-functional teams in Marketing, Customer Service, Sales and Technology Operations to develop a common understanding and interpretation of customer feedback

So are YOU our next Customer Experience Research Analyst? You are if you …
✔ Have a BA/BS degree in Business, Statistics or other related fields or equivalent practical experience
✔ Have 3+ years of quantitative market research experience or equivalent combination of experience and education
✔ Have 3+ years of experience with traditional and digital market research techniques
✔ Have expertise working with customer satisfaction/experience tools and methodologies preferred
✔ Have the ability to manage multiple projects – strong quantitative research project management skills
✔ Have exceptional interpersonal, presentation and collaboration skills
✔ Have superior data management, manipulation, interpretation and analysis skills
✔ Have prior experience working with CX EFM platforms such as Qualtrics, including practical experience with programming and testing surveys with Qualtrics
✔ Have experience working on Qualtrics Digital CX is an asset
✔ Have working knowledge of reporting and data visualization tools, such PowerBI and Qualtrics dashboards and Text iQ
✔ Have practical experience with data analysis and proficiency in using Excel, including the ability to create pivot tables and combine multiple tables (such as through VLOOKUP), manipulating multiple data sources, and visualizing data
✔ Have knowledge of SPSS, SAS, Python, R or other statistical analysis or data transformation tools. Basic experience using tools such as SQL to append additional data and identify relationships is a plus
✔ Have familiarity with HTML and CSS programming languages used for survey design
✔ Have sound interpersonal, presentation and collaboration skills
✔ You are an innovative thinker possessing both drive and intelligence, with a passion for matching science with insight
✔ Have strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present insights and recommendations clearly and effectively
✔ You are self-motivated; able to work both independently and in a collaborative way to achieve set outcomes

Brownie points if you...
✔ Have experience working on Qualtrics Digital CX

Sounds like you? Click below to apply! #LI-Hybrid #LI-TM1

We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings, and believe that when our teams feel supported and motivated, their creativity becomes a source of innovation. We are also committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and also one which reflects the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in to help us revolutionize financial services for the benefit of all of our customers. About Toogood
Toogood Financial Systems is an industry-leading, Canadian-based financial technology firm. With more than twenty years of experience supporting some of the largest financial institutions, our sophisticated, enterprise-grade portfolio management system helps the financial industry manage over $100 billion in assets. To learn more about us, please visit https://www.toogood.com.
Data & automation is a large component of ensuring our clients have accurate information on our application. Toogood is looking for an analyst who can interpret financial data, while being capable of managing ETL (Extract/Transform/Load) related functions. Our clients typically submit individual ticket requests and/or project requests, which need to be investigated & solutioned (with assistance from internal teams). Another important function with digesting data is being able to automate tasks and functions for our clients; utilizing an in-house built application (Evolution) to do so.
What you’ll work on
Intake and maintain data and automation requests (incidents, modifications, ad-hoc data requests), triaging and determine priority; all ticket requests need to be overseen to ensure delivery dates and objectives are met
Analyze data requests, gathering requirements and expected behaviour to determine next steps for product, development and testing teams; requests are related to data ingestion and automation of financial data
Communicate and walkthrough client and internal teams to ensure proposed changes (or solution) will accurately resolve the request; specifically business cases, technical requirements and test cases to verify
Perform impact analysis on requests, to ensure business as usual, along with no negative application impacts to our clients
Document all detailed requirements (& specifications) that are required to meet the request; communication on ticket requests is important as various parties are involved to be kept in the loop
Test and verify changes are completed correctly and accurately
Ad-hoc projects as required
What you’ll need
Ability to comprehend and analyze different data and automation requests, ensuring that client problem is understood to adequately for you to determine a successful resolution
Effective communication abilities, to be able to extract requirements from clients, to then be able to describe thorough details to the internal teams to resolve successfully
Organized with high degree of attention to detail to ensure client requests are met timely and accurately
Experience working with private wealth investments
Experience with SDLC
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Passionate about data analytics with a positive and solution oriented mindset
Exceptional time management skills and ability to work under tight deadlines where there are multiple priorities to manage
Nice to have
CSC certification
Previous experience with data integration or implementations
Experience with basic SQL queries
Qualifications & academic requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in financial related field.

Full-time contract position
Primarily Remote/Occasional Onsite

Tree of Life Canada ULC is an Employer who strives to provide an inclusive work environment that involves everyone and embraces the diverse talent of its people. Primary Responsibilities:
This role is part of the Markting Department and it's primary responsibility is to oversee the verification, collection, and input of client, customer, and master item data into the AS400 and other internal systems. As with all positions at Tree of Life Canada, we expect that all actions will be consistent with Tree of Life Canada’s Mission, Vision and Values.

*OPEN TO BRITISH COLUMBIA, ALBERTA, AND ONTARIO RESIDENTS*
Essential Functions:
Co-manage the ongoing verification of data within the AS400 system to ensure complete records for item management, client/brand information and customer specific records.
Oversee data collection for new brands and line extensions to ensure all required information is provided and inputted into the AS400 system. This includes pricing, marketing and nutritional information, stewardship, attributes, allergens, and ecology.
Partake in data cleansing activities and aid in developing routine interval checks to ensure accuracy, completeness and overall system synchronicities.
Work collaboratively with sales, marketing, and finance teams to ensure certificates, third-party authentications and brand/customer forms are complete, categorized and readily available for use by all other departments.
Work collaboratively with sales and marketing teams to ensure data accuracy, identify real or potential challenges and pressures to the business. Provide corrective action advice when necessary.
Contribute ideas and actions towards improvement of processes for data collection.
Must maintain good attendance and maintain safe work practices.
Maintain safeguards of confidential company information.
Other duties and special projects as requested.

Minimum Requirements, Qualifications, Additional Skills, Aptitude:
Minimum 3-year post-secondary degree/diploma
Proficiency in MS Office programs with Advanced Excel skills including vlookup, macros, and pivot tables
Ability to learn new platforms including Power BI
Strong analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills
Sound judgment and decision-making skills
Strong communication skills written and oral; ability to professionally present information to leaders
Ability to respond to competing priorities with a strong sense of urgency
High degree of self-motivation, accountability, and dependability

Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Job Description
The opportunity
As a key technical lead in the Insights and Governance team within the Strategic Cost Management team, the Senior Data Analyst will play a meaningful role in delivering and supporting our newly released Global Initiative App (GIA). With 600+ users, the GIA encompasses the following components:
Front End Application (Power Apps)
Workflows (Power Automate)
Portfolio Dashboards (Power BI)
This high visibility role will work in developing and improving the components above. You will meet with partners from all segments to understand their requirements on reporting and adapting it to GIA. You will gain exposure to new and exciting tools within the Microsoft Power Platform and build end to end solutions used by all of Manulife

Key Accountabilities:
Act as a domain expert for all things Power BI and dashboard reporting
Work with partners to translate business requirements to useful development features

Strategize on architecture and roadmap for future releases
Help lead product backlog and supervise the weekly change management process
Coach and mentor more junior staff members

How will you build impact?

Working with the Director, Insights and Governance, you will be a key member of the team to take our application to the next level, driving analytics and insights to help all partners make decisions for over 1000+ active initiatives.

Works well individually with much ambiguity

About John Hancock and Manulife
John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com .
One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com .
Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer
At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

About the Job
The primary responsibility is to oversee the verification, collection, and input of client, customer, and master item data into the AS400 and other internal systems. Position Accountabilities

Work collaboratively with sales, marketing, and finance teams to ensure certificates, third-party authentications and brand/customer forms are complete, categorized and readily available for use by all other departments.
Work collaboratively with sales and marketing teams to ensure data accuracy, identify real or potential challenges and pressures to the business. Provide corrective action advice when necessary.

At Shoppers Drug Mart, we’re innovating health and wellness in Canada. From prescriptions to walk-in clinics, and a beloved loyalty program, we’re caring and supporting our customers in new ways every day.
With more than 1,300 locally owned and operated stores from coast to coast, the Shoppers Drug Mart network is more than a great place to shop, it’s a great place to work. SUMMARY

The Lead Data Governance Analyst works as part of the Enterprise Data Governance Team to support the implementation of new data governance tools and related processes, with a focus on enterprise data cataloging, metadata management, business workflows and data quality management.

This role will work closely with the Business teams and other Data & Technology partners to ensure data governance standards, policies and best practices are understood and applied consistently across the organization.

Responsibilities:
Understand OMERS business functions, activities, and transactions, as well as standard information and data governance best practices to contribute practical solutions for both structured and unstructured data in the development and implementation of the Data Governance Program
Design, develop and monitor technology solutions around key data governance focus areas of data catalog, metadata management, data quality management, data lineage business workflows and access management
Partner with Enterprise Data Governance Managers and Data Stewards to define and instrument metadata capture and storage for the CDE’s, evolve our enterprise business glossary, and facilitate the linkage between business definitions and the underlying technical metadata
Manage the processes around metadata repositories (data dictionary, business glossary) and data classification process (identification of sensitive data)
Perform data profiling, data quality analysis and the development of data quality rules to support monitoring and remediation activities
Refine and implement the enterprise metadata management framework, inclusive of business, operational and technical metadata
Provide ongoing access, maintenance, usage, and technical support for our Data Governance Tool inventory including Collibra, Azure Purview
Contribute to the development of reporting requirements to monitor data compliance as well as KPIs and metrics to gauge the health and maturity of data governance program
Collaborate with business and D&T partners to find opportunities to improve data accuracy and ensure that data owners are accountable for remediation
Contribute to the development of appropriate materials, conducting training sessions and be the change advocates to drive data governance best practices
Provide inputs on the design and development of data models for data warehousing and cataloging projects
Work closely with Data & Technology team during the development of new information and data governance related applications, including requirements validation and testing
Primary point of contact for business partners to resolve data security & access issues

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, math or a field related to information, data management, analytics or financial services.
3 - 5 years of technical experience in implementing data governance, data analytics or data quality tools
Knowledge and expertise in data governance technology, business process modeling, metadata, data lineage, data classification, data quality and enterprise implementation of data governance tools and solutions
Experience in defining and building enterprise data management policies, processes, solutions, and associated documentation to strengthen data management
Experience with SQL, database applications MS SQL/ Oracle, and visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau
Understanding of Cloud, Big Data technologies, architectural concepts - data lake, data warehouse, relational databases, data ingestion, ETL etc.
Hand’s on experience with tools such as Ataccama, Collibra, Informatica EIC/ BDM/BDQ, IBM IGC/ IA/ DQS, Microsoft Purview or similar
Knowledge and understanding of data regulations, privacy, ethical use, data sharing, critical data indicators, access management and data masking techniques
Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively articulate and communicate with both business and technical development teams
A team player with a good understanding of the Agile methodology and Change management

Our story:
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Come Work with Us!
At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.
Whether you're helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
HR Data Analyst
Job Description
What is the Opportunity?
RBC, one of Canada's largest and most respected employers, is looking for a HR Data Analyst to join our growing Talent Data and Analytics team.
Reporting to the Director, HR Data Governance & Data Management, the HR Data Analyst will be a strong execution lead of all facets of HR data governance and management across the HR domain. You will lead root cause analysis and end-to-end data discovery efforts and will provide advice and oversight to our HR Centres of Excellence and our business partners through projects, initiatives, and day to day operational activities related to the management and governance of HR data.
Your quick, problem-solving ability allows you to investigate, analyze, organize and prioritize easily -and is foundational to your success in the role. Your strong ability to work with multiple stakeholders and form positive working relationships will also be helpful. You will interface regularly with SMEs from HR Centres of Excellence, the HR Architecture team and the HR Reporting team as well as our partners in IT, Finance, Chief Data Office and Legal. A key focus for our team and this role in particular is in the proper design of employee data capture processes, to make them more accurate and efficient for employees, managers, and the HR community.
As the right candidate, you are multifaceted, fast-paced, comfortable with change and ambiguity, and understand how to apply design thinking and problem solving skills to projects. You will be excited by opportunities to optimize (and support) our HR data architecture, data governance, and data pipelines. You understand how HR data is increasingly seen as an invaluable asset, and are comfortable collaborating with HR subject matter experts to understand the business requirements.
What will you do?
Understand requirements from businesses to help review, improve and document changes to data definitions, access, usage and management processes
Translate business requirements to IT requirements
Advise on best practices for data usage/security/retention/collection etc. for various projects related to HR data and analytics
Engage in a variety of initiatives supporting HR operations, and strive to evolve the maturity of the HR Data governance program
Work with data infrastructure team, data integration teams etc. to execute on projects
Document, manage and execute master data validation strategies for the function.
Execute analytical audits against a variety of types of HR data to assess data validity and data quality, understand gaps, impact and scope of data issues
Collaborate with other departments on data management related projects and reviews.
Support an effective governance communication program for the function
Build a common repository of HR data knowledge including data dictionaries, dimension and measure definitions, and lineage.
Summarize and explain data sets and designs, business processes
Support the strategic development of the HR Governance Program through research and analytics.
What do you need to succeed?
Must have:
5+ years' experience in a data-driven environment with a strong understanding of data issues, data management and data governance principles.
Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills
Experience troubleshooting data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Experience designing processes to support data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured and sub-optimized datasets.
Strong management and organizational skills
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
Communication and presentation skills: ability to summarize and playback analysis, tailor the content for different audiences (technical and non-technical) to drive to impact and help make data-driven decisions.
Nice-to-have
HR/People data domain experience is preferred.
Graduate degree demonstrating the ability to research, learn and problem solve.
Experience in agile development and design thinking methodologies
Superior MS Excel and PowerPoint
SQL/MySQL or other data query/analytics capability
Comfort with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience managing a small team would be an asset.
What's in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to take on progressively greater scopes of work
RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with hiring manager.
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Description
Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that accomplishes operational excellence. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our 25,000 team members in over 400 locations worldwide are vital to making our Company stronger.
Your Opportunity
We have an exciting opportunity for a data analyst supporting Stantec’s digital marketing team. In this role you will develop insights into the performance and impact of digital marketing campaigns and programs. This role reports to the Market Research & Intelligence Director.
Your Key Responsibilities
Develop analytics for Stantec’s digital marketing campaigns and programs
Analyze patterns to better understand performance and identify actionable insights from the data
Develop and analyze reports that provide actionable insights into digital content performance and impact as it relates to the client buying journey
Build and maintain interactive and user-friendly data visualizations, dashboards and analysis tools
Manage accurate reporting of key data metrics used for decision-making
Communicate findings to key stakeholders in a relatable and timely manner
Help marketing and business development teams develop digital analytics use cases that are connected to key business outcomes
Design, execute and analyze tests for performance and direct marketing efforts
Work collaboratively with governance stakeholders to identify and fix data quality issues
Regularly meet with stakeholders across marketing and IT related to data needs and usage
Collaborate with stakeholders to align data requirements with business strategy objectives
Build strong documentation using common data definitions

Problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills, driven by a deep sense of curiosity
Strong reporting skills to present insights concisely

Experience working with and merging large datasets and developing detailed logical analyses
Experience with marketing analytics tools, specifically Google Analytics (GA4 preferred) and Adobe Analytics

Education and Experience
Post-secondary degree in business, data analytics, computer science, or an equivalent level of experience
Minimum 5 years of experience in digital marketing analytics and visualization, preferably in a business-to-business professional services environment

Job Title

Job Description
Senior Business Systems Analyst – DNA Business Analysis
WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?
The Business Analysis team within DNA is looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst to be responsible for data analysis activities on medium to large size projects. The role demonstrates good knowledge and ability and can work independently on assigned projects. The role is responsible for execution of all aspects of data analysis including planning, elicitation, analysis, documentation and post implementation verification. The role is part of a team that works across IT and with assigned business line(s) to enable business objectives and strategies. The role also requires the mentoring of junior BSA’s once the candidate is comfortable in the role. The successful candidate will have a positive attitude, fresh ideas and the ability to produce quality results in a fast paced dynamic environment.
WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Write SQL queries using complex joins, grouping and aggregation.
Complete detailed data profiling and data mapping documentation, complete detailed transformations and rule derivations.
Prepare functional & non-functional design specifications, business process models, business object models.
Complete end-user documentation for communique’s for the DNA User Community.
Estimate activities required to perform requirements gathering and acceptance testing improving accuracy over time.
Prepare and deliver knowledge transfer presentations to peers during monthly BSA Meetings.
Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, modelers, DBAs, Stakeholders and business partners using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close.
Use Jupyter Notebook to query data in the Enterprise Data Lake
WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?
Must have:
University degree or equivalent in Business Analysis field of Study. Business & Information Technology preferred.
Experience with SQL, Proficient in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, HIVE, Jupyter Notebook & JIRA. Environments are Teradata Data Warehouse and Enterprise Data Lake. Near future Cloud
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Exposure to Relational Databases and Concepts.
Requirements methods: Exposure to data modeling, business process modeling, business object modeling and user interface design.
Nice-to-have:
Knowledge of Data warehouse, Data Warehouse Environment (DWE), Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) & Royal Bank Data Mart (RBDM) (Asset).
Knowledge of Host (Mainframe) with TSO (Asset).
Knowledge of Big Data and Big Data tools/solutions such as Python, Scala, Apache Spark, Hadoop, Hive, Jupyter Notebook etc. (Asset)
Knowledge of data analysis in a Cloud environment (AWS and/or Azure) tools such Snowflake (Asset)

About Thentia
Thentia Cloud is a fast-growing, venture capital-backed software as a service (SaaS) company that is emerging as a world leader in government technology with a platform that is transforming and modernizing how regulatory organizations are conducting business. A company of builders, thinkers, and owners, Thentia gives employees the opportunity to create amazing solutions, showcase their talents, and benefit from our shared success as we scale up in the U.S., Canadian, and global markets. Further, Thentia Cloud’s solutions directly impact public trust and regulatory integrity, helping regulators and agencies meet 21st century standards by leveraging predictive analytics, Big Data, AI, and other innovative capabilities. Internally, our culture fosters collaboration, inclusivity, intellectual curiosity, and professional development.
About the role:
We are seeking a business minded research analyst to support strategy development within our growing company. You will have experience and an aptitude for various commercially oriented types of research including: market research, customer research, product research and competitive research. Ideally, you will have some experience as a research analyst or commensurate experience or study in a related field within our target market. You will understand public policy broadly, with some understanding of the regulatory market and government procurement preferred. You will also gather information through a variety of forms of data collection (e.g., surveys, research, statistical reports, anonymized product usage data, etc.) and leverage their statistical analysis capabilities to interpret and draw insight from the data. Critically, the candidate will be able to write effective reports, summary articles and powerpoint decks to convey key findings on the information collected. You will also be supported by our internal editorial team, industry experts within and outside of the company and others with close knowledge of the subject matter.
*
Responsibilities: *
Establish and develop research capabilities focused on the regulatory market, our customers in the regulatory space as well as direct and indirect competitors to Thentia
Gathering industry, customer and competitor data through research, surveys and other forms of data collection.
Interpreting and analyzing data in meaningful ways to derive insights that are relevant to various internal and external stakeholders.
Build and launch surveys on an array of industry and organizational capabilities, priorities, etc. to develop a sense of strategic insights, industry trends, and other
Work with the editorial and design teams to develop outstanding content
Development of economic impact models to quantify the benefits of various government technology offerings
Novel original research supporting network effects-driven product and GTM strategy
Primary and secondary research to identify total addressable market supporting strategic choices on new product offerings
Qualifications:
2 to 4 years in a research role as a research analyst, research associate, or principle analyst
BA or BS required, Masters degree and/or MBA preferred
Background in statistics, data analytics, data visualization. Experience conducting primary and secondary research utilizing qualitative and quantitative data.
Critical thinking, intellectual curiosity, and a nuanced understanding of organizational excellence, best practices, and evaluative criteria.
Capable of converting qualitative and quantitative information into clear frameworks, narratives, and visually compelling presentations.
Background or education in political science a bonus
Experience with regulators, government regulation, regulatory affairs or regulatory compliance a bouns
Please include at least one research-oriented writing sample in your resume.
We thank all applicants in advance for applying. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

Full Health Insurance coverage
Flexible paid-time-off, including vacation and wellness days

Employee Stock Option Plan
Year-end bonus potential
Remote or Hybrid working options (as position allows)
Professional development & training, including Udemy Business

Ting Internet is a leading fiber Internet provider in the United States, delivering future-proof internet in over a dozen Ting Towns across the country.

About the opportunity
The Business Analyst is responsible for driving and improving change management practices for the Ting Information Systems (IS) Team. The Business Analyst will support change management for our existing third party SaaS and Software ecosystem as well as support the implementation for any new solutions. You'll work closely with a number of our team members including Customer Support/Enablement, Marketing, Field Operations, Product, etc. to refine requirements and ensure solutions are focused on improving system efficiency and overall user experience.
You are responsible for bridging the gap between IS and Ting business partners by actively leading requests and creating an action plan for each. This includes initial triage/prioritization, requirements gathering, developing user stories and collaborating with the IS team to deliver data-driven recommendations.
The Business Analyst must articulate process and solution recommendations by working closely with other members of the team including Project Managers, Process Analysts and System Administrators. You'll need to understand how to balance priorities against what's technically feasible and financially reasonable. You'll look to support and evolve how we intake, size and communication solutions to our partners.

What you'll be doing:
Work with the IS team (Project management, Process Analysts, System Admins) to capture business problems and define requirements for net-new projects and improvements to existing processes, programs, and SaaS platforms.
Work with partners to understand their business challenges and use these to properly develop the use case and business requirements for new solutions.
Create detailed business analysis, outlining problems, opportunities and solutions for a business group.
Use the A3 problem-solving methodology for each new request to highlight business needs, conditions, goals, and root cause analysis.
Bridge the gap between stakeholders (requesters) and the Information Systems Team
Work with leadership to understand overall business needs and future goals; Ensure solution proposals are aligning with those needs.
Schedule Management – ensure that project timelines are established and published and assist with the determination of a project scope that is scheduled in manageable components. Track the stage of each request until completion.
Foster partnership with collaborators, project sponsors, and vendors.
Improve communication and change management practices within the IS team.
What you'll bring:
Three (3) or more years of Business Analyst and/or project management experience
Project management qualification (PMP) or PMO preferred but not mandatory
Strong organizational skills
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
Thorough and capable of delivering with a high level of accuracy
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Facilitation skills
Stakeholder management, analysis, and requirements engineering
A great teammate who is able to manage multi-disciplinary teams and multiple projects simultaneously
Strong Leadership and organization skills
Demonstrated ability to deliver complex, multi-platform projects and solutions
Proficiency with related software tools including but not limited to Wrike, Asana, JIRA

Some of what you will do
As the Supply Chain Strategy & Optimization Analyst, you will support the B2B and B2C business with the right amount of inventory, at the right time, at the right place to serve the business and our customers. You will work closely with Category Specialists, Category Managers and other cross-functional team members to forecast, provide order recommendations, order fulfillment and overall inventory management duties. You will also perform data analysis on a regular basis analyzing current and historical trends, providing insights within their categories. Each day will be rewarding and meaningful.
Specifically, you will:
Perform daily inventory fulfillment tasks in their category including purchase order creation.
Review inventory KPI’s on a frequent basis and discuss the results with the Category Manager to evaluate inventory management opportunities and results.
Manage Store and Fulfillment Centre inventory balancing customer experience, sales while managing to the inventory KPI’s.
Maintain proper SKU/Vendor setup as it relates to replenishment parameters in AS400, JDA Advanced Store Replenishment and/or Advanced Warehouse Replenishment applications.
Complete the daily out of stock review, identifying trends and inventory depth opportunities that could result in out of stocks.
Collect, analyze and report on sales/inventory data to support seasonality and trends. Adjust the forecast/demand in JDA at different fulfillment nodes.
Promotional forecasting – Analyze inventory and sales data (where required) to support proposed promo position and evaluate impact on current and future inventory levels to determine the best way to support customers.
Collaborate, determine load in and maintain forecasts for new items as created by the Category Specialist.
Identify unexpected inventory opportunities between sales and forecast. Research to determine root cause working closely with the Merchant team. Providing recommendations to resolve opportunity.
Manage customer fulfillment KPI’s such as in-stock, late purchase order management, vendor fill rates, system lead days, etc.
Issue and follow up with fulfillment nodes regarding the return to vendor (RTV) program to ensure cost recovery and that inventory is removed from the system in a timely manner.
Execute department and SKU level plans to drive unique Store/FC merchandise inventory strategies. This includes localization and monitoring for smooth transition between selling periods.
Evaluate minimum presentation quantities, stock balancing, and inventory variances at store and make required changes and/or recommendations as required.

Who We Are:
Ipsos is one of the world’s largest research companies and currently the only one primarily managed by researchers, ranking as a #1 full-service research organization for four consecutive years. With over 75 different data-driven solutions, and presence in 90 markets, Ipsos brings together research, implementation, methodological, and subject-matter experts from around the world, combining thematic and technical experts to deliver top-quality research and insights. Simply speaking, we help the biggest companies solve some of their biggest problems, serving more than 5000 clients across the globe by providing research, data, and insights on their target markets. And, we’re proud to share we’ve received our Great Place to Work Certification for 2022!

About Market Strategy & Understanding Research:
The Market Strategy & Understanding Research (MSU) Service Line works with our clients on Foundational, Branding, and Shopper & Retail research. Our insights help clients understand the size and composition of a market, the current consumer profile, the target consumer and how to engage them, and the shopper experience and purchase journey. We also specialize in brand equity, brand assets, brand stretch and open category opportunities (e.g. whitespace).

What makes this role important at Ipsos?
We are looking for someone who is passionate about market research and motivated by a fast-paced and challenging work environment. This is an excellent entry-level role for someone who is interested in starting a career in the consulting and insights industry.

What you can expect to be doing:
Manage the launching and ongoing maintenance of research studies
Creation and maintenance of technical specifications in proprietary software for study questionnaires
Quality check study questionnaires & perform in-depth quality checks at every stage of the process
Liaising with our internal data collection teams, coding & data processing teams
Perform data verification
Identify and solve project issues as they arise

This might be the job for you if you have:
Bachelor’s Degree
Project management and/or market research experience an asset
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and analytical skills
Proactive, “can do” attitude
High attention to detail: ability to balance overall project goal with key milestones and tasks
Advanced proficiency with MS Office Suite; specifically, PowerPoint and Excel
Self-starter with superior organization skills who thrives in a deadline driven environment
Ability to juggle multiple projects and diplomatically respond to conflicting needs
Bilingual an asset, but not required.

If you don’t meet 100% of the requirements, we encourage all who feel they might be a fit for the opportunity to apply. We may consider a variety of backgrounds for a particular role and are also committed to considering candidates for available positions throughout our organization, not just the one you’re applying to!

What’s in it for you:
At Ipsos you’ll experience opportunities for Career Development, an exceptional benefits package (including generous PTO, healthcare plans, wellness benefits), a flexible workplace policy, and a strong collaborative culture.

To find out more about all the great reasons to work at Ipsos, how we’re making an impact around the world, and more about our benefits and employee programs, please visit:https://www.ipsos.com/en-ca/opportunities-ipsos

Commitment to Diversity
Ipsos recognizes the necessity of building an inclusive culture that values each employee’s individuality and diverse perspectives. For more than 40 years, our mission has been to generate and analyze data about society, markets, brands, and behaviors to provide our clients with the insights that elevate their understanding of the world. This could not be fulfilled without Ipsos’ diverse employees who compile and analyze this data—they are the essence of who we are and what we do.

We are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees, creating an environment that promotes inclusion, and enabling employees from all walks of life to flourish. Ipsos encourages our employees to act in a respectful and responsible manner, in line with code of best practices concerning diversity and inclusion, human rights, equality, and civility for every individual.

Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

#LI-JD2
#LI-Remote

Required Skills

Required Experience

Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.
Summary:
Do you love solving business problems or complex questions with data? Are you a logical, analytical thinker who has a passion for scalable solutions? Are you a tech savvy individual looking for an exciting, dynamic role which deep-dives into the consumer, commercial and fraud credit world? If so, we would love to hear from you!
Equifax is looking for a Lead Data & Quality Assurance Analyst to join its Canadian team. As a lead data analyst at Equifax, you will work directly with both internal stakeholders and external clients using data and analytics to answer key industry questions.
This is a hybrid role where 50% of your time will be spent utilizing data and analytics to address internal and external client problems / projects via the creation of reporting and data analytics, and 50% of your time will be ensuring deliverables within the team are to a high quality standard and error free.
The ideal candidate will not only have strong technical experience but demonstrate creativity and inquisitiveness and a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for identifying potential risks in data and analytical project deliverables and have a hands on approach to solving these. You will be working in a fast-paced function where digging to understand the “why” and “so what” is critical.
What you'll do
Working in our cloud environment, leverage analytical techniques & visualization tools to develop scalable solutions across multiple credit related topics
Lead and develop a quality assurance framework for custom projects which can be easily implemented provide demonstrably improved accuracy and quality of deliverables
Fulfillment of a vast array of client specific projects involving data engineering, reporting and insight generation
Effectively communicate to key stakeholders using storytelling, strong data visualizations, superior presentation skills and business language to emphasize the “so what” of the analysis
Creation of recommendations, market insights and dashboards following completed analysis for client projects
What experience you need
You don’t have to tick all of the boxes but some of the following would be ideal:
3+ years’ analytics / data science experience with expert knowledge of R, Python, SAS or SQL in a large data environment
2+ years experience designing and building analytical solutions to solve real world problems, with limited direct supervision required
Exceptional sense checking and error identification skills with experience in real world quality assurance checks on complex analysis
Creativity & idea generation
Experience in working with Credit Bureau data
Experience working in the consumer / commercial credit or fraud industry
Background in financial services, telecommunications or utilities favorable
Experience with data visualization tools (Spotfire, Tableau, Qlik) is an assetBachelor’s or advanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or Physics (essential)
What could set you apart
Master’s level degree in a business-related field/MBA (preferred)
We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, paid time off, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.

Are you ready to power your possible? Apply today, and get started on a path toward an exciting new career at Equifax, where you can make a difference!

Equifax is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

ABOUT ONEX:
Founded in 1984, Onex invests and manages capital on behalf of its shareholders, institutional investors and high net worth clients from around the world. Onex' platforms include: Onex Partners, private equity funds focused on larger opportunities in North America and Europe; ONCAP, private equity funds focused on middle market and smaller opportunities in North America; Onex Credit, which manages primarily non-investment grade debt through collateralized loan obligations, private debt and other credit strategies; and Gluskin Sheff's actively managed public equity and public credit funds.
ABOUT GLUSKIN SHEFF & ASSOCIATES:
Gluskin Sheff + Associates Inc. is one of Canada's pre-eminent wealth management firms. Founded in 1984 and acquired by Onex in 2019, we are dedicated to meeting the needs of our clients by delivering strong, risk-adjusted returns together with the highest level of personalized client service to high net worth private clients and institutional investors.
THE OPPORTUNITY:
As a member of the Wealth technology team, you will work with key stakeholders to align technology solutions with business strategies. Your focus will be to gather requirements from business units and to work with the technical team to develop solutions. You will take a strategic view of the application portfolio and establish a longer term vision for the evolution of applications to support the evolving business needs.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
The job responsibilities include:
Contribute to the product vision, strategy and overall roadmap of the Wealth portfolio, in alignment with overall business strategy and stakeholder priorities. Break down strategic problems, analyzing information from various sources to make strategic recommendations.
Create and maintain a prioritized backlog of requirements; work with development teams to establish release plans to deliver this new functionality
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of stakeholders and business users
Serving as a liaison between business stakeholders, users, vendors and technical teams
Translates conceptual customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team; creates process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team
Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood
WHAT YOU BRING:
A bachelor's degree in business, technology or related field or an MBA.
A minimum of 5 years' experience in business analysis in Wealth management industry, with back office exposure. Fund experience (administration, accounting) is strongly preferred.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions
Strong ability to navigate ambiguity, overcome confusion and simplify complex situations
Team player with strong interpersonal skills and ability to take a leadership role when necessary
Detail-oriented individual with the ability to quickly assimilate and apply new concepts, business models, and technologies.
Highly organized with attention to detail and ability to deliver projects and "get it done"
You should be a highly driven and results oriented individual, comfortable in a dynamic, fast paced, and changing environment
Strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business requirements into data models, data flows, functional and operational requirements.
Good understanding of the relational database design and modeling, data queries and reporting.
