Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) is a US$5.8 billion global leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions. We bring global expertise and insight at every stage of product development - from the drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services. Through our unrivalled customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in aerospace and defense, communications, enterprise, healthtech, industrial, capital equipment, and smart energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges.
Celestica is a high-integrity work environment and when you join Celestica you are apart of a leading global company that enables the world’s best brands, and contributing to our innovative and collaborative solutions that help our customers unlock the potential of the future.

Our global network spans 14 countries with 24,500 employees across the Americas, Europe and Asia. At our Toronto headquarters, we are focused on attracting top talent into our organization, including interns from universities and colleges throughout Southern Ontario.

Celestica's internship program provides students with valuable development through real-life work experience, exciting projects and networking with industry professionals.

Benefits for Students Include:
Experience working for one of the largest Canadian global technology companies
Possibility of a student casual contract position after completion of internship
Possibility of a full-time position after completion of degree
Access to Celestica’s development programs and projects
Celestica's Time Off to Volunteer program – two paid days off to volunteer per year
Fun intern activities including celebration events and networking
Internal recognition programs and rewards for stellar performance

What’s in it for you?
Opportunity: Job experience at a large Canadian-based global company
Innovation: We look to our employees to implement new ideas and improve the way we do things
Collaboration: Students work as part of global teams, enabled by collaborative technology
Sustainability: We uphold strong ethics, reduce our impact on the environment and empower employees to give back to the community with two paid days
off per year to volunteer
Development opportunities: including soft skills courses, innovation projects and mentorship
Networking: Strategically build your professional network to advance your career and deepen relationships across your peers and colleagues.
Fun: Our interns have the opportunity to participate in fun activities including intern social events, Celestica’s charitable initiatives and our Spirit Week activities


About this opportunity:
In this role, student will have an opportunity to work with our external customers processing, maintaining and managing data.

Preferred Skills:
Understanding and efficient usage of spread sheets and database
Fast learner with great communication skills
Knowledge in Macros Excel is an asset
Project Management Skills is an asset
Able to analyze German, French or Chinese would be an asset

Activities:
Receive, review and understand product data packages from our external customers.
Complete bill of material, component and assembly data set up within Celestica's internal databases to enable material procurement and manufacturing.
Communicate with external customers to resolve missing and/or inaccurate data.
Work is guided by detailed instructions, routine, procedure and under close supervision. Will receive detailed instructions on all work assignments.
Work autonomously once proficiency in the tasks is achieved.
Opportunity on more complex duties as proficiency is gained.
Opportunity to gain global and supply chain experience within diverse industry environment.

Area: Product Data Management (Global Business Services)

Start Date: May 2023

Location: 5140 Yonge Street, Toronto, ON

Experience: no formal experience required

Education: Currently enrolled in a University Internship program completing 3rd year of a 4-year program. Enrolled in Engineering (Mechanical/Electrical/Computer), Mathematics, Statistical Analysis, Data Management or Business Administration.

***As this position involves work that is subject to the Canadian Government's Controlled Goods Program (CGP), your employment offer is conditional upon the successful completion of a security assessment by Celestica and/or its authorized agents, per the Controlled Goods Regulations.


To apply, please visit www.celestica.com. Please provide a copy of your transcript with your application.

Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law).


At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them.

TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview


The Wealth Operations team enable resources for operational needs across the Wealth business resulting in lower costs with excellent customer-service levels. The team facilitate key business strategies to handle core business processes and lead cross operations initiatives while ensuring operational effectiveness.

The Mutual Fund Operations department is part of the overarching Wealth Shared Services team. Mutual Fund Operations manages all systems and processes related to mutual fund trading activity from both the Fund Company and Dealer perspectives. The team is currently constituted of over 80 team members, split into several teams responsible for Trade Processing, Settlement and Trade Corrections. In addition, operational support is provided through the Fund & Dealer Relations team and our Functions Specialists teams.

Job Description
The Mutual Fund Operations team is looking for a highly-motivated, result-driven, technically-focused individual to help guide our team through a period of unprecedented industry and technological change, and support the team's vision to simplify processes and operations. The Business Wealth Innovation Analyst reports to the Manager of the Mutual Fund Operations team.

Job Accountabilities:
Drive continuous improvement and process-based innovation automation initiatives throughout the Mutual Fund Operations group.
Recommend and develop solutions to optimize process performance:
Take a risk-based approach in applying innovative solutions to unique problems in differing lines of business
Liaise with multiple partners
Recommend and summarize improvements
Using tools including Excel VBAs, Alteryx and Tableau, build workflows/processes that optimize the efficiency of existing operations by automating day-to-day functions and processes, such as processing and data analysis.
Provide accurate and thorough analysis of key process divers, root or systemic causes of cross functional operational issues, interpret findings and make recommendations
Coordinate with partners on key initiatives and may act as a project lead / subject matter expert for small-scale projects / initiatives in accordance with project management methodologies
In partnership with the leadership team and colleagues, solve complex problems using judgement based on analysis to streamline and build efficient process flows
Assist in analysis, development, testing and implementation of operational changes and process improvements.
Act as a key resource for team by providing deep technical subject matter expertise, analysis and operational process support
Proactively evaluate risk exposures and opportunities for improvement through tracking and analysis of incidents and metrics, executing centralized protocols for issues management and escalation to reduce potential impact to clients
Design/develop dashboards and scorecards to support business needs; ensure alignment of metrics across the organization
Identify and bring forward opportunities to improve service delivery
Lead work streams by acting as a project lead and subject matter expert on a range of projects and initiatives
Contribute to the identification, development and implementation of continuous improvement opportunities
Job Requirements
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (advanced excel preferred). Excellent knowledge and use of MS Excel spreadsheets/macros, with the ability to extract and manipulate data.
Knowledge of other programming language and familiarity with tools such as Alteryx/Python/Tableau are a strong asset.
Technically astute, very comfortable understanding and learning new systems, processes and technologies.
Strong communication skills - able to present complex issues/concepts in simple and clear language and able to cater messaging to senior audiences
Prioritize and manage own workload to meet SLA requirements for service and productivity
Self-starter and continuous improvement mindset - needs minimal direction on how to get things done and is driven by a continuous improvement mindset that is striving to improve processes and the client and partner experience
Superior time management and organizational skills to manage multiple deadlines and priorities within a highly demanding environment. Be self-motivated, customer and deadline oriented. Be able to work well under pressure both independently and within a team.
Knowledge of mutual fund and TD systems, including SMS, Primebase, ISM, Fundserv would be an asset
Demonstrated organizational and analytical skills
Proven ability to work independently and within a team

CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.

What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our
Hybrid Work Model
.
Job Description
POSITION PURPOSE
Ensure data integrity by analyzing data sources details and accuracy, mapping, verifying and providing data governance reports
Analyze the data to identify any anomalies (fraudulent and suspicious) within the customer reported transactional data.
Build supervised learning, algorithms using python, detect new patterns / anomalies and simplify corrective actions
To develop power BI dashboards, provide business intelligence and analytical support to the Finance Controllership.
Success in this role will result in greater asset control, consistent data tables, and accurate billing.
SCOPE
Region: Canada
MAJOR / KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Asset Efficiency
Liaison with North America and BXB to drive data integrity projects within CHEP Canada.
Identify opportunities to control leakage at the Retailers
Create ways to control negative balances at Emitters
Create tools to identify duplicate or suspicious transactions
Identify and fast-track quick-wins and create regular cadence
Responsible for monthly reporting of asset efficiency metrics
Business partner with controllership to continue to refine the Detect model
Data Integrity
Work with business stakeholders and SMEs to assess current capabilities, understand high-level business requirements and apply technical background in the development of PBI analytics
Using Python based Detect tool and customize it for regional use
Develop intuitive business reports that provide intelligence to the organization
Prepares actionable viewpoints by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
Prepare monthly reports for top management i.e. market intelligence analysis, red flags analysis.
Leverage industry data to provide insightful recommendations regarding business strategies
Deliver high quality reports and presentations for specific audiences
Participate in team initiatives to conduct timely quantitative and qualitative evaluations
Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise in own area and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends/developments and develop expertise applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques that can contribute to effective solution development/deliver
Transaction Management & Controls
Liaison with Transaction Management team to identify anomalies and subsequently create cases in Sales force for resolution.
Owns reversals and corrections of data integrity transactions
Business Insights
Develop new insights of business performance based on data and statistical methods.
Conduct deep dive analyses to create new and critical metrics in the focused areas of business
Translate customer KPI’s, reports and analytics into a business intelligence using Power BI
Management of all internal and external KPIs via Power BI dashboards to monitor anomalies and data integrity of transactions.
Business Partnering
Respond to and collaborate on issues and requests from other internal and external departments
Develop and deliver high quality reports and presentations for specific audiences.
Support the Canadian leadership team quarterly reviews, ad hoc requirements and any in-depth analysis
QUALIFICATIONS
College Degree in Business/ IT is required
University Degree in Business/ IT is preferred
EXPERIENCE
1-3 years of experience in Data Analysis
Experience in writing algorithms using Python
1-2 years of experience in Python
Power BI experience is preferred
Advance excel experience in developing macros, pivot tables dealing with bad data and transactional data
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, business strategy, and decision-making skill
Work independently and with all levels of key stakeholders and SMEs
Experience in facilitating and conducting live presentations
SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE
Self-starter with the ability to take initiative and ownership of responsibilities
High competence in languages required to own and deliver Power BI. MS Office (PowerPoint, Word, Project and Excel (Macros, formulas, pivot tables, etc.)
Superior attention to detail and strong communication and influencing skills
Digital experience and mindset
Proven ability to take initiative and champion a project from concept through implementation
Demonstrated ability to juggle concurrent projects and demonstrate flexibility within a frequently changing environment
Strong team player with the ability to form relationships at various levels.
Act with sense of urgency and drive and a commitment to personal excellence
LANGUAGES
English
Desirable: French
Objectif du poste
Veiller à l’intégrité des données en analysant les détails et la précision des sources de données, en les mappant, en les vérifiant et en fournissant des rapports sur la gouvernance des données.
Analyser les données pour détecter les anomalies (frauduleuses et suspectes) dans les données transactionnelles rapportées par le client.
Créer des algorithmes d’apprentissage supervisé au moyen de python, détecter les nouvelles tendances/anomalies et simplifier les mesures correctives.
Préparer des tableaux de bord dans Power BI pour fournir de l’information et du soutien aux activités d’analyse de l’équipe de contrôle des Finances.
La réussite à ce poste entraînera un meilleur contrôle des actifs, des tableaux de données plus uniformes et une facturation précise de la circulation des TED.
Principales responsabilités
Efficacité des actifs
Agir à titre de point de contact avec l’équipe nord-américaine et BXB pour faire progresser les projets relatifs à l’intégrité des données chez CHEP Canada.
Trouver les occasions de contrôler les pertes chez les détaillants afin de réduire l’impact du IPEP sur les profits et les pertes.
Créer des façons de contrôler les soldes négatifs chez les émetteurs.
Créer des outils pour détecter les mouvements de TED en double ou factices.
Trouver et accélérer les gains rapides et créer une cadence régulière.
Superviser et faire progresser les initiatives de transformation.
Responsable des rapports mensuels des indices de mesure sur l’efficacité des actifs.
Agir à titre de partenaire pour l’équipe de contrôle afin de continuer de raffiner le modèle de détection et aider à réduire l’impact du IPEP et de l’exposition pour CHEP Canada.
Intégrité des données
Travailler avec les intervenants de l’entreprise et les experts techniques pour évaluer les capacités actuelles, comprendre les exigences générales et appliquer l’information technique à l’élaboration des analyses dans PBI.
Utiliser l’outil de détection pour créer un tableau de bord des anomalies dans l’application PBI.
Préparer des rapports intuitifs offrant de l’information à l’entreprise.
Préparer des avis avec des mesures concrètes en recueillant, en analysant et en résumant l’information et les tendances.
Préparer des rapports mensuels pour la haute direction, c.-à-d. analyse des données du marché, analyse des alertes.
Utiliser les données de l’industrie pour émettre des recommandations utiles à l’égard des stratégies de l’entreprise.
Fournir des rapports et des présentations de grande qualité destinées à différents publics.
Participer aux initiatives d’équipe pour mener des évaluations quantitatives et qualitatives dans un délai raisonnable.
Lier les analyses et les résultats aux problèmes de l’entreprise ou aux objectifs d’analyse.
Analyser les résultats de l’entreprise et fournir des recommandations concrètes et stratégiques (lorsque nécessaire).
Améliorer continuellement les connaissances et l’expertise dans son domaine de compétences et demeurer au fait des tendances et avancées technologiques et gagner de l’expertise sur les applications, l’infrastructure, les outils analytiques et les techniques pouvant aider à développer efficacement et offrir des solutions.
Gestion des transactions et contrôles
Agir à titre de point de contact avec l’équipe de gestion des transactions pour détecter les anomalies puis créer des requêtes dans Salesforce pour résolution.
Être responsable des renversements et des corrections aux transactions pour l’intégrité des données.
Connaissance du marché
Trouver de l’information sur le rendement de l’entreprise fondée sur les données et les méthodes statistiques.
Mener des analyses en profondeur pour créer de nouveaux indices de mesure essentiels dans les secteurs ciblés de l’entreprise.
Convertir les IRC, les rapports et les analyses des clients en information pour l’entreprise à l’aide de Power BI.
Gérer tous les IRC internes et externes au moyen de tableaux de bord dans Power BI afin de surveiller les anomalies et l’intégrité des données des transactions.
Partenariats
Répondre aux problèmes et demandes soulevés par les services internes et externes et collaborer avec ceux-ci.
Préparer et fournir des rapports et des présentations de grande qualité destinées à différents publics.
Soutenir l’équipe de direction canadienne lors des examens trimestriels, avec les besoins ad hoc et les analyses approfondies.
Qualifications
Un diplôme collégial en administration des affaires/TI est requis.
Un diplôme universitaire en administration des affaires/TI est souhaité.
Expérience
1-3 ans d’expérience à un poste intermédiaire ou supérieur de scientifique/analyste des données à concevoir des algorithmes prédictifs et de détection de fraude.
d’expérience avec Power BI, R et Python.
Maîtrise d’Excel en développement de macros, de tableaux croisés dynamiques tout en étant en mesure de gérer les données problématiques et les données transactionnelles d’environ 10 à 20 millions de transactions.
Une expérience dans les industries des services logistiques et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement est souhaitée.
Promoteur de la gestion du changement avec la capacité d’influencer sans détenir d’autorité.
Excellentes aptitudes en analyse, en résolution de problèmes, en stratégie d’entreprise et en prise de décision.
Capacité à travailler de façon indépendante et avec les intervenants clés de tous les niveaux et les experts techniques.
Expérience en animation et en présentations en direct.
Capacité éprouvée d’établir des relations efficaces, d’écouter, d’influencer, de collaborer à l’interne et à l’externe avec tous les échelons de l’entreprise.
Compétences et connaissances
Autonomie et capacité de prendre l’initiative ainsi que d’assumer ses responsabilités.
Une maîtrise des langages de programmation nécessaires pour programmer dans Power BI. Maîtrise de MS Office (PowerPoint, Word, Project et Excel [macros, formules, tableaux croisés, etc.]).
Grande minutie et excellentes compétences à communiquer et à influencer.
Expérience avec le numérique et volonté de l’utiliser.
Capacité éprouvée à prendre l’initiative et à faire la promotion d’un projet de la phase de la conception à la phase de mise en œuvre.
Capacité démontrée à gérer des projets simultanés et à faire preuve de souplesse dans un environnement en évolution constante.
Bon esprit d’équipe avec la capacité d’établir des relations à différents échelons.
Capacité d’agir avec un sentiment d’urgence et avoir un engagement à atteindre l’excellence individuellement.
Langues
Requis Anglais SouhaitableFrançais
Preferred Education
Bachelors - Computer and Information Science
Preferred Level of Work Experience
5 - 7 years

Job Title: Business Analyst Intern- Enablement Operations
Department: Partner Delivery Enablement
Work Term & Duration: 8 or 12 months
Location: Virtual

Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale. Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity.

Benefits for Students:
Experience working for one of the fastest growing Human Capital Management technology companies in the world
Access to Ceridian’s development programs and resources
Ability to work with as well as create relationships with members across the globe
Autonomy to bring forth new ideas and optimize existing structures within the organization
Meaningful responsibilities, enabling you to obtain ‘real-world’ experience
Dynamic hands-on exposure to multiple business-units and stakeholders across Ceridian
Summary/About the opportunity:
Reporting to the Director of Partner Enablement, the Business Analyst Intern will support the Systems Integrator (SI) Partner Delivery Enablement team to maintain and continuously improve the SI Partner Portal.
SI or Systems Integrator (SI) partners are one of Ceridian’s many partner types and growing this partner base is a key strategic initiative for Ceridian. The term SI refers to a technology company who implements an enterprise-wide applications within an organization and in our case, that’s Dayforce! We onboard SI Partners into our program, provide Dayforce training and certification, and then support them to grow their practice. Partner Delivery Enablement helps SIs to connect with the systems, processes, and tools they need to be successful and bridges them with key Ceridian teams who still need to do work on their projects. The SI Partner portal is an SI’s central source of information to access these assets.

Primary Responsibilities/ What you’ll get to do:
You will become a valued and integral member of the partner delivery enablement team. You will work on a variety of operational activities related to the SI Partner Portal that directly impact the SI partner program.
We will provide training and documentation to do the following:
Using Salesforce communities, process SI Partner requests to change their Partner Administrator or Sponsor.
Use Salesforce communities, process SI Partner requests to order more education membership or exam vouchers.
Assist with publishing new SI assets to the portal or edit existing assets.
Learn to troubleshoot basic access issues.
Participate in daily team standup to report on progress, and monthly backlog grooming sessions.
Qualifications/Skills and experience we value:
Pursuing bachelor's degree in Math, Computer Science, Business Administration, or related field with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship.
Flexible working hours may be required from time to time to accommodate our global team
Available for an 8–12-month consecutive internship starting Jan 2023.
Nice to have:
One year of classroom or work experience at a SaaS company, in partner management or consulting.
Formal training in program management and process management, process improvement, business strategy and/or operations
Ability to understand business metrics, customer, and market trends.
Excellent verbal and written communication, analytical and presentation skills
Intermediate/Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com or follow us on LinkedIn to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you!

Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.

Virtusa Corporation is a global provider of digital business strategy, digital engineering, and information technology (IT) services and solutions that help clients change, disrupt and unlock new value through innovative engineering. Virtusa serves Global 2000 companies in Banking, Financial Services, Insurance, Healthcare, Communications, Media, Entertainment, Travel, Manufacturing, and Technology industries. With a Revenue of B$1.6 and global employee strength of 32000, Virtusa has an exponential growth year-on-year.
Virtusa helps clients grow their business with innovative products and services that create operational efficiency using digital labor, future-proof operational and IT platforms, and rationalization and modernization of IT applications infrastructure. This is achieved through a unique approach blending deep contextual expertise, empowered agile teams, and measurably better engineering to create holistic solutions that drive the business forward at unparalleled velocity enabled by a culture of cooperative disruption.

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
We want to hear from you if you're hardworking, collaborative and innovative with a forward-thinking approach to join our Access Controls team.
This team coordinates user attestations and works with business and technology groups to maintain the standard role documentation process, with a focus of improving controls around access management.
We also support access management related initiatives through effective collaboration with various business groups to build operational capabilities that drive efficiency, improve client service levels and reduce operational risk.

Job Description
The Business Analyst demonstrates governance, control and risk management behaviors that align with TD policies and practices to drive accountability of team deliverables.
You support the successful delivery of Access Control initiatives by:
Participating in the problem statement articulation, planning, execution, and project management activities
Developing, collaborating and executing on tactical plans that align to the Risk & Control framework
Facilitating communications with all partners
Identifying, supporting and offering creative solutions to key operational or process issues across the broader team
Support tasks related to the various control processes that are managed by the access controls team, specifically around the execution of triple validations, toxicity reviews and standard role documentation
Coordinate with business, technology partners and controls teams to remediate issues
Connect with various partners to understand new access control requirements
Address issues with speed and know what issues to call out
Support any remediation activities, as needed
Lead initiatives to improve the Risk & Control framework
Build positive relationships and work closely with key partners to establish the proper support model and offering leadership as needed
Job Requirements
Experience in Access Management processes and controls
Strong Excel skills
Understand IT security risks, processes, controls and have the ability to converse at a technical level
Sound analytical skills with the ability to problem solve and ‘think outside of the box’
Able to connect with a diverse group of partners at all levels of the organization to make an impact
Outstanding problem-solving capabilities and an ability to collect and analyze data and provide insights
Highly motivated individual with a consistent record to deliver results

Company Biography:
Across our three hospitals and eight satellite sites, Scarborough Health Network (SHN) is shaping the future of care. Our many programs and services are designed around the needs of one of Canada’s most vibrant and diverse communities. We are home to North America’s largest nephrology program, as well as the designated cardiac care and spine centre for Scarborough and surrounding communities to the east. We are proud to be a community-affiliated teaching site for the University of Toronto and partner with a number of other universities and colleges, helping to train the next generation of health care professionals. We are also proud to be named one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2022! Learn more at shn.ca

FOR EXTERNAL APPLICANTS ONLY: As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccination status to the Hospital’s Workplace Health and Safety department.

Position Overview:
A newly formed Regional Operations Team will provide operational support following the regional Epic go-live in December 2021, to the seven (7) acute hospital organizations in the Central East (CE) region: Campbellford Memorial Hospital, Haliburton Highland Health Services, Lakeridge Health, Northumberland Hills Hospital, Peterborough Regional Health Centre, Ross Memorial Hospital and Scarborough Health Network. These organizations have been on a clinical transformation journey to implement a shared, regional Epic CIS solution as well as a number of regional third-party applications since July 2019.

The CE Regional Operations Team will have a dedicated leadership team overseeing five (5) work streams: Outpatient Ancillary, Inpatient, Access/Revenue & Reporting, 3rd Party & Integration and Technical. Each team will have a number of clinical and technical analysts, and Principal Trainers (PTs). The Regional Operations team will work on behalf of all 7 hospital organizations. Scarborough Health Network (SHN) will manage employee policies and act as paymaster on behalf of all 7 hospital organizations.

The Data Quality Analyst, reporting to the Regional Revenue and HIM Lead, works in collaboration with operational programs and regional partners to support chart correction workflows required for fixing incorrect patient data within the shared CIS. All Chart Corrections (Merges/Unmerges, Note changes, note redactions) will take place by and be facilitated by a centralized group of data quality analysts. All requests will be routed to a central team of analysts, where they will communicate with the end user, 3rd party systems, and operational personnel to complete the correction. In addition, the Data Quality Analyst will also be responsible for MyChart queries and activation requests.

Company Vacancy/Request for Transfer:
The completion of this online form serves as your application and will be used to determine if you meet the requirements of this position. Please ensure that you have provided all pertinent information necessary to be considered for this vacancy by the close date.

Responsibilities:
Coordinating chart corrections across organizations including, but not limited to the following:
o Merge and unmerging patients (including interface generated duplicates)
o Contact Moves
o CareEverywhere Link/Unlink
o MyChart support
o Non-Hard Stop Overlay Resolution Report Tasks
o Anesthesia Device Data Deletion, Anesthesia Device Data Mover, Anesthesia - Unlink or Delete Record Anesthesia - Undelete Record
o Care Plan Note Redaction
o Undelete Incomplete Notes
o Note Soft Deletions
o Note Service and Date of Service Changes
o Medical History Deletions, Replacements
o Surgical History Deletions, Replacements
Prioritize and complete activities to meet the SLA defined by the regions’ clinicians
Participates on internal team meetings and external committees to provide input from an HIM Data Quality perspective, as it related to the tasks noted above
Collaborates with regional partners to support creation and update policy and procedures, education and training in accordance with best practice, regional trends and quality improvement initiatives Provides reporting on workload progress, SLAs etc. as requested by generating reports, queries in various systems
Requirements:
Knowledge of electronic medical/clinical information systems
Experience working with Epic® (Preferred)
Undergraduate degree/diploma in a business or health care related program
Graduate of a recognized Health Information Management Program and a current Certified Health Information Management (CHIM) certification is strongly preferred
3+ years of experience in a health care environment, preferred in Health Records, Admitting, Registration, Transcription or Decision Support
Ability to create educational material and knowledge of the principles of adult education and learning required
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with internal and external stakeholders
Time management skills and ability to prioritize competing requests
Demonstrated ability to achieve goals and objectives within specified time frames
Problem solving and analytical skills with strong attention to detail
Demonstrates values consistent with SHN's Code of Conduct and is committed to fostering a healthy and positive work environment in accordance with Health & Safety policy and legislation.
Demonstrates an understanding of and commitment to SHN's comprehensive safety programs and practices including staff safety, patient safety, and environmental safety and participates in regular in- service education in this area.
Demonstrates excellent work performance and attendance record
Accommodation Statement:
Scarborough Health Network (SHN) embraces and celebrates our community’s unique multicultural heritage and diversity. Investment Funds and Structured Products Branch

Permanent, Full-Time

File No. 22-76

The Ontario Securities Commission (OSC) is the statutory body responsible for regulating Ontario’s capital markets in accordance with the mandate established in the provincial Securities Act and the Commodity Futures Act. The mandate of the OSC is to provide protection to investors from unfair, improper or fraudulent practices, to foster fair, efficient and competitive capital markets and confidence in the capital markets, to foster capital formation, and to contribute to the stability of the financial system and the reduction of systemic risk. This mandate is performed through policy, operational, adjudication and enforcement work. The OSC also contributes to national and global securities regulation development.

Branch Overview

The Investment Funds and Structured Products Branch oversees the regulation of investment funds and structured products that offer securities to the public in Ontario. Our function in the OSC’s mandate of providing investors protection is a vital one. We have a leadership role in developing new rules and policies within the OSC and within the Canadian Securities Administrators (CSA) to adapt to the changing environment in the investment fund and structured products industry. Our scope of activity includes reviewing and considering investor protection issues related to the offerings of investment products (including mutual funds, exchange traded funds, structured products, scholarship plans and labour-sponsored funds); assessing product disclosure, including prospectus and continuous disclosure filings; and considering applications for discretionary relief from Ontario securities legislation and rules.

Job Summary

The Business and Market Analyst position will involve playing a key role in profiling the activities of the Investment Funds and Structured Products Branch by reporting on the success and impact of Branch initiatives and core work processes.

The Branch’s core processes include rule and policy consultation, prospectus and exemptive relief application reviews and issue-oriented reviews of important regulatory development. The Business and Market Analyst’s primary function will be to support the Branch’s core processes by conducting research, collecting and interpreting market data and activities, partnering with the Digital Solutions Branch, and supporting special policy projects the Branch undertakes (i.e. Risk Methodologies, and Regulatory burden-reduction initiatives).

Reporting to the Manager, Investment Funds and Structured Products, the Business and Market Analyst will be instrumental in developing, maintaining and analyzing key performance indicators to measure, and report on, Branch activities internally and for publication (i.e. quarterly and annual reports). The Business and Market Analyst will work closely with the newly created Digital Solutions branch to ensure data accessibility, define analytics needed and support reporting needs for the Branch. The two branches will work together as a “hub and spoke” model and utilize an agile framework to allow for iterative development and delivery on IFSP Branch needs.

Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Market Research for Branch Core Processes

Provide research, including conducting background research on topics relating to investment activities in the funds industry, novel investment products, capital market development, and investor protection concerns, as requested
Working with the Digital Solutions Branch, identify, plan and conduct extensive market research to inform on mutual funds industry trends which impact on core Branch processes and decisions, including prospectus, application and continuous disclosure reviews
Work closely with the Digital Solutions branch to identify, plan, and conduct research on relevant market developments and international regulatory developments
Conduct analysis of investment products’ attributes and risks
Collaborate with the Digital Solutions branch to monitor and identify products and trends in the investment funds and structured products markets, both in Canada and globally, and prepare and design requirements on these trends
Proactively identify additional market data and information to collect, maintain and analyze which is conducive to the efficient and effective operation of the Investment Funds and Structured Products Branch
Identify problems whereby efficiencies can be achieved, research and evaluate various alternatives and proceed with the most efficient solution
Identify, evaluate and access potential data sources and summarize results of the analysis in a clear manner
Present research findings to the Branch management team, senior staff, policy project leads and/or committees (i.e. CSA) and address questions and/or defend analysis
Partner with staff from the Digital Solutions branch to develop a data and analytics roadmap for Branch priorities with a goal of making tasks more efficient and effective

Data Collection and Analysis

Collaborate with the Digital Solutions branch by drawing on knowledge of OSC systems and databases, and act as a resource for the Branch and OSC in the area of data analysis and interpretation
Develop, maintain and report, using Branch-wide performance measures, to better reflect how the Branch is meeting its mandate (i.e. for use in quarterly reports)
By partnering with the Digital Solutions branch, interpret information related to Branch operations, analyze market data, and present and report issues, findings and trends that impact on the work of the Branch
Given the “hub and spoke” model with the Digital Solutions branch, develop, maintain, analyze, and report on key Branch operational performance indicators
Work with the Digital Solutions branch to conceptualize new ways of performing tasks, and establish, measure and analyze key performance indicators to develop a risk framework for reporting issuers

Skills & Qualifications:
Intermediate-level knowledge and experience regarding business operations to identify process gaps and efficiencies
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate important information, with attention to detail, accuracy and confidentiality
Excellent presentation, problem-solving and strategic thinking skills
Clear and concise verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated tact and sensitivity when negotiating with diverse parties
Ability to interact professionally with management and professionals at various levels
Demonstrated ability to respond to ad hoc unstructured problems with planning, flexibility, communication and execution
Demonstrated ability to conduct research and prepare dashboards
Ability to work with minimal direction, and prioritize and meet strict deadlines
Knowledge or experience in the securities industry
Understanding of investment funds regulation and funds’ operations

Education & Training:
University degree in Business, Finance or a related discipline
Knowledge of, and experience with, data science tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Python and R for data preparation and analysis
A minimum of 3-5 years of intermediate-level experience in the financial services industry performing a similar function
Demonstrated interest in capital markets, specifically investment products and management
Understanding of the Canadian securities regulatory environment, with the capability of assessing the impact of various regulatory actions on stakeholders and the capital markets
Basic knowledge of the Ontario Securities Act, regulations, policy statements, rules and internal operating procedures
Data and business analysis experience working in the financial and/or regulatory sector
High proficiency in the MS Office suite of products
Completion of the Canadian Securities Course, an asset

Grow your career and make a difference working at the OSC!

Apply online at https://tre.tbe.taleo.net/tre01/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=OSC&cws=1&rid=1575 by Friday, October 14, 2022.

We thank all applicants for their interest in the Ontario Securities Commission. We will contact those selected for an interview.

Inclusion and Diversity at the OSC

The OSC is committed to diversity and providing an inclusive workplace. It is our priority to ensure employment opportunities are visible and barrier-free to all under-represented groups, including, but not limited to, Indigenous, Black and racialized groups, people with disabilities, women and people from the LGBTQ2S community, to achieve an employee demographic profile reflective of the demographic profile of Ontarians.

The OSC is a proud partner with the following organizations: BlackNorth Initiative < https://blacknorth.ca/>, Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion < https://ccdi.ca/>, and Pride at Work Canada < https://prideatwork.ca/>.

Accommodation

If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting our confidential inbox HRRecruitment@osc.gov.on.ca.

Visit Accessibility at the OSC < https://www.osc.ca/en/accessibility-osc >to review the OSC’s policies on accessibility and accommodation in the workplace.

This is where you save and sustain lives
At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.
Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.
Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.
Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.
Your Role:
In this position, you will be responsible for Analyzing, coordinating, and consolidating supply chain related data with the objective of optimizing Supply Chain performance. You will be leading the development and publication of Supply Chain insights related to specific KPIs (OTIF/OLFR), Inventory, Transportation and Warehousing and associated costs. You will support customer supply chain related analytics focused on insight, root cause and continuous improvement of customer fill rate. You will also be responsible for new system integrations projects and network optimization projects along with supply chain digital transformation initiatives.
What you'll be doing:
1. Supply chain Reporting:
Standard Supply Chain reporting.
Regularly generates reports and track KPIs in order to analyze actual performance versus targeted performance.
Develops automated and standardized reporting.
Collaborates with business and technology stakeholders to design reports, visualizations and dashboards to support tactical and strategic decision making
Develop, maintain and deliver customer/region specific scorecards that will highlight opportunity areas and focus areas Analytics and Insights
Work directly with Global counterparts on aligning KPI methodology and reporting requirements
Validate global reporting accurately represents Canadian metrics (OTIF/OLFR/Inventory) and works directly with IT on system upgrades and changes and works within the Supply Chain to support change leadership and assess resources required for developments.
Dotted line oversight of the analytical elements of Inventory Analyst and Transportation Analysts with the expectation of ensuring all analytical outputs of the Supply Chain are consistent and valid
Work with finance and logistics on month end and quarter end financial reconciliations Local SME
Responsible for training and coaching of all supply chain stakeholders for analytic standards
2. Continuous Improvement Initiatives & Budget Planning:
Analyzes data to identify problematic areas and serve as a consultant for process improvement within Supply Chain
Work directly with Logistics and 3rd Party provider to Plan and implement Supply Chain optimization projects (e.g network optimization through Cost to serve model)
Direct support of Customer Supply Chain optimization projects thru analytics related to customer fill rates, order patterns, complaints to support the improvement of Net Promoter Scores
Participate on Local, Regional and Global continuous improvement initiatives
Support S&OP analytics as required
Support in supply chain budgeting exercise
3. New system integrations:
Support implementation of new systems across Supply chain
Support change of process within current tools
What you'll bring:
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain / Business Management
Minimum 6 years' experience in end-to-end supply chain
Strong data management and operations experience
Good communication skill along with problem solving skills
Ability to work cross functionally
Nice to have:
8+ years' experience in end-to-end supply chain
Strong financial experience including cost structure, P&L knowledge
Lean and Six Sigma exposure and practical experience in implementing the theories and tools
Strong experience in managing projects independently
Prior experience in JDE, EDI Management, Tableau
Reasonable Accommodations
Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to Americas_TTA@baxter.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

Advantages
Good Compensation working on projects that will make a difference to the people of Ontario.

Responsibilities
Work with project teams to ensure successful release of Business Intelligence reporting using Power BI. The resource(s) will be responsible for:

Use Power Query to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type.

Profile, clean, and load data into Power BI

Design data models that are intuitive, high-performing, and simple to maintain

Use M and DAX language to create measures

Ensure high performance of Power Query data retrieval tasks

Create Power BI report designs and report formatting, including report navigation

Examine, sort and present data using Power BI in a cohesive manner.

Leverage statistical summaries of data and facilitate export of data from Power BI when required.

Apply and perform advanced analytics on reports for deeper and more meaningful data insights.

Leverage workspaces in the Power BI service.

Deploy Power BI artifacts to workspaces and enable sharing to users.

Connect Power BI reports to on-premise data sources.

Configure automatic refresh for Power BI datasets.

Enable Row-level security

Understand the report users needs and their requirements

Develop reports all the way into production.

Work with the project team in completing all relevant and required documentation in alignment with OPS standards.

Qualifications
Proven work experience as a Business Intelligence Specialist, Power BI Developer, or similar role
Demonstrated experience with M, DAX and Power Query
Proven experience with SQL Server and other database technologies
Proven, demonstratable experience in data modeling and data visualization; working with different data schemas and BI implementation methodologies
Knowledge of data analysis, data management
Demonstrated experience collaborating with Developers, Testers and Program Managers

Summary
If interested and qualified for this role, please apply today for immediate consideration!!!

column2: Sr. Analyst Data Operations – Consumer Canada
column7:
Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Sr. Analyst Data Operations – Consumer Canada. This position can be located in either Markham, Ontario in Canada, Skillman, New Jersey in the US, or Sao Jose dos Campos, in Brazil.
Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc., based in Skillman, N.J., is one of the world's largest consumer health and personal care products company. Our consumer companies produce many of the world's most trusted brands, among them JOHNSON'S® Baby, BAND-AID®, NEUTROGENA®, TYLENOL®, MOTRIN®, and LISTERINE®. Each one of our consumer businesses embraces innovative science to create products that anticipate consumer needs and create experiences that help them live healthy, vibrant lives.
The Data Operations team delivers trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include governance and maintenance of the Data Operations Framework; delivering a regulated and compliant data environment; using intelligent automation, workflow, process improvements, and third-party suppliers to improve quality, timeliness, cost, and effort across Supply Chain; applying deep end-to-end knowledge and subject matter expertise to define, shape and implement supply chain strategies; and cultivating talent as a distinctive capability.
This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Canada Consumer business. Will support projects & also lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures.
Major Duties & Responsibilities:
Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third-party team(s).
Engage with partners on tactical matters as Data Governance Lead for a specific workstream or functional area. Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of sophisticated change assessments and/or project prioritization requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, s strategic launches and audit/compliance activities.
Facilitate continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes.
Implement and monitor tools and processes that improve execution.
Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework.
Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third-party reviews.
Collaborate to create and maintain documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate partners on detailed procedures, data flows, etc.
Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework.
Key Working Relationships:
Internal: Data Operations team, Functional area business partners, S4HANA project team. Supervisor/people management experience is not required.
External: Third party suppliers of operational and/or project functions.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
A minimum of 4 years of relevant professional business experience is required.
A minimum of 2 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required.
Additional Qualifications:
Supply chain experience is required, preferably in master data, operations, or multi-functional business environment.
Business and technical knowledge and understanding of all Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. (E.g. SAP and/or JDE, Winshuttle, Data Quality), required.
A relevant mix of global, regional, cross-sector/industry experience is preferred.
MS Office Suite experience required (Excel, Outlook, Word).
Strong written, oral, and presentation skills are required.
Excellent organizational and prioritization skills are required.
Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple partners, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes, required.
Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural and remote team is required.
Ability to prioritize multiple initiatives within timelines, in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly, required.
This position can be located in either Markham, Ontario in Canada, Skillman, New Jersey in the US, or Sao Jose dos Campos, in Brazil. This position may require up to 5% of domestic and international (US) travel.
On November 12, 2021, Johnson & Johnson announced plans to separate our Consumer Health business to create a new publicly traded company. The process of the planned separation is anticipated to be completed within 24 months, and it will be subject to legal requirements including consultation with employee representative bodies, as required, and other customary conditions, and approvals. It is anticipated that, following conclusion of the transaction, you will be an employee of an entity within the newly created Consumer Health company and your employment will be governed by that company’s employment processes, programs, policies, and benefit plans. In that case, details of any planned changes would be provided to you at an appropriate time and subject to any necessary consultation processes.
At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.
For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.
Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.


Primary Location
United States-New Jersey-Skillman-199 Grandview Road
Other Locations
Latin America-Brazil-São Paulo-São José dos Campos, North America-Canada-Ontario-Markham
Organization
Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc. (6101)
Job Function
Info Technology
Requisition ID
2206074856W

Position Profile:
Join our professional team of Decision Support Professionals as a Business Intelligence Report Analyst as we work together to deliver compassionate care that is responsive to the healthcare needs of our community.

Humber River Hospital is committed to revolutionizing patient care for our diverse community. We are looking for exceptional individuals to join our great team: people who share our passion to deliver excellent, patient-focused, expert care. The Hospital is formally affiliated with both the University of Toronto and Queen’s University.

At Humber River Hospital, Decision Support (DSS) plays a pivotal role in understanding the business/reporting needs of the hospital, identifying, tracking, analyzing and making recommendations for corrective action to financial/statistical utilization issues; and ensuring the hospital is meeting Central Local Health Integration Network (LHIN), Ministry of Health and Long Term Care (MOHLTC), and other external regulatory/stakeholder reporting requirements. As we continue to grow our operations, we are seeking a Business Intelligence Report Developer to join our team.

Are you able to develop test, retest and monitor business intelligence tools based on specifications by end users? Can you gather business requirements and translate them into logical and physical data models? If you answered yes, we invite you to read the requirements below and apply to this exciting career opportunity at Humber River Hospital.

Reporting Relationship: Manager of Analytics and BI Reporting
Schedule Requirements: Must be available to work Monday to Friday. Occasional weekend work may be required.
Location: Wilson Site
Employee Group: Non Union

Position Responsibilities:

As an expert resource, provides support in the implementation of business intelligence tools.
Works collaboratively with business contacts, analysts and other subject matter experts identifying understanding and documenting business needs for data.
Develops, implements and monitors analytics solutions from multiple databases to ensure efficient processing, up-to-date tools, and improved clinical and operational efficiencies.
Performs programming and analysis work to improve user determined data analyses and reports.
Providing expert-level consulting services in identification and resolution of data design issues.
Create and maintains complex SQL Queries.
Oversees the design complex conceptual, logical and physical data models, including complex data modeling, mapping, and integration efforts.
Maintains and updates custom tables in specific BI databases.
Assists Manager with training of departmental staff in development of new BI tools/dashboards.
Assists DSS staff in training leaders in the production and interpretation of reports.

Qualifications:

3 years of experience with decision support or financial planning and analysis, developing and implementing business intelligence tools database systems, data management, analysis and reporting required.
Diploma in Computer Science, Health Information management or related programs.
Canadian Health Information Management System (CHIM) certification preferred.
Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) programing, query design and developing scripts and reporting preferred.
Strong knowledge and understanding of data: defining and working with models both physical and logical: data management, analysis and reporting.
Understanding of data quality assurance processes and procedures.
Well versed with Source to Target Mapping.
Experience in business intelligence tools and Meditech or similar system preferred
Strong Analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills, organization and problem-solving.
Excellent attendance and discipline free record required.

Why Humber? Why Now?

Humber River Hospital is on an exciting transformation journey of redefining patient care as we leverage the most advanced technologies to enhance all aspects of delivering high-quality, safe care. We continue to build a people-centered workplace with excellent staff and physician engagement by hiring passionate, diverse and inclusive healthcare professionals. People who care and live our values of Compassion, Professionalism and Respect. People who are committed to making a positive difference.
We are a Studer Group hospital, focused on building our evidence-based practice and hardwiring a culture that WOWs.
Why? Because at Humber River Hospital, we know it’s our people and our ability to innovate that allows us to consistently deliver a great patient experience and the best quality outcomes. After all, we are the hospital that believes exceptional care...healthier community.

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by the employee within this position. However, the actual responsibilities, duties, qualifications and experience may vary. Employee may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. Information contained in this job posting/description is subject to change.
This position will be filled in accordance with the non-union recruitment policies.
Humber River Hospital is committed to inclusion and diversity. We believe that diversity drives our culture of innovation. By bringing together a variety of different perspectives, it fuels our creative thinking, generates new ideas and creates solutions designed to address tomorrow's healthcare challenges today. We take pride in providing professional development and career advancement opportunities for our employees including minorities, women, veterans and individuals with physical and developmental disabilities. We also provide accommodation to applicants and all of our employees - from hire to retire.
Let us know what we can do to help you be successful during your recruitment experience at Humber River Hospital.
Please be advised that in order to be eligible for employment at Humber River Hospital, all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days prior to the hired employee’s first date of employment Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Hospital’s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis

Leading digital performance marketing agency seeks Business Analyst

Do you have the enthusiasm to rise to each challenge, the execution to drive outrageous performance, the curiosity to continually expand your knowledge, and the courage to propose original solutions to perplexing problems? Then you may have just found the perfect opportunity at a performance marketing agency like no other.
The DAC Group is looking for a highly motivated, self-organized, and solution-focused Business Analyst, who will be responsible for analyzing the various interdepartmental processes to improve efficiencies across these teams while also leveraging leading-edge technologies.
The ideal candidate will not only work closely with the Account Service team, but will also work with multiple internal sources to facilitate requirements gathering workshops involving key stakeholders to understand critical business issues, challenges and translate them into detailed stakeholder’s solution requirements.
The Business Analyst will report to the Director of Product and partner with the Product Owner and System Administrator to deliver quality solutions and promote team collaboration across the various platform technologies.
Sound like your kind of thing? Let's get to the details!
What you get
The opportunity to shape the future—yours and ours—at one of the world's most significant performance marketing agencies with offices across the US, Canada, and Europe.
A diverse, equitable, and inclusive (DEI) environment where you can bring your whole self to work.
A host of perks and benefits, including flexible hours, hybrid working models, employee assistance, and 20 days off to recharge.

What we get
5+ years experience as a Business Analyst and/or Business Systems Analyst
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent college diploma with a major in computer science, information techology, business administration or equivalent education and experience.
Proven experience in requirements analysis, system design proposals, cost/benefit analysis and testing in support of solution development
Demonstrated ability to work with clients, end-users and other IT professionals, specifically in building relationships and managing expectations.
Experience in defining, implementing and/or enhancing requirements gathering processes and templates.
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Certification in Business Analysis (CCBA) or other relevant professional designations (Nice to Have)
Strong Requirement elicitation and documentation skills
Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to effectively present to the variour levels of stakeholders within the organization
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written and presentation skills)
Exceptional attention to detail with proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
Proven experience in studying business processes and documenting requirements
Knowledge of Visio, MS Office, Microsoft Dynamics 365

Responsibilities
Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures to identify process improvements
Define, develop, and document business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments
Conduct interviews/ discovery sessions to gather user requirements via workshops, process flow, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Develop an understanding of existing business processes and recommend changes that leverage best usage of the application
Create systems models, specifications, and diagrams to assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options and communicate these to the business stakeholders and development.
Conduct User Acceptance testing to ensure the resulting solution meets business requirements and confirm business acceptance was achieved.
Curate job aids and system documentation for operational staff describing new features/systems implemented
Communicate/document business requirements (including processes, flows, forms, rules) using appropriate techniques such as epics, user stories, BRDs, models, wireframes, and use cases.
Serve as a subject matter expert concerning the various processes and tools used to support our business.
Prepare cost-benefit/ impact analysis documentation to present proposed solutions to stakeholders for approval.
Perform gap analysis and identify any areas for improvement within existing procedures, methods, and business processes.
Understand data analytics/data science strategies and insights that are cross-functional and inform business priorities
Translate business requirements into detailed design specifications to address both functional and non-functional requirements for major feature components
Validate requirements using tools and techniques such as documentation review, prototypes, demos, and other validation methods in order to ensure requirements are complete, accurate and aligned with goals, objectives, and value proposition
Willing to take ownership, proactive, flexible, adaptable, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to communicate to all levels in an organization

What's next?
We simply want to know what makes you special. Send us an application that showcases your talent—and your personality—and shows us how you would thrive in our unique agency environment.

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses today need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.
We are a fast-growing global company with 75+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents.
We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.
Equinix CRE
Two thirds of Equinix’s 12,000 staff are supported from a portfolio of 60+ offices worldwide.
The acquisition, design, construction, management and evolution of these spaces falls to Equinix’s Corporate Real Estate (CRE) team.
CRE seeks to improve Equinix every day with a better workplace: one that is caring, cool and smart.
Caring for the staff of Equinix and each person they invite into our spaces
Creating environments and experiences that are inviting, effective and elegant
Relentlessly pursuing and applying winning concepts in corporate real estate, having created ‘hybrid’ working years ahead of industry peers
Job Summary
The CRE Senior Analyst is pivotal to the smooth running and recognized value of the CRE team.
Reporting to the Global Head of CRE, the role acts as the subject matter expert across all financial and data analyses, enabling both tactical and strategic decision-making.
Job Description:
Build the cashflow analysis for strategic scenario comparison ahead of quarterly governance meetings with the Global C-Suite Exec team
Oversee CRE’s global budgets - $70m Opex and $40m Capex - through forecasting activities during the year ensuring they are prepared, tracked and maintained
Lead monthly triage of outstanding approvals (location approvals, purchase orders etc.) for all three regions: Americas, APAC & EMEA
Own the analysis and benchmarking of CRE data across staffing, cost, utilization, and workplace design projects
Build and track a rolling 3-year forecast of anticipated projects, feeding into the Governance and annual Budgeting processes
Collate savings data through the year to support the following year’s budget request
Tracking CRE team headcount according to the company’s FP&A framework
Partner with internal stakeholders including, but not limited to:
The three Regional CRE Operations Directors (the ‘CREDs’)
CRE Programs and Communications Sr Manager in coordinating the governance calendar
CRE Vendor Manager in the prioritization of VM initiatives
CRE Design & Construction Manager in requesting cost estimates for projects and budgeting

The successful candidate will have the following attributes:
4+ years of CRE relevant experience of financial appraisals, budget supervision, and data analysis
Professional qualification in CRE, Workplace or equivalent experience
Located in one of these metros: Amsterdam, London, Warsaw, Dallas, Toronto, Tampa, Singapore, Bangalore, Manila
High quality professional English essential, with other conversation-level language skills an advantage
Open to occasional travel 1-2 times per year
Required skills
Experience of real estate cash flow appraisals across several geographies
Affinity with data crunching in excel and one or more of the main data visualization packages (Power BI, Tableau etc.)
Appetite for driving fact-based decision-making between strategic scenarios
Preferred skills
Experience of working in a multinational corporation environment in more than one geography
Exposure to reporting on carbon footprint and other sustainability metrics
Some exposure to using Oracle or other ERP systems, potentially including use of Hyperion

Description:
Job Purpose :
The Data Analyst, Data Management provides support in completing a variety of functions relating to new data and reporting initiatives. As a resource for projects and data enhancements, the analyst is a key participant in the design, development, implementation and facilitation of data mapping, data sourcing workflows, systems integration and data quality enhancements.
The Data Analyst will be responsible for delivering two enterprise projects – Dynamo Enhancement Project and Performance Reporting Project. The Dynamo Enhancement project will look to expand usage of the existing Dynamo private markets application to streamline and scale operational activities, centralize private asset data attributes, and timely reporting for Investment teams. Performance Reporting project will focus on building a technical foundation and architecture for streamlining of existing and future performance reporting.
The Data Analyst will be involved in the sourcing and migration of data from various vendors, along with significant data vetting and validation and the development of new processes to service the reporting requirements from front office stakeholders
Major Responsibilities
Gather business requirements and create data specifications for project initiatives and business enhancements.
Research, source and map new data in support of reporting requirements.
Document data and process flows, and develop automation as relates to project initiatives.
Develop test plans, create test cases and perform testing for data integration developments.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders (e.g. Investment Operations, Performance, and Investment teams) on project tasks and ad-hoc requests.
Partner with IT to provide subject matter expertise in translating business requirements into technical specifications, solution design and data flows.
Other duties as assigned.

Data management, data analysis, data warehouse, data lineage, Testing, Data Integration, Business Requirements, Investment Management, Investment Risk, Market Risk, Capital Markets, SQL, VBA, Excel, Eagle Pace, MyStatestreet, Dynamo, Bloomberg, Private Markets, Performance Reporting, Performance Measurement
