The Financial Crimes Unit (FCU) brings together our Cybersecurity, Fraud, Physical Security and Resilience Planning capabilities to address the ever-growing and increasingly complex global security environment. It is a highly collaborative effort that greatly enhances BMO’s ability to rapidly prevent, detect, respond to, and recover from all security & crisis threats. This position offers a unique experience to learn from experienced leaders in the industry, join a team building the 21st century model for security and helping grow the good by protecting our customers and communities.

Monitors inbound and/or outbound calls to assess quality, compliance and/or customer service opportunities.
Acts as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group.
Influences and negotiates to achieve business objectives.
Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy.
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
May conduct audits to support internal stakeholders.
Oversees and provides regulatory expertise to the team of call quality specialists and call monitors.
Supports the development and promotion of a business/group program.
Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs.
Participates in the design, implementation and management of core business/group processes.
Monitors and reviews calls in detail. Consistently applies quality and compliance assessments to calls using established and documented processes and procedures.
Tracks operational performance, KPI’s and best practices metrics and measures.
Gathers and formats data into regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards and provides reports to management to action.
Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Identifies coaching insights and opportunities. Provides information to management regarding opportunities for coaching and training of employees to improve handling of calls.
Completes non-compliance reports as required. Escalates high risk issues, behaviors or trends to management for corrective/remedial action as required.
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives.
Supports the development of tools and delivery of training focused on delivering business results.
Provides recommendations to improve the effectiveness of the call quality review process while maintaining cost effectiveness.
Supports change management of varying scope and type; tasks typically focused on execution and sustainment activities.
Executes work to deliver timely, accurate, and efficient service.
Organizes work information to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Develops knowledge related to specialty (i.e. systems/policies/processes/procedures, as appropriate).
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
PC skills (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint) – Advanced
Knowledge of the business/group processes/procedures/tools/technology as required.
Knowledge of applicable risk and regulatory requirements and the impact on the business/group.
Certifications as required for position.
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

column2: Senior Financial Data Analyst- Process Improvement
column7:
Get started on an exciting career at Element!
Element employees make a difference in the lives of others every day. We are re-defining the fleet management industry to be people first, then business – delivering on our promise of a superior client experience. This takes hard work and innovation, and we need more like-minded people on our team.
What We Need

We are looking for a Senior Financial Data Analyst- Process Improvement to join Element Fleet Management. As the largest pure-play fleet manager in the world, we provide unmatched products and services and solutions to our clients.

At Element, employees play a critical role in delivering value to customers and ensuring an exceptional client experience. We are committed to the success of our clients, employees, and investors by fostering a culture where every employee can make a difference!

Are You:
A versatile, driven individual with high intellectual horsepower, strong communication, keen attention to detail, and well-honed business judgment.
passionate about process excellence and emerging technologies, comfortable in working in a dynamic team environment, and embrace the opportunity to connect cross-functionally with other teams

As the Senior Financial Data Analyst, you will work with a highly skilled and motivated team and your efforts will have a direct impact on framing and solving the challenges of a function seeking modernization and the development of a continuous improvement culture. In this role you will act as a key enabler within a transformation squad, supporting change and process re-engineering within Finance Operations. The Finance Data Analyst will support the transformation squad lead through the inception to execution of projects, providing data and analytics support for process owners, building automation solutions, and driving joint initiatives held with IT or our Automation specialist teams.

A Day in the Life
Look for opportunities to eliminate, simplify and automate processes. Based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs, recommends approaches or changes to streamline and integrate processes to improve overall efficiency.
Key contributor within a team of mixed discipline resources to drive tangible change across key priority processes to deliver process improvements for productivity savings and enhanced customer/employee experience.
Analyzing business requirements and processes to identify opportunities for improvement with technology solutions
Facilitate automation of analytical and operational tasks and processes at scale, incorporating automation tools such as Alteryx, Power BI, Power Automate, or development of requirements for RPAs and IT led projects.
Take ownership of financial data and analytics processes with a fair understanding of business processes to equip the team with proper data for advanced analytics and exploratory data analysis
Provide data management processes such as accessing raw data feeds, building queries, and designing reports that present status-at-a-glance visualization of business performance
Create user friendly data visualizations to report complex business processes via related KPIs, benchmarking, statistical analysis, exception reporting, etc.
Perform ad hoc and rapid data analysis.
Ability to work independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations and financial modelling.
Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Data Analysis or a related field of study
Minimum three years of experience in business process engineering, finance transformation, or a top-tier management consulting firm, or as a data analyst within finance or business intelligence.
Track record of data-driven analysis, and linking data and analytics to business strategy, financial performance, and process improvement.
Strong analytical background, including the ability to break down and work through complex problems in a structured manner, using both quantitative and qualitative methods
Ability to create data visualizations to report KPIs and metrics, pull data from various data sources, direct querying, exploratory data analysis, financial modelling, and performing root cause analysis.
Resourceful and relentless: independently capable of seeking information, solving conceptual problems, corralling resources, and delivering results in challenging situations
Quick and scrappy learner who adapts well to a fast-moving environment and gets things done, combines creativity, problem- solving skills, and a can-do attitude to overcome any obstacle
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to deal with complex problems and present recommendations and findings in a clear, concise format
Customer focused and results oriented, passionate about creating a best-in-class service and a best-in-class company.
Ability to work well with colleagues in a team environment, but also perform well independently with minimal supervision
MS Office proficiency: Excel power user, Outlook, Power Point, SharePoint
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL, SnowSQL, etc.)
Extensive experience with automation technologies and data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Power Automate, Smartsheet workflow, RPAs, Alteryx, or other BI tools.
Knowledge of data gathering, cleaning and transforming techniques preferred
Knowledge of and hands-on experience with SAP S4/HANA a plus
#LI-Hybrid
#LI-KT1
What’s in it for You
A culture of innovation, empowerment, decision-making, and accountability
Comprehensive health and welfare benefits that serve the needs of you and your family and foster a culture of wellness
Additional benefits and amenities, including paid time-off programs (vacation, sick leave, and holidays)
Hybrid work environment for most positions
Applicants will be required to undergo a background check only if and after a conditional offer of employment has been extended.
Element Fleet Management and its wholly owned subsidiaries are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability, national origin, Aboriginal/Native American status, protected veterans’ status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application and interview process are available upon request. Should you require an accommodation with our hiring process please send an email to
talentacquisition@elementcorp.com
or call (800) 665-9744.

Culture
.

and

we offer our clients.

HVAC Data Analyst is responsible for coordinating the development and maintenance of HVAC information for the Sales Department. Coordinating with internal departments on a weekly basis, to identify opportunities for sales/leads.
Key Responsibilities:
Own and maintain the UTG/Enercare data

column2: Data Analyst - North American Integrated Analytics Team
column7:
Data Analyst - North American Integrated Analytics Team
The North American Integrated Analytics Team is looking for a Data Analyst.
In keeping with our global position as an industry leader and innovator, Munich Re is driving transformative change in the life insurance industry through data science.

Location
Toronto , Canada
In keeping with our global position as an industry leader and innovator, Munich Re is driving transformative change in the life insurance industry digital analytics transformation. As a Data Analyst, you will support decision making, resolve issues and provide leadership in data management across our business.
You will be immersed in real-time business problems while engaged in a collaborative approach to delivering world-class, innovative solutions for our North American operations and client companies.
We see the use of data as instrumental in making it easier for people to buy life insurance and to expand the number of people insured and help people live longer.
Your job
Interrogates, structures, and transforms client and third party to facilitate scalable analysis:
Assess the data availability and perform feasibility analyses to make sure we can run our machine learning models and underwriting rules
Responsible for data collecting, mapping, making assumptions and maintaining consistency across all client level data and then making data accessible to internal partners
Responsible for running machine learning models to score the data and making sure the quality of the outcome passes through the quality assessment test
Validate metrics to ensure calculations are accurate and approve UAT testing results
Conduct in-depth data analysis, Diagnose and remediate underlying data issues acting as the single point of contact and owner for data integrity, accuracy, and completeness
Manage end to end data flow as playing a role of project manager for a given client
Work closely and communicate effectively with internal stakeholders such as data scientists, underwriters, pricing, operations to understand requirements and formulate analytics solutions
Create roadmaps for the life cycle of a given data project
Prepare the EDA (Explanatory Data Analysis) and results of underwriting rules assessment engine
Make use of statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts
Develop and maintain a Python coding approach of an underwriting preferred rules guideline
Develop and maintain scalable data transformation code
Apply automation and innovation on new and existing data projects
Create appropriate documentation that allows others to understand the steps of the data analysis process and duplicate or replicate the analysis; synthesize user feedback, create release notes and assess end-users understanding of outputs
Analyze current business processes and identify improvements to be recommended to the business
Support analytics product management in the prioritization of multiple workstreams handled by the group
Your profile
The successful candidate will demonstrate a natural desire to provide exceptional client service through their energy, enthusiasm, and initiative. In addition, we are looking for the following qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Data Science or related quantitative field (Applied Mathematics, Engineering)
At least 5 years demonstrated ability working with large-scale software systems. Basic knowledge of ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) is necessary.
Basic Knowledge of Azure DevOps, git hub repository, other DevOps tools and airflow
Basic knowledge of systems like: Kubernetes, Docker, Azure blob storage is a plus
Proficiency especially in Python with the ability to query and analyze data and understand data complexity, models and structures
Experience or basic understanding about machine learning models is required
Solid experience working with large data sets on enterprise data platforms and performing tasks such as managing data transformations and machine learning models
Good experience in Reporting and Visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau
Demonstrated analytical skills, including data mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization
About us
Munich Re is one of the world’s leading reinsurance companies with approximately 40,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe. As an industry leader, we provide a unique opportunity to be part of a global success story. We offer our employees a diverse and challenging work environment which champions high performance, professional development, innovation and passion, and rewards top performers with a highly competitive total rewards package.

Apply now!
Apply for this Job!
Munich Re Canada is committed to providing a work environment that is inclusive and free of employment barriers and discrimination. Accommodations will be made for qualified applicants with a disability throughout the recruitment process. If you receive a request for an interview and you have a disability which will require an accommodation to support your participation, please consult with Human Resources or contact AODARequestHR@munichre.ca as soon as practical so that suitable accommodations can be arranged.

The Opportunity:
We are a leading Canadian financial services co-operative committed to being a catalyst for a sustainable and resilient society and our team is essential to deliver on this strategy. That’s why we prioritize our people, to ensure we provide a strong culture and development opportunities which enables our team to thrive and to live our purpose. The best part is that you will work with people that care passionately about you, our clients, and our communities.
Our Information Technology (IT) team aspires to be a leader in applying technology to power business strategies. We connect concepts with solutions to create value and efficiencies for our clients, employees, and communities. Our success is driven by our skilled and diverse team who are passionate about excellence, innovation, and agility.
As the Senior Business Systems Analyst for Creditor IT Solution Delivery, you will liaise between the team and business stakeholders for functionality enhancements and new developments. You will be a part of an exciting team responsible for translating concepts and requirements into client focused and effective system-based solutions. You will contribute to complex and diverse initiatives through formulating and defining system scope and objectives based on both user needs and a comprehensive understanding of the applicable business applications.
Technologies you have experience with:
You have experience working with large, complex, integrated technology systems.
You have experience with Atlassian Clouds tools – JIRA, Confluence and Agile Methodology.
Having experience with DevSecOps technologies and Application Programming Interface (API) would be considered an asset.
How you will create impact:
Participating in the assessment and selection of technical design solutions, acting as intermediary between the team and the stakeholders.
Contributing to the preparation of business case and project planning by gathering required information while working with the team and business stakeholders.
Facilitating discussions with business partners to collect, document, and validate detailed analysis of business functions, processes, requirements, and test plans for highly complex projects.
Ensuring that the implemented software solution is effective and may include preparing training material, delivering training, and engaging in production support activities.
Leading the continuous improvement of the Business Systems Analyst (BSA) practice through research, devising improvements, establishing more efficient processes, and providing guidance to other team members.
How you will succeed:
You have an innovative mindset to improve operational efficiencies and ability to influence change, with a primary focus on client needs.
You use critical thinking skills to recognize assumptions, evaluate arguments, draw conclusions, and proactively propose solutions.
You have strong communication skills to clearly convey messages and explore diverse points of view.
You build trusting relationships and provide guidance to support the development of colleagues.
To join our team:
You have five years of experience in an analytical role within a project-related environment.
You have completed post-secondary education in Information Technology, Business Analysis, or a related discipline.
You are a proactive, experienced intermediary between client and IT teams participating in technical solution design activities, including process mapping, requirement solicitation and refinement, documenting data and business rules, communication of technology constraints and gap analysis and overall test and implementation activities.
You have strong knowledge of Agile practices and iterative delivery.
You have advanced knowledge of The Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies and processes as well as project planning methodologies and LEAN process improvement tools and techniques
What you need to know:
Extended work hours, including evenings and weekends, may be required.
You will be subject to a Criminal Record and Consumer History background check as a condition of employment, in the event you are the successful candidate.
What’s in it for you?
Training and development opportunities to grow your career.
Flexible work options and paid time off to support your personal and family needs.
A holistic approach to your well-being, with physical and mental health programs and a supportive workplace culture.
Paid volunteer days to give back to your community.
A comprehensive total rewards package, including competitive salary, bonus, pension and benefits.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
Paid time off
RRSP match
Vision care
Wellness program

About Us
As EDW production Support Analyst responsibilities involve to ensure timely resolution of Production Support issues and partnering with the team to mature the operating model.
Candidate is expected to exude a take-charge attitude towards problems and thrive for excellence. This is a hands-on, delivery focused role.
Who we are
As Canada's largest automobile association, we are passionate about keeping our Members safe- whether they are on the road, at home, or travelling abroad. Meeting the diverse needs of our two-million Members requires high performing, forward thinking, and innovative people who work collaboratively to keep propelling our business forward. Life at CAA Club Group is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development- and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results. CAA Club Group (CCG) is known for providing stellar emergency roadside assistance to our motoring Members and non-Members. We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it.
Position Details
What You Will Do
Assist with troubleshooting application system related issues.
Identify solutions to business system problems.
Lead or participate in multiple projects by completing and updating project documentation; managing project scope; adjusting schedules when necessary; determining daily priorities; ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; following proper escalation paths; and managing customer and supplier relationships
Create and maintain requirements, issue logs, meeting minutes, meeting schedules, project summaries and updates.
Diligently support and lead where needed, various activities between the teams to ensure the business and technical requirements and objectives are met.
Participate and contribute to the overall system(s) design.
Assist with the creation of test suites, execute testing and support the QA process.
Who You Are
3 - 5 years’ experience EDW Production Support.
Good to have P&C domain knowledge or Experience
Proficient in SQL and database systems
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to set priorities and multi-task in a fast paced environment.
Ability to work independently and productively under pressure.
Strong organizational skills and decision making ability.
Our Commitment
We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). CAA CCG will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

column2: Business Analyst - Business Process Design, Data
column7:
Job ID #348440
Business Analyst
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Business Analyst.
Business Analyst – Job Description
Business Analyst is accountable for partnering with the run-the-bank teams in Global Operations to identify areas of process improvement and design, re-engineer new workflow for process efficiency.
The candidate will get an opportunity to work and develop with a variety of workflow automation solutions mainly using ServiceNow and other workflow automation tools offered at the clients for repetitive processes.
Design, develop new workflow for process efficiency and implement workflow automation using tools offered (ServiceNow, Camunda BPM etc)
Analyze complex business processes, and translate into business requirements to address issues
Collaborate with cross-function teams in various global locations to define and drive a standardized approach to leverage workflow tools for automation
Prioritize incoming projects based on key criteria: capacity creation, operational risk avoidance, and control improvements
Develop and maintain good business relationships with “internal clients” and lead, coach, motivate a diverse team to influence and promote a culture of innovation
Act as an operation group liaison across clients Securities and other enterprise automation teams
Highly motivated individual with a proven track record to deliver results.
Exceptional problem-solving capabilities with an ability to collect and analyze data paired with passion to expand automation skillsets
Business Analyst – Mandatory Skills
2 years or more of experience in business process design, analysis, and mapping as BA or as developer
Strong communication skills and an ability to articulate complex issues in a concise manner, able to synthesize complex information into simple discussion points.
Knowledge of project/program support, planning, implementation and change management
Strong Microsoft suite (specifically Excel)
Tenacious mentality and ability to problem solve and ‘think outside of the box’
Enjoys the challenge of a fast-paced, dynamic, high volume work environment
Ability to work successfully as a member of a team and independently
Business Analyst – Nice to Have Skills
Experience in development works using workflow tools such as ServiceNow, Camunda BPM is an asset
Experience in Robotic Process Automation tools such as UiPath, Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere is a plus.
Understanding of Prime Brokerage markets, with specific emphasis on the US markets is a plus
Experience with data manipulation and utilizing multiple data source is an asset
Business Analyst – Assignment Start Date
ASAP – 6 months to start
Business Analyst – Assignment Location
Toronto, ON – Hybrid

Req # JR - 081660
Location Mississauga, Ontario, Canada
Job Category Supply Chain
Date posted 10/12/2022

This is where you save and sustain lives
At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.
Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.
Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.
Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.
Your Role:
In this position, you will be responsible for Analyzing, coordinating, and consolidating supply chain related data with the objective of optimizing Supply Chain performance. You will be leading the development and publication of Supply Chain insights related to specific KPIs (OTIF/OLFR), Inventory, Transportation and Warehousing and associated costs. You will support customer supply chain related analytics focused on insight, root cause and continuous improvement of customer fill rate. You will also be responsible for new system integrations projects and network optimization projects along with supply chain digital transformation initiatives.
What you'll be doing:
1. Supply chain Reporting:
Standard Supply Chain reporting.
Regularly generates reports and track KPIs in order to analyze actual performance versus targeted performance.
Develops automated and standardized reporting.
Collaborates with business and technology stakeholders to design reports, visualizations and dashboards to support tactical and strategic decision making
Develop, maintain and deliver customer/region specific scorecards that will highlight opportunity areas and focus areas Analytics and Insights
Work directly with Global counterparts on aligning KPI methodology and reporting requirements
Validate global reporting accurately represents Canadian metrics (OTIF/OLFR/Inventory) and works directly with IT on system upgrades and changes and works within the Supply Chain to support change leadership and assess resources required for developments.
Dotted line oversight of the analytical elements of Inventory Analyst and Transportation Analysts with the expectation of ensuring all analytical outputs of the Supply Chain are consistent and valid
Work with finance and logistics on month end and quarter end financial reconciliations Local SME
Responsible for training and coaching of all supply chain stakeholders for analytic standards
2. Continuous Improvement Initiatives & Budget Planning:
Analyzes data to identify problematic areas and serve as a consultant for process improvement within Supply Chain
Work directly with Logistics and 3rd Party provider to Plan and implement Supply Chain optimization projects (e.g network optimization through Cost to serve model)
Direct support of Customer Supply Chain optimization projects thru analytics related to customer fill rates, order patterns, complaints to support the improvement of Net Promoter Scores
Participate on Local, Regional and Global continuous improvement initiatives
Support S&OP analytics as required
Support in supply chain budgeting exercise
3. New system integrations:
Support implementation of new systems across Supply chain
Support change of process within current tools
What you'll bring:
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain / Business Management
Minimum 6 years' experience in end-to-end supply chain
Strong data management and operations experience
Good communication skill along with problem solving skills
Ability to work cross functionally
Nice to have:
8+ years' experience in end-to-end supply chain
Strong financial experience including cost structure, P&L knowledge
Lean and Six Sigma exposure and practical experience in implementing the theories and tools
Strong experience in managing projects independently
Prior experience in JDE, EDI Management, Tableau
Reasonable Accommodations
Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to Americas_TTA@baxter.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.
Recruitment Fraud Notice

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

column2: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst - North American Integrate...
column7:
Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst - North American Integrated Analytics Team
The North American Integrated Analytics Team is looking for a Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst.
In keeping with our global position as an industry leader and innovator, Munich Re is driving transformative change in the life insurance industry through data science.

Location
Toronto , Canada
In keeping with our global position as an industry leader and innovator, Munich Re is driving transformative change in the life insurance industry digital analytics transformation. As a Sr BI Analyst, you will partner with the business to understand the domain needs, brainstorm creative solutions, and deliver insights to support high quality decision making across our business.
You will be immersed in real-time business problems while engaged in a collaborative approach to delivering world-class, innovative solutions for our North American operations and client companies. We see the use of data as instrumental in making it easier for people to buy life insurance and to expand the number of people insured and help people live longer.

Your job
Develop end-to-end solutions, from understanding requirements to partnering with technology teams to design data models and solutions that translate data into meaningful insights.
Explore design options to address reporting, dashboarding, and data analysis needs in line with corporate objectives.
Maintain existing BI solutions, customize data models to deliver new product features and support user experience through performance tuning, monitoring, and optimization.
Collaborate with the data and technology teams to improve the integrity and quality of data in our source systems.
Contribute to shaping the BI strategy roadmap by recommending modern techniques and tools, researched through industry leading practices.
Support data governance initiatives through maintaining data quality, access, and security, and adhering to company, industry, and global policies /regulations.
Work with stakeholders – data scientists, data engineers and project teams to assist with data related issues and support their data needs.
Support in designing database tables, datatypes, stored procedures, functions, views etc.
Apply automation and innovation on new and existing data projects.
Balance multiple, competing priorities effectively, track documentation and deliverables in an organized manner.
Your profile
The successful candidate will demonstrate a natural desire to provide exceptional client service through his/her energy, enthusiasm, and initiative.
In addition, we are looking for the following qualifications:
3+ years Power BI development experience delivering interactive dashboards with a robust design aesthetic and writing complex DAX queries and functions
Bachelor's or master's degree from an accredited college or university
5+ Years SQL development experience, knowledge of scripting, database structures, and exposure to big data concept
Minimum 3 years of experience in Microsoft Azure Architecture, Microsoft Azure Databases Administration, Microsoft SQL Server Database Administration
Preferably to have experience working in insurance/reinsurance industry
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving ability
Basic Knowledge of Azure DevOps, git hub repository, airflow, and other DevOps tools
Basic knowledge of Python (pandas) is an add on
Expertise in GUI design with to develop easy to use applications
Knowledge or experience working in Agile, Lean methodologies
Passionate about delivering solutions with excellent UX and UI design concepts
Knowledge of how to gather the business requirements and translate them into technical requirements to create the dashboard
Prior experience in training other users on Power BI will be a plus
Interest in learning modern technologies, concepts, and business processes
About us
Munich Re is one of the world’s leading reinsurance companies with approximately 40,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe. As an industry leader, we provide a unique opportunity to be part of a global success story. We offer our employees a diverse and challenging work environment which champions high performance, professional development, innovation and passion, and rewards top performers with a highly competitive total rewards package.

Apply now!
Apply for this Job!
Munich Re Canada is committed to providing a work environment that is inclusive and free of employment barriers and discrimination. SUMMARY

Meets department objectives by developing and implementing fuel pricing strategies designed to achieve volume and profit goals. Assists operations team on all fuels related issues. Works closely with operations and fuel sites to deliver on site experience targets.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES
Maintains the fuel products pricing function by analyzing current market conditions, sales volumes, costs, competitive prices and supply forecast.
Administers site price changes and maintains fuel pricing system.
Establishes retail fuel prices by determining relationships between change in price and profit, monitoring competitive reactions to price changes.
Achieves pricing strategy goals of market share growth and profit by
determining the relationship between pricing and volume, analyzing past sales performance, monitoring competitive pricing and cost data, sales budget and projected sales.
Presents recommendations to management and utilizes input from
operations team and monitors implementation.
Ensures accurate supply costs are calculated for each tender received based on contract agreements. This includes management of new contracts and price information.
Maintains and updates databases, which provide pricing and site level
information essential for daily pricing decisions and analytical analysis of
market elasticity.
Conducts compliance audits on assigned areas to maintain performance metric with pricing strategies at a site level.
Contributes to team by accomplishing financial and key result area targets pursuant to company plan guidelines.
Creates and submits daily, weekly and period fuel reports.
Ability to effectively communicate with operations team as their primary
fuels’ liaison.
Successful implementation of fuels initiatives requires effective coaching and counseling skills.
Works closely with operations team on achieving site experience targets across all fuel sites.
Special projects to support objectives as required.
PROFILE REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree or college diploma in business or related field preferred. Combination of experience and education that meet the minimum requirements may be substituted.
1 - 3 years of data analytics experience or more preferred.
Must be proficient in MS Access, Excel, PowerPoint and Word. Working knowledge of Power BI is an asset
Experience in the Convenience and Gas Channel is an asset
Must be able to work from 7:00am – 3:00pm. Occasional weekends/holidays are required.

CannonDesign has an exciting opportunity for a Building Performance Analyst based in our Toronto, ON office. Take a look at the description below. If you think your skills and experience make you a good match for this position, we'd love to hear from you. We're looking for creative, curious, empathetic people to join our Living-Centered Design movement.
ABOUT OUR FIRM
CannonDesign is an integrated design solutions firm focused on helping people continuously flourish. Whether designing for innovations in health, new scientific discoveries, equity in education or the next big idea in business, we use our Living-Centered Design approach to help organizations realize widespread change. Our ability to design transformational places, plans and strategies is why Fast Company named us a World Changing Company and one of the most innovative design firms in the world.
ABOUT THE ROLE
You will be a member of our multi-disciplinary sustainability team, collaborating with design and technical leadership as an integral part of project teams across the firm.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Perform building performance analysis and produce graphical representations of results for communication with our multi-disciplinary teams across multiple markets and office locations.
Develop visually appealing graphical representation of building energy consumption, thermal envelope performance, daylighting, glare, thermal comfort, renewable energy analysis, climate analysis, massing, orientation and other performance metrics for project pursuits and active design work.
Develop detailed energy and daylighting analyses to complement early design simulations and feedback.
Manage the documentation for LEED energy credits, energy code compliance reports and other performance rating systems.
Research performance modeling methodologies, workflows, and software to improve how the firm delivers high-performance design solutions.
Develop research, case studies and white papers to present findings and recommendations.
Assist in the production of narratives, approaches, and fees for project proposals.
May perform related duties as required.
ABOUT YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
Associate degree in Architectural, Environmental, Civil or Mechanical Engineering or related degree. Bachelor's degree in related field preferred.
Minimum 4 years of related experience which includes at least 2 years of building performance analysis.
Must have experience in data analysis, energy modeling, and visualization tools, and be well versed in A/E/C industry trends related to high performance buildings. Experience with net-zero energy buildings and advanced metering technologies is preferred. Experience with a broad range of building typologies, including but not limited to healthcare, laboratory, office and educational facilities is preferred.
Complete proficiency with at least one of the building energy modeling software with a strong desire to have multiple software proficiency: EnergyPlus, OpenStudio, IES-VE, eQuest, EnergyPro.
Must have familiarity with ASHRAE Standard 90.1, ASHRAE Standard 62.1, LEED Reference Guides, California Title 24, IECC, and other energy related codes.
Strong verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills are essential.
Proficiency with BIM applications strongly desired.
Experience in computational design and programming languages such as Python strongly desired.
This position may require travel to other CannonDesign offices as well as client locations.
One or more credential such as LEED, CPHC, BEMP or similar strongly desired. PEng a plus.
ABOUT WORKING HERE
We are relentless in our pursuit of client adoration (not simply satisfaction). Consistent delivery of the best service is what we are about.
We are committed to ensuring our practice is equitable for all employees, representative of the communities around us – and focused on the future of design. We advocate for equity, diversity, and inclusion efforts through the leadership of our DEI Council, Employee Resource Groups and other community advocacy initiatives.
We're about communication and transparency here. If you want to talk to someone about an idea you have, or a challenge that needs addressing, we're ready for you.
Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site. It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. Please provide your resume and portfolio when applying.
As a condition of employment, all employees are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required timeframes and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.
CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce and is committed to Employment Equity and the Federal Contractors Program. We encourage applications from qualified aboriginal Canadians, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities and women. CannonDesign is committed to providing accommodation for people with accessibility needs due to disabilities in all aspects of the hiring process. If contacted, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.

About Chartered Professional Accountants of Canada
Chartered Professional Accountants of Canada (CPA Canada) works collaboratively with the provincial, territorial and Bermudian CPA bodies, as it represents the Canadian accounting profession, both nationally and internationally. This collaboration allows the Canadian profession to champion best practices that benefit business and society, as well as prepare its members for an ever-evolving operating environment featuring unprecedented change. Representing more than 220,000 members, CPA Canada is one of the largest national accounting bodies worldwide.
About the opportunity
Reporting to Director, Applications and IT Operations, you will be part of the Business Analysis team with direct responsibilities for the CRM product. In your role as Senior Business Analyst and technical product owner, you will be working with stakeholders and business product owners creating and managing requirements, developing the product charter, working closely with the vendor to ensure that the requirements are implemented as per CPA Canadas needs. This role performs hands-on best practice advisory, requirements gathering, troubleshooting, and development of cloud-based CRM solutions.
What you'll do
In this role, you will:
Collaborate closely with project and product stakeholders, plan, elicit, analyze, validate, document, and manage the business needs.
Prepare and track requirements management plan, business and functional requirement documents, user stories throughout the project lifecycle.
Create data flow diagram, process diagrams and project artifacts by leveraging modern tools.
Prepare training material and conduct internal training sessions targeting business users to demonstrate CRM functionality
Work with QA/business users to plan testing strategy, support user acceptance testing
Assist development and business teams in troubleshooting various CRM configuration and user requests
Support business teams in designing page layouts, custom tab components, custom dashboards, reports, email templates and workflows.
Work with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Adhere to the enterprise standard requirements methodology for requirements planning, analysis and documentation.
Support Project Managers in assessing the value created by solutions, including evaluating the progress made against business objectives and manage the product backlog in conjunction with the Business Product Owner.
Define and maintain standard operating procedures and work instructions related to changes and assisting in communicating updates
Drive information-gathering activities such as surveying, analyzing, and evaluating processes, products and services, by using a variety of internal and/or external data
Determine, implement, and evaluate business metrics to meet ongoing organizational needs
Review the impact of application and/or system changes being developed and communicate any issues to all parties involved

What we're looking for
The ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience:
5 years and above experience in business analysis and development on a CRM platform, ideally Salesforce or Microsoft Dynamics
Certified Business Analyst
3+ years experience with Salesforce Cloud Solutions, ideally Nonprofit cloud
3+ years experience implementing Marketing Cloud, certification would be nice to have
Strong project management, analytical and technical skills; solid judgment and problem solving
Excellent understanding of SDLC and Agile methodologies.
Exceptional and well-honed interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills
Team player with ability to work with multiple internal groups and external stakeholders in fast-paced, high-energy environment, people leadership would be considered a strong asset
Keen interest and awareness of recent and emerging trends in the profession
Ability to manage multiple large projects/products
Strong consensus building skills and ability to convey technical concepts in a clear, understandable way

What it's like to work here
CPA Canada is a great place to work with a diverse workforce and a commitment to health and wellness for its employees. The organization offers a flexible and balanced environment that allows individuals to maximize professional and personal development. CPA Canada employs over 400 people, with its headquarters in Toronto and regional offices in Burnaby, Ottawa and Montreal. Our technology-enabled culture is designed to attract qualified people and enable them to do their best work. Employee perks include competitive salaries and pension, a comprehensive benefits package, professional development programs, flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home, regular social events and a highly successful employee volunteer program. CPA Canada is dedicated to continual improvement and building a high-performing, innovative organization that creates value for members and other stakeholders.
Organization values
We create a collaborative and constructive culture by:
• Acting with Integrity • Fostering Excellence • Respecting Others • Working Collaboratively • Being Accountable
CPA Canada is committed to cultivating an inclusive, accessible environment, where each employee feels respected, valued and supported. All qualified individuals may apply online. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in our recruitment process, please note this in your application. We'll be happy to work with you to meet your needs.

Job purpose
The purpose of this position is to maximize profitability by keeping pricing systems and data updated and by providing prompt pricing decisions to the sales group.
Duties and responsibilities
The duties and responsibilities of the pricing analyst are to:
-provide special pricing quotations to the sales team in a prompt manner, while maintaining pricing strategy, structure, and -profitability targets
-respond to pricing shifts in the market by proactively adjusting customer pricing
-ensure pricing on open orders is present, profitable, and free of discrepancy
-maintain supplier costing and process cost changes
-manage supplier supports/rebates for claims and database updates
-suggest and implement enhancements to existing pricing processes and systems
-review abnormal margins and invoice discrepancies and process pricing corrections as needed
-provide ad hoc reports, advice and analysis to sales group for more effective pricing decisions
Qualifications/Competencies
The pricing analyst will need a business background at the university level, with intermediate or advanced skills in Microsoft Excel. Experience in pricing, finance, and/or accounting would be considered an asset but are not required.
Working conditions
This position does not require travel and will be focused on working internally with the commercial and finance groups.

Department Overview
TD Wealth's Governance & Control (G&C) team partners with the Wealth businesses to design, implement, maintain, and monitor effective internal controls and ensure business activities remain within TD Bank's risk appetite and comply with external regulatory requirements
Job Description
Reporting to the Manager, the Analyst is responsible for Model and Business Managed Technology (BMT) Risk and overseeing ORM Programs such as ILED, Key Indicators and Scenario Analysis.

Primary Responsibilities:
Support second line (Model Risk Management (MRM), BMT governance team) and first line(technology owners/users ) manage all models and BMT lifecycle activities (i.e., attestations, document submissions, standard controls, gap analysis).
Ensure and maintain accuracy of all assigned model and BMT Assets in their associated inventories.
Provide oversight, diligence, and support for completion of Risk Assessments for all assigned model and BMT Assets.
Escalate issues related to the execution of Wealth models and BMT tools, ensuring appropriate individuals or teams are notified and accountable for resolving.
Support ongoing risk measurement activities by acquiring, analyzing, and reporting business operational or relevant loss data (ILED) and coordinate with partners across wealth and W-ORM to ensure reporting is accurate and timely.
Establish and maintain a process where all information regarding Operational Risk Events entered in OpERA is accurate, complete and current.
Conduct root cause analysis and develop appropriate remediation plans to help manage any risks associated with operational risk events within the Bank's risk appetite.
Analyze and prepare data for Executive level reporting of the Monthly KRI dashboard, for Wealth line of businesses.
Work on the Review, Refresh, Development, and threshold validations for Wealth line of business Key Risk Indicators (KRI).
Act as SME for the associated accountabilities by providing training and direction
Job Requirements
Education & Experience
Post-secondary education – undergraduate degree
3+ years of relevant experience preferred
Skills
Excellent skills in using computer applications, including MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Previous knowledge of risk management principles, ILED is an asset
Ability to communicate effectively in both oral and written form
Working knowledge of OPERA, MERLIN, ISM is an asset
Skilled in analytical software tools, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships
Ability to work successfully as a member of a team and independently
Ability to exercise sound judgement in making decisions
Ability to analyze, research, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines

column2: Senior Analyst, Canadian Policy Regulatory Reporting
column7:
Requisition ID: 164948

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

** This is a contract position **

Job Purpose

The Senior Analyst scrutinizes and evaluates FINTRAC regulatory reporting with a focus on analytical procedures for effective reporting. Guided by Bank policy, receives direct supervision from the Senior Manager. Within a well-defined task, the Senior Analyst is expected to function independently while ensuring that management is kept informed and that problems and issues are escalated appropriately.

Accountabilities

Provides senior management with consistent, consolidated, annotated reporting on AML regulatory reporting to FINTRAC, specific to Canadian legislation, with specific emphasis on Large Cash Transaction Report (LCTR) and Electronic Funds Transfer Report (EFTR) requirements.
Identifying unacceptable AML risks and escalating appropriately to the Senior Manager or Director.
Identify, track, and communicate system improvement opportunities and analytic defects, and participate in the implementation process.
Assist in the creation and maintenance of analytical tools (Advanced Excel tools) and reporting dashboards (e.g. Tableau, eazyBI) in respect to FINTRAC regulatory reporting.
Assist in the development of business requirement documents and user acceptance testing of AML front end and detective controls. Participate in the operational implementation process by assisting in the development of training materials, the creation of job aids and workflows, the development of communications and publications, the development of conversion and implementation strategies, training staff, and post-implementation support.
Support and continuously improve the on-going initiatives in respect to AML regulatory reporting to FINTRAC, by providing ad hoc reporting, monitoring efficiency/effectiveness of reporting through analytical processes, soliciting feedback, and critically assessing procedures.
Prepare documents for audit review and validate.
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, Enterprise AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
Champions a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team.

Functional Competencies

A proven ability to critically assess, prioritizes tasks, and delivers meaningful results in a fast-paced environment.
Basic knowledge of operational processes including best practices, current and anticipated regulatory requirements, Back Office processes, and the end-to-end workflows among the Front and Back Offices.
Good interpersonal and communication skills in both oral and writing, and to ability exercise diplomacy and judgement, to effectively work with end users, members of project teams, and stakeholders across the global organization.
Proficient with querying in database management software (e.g. Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, Oracle, MySQL)
Proficiency in advanced functions in Microsoft Excel, such as VLOOKUP, Nested IFs, SUMIFs, Fuzzy Logic
Proficiency with languages and tools: Python, VBA
Proficiency with data analytics and visualization/ case management software, (e.g. Tableau, eazyBI).
Working knowledge of XML an asset
Proven ability to effectively analyse large amounts of transactional and case management data.
Proven creative, self-starter, results-oriented, and highly motivated individual with good analytical skills in order to apply this knowledge to improve existing solutions and assist in the development of AML/ATF strategies.
Strong knowledge of regulatory compliance, particularly with respect to FINTRAC regulatory reporting (including LCTR/EFTR).
Experience with SWIFT EFT/Non SWIFT EFT/LCTR reporting (e.g. MT 103 messages)

Education /Experience

A recognized under-graduate degree in a business or technical discipline (Accounting, Finance, Data Science, Statistics or a related field) with a minimum of 1 year related experience

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Our client, a Financial Institution/Alternative Asset Manager, is looking to onboard a Business Analyst "BA" Capital Markets for an initial term of 6-12 months. They are going through systems changes and need BA's with Capital Markets experience. If you are interested please reach out and let us know.

As the Business Analyst, Capital Markets your main responsibility will be to work with various stakeholders to draft Business Requirements Documents. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to, helping with business process efficiencies to automate reconciliations, etc. helping to 'clean data' and map data fields, etc.

To be considered for this role, our client is looking for someone with the following skills/qualifications;
3+ years hands on BA experience within Capital Markets / Alternative Asset Managers
Ability to start asap
If you have the skills required to be successful in this role and you want to know more, please send your updated resume in MS Word format to Michelle Campanaro CPA, CGA at michelle@ifgpr.com.

Other opportunities can be viewed at www.ifg-global.com. #PR
