Job ID: 276346
Posted On: 2022-08-16
Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The Opportunity

We currently have career opportunities for Senior Consultants and Managers in our Canadian Capital Markets (CM) consulting team. Our team works to build a better world by transforming businesses through the potential of our people, technology, and innovation. Emerging technologies are transforming all lines of business and requires our customers to embrace these new technological capabilities and see them as new competitive advantages.

We work collaboratively with some of the top executives in financial institutions of all sizes and scales, helping them create and realize the best solutions for the future of their business. Each project is different, so you’ll need to be able to excel in ambiguous situations and confidently navigate ever-changing circumstances. We’ll look to you to be a self-starter, have the ability to translate complex information into simple terms, manage teams, and deliver long-term solutions with confidence. On this team, you’ll have the unique opportunity to imagine the future as well as create it, where you can craft ideas and implement them for our clients.

Your Key Responsibilities

As a part of the CM practice, you will advise clients and assist in solving Business and Technology problems in Capital Markets industry. You will provide clients with functional analysis, design, implementation, and technical program management support services.

You will support or lead the delivery of customer engagements, build customer relationships and lead team development. This will include generating new business opportunities by developing ideas and solutions to present to internal and external clients.

This will include assisting with performing analysis of business requirements, translating requirements into functional specifications, design of technical solutions and requirements for implementation by development teams. Assisting with feature design, business process decomposition, supporting technical system integration, configuration of systems, modernization, optimization, decommissioning and analysis of underlying front to back data requirements

You will also be able to support client technology organizations with front to back SDLC, provide hands-on support across one or multiple phases of the process and have experience with Technical Project Management and Agile ways of working.

Individually and as a member of EY team, you will converse with the with Capital Markets buy side and sell side technology, operations and business clients on traded products and the end-to-end trade lifecycle levels of AVP to Senior VP/Director. You will have the ability to understand business problems and advise on proposed technology solutions. Summarize and document technical discussions, translate technical decisions into business English language and communicate with client’s business stakeholders. Liaise between business and technology teams.

You will have the ability to effectively integrate with and leverage offshore development teams to scale and accelerate software delivery to meeting deadlines and close work

Skills and attributes for success
Agile, growth-oriented mindsets. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world. Experience in business development or delivering against financial targets in a service-oriented context is a plus
High-performance tech leaders. A strong track record of management of large teams delivering strategic technology-enabled transformations and major digital implementations. Demonstrated team leadership experience in complex contexts, in addition to project management, advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
Great communicators. Communication is key — we strive to bring our best interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, whether we’re writing an e-mail, building a proposal, drafting an architecture diagram, or cutting code. It is required to be bilingual (French/ English) to work in the Montreal office
Curiosity and purpose. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world, and who are committed to integrity in every environment
Integrity and inclusivity. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust

To qualify for the role, you must have
Capital Markets Business domain expertise. Intimate knowledge of the trading environment (front, middle, and back office), trading instruments (including Derivatives and Exotics across multiple asset classes), pricing, risk, and knowledge of the risk and regulatory issues within the Capital Markets businesses lines.
Capital Markets Technology experience. Practical knowledge of the Capital Markets and investment division business and technical architecture and workflows. Experience with implementation of trading and risk platforms; especially with experience in Murex or Calypso.
Hands-on experience with delivering technology solutions in Capital Markets industry across any of the following process areas:
Transaction processing from pre-trade to settlement, transaction pricing, market risk, position / portfolio management, collateral management, client onboarding as well as risk and regulatory concepts
Understanding of technology environments across Capital Markets; typical integration of key systems and platforms (trade capture, pricing, reference data, market data, etc.)
Understanding of basic principles of financial data modeling; data shape, size, velocity of change
Strong knowledge of transaction lifecycle across CM (FO-MO-BO)
Strong knowledge of financial instruments and asset classes (e.g., fixed income, multi asset derivatives, equities, FX, commodities)
Overall understanding of the front to back capital markets data value chain
Excellent analytical skills with ability to systematically resolve technical problems
Attention to detail, strong interpersonal skills, good communication across all levels of seniority in an organization

Ideally, you’ll also have

Technical Skills (Technologies)
Experience with technology implementation or support for core CM systems/ applications such as Murex and Calypso
Deep understanding of the Murex and Calypso product suite, including its application across sell and buy side firms
Advanced level of application implementation in modern programming languages C++, Java, Scala, Python, Node, or similar programming languages common in financial industry
Strong understanding of computer science concepts including data structures, algorithm design, complexity, time, state
Comfortable with object-oriented programming
Experience working with RDF, JSON, XML and other standard data frameworks and standards
Strong services-based implementation skills for building scalable, enterprise-grade solutions. SOAP, REST.
Experience with industry standard RDMS (e.g., MySQL, SQL Server, PostgresSQL) and No-SQL datastores.
Comfortable working with large data sets, complex objects, performing analysis, modelling and linage
Demonstrated experience with DevOps technologies (requirements management, version control, automated unit testing, code reviews, build and deployment).
Understanding business and functional requirements, translating into technical requirements, and designing solutions
Experience in architecture and design of solutions based on functional requirements
Experience with application integration, upgrade, decommissioning
Experience building and deploying applications in cloud
Leading development teams, agile pods
Strong knowledge of SDLC, and agile methodologies; experience delivering solutions in an agile environment. Experience with TDD and pairing

Desired Skills
BSc/BA in Data Science/ Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; MBA or other relevant graduate degree is a plus [5+ years]
SCRUM master and PMP certification is a plus
Understanding of DLT, Cloud, AI/ML technologies and use cases in Capital Markets
Knowledge of capital markets technology industry trends; knowledge of FinTech’s and their offerings
Developing technology strategy, architecture principles, product roadmap
Comfortable interacting with business stakeholders and clients for the purposes of understanding of business problems and design of solutions

What we look for

Successful candidates will have a leadership presence with a proven track record of sales and delivery in a management consulting context with established client relationships and experience in Canada.

What we offer

At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients, and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial, and social well-being. Plus, we offer:
Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

Diversity and Inclusion at EY

Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

EY Way of Work and your health and safety

EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Job Title
Pricing Analyst
Job Description
Effective January 1, 2022, all Canada.-based Philips employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID as a condition of employment at Philips. Employees with a documented medical condition or other protected human rights ground that prevent them from participating in COVID-19 vaccination may apply for accommodation. Philips Canada will consider accommodation requests on a case-by-case basis in accordance with applicable human rights legislation.
Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. Driven by the vision of a better tomorrow.
But it’s not just what we do, it’s who we are. We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common: An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers’ needs. It’s what inspires us to create meaningful solutions – the kind that make a real difference – when it matters most.
The world and our customers’ needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more. That’s why we need you, to help us tackle increasingly complex challenges posed by ever evolving health and well-being needs.
In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better
Looking at the challenges the world is facing today, Philips’ purpose has never been more relevant. So, whatever your role, if you share our passion for helping others, you’ll be working towards creating a better and fairer future for all.
Function as the Service & Solutions Delivery (S&SD) – Pricing Analyst and lead the Service Pricing within Philips Canada.
You are responsible for
Collaboration: The S&SD Pricing Analyst will work closely with Canadian (CDN) field staff, Finance and Marketing to develop and approve pricing models, promotional offerings, and provide negotiation support as required for our service offerings. In addition, the Pricing Analyst will align with North American (NAM) counterparts to ensure alignment within Canada as required.
Price realization and actualization: The Pricing Analyst will drive the price review and increase process to ensure minimal margin dilution while ensuring balanced competitiveness of Philips’ offerings
Discount Authorization Threshold (DAT) Policy: In conjunction with the NAM Service Price book release quarterly, the S&SD Pricing Analyst will be responsible for validation of the revised quarterly pricing tool. This individual will define and maintain localized discount authorization structures in addition to developing and approving localized promotions.
Historical & Competitive Market Data, including win/loss: The S&SD Pricing Analyst will be responsible building a database of Philips historical pricing, competitive information from debriefs and publicly available information to inform pricing analyses.
Performance Optimization: Drives continuous improvements applying LEAN.
You are part of
This opportunity will include, but not be limited to, standalone service pricing on current installed base, service pricing support attached to commercial RFP opportunities, Multi-vendor-service pricing, and catalogue maintenance. You will also gain knowledge of commercial pricing through cross training with the commercial pricing lead.
To succeed in this role, you’ll need a customer-first attitude and the following
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field
3+ years’ experience in a Finance or Sales Operations role
Highly analytical and value realization focused
Well-versed with Lean, Daily Management & Problem Solving
Skilled in working with Salesforce and SAP
Expert competency with Excel
Effective communicator and comfortable dealing with multiple stakeholder
Skill in effective organization; including proper problem–solving and follow-up
Ability to multi-task, while prioritizing frequently changing needs
Skilled at managing multiple interruptions and tight deadlines
Knowledge with leading a cross functional team
Experience with working in a business with complex market/channel structures
In return, we offer you
A path towards your most rewarding career. Philips is growing its marketing capability enterprise wide. Succeeding in this market-based role in a complex environment will open many doors for your long-term career, in other areas in Philips or otherwise. We also believe that we are at our best as a company when you are at yours as a person. Thus, we offer competitive health benefits, a flexible work schedule and access to local well-being focused activities.
Canadian work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa.
Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. For this position, you will reside in or within commuting distance to Mississauga, ON.
How we work at Philips
Our newly adopted hybrid work concept fuses flexibility with collaboration to deliver great outcomes for our people and our customers. We are embracing an approach wherein we spend more time together than apart – which for full-time employees translates to an average of at least 3 days working from the office and up to 2 days from home – for our hybrid roles.
Hybrid work flexibility means people can meet the changing demands of work and home in the most balanced, productive, and healthy way.
Our hybrid working model is defined in 3 ways:
We believe in the importance of impactful collaboration: There's a certain energy when everyone’s in the same room that can heighten idea generation and creative friction needed for problem-solving.
We embrace flexibility: Choosing where, when, and how to work can vary according to task and team schedules. Flexibility isn’t office or online, it means choosing the space that works best for you, your teams, and our customers on a case-by-case basis.
We want to be at our best: The way we work, and our workspaces are designed to support our well-being, offer career advancement opportunities, and enable us to be at our best.
Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions. Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year. Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for. Even you.
Visit our careers website to explore what it’s like working at Philips, read stories from our employee blog, find information about our recruitment process and answers to some frequently asked questions.

Job Summary:
This role serves for Corporate Sales & Marketing Division by major functions such as Planning of NECA services’ pricing, Analyzing market data and NECA’s pricing data, negotiation with vendors for buying price and conditions, quotations & responding and submitting RFQ’s, developing strategic relationships with all the business stakeholders such as clients, vendors, NX Group companies and other business related entities and supporting operation dept for successful onboarding process of customers, from aspect of both expansion of new customer sales and retention or upselling of existing customers for achieving company goal.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Work on RFQs, RFIs and RFPs, and review the bid package to adhere to service requirements to support completion within requested deadlines.
Create cost models required for pricing requirements and tariff creation.
Analyze market trends and business opportunity as well as dealing directly with Carriers and Customers if requested to source and provide quotes, also working with NECA A&D for strategic carrier management and pricing.
Assist in analyzing export and import data to create models for pricing and account profitability measurement, lane segment studies determining and measuring yield and margin results.
Determine product cost components, such as transportation cost and out-of-pocket expenses. Focus on a target reduction of overall Carrier costs to increase file profitability.
Negotiate service contract freight rates, terms and conditions with Carriers.
Develop strong overseas contact relationship for pricing and operational support.
Support the onboard process dealing with multi function and respond/report to customer request.
Assisting issuance of marketing materials and developing marketing campaign project where required.
Supporting the National sales team to obtain overall goals and budgets and build new business.
Manage communications from many sources and be sensitive to changing trade flows and market conditions.
Support Pricing & Planning Asst. Manager’s job
All other duties as assigned by management

Qualifications:
3 or plus of years experience in a similar role.
Working knowledge and experience in multi-mode domestic and international transportation services (especially Air and Ocean).
Strong focus on Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint programs.
Strong ability to maintain relationships and at various levels of the organization and related parties.
Familiar with customer contracts, SOP, tariff rates and issuance of quotation along with accessorial charge and proper T&C.
Ability to scrutinized tender documents and be aware of changes in the market as well as complete and analyze tender documents.
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal, and managing communications from many sources
Strong customer service oriented.
Strong mathematical and analytical skills
Have the ability to remain calm in stressful situations, work under pressure and meet deadlines
Understanding changing trade flows and market conditions

Education/Certifications:
Bachelor Degree in Commerce of College Diploma with freight forwarding experience

Nippon Express is an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise us if you require accommodation.

About Restaurant Brands International:
Restaurant Brands International Inc. is one of the world's largest quick service restaurant companies with more than $35 billion in annual system-wide sales and over 28,000 restaurants in more than 100 countries. RBI owns four of the world's most prominent and iconic quick service restaurant brands – TIM HORTONS®, BURGER KING®, POPEYES® and FIREHOUSE SUBS®. These independently operated brands have been serving their respective guests, franchisees and communities for decades. Through its Restaurant Brands for Good framework, RBI working towards its goal of improving sustainable outcomes related to its food, the planet, and people and communities.
Our opportunity for you:
80% of Canadians visit a Tim Hortons restaurant at least once per month. We're the #1 mobile app in food and drink category and #2 largest loyalty program in Canada. Tim Hortons also currently supports more than 300,000 children on teams in hockey, soccer, ringette, lacrosse, softball and baseball leagues in Canada and the United States. Our guests' experience is becoming increasingly digital, so we're creating innovative products to deliver better consumer experiences.
To continue this success, we are deepening our relationship with guests and their communities. The next step is to build out our digital ecosystem and expand our TimCard offering to include next-generation financial tools and products. Our goal is to double the number of guests using our app every month. We're quickly growing the team and need an Analyst, Customer acquisition in our Toronto office. You will be a part of the Customer acquisition team focused on driving growth in the Consumer Cards/ Payments business for Tim Hortons customers to deliver exceptional value. We aim to serve and meet the digital payments needs of Canadians, while connecting them to the brand Canadians trust most.
Join us and help build the next generation of digital experiences for Canada's most-loved brand!
What you'll do:
RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with your manager to achieve targets for customer growth via marketing campaigns
Support design and execution of testing plan/ framework to drive growth and be an embodiment of test and learn culture
Track Client acquisition costs, channel attribution, customer cohorts, LTV, etc.
Help with establishing communication channels with cross-functional teams
Monitor and appropriately escalate roadblocks for quick resolution
Assist with providing updates to senior leadership on a regular cadence about progress, potential roadblocks and other material information
Develop a thorough understanding of customer needs through quantitative and qualitative user research
Understand RBI and Tim Hortons's business strategy to deliver best-in-class products to serve our guests and franchisees.
What you'll bring:
REQUIREMENTS
1-2 years of customer acquisition/ growth experience working on consumer facing products
data analysis experience
Ability to translate analytical findings into meaningful insights
Experience working with CRM tools in Agile environments
Effective communication and interpersonal skills
Previous experience in QSR, Retail or with Loyalty products is a plus

Benefits:

Short- and long-term disability
Comprehensive global paid parental leave
Telehealth

Company Information

One of Canada's oldest and most respected debt solution providers. We help people and businesses get out of debt and start rebuilding their lives and businesses again. We also provide tax dispute resolution, through our team of tax lawyers and ex-CRA advisors. Established in 1979, Farber has over 250 employees in over 94 offices across Eastern and Western Canada, having helped over 100,000 Canadians get out of debt and solve their tax disputes.

And now we’re embarking on our next stage of significant growth. To do that, we need experienced, energized, and agile team members to play critical roles in helping us reach our ambitious goals so we can better serve Canadians in need.

Position Summary

We are currently seeking a BI Developer to join our Finance Team at our Toronto office.

Major Responsibilities
Support the scoping of BI solutions with business unit leaders to capture business objectives and prioritize opportunities
Design and develop complex BI Solutions, from back-end components and processes to front-end user interaction/experience components/requirements
Develop Power BI data models that aggregate data from multiple sources to meet requirements, configure, and set up application gateway refreshes
Create mock-up reports for proof-of-concept reviews
Design and develop complex BI solutions, from back-end components and processes to front end user interaction/experience components/requirements
Troubleshoot/test the solution and ensure the solution performs/performance-tune these solutions as necessary and document results
Document business expected outcomes, baselines, and value-add framework
Understand and implement Power BI performance improvement and dashboarding best practices
Remain current on Power BI upgrades and other tools to enhance solutions for stakeholders
Qualifications
A post-secondary education in Computer Science or Information Management or relevant experience
3+ years’ experience using Power BI or similar BI platform to deliver complex visuals
Minimum of two years of experience developing and implementing Power BI solutions, including modelling, design, development and testing of data visualization or paginated report solutions
Proficiency in Data Analysis (DAX), M, ETL (Power Query), SQL (or data extraction and integration tools) and performance optimization
Strong ability to work on multiple initiatives simultaneously and work within tight deadlines
Ability to communicate clearly in conversation and in presentations to both technical and non-technical staff and to provide updates to all levels of management and stakeholders
Microsoft Power BI certifications or Azure certifications are an asset
Experience working in an Agile project delivery model is an asset
Compensation, Benefits, and Perks

To ensure we attract and retain top talent, we offer competitive compensation and benefits which we continually review and update to meet the evolving needs of our people.

As a part of our team, you will receive:
hybrid work arrangements
vacation days based on experience and years of service
wellness days
extended health and dental coverage
life insurance
long-term disability
employee contributed retirement savings plan option
financial support for professional development

Our Commitment to Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity

At Farber, we’re in the business of helping people—and this ethos extends not only to our clients, but to our employees, partners, and the communities in which we work. Behind IDEA is our commitment to take action and to deliver an inclusive, diverse, and equitable experience for everyone. Our commitment also shapes our corporate culture and hiring practices.

Farber encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the diversity of Canada.
if you require any accommodations throughout the recruitment process—including alternate interview formats, accessible materials, or any other accommodations—we encourage you to contact us at careers@farbergroup.com.
We thank all candidates for submitting their resume, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

LOCATION: Toronto Hybrid
Fixed-Term End Date: Jan/2024
Who we are
Moneris was created as a joint investment between RBC and BMO Bank of Montreal (including Harris Bank) in December 2000. By maintaining the tradition of security and strength of our parent banks, today we are Canada's #1 processor, and one of North America's largest.
We are re-imagining commerce and shaping the future of FinTech. To do that, we empower our teams to redefine what's possible, enable them with the right tools and resources, and support them every step of the way.
Connect. Impact. Grow. Join one of Canada's top employers and make your mark at Moneris.

What you'll do

This role exists in order to analyze, design, develop, manipulate, business and financial data to influence and drive decision making as well as produce models to support business operations and business insight.
You will be accountable for:
Eliciting, analyzing and understanding business and data requirements to develop complete reporting and analytics solutions.
Executing on special projects / ad-hoc assignments as required with the ability to assume assignments that are moderate- to highly-complex and multi-faceted, to be performed under management guidance.
Conducting regular, on-going evaluation of current processes and provide guidance and recommendations to enhance the team’s overall performance.
Extensive SQL query skills to produce tableau dashboard reporting as well as ad-hoc analytics.
Design and development of data sources based on business requirements for reporting objects.

What you bring
Must-have experience, knowledge, skills & abilities
Undergraduate Degree, Technical Certificate or equivalent business experience.
5-7 years of experience working with various data sources and relational databases.
Must be able to clearly articulate analytical findings.
Must have superior skills in SQL
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) with proven ability to communicate technical and highly complex information.
Strong time management skills ability to prioritize and manage own workload in order to deliver quality results and meet timelines.
Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills with proven ability to interpret data, spot patterns and anomalies and provide insight.
What you get
Emphasis on Wellness - Meeting Free Fridays (MF2), company-wide holiday closure, just to name a few
Thrive in a Hybrid or Remote Model
Learning & development programs and resources - plus unlimited free access to LinkedIn Learning
EAP (Employee Assistance Program), Educational Assistance and Recognition Program
Employee perk program with incredible discounts for over 2,400 vendors and exclusive banking offers from BMO and RBC
Get involved in one or many of our Employee Inclusive Groups (EIGs) including Black Employee Network, Moneris Immigrants Society, 2SLGBTQIA+ EIG, just to name a few

Who you'll work with
As an integral part of the Moneris team, our Finance Department is made up of analytical and critical thinkers within five key functions: Controllership, Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), Corporate Data Analytics, Treasury. We are united by our mission to provide insights on key analytics and trends to support our teams in making the right business decisions. We are responsible for protecting the assets of Moneris and ensuring there are sufficient funds to support operations, merchant settlements, and growth.

Check out our careers hub to learn more about life at Moneris!
Note: We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

Get to Know Vault Credit Corporation
Vault is a non-bank private lending company offering a wide array of financial services such as mortgage, leasing and lending products. Vault has a devoted team of experts with years of experience in both financial services and real estate. We are dedicated to delivering products and services that meet the diverse needs of our borrowers, quicker and easier than traditional sources!
We have a fast-paced, fun, progressive, and friendly work environment. The company is currently experiencing growth (which comes with incredible opportunity) that can be attributed to the “work hard, play hard” and “have fun while you work” values of the organization. This is a company with no politics or red tape, you want to get something done, you will have the latitude and opportunity to run with it, giving you the chance to take ownership of your results with no ceiling of what you can accomplish.
Description
We are seeking an Analytics Manager to help establish our Data & Analytics group. If you are passionate about learning, developing your technical skills and be part of a core transformational team, we want to talk. Your work will inform both strategic and operational decisions across the organization and you will be involved in projects from inception to delivery.
Responsibilities
The successful candidate will be responsible for building reports and dashboards, designing automation processes to solve for efficiency and lead data science initiatives.
Lead data science and predictive modeling initiatives, especially in the credit risk modeling, and develop PD, LGD and EAD models for different lines of business.
Lead requirements gathering for reporting, dashboards, KPI definitions and automation needs with business units across the organization.
Act as a subject-matter expert in reporting and analytics to better guide the team when building reports and dashboards for the different business units.
Develop and launch configuration-based solutions on low-code to no-code platforms, such as Excel, SharePoint, PowerApps and more.
Build ETL pipelines and assist in managing the data warehouse to maintain a strong data platform capable of serving the organization’s data needs.

Qualifications
A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science or other related areas is required.
5+ years of experience with reporting tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI and Looker.
3+ years of experience with programming tools such as SQL and Python, as well as integrations via API.
3+ years of experience with statistical techniques, including logistic regression, neural networks and gradient boosting.
Experience with Salesforce CRM, especially around object structure and reporting.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.

Thank you for your interest in Vault Credit Corp. Please note that due to the volume of applications, only those under consideration will be contacted for an interview. We are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Should you require accommodation, we will partner with you to meet your needs.

Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the subfunction/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.

Responsibilities:

Utilizes good understanding of apps support procedures and concepts and basic knowledge of other technical areas to field issues and queries from stakeholders, provide short-term resolutions and work with relevant technology partners for long term remediation.

perform post release checkouts after application releases and infrastructure updates. Develop and maintain technical support documentation.

Analyzes applications to identify risks, vulnerabilities and security issues.
Makes evaluative judgments based on analysis of factual information; resolves problems by identifying and selecting solutions Cooperation with Development colleagues to prioritize bug fixes and support tooling requirements.
Directly impacts the business by ensuring the quality of work provided by self and others; impacts own team and closely related work teams.
Exchanges ideas and information
Active involvement in and ownership of Support Project items, covering Stability, Efficiency, and Effectiveness initiatives.
Performs other duties and functions as assigned in a concise and logical manner.
Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.
Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

2-5 years experience
Basic knowledge or interest about apps support procedures, concepts and of other technical areas.
Participation in some process improvements.
Previous experience or interest in standardization of procedures and practices.
Basic Business knowledge/ understanding of financial markets and products.
Knowledge/ experience of problem Management Tools.
Understands of how own sub-function integrates within the function and commercial awareness
Evaluates (sometimes complex) situations using multiple sources of information Developed communication and diplomacy skills to persuade and influence
Good customer service, communication and interpersonal skills
Good knowledge of the business and its technology strategy
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of issue tracking and reporting using tools
Good all-round team member
Effectively share information with other support team members and with other technology teams
Ability to plan and organize workload
Ability to communicate appropriately to relevant stakeholder
Education:
Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience

Company Description

Canada Goose isn't like anything else. We’ve built something great, something special – an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. At the heart of it is our promise to inspire and enable all people to thrive in the world outside. To Live in the Open. At Canada Goose, you’re part of a movement that belongs to something bigger. One that seeks out the restorative power of nature and is driven by a purpose to keep the planet cold and the people on it warm. We endure any condition, observe every detail, and are building a community that believes in living bravely and coming together to support game-changing people.
Here, opportunities are everywhere – to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they’re yours for the taking.

Job Description

The Project Analyst defends the Canada Goose brand thorough continuous improvement projects and will be responsible for the maintenance and implementation of all major project plans and initiatives related to the function of Quality Assurance for Canada Goose. The Project Analyst will implement the principles and practices of Lean Six Sigma to ensure that projects achieve a high return on investment, higher QA performance and increase customer benefits. The role will involve developing close working relationships with all Project Stakeholders and will also be connected to Cross Functional Projects in which Quality is featured. The Project Analyst plays a strategic role in improving key processes in QA, as well as, coaching and training others in tools and techniques.

Qualifications

Key Responsibilities:
Projects
Develop the project charter, integrated project plan, staffing resource plan, contingency plan and other project management artifacts.
Work to help solidify project objectives and connect them with the right business process owners.
Support Managers and SME’s through data analysis to provide data driven recommendations.
Report on projects and develop project status communications to QA, Warranty and Compliance Senior Leadership.
Alert all stakeholders on needed updates for all documentation based on the tracker
Support on standards, tools and procedures for use on the project to include issue management, risk management as well as change process.
Support management on implementing new project tools.
Ensure new initiatives/best practices are documented and their business impact is measured.
Review SOPs, guidelines and QA documentation according to cadence and reach out to correct Subject Matter Experts if necessary.
Research and advise on new tools and equipment that could enhance CG Quality and/or Project Management.
Complete post-mortem of new initiatives to identify areas of success and opportunities of improvement for future projects.

Work Cross functionally
Support cross-functional strategic projects which require complex project management and coordination. Examples of these projects include, MLL Project and Reduction of Cost of Poor Quality (FY21 value at $9 million) and to be the key representative for Quality & Compliance for the Traceability project.
Identify business processes, roles within those processes, and develop workflow diagrams with multiple swim lanes using Microsoft Visio or other industry standard tools

Budget & Invoicing
Provide analysis of forecasts against actuals for QA & Compliance $1.5 million testing budget and $200K travel budget.
Track project expenses and validate financial forecasts
Develop, maintain a post covid formula to measure staffing effectiveness. Analyze, report, and provide recommendations based on the analysis for staffing within QA teams.
Responsible for budget deliverables each quarter and fiscal year
Support on key deliverables for the financial performance of Warranty’s $9 million annual provision
Responsible for processing QA invoices and purchase requests in CG’s ERP system

Experience, Education and Designations:
Bachelor’s degree in business or a relevant discipline
4 years work experience in an operational role or managing projects
3+ years of business process mapping experience
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong computer competence in MS Project, PowerPoint, Visio, Word, and Excel
Lean Six Sigma training is considered an asset

Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:
Technically savvy; knowledge of how ERP, BI systems, up to date on new technologies
Strong strategic thinker and a strong ability to convey new concepts
Ability to analyze statistical and financial reports
Ability to translate a best practice into practical use for Canada Goose
Ability to translate data into information for those who will rely on it
Ability to build collaborative working relationships with internal colleagues and external vendors
Leadership ability – able to inspire others to action – both peers and business leaders
Active problem solver
Demonstrated ability to identify risk and find practical ways to mitigate
Consistently exhibits Canada Goose Values, taking pride in being innovative, respectful, passionate, accountable and entrepreneurial while exhibiting personal commitment
Ability to extract data from multiple systems/sources and make recommendations
Must be analytical and be able to demonstrate cost/benefit proposals (business cases)
Understanding accounting will be preferred

Working Conditions:
Environmental conditions: Office and Manufacturing

About JLL –
We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.
Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
JLL’s Project & Development Services (“PDS”) group is seeking a Building Performance Analyst preferably based in the Greater Toronto or Kitchener-Waterloo Area to assist with Net Zero Carbon energy modeling and data analysis projects across Canada and abroad. This position will be directly reporting to Senior Building Performance Analyst. The Analyst role will work on multiple projects at one time employing a range of skillsets, so flexibility and adaptability are valued qualities.

As a part of building energy performance team, you will be able to work on high profile projects ranging from ASHRAE level 2 and 3 audits to Net Carbon Zero Assessments. You will be working with world-class colleagues and will get an opportunity to collaborate and learn from internationally experienced professionals.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The ideal candidate will be responsible for:
Developing detailed energy models to establish NZC (Net Zero Carbon) interventions.
Reviewing building information from site assessments, as-built information, utility bills and floor plans
Creating templates and standard practice for energy modelling and data analytics initiatives
Liaising with internal team members within the energy and sustainability group
Benchmarking analysis for building energy and water consumption
Performing building life cycle assessments and evaluating opportunities of embodied carbon reduction
Cleaning and preparing large datasets to visualize and gain key insights
Developing visualizations to show building energy consumption, savings, and envelope performance
Assisting in production of technical reports, energy dashboards, and supporting documentation

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or energy related field(s); may consider those candidates with a related technical diploma and experience as an equivalency.
Preferably a recent graduate with 1-2 years of experience of energy/ sustainability or related fields.
Minimum 1 year of experience using IES VE as an energy modelling software.
Experience using Tableau or any other data analytics tools.
Experience performing whole building life cycle analysis (WBLCA) using Athena, OneclickLCA or Tally.
Working knowledge of energy efficient building design, HVAC and lighting systems and building façade with effect of thermal bridging.
Working knowledge of data prepping and data visualization tools, preferably Tableau Desktop.
Knowledge of green building standards including but not limited to LEED, International Living Future Institute, Zero Carbon Standard, SBTI etc.
Able to manage multiple tasks effectively and prioritize as required to meet expectations.
Strong verbal and oral communication skills. Able to work in collaboration with the internal team.
A positive attitude
Ability to self-motivate and deliver results.
What you can expect from us
We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.
We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!

Let’s make Power Plants Obsolete.
The current, centralized electricity system is not sustainable. Between the climate crisis, state-wide blackouts, aging infrastructure, and rising costs, the system needs a huge overhaul. The demand for electricity is high – and getting higher – and big power plants aren't meeting our needs. We say it's time to disrupt and decentralize.
At Peak Power, we're energy nerds that develop software for the real estate sector. Our tech turns commercial buildings and industrial facilities into hubs in a new, decentralized electricity system. This means cleaner, more reliable, and more affordable electricity. We’re powering the clean energy revolution.
Peak Power has developed a comprehensive software platform that alleviates strain on the electricity grid and drives value to owners of clean energy assets, buildings, and electric vehicles (EVs) through electricity markets.

The Opportunity
Reporting to the Manager - Asset Management and Market Operations, the Market Operations Analyst will be pivotal in driving the execution and delivery of day-to-day operations of Peak's electric asset portfolio. You will interface with multiple Peak Power assets across ISO regions and leverage analytics to optimize and build scalable operations practices to support our growing energy storage business. You will leverage your understanding of Independent Systems Operator (ISO) electricity markets, energy storage, and power systems to develop and position Peak's electric asset portfolio. So, if you are passionate about data analytics, and would like to apply your talents toward reducing the carbon intensity of the grid, then we'd like to hear from you!
This work matters. Even a small change to optimize power utilization can significantly impact our customers, electrical grid, and environment. We're building something that will have a lasting, positive impact.

Our new Senior Market Operations Analyst will:
Deliver. You have excellent time management, prioritization, and project management skills to ensure operational performance targets and project milestones are met or exceeded.
Dispatch energy storage resources for wholesale revenues and behind-the-meter applications while following bid optimization strategy and complying with market rules
Supporting all aspects of registration, metering, data management, and maintenance of Peak’s clients and its assets in different energy markets and Demand Response programs
Report. You will monitor and report on progress, methodically evaluate processes and systems to improve efficiency; and implement processes that provide transparency and tracking
Track asset and corporate performance requirements in each ISO/Utility Program and prepare asset performance and energy market reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Create quantitative analysis and run advanced pricing and economic models (Excel/Python) to assess energy storage projects under a variety of use cases
Collaborate. You have strong interpersonal and communication skills to enable effective operations that require input, buy-in, and execution across multiple departments, as well as customer and stakeholder communications.
Work with the Product and Software Development team to test, monitor, iterate, and automate asset operations tasks
Support business development efforts through customer information analysis to assess suitability of clients for available monetization and savings opportunities
Grow. You are a critical thinker who can seize opportunities to create value for Peak Power’s long-term vision for optimizing power utilization and energy storage. You will proactively identify opportunities to improve operational performance, efficiency, and scalability and contribute to Peak Power’s electric asset portfolio growth.

What you bring to Peak Power:
The education. You have an undergraduate degree in Science, Engineering, Business, Economics, or a related field. A higher education degree or additional training in project management, data analysis, or operations is considered an asset.
The experience. You have proven experience delivering success in a fast-paced, multi-tasking, team coordination role. You have a minimum of 2-3 years of professional experience with statistical techniques and concepts, data analysis using excel and python, or can demonstrate alternative knowledge that has prepared you for this role. Specific experience in the energy markets or electricity sectors/Demand Response is considered an asset.
The drive and curiosity. You have a roll up your sleeves attitude and are motivated to solve problems and support team success. You are passionate about contributing to innovative solutions to climate change.
The flexibility. You are flexible to adapt your activities as needed to support evolving team priorities in a rapidly changing business environment. You are comfortable with ambiguity and are willing to figure things out when there is no clear, defined path or process outlined. You have proactiveness in identifying problems & finding solutions.
So why Peak Power?
We are focused on solving problems that impact energy markets both locally and around the world. We are a growth-stage clean technology company that has partnered with major names in real estate, electricity, and smart city spaces. To work with us is not only to work with an exciting company, but to also be on the cutting edge of the global transition to distributed, clean, and carbon-free energy.
Join us!
Apply here or learn more about our company from our website or LinkedIn.
Peak Power is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

AppLovin enables developers to grow their business. Businesses rely on AppLovin’s market leading technologies to solve their mission-critical functions with a powerful, full stack solution including user acquisition, monetization and measurement. AppLovin is headquartered in Palo Alto, California with several offices globally.

AppLovin was named one of the Best Workplaces in Advertising & Marketing 2022 by Fortune, one of the Hottest Adtech Companies of 2021 by Business Insider, and a Certified Great Place to Work in 2021 and 2022. Fortune recognized AppLovin as one of the Best Workplaces in the Bay Area 2022, alongside The San Francisco Business Times and Silicon Valley Business Journal who have also awarded AppLovin one of the Bay Area’s Best Places to Work for the past four years. Our team members are regularly recognized for their work and leadership, including recent award wins for San Francisco Business Times’ Outstanding LGBTQ+ Leaders 2022, Business Insider’s Rising Stars of Adtech 2022, Glassdoor’s Top CEOs 2019, and the Women in Content Marketing Awards 2021.

We are looking for a hungry and data-oriented Sr. Analyst to join our Business Operations team. In this role, you will partner with various internal teams, from Business Development to Product, to drive meaningful growth for our top gaming partners. You will also have a chance to work directly with AppLovin’s leadership - including VPs and Directors across several teams, and to learn from many thought leaders in the industry, including our founders.
Responsibilities:
Apply data driven problem solving to find and execute top growth opportunities for the company
Define and analyze metrics to achieve success for our partners
Monitor daily performance against key metrics to identify opportunities and anomalies
Become a mobile advertising guru and expert on our suite of products
Stay relevant on industry trends and work with product team to develop high impact features
Help define and shape companies business intelligence products and tools
Basic Qualifications:
Passion for mobile games
2-5+ years experience working with data or technology
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, Economics, or equivalent analytical degree
Demonstrate outstanding analytical ability, comfort working with numbers, and strategic grasp of the “big picture”
Have experience prioritizing competing demands
Proficiency in Excel, and comfortable working with large data sets
Flexible team-player who can use drive, creativity and initiative to move the organization forward
Demonstrated experience applying statistical methodologies to real world problems
Ability to communicate complex results with clarity to both technical and non-technical audiences
Preferred Qualifications:
Previous experience in a start-up environment
Basic understanding of SQL and data structures
Proven interest in technology

Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's toy, entertainment and digital gaming company?
At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!
Job Description:
What will you work on?

You will work under the supervision of a Senior Analyst and Senior Manager to design and deliver data analytic products and services. You will have the opportunity to work with a variety of clients where you will analyze data using company’s analytics platforms. You will design dashboards and use business intelligence tools to cleanse, normalize and classify data to derive actionable insights.

How will you create impact?
Data Normalization (including Supplier Name Normalization, Parent-Child relation, etc.).
Development of Spend Taxonomy (Category Tree).
Spend data classification & categorization using Spend Taxonomy (Category Tree).
Design and build data visualization dashboards using BI tools.
Other procurement and performance analyses (e.g., Cycle time analysis, One-time vendor. analysis, price variance analysis, KPI reports, etc.).
Cost & process optimization assessment.
Identifying actionable insights from spend analysis.
Produce daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports using Microsoft Excel, and other BI reporting tools.
Partner with other analysts and subject matter experts (SMEs) to analyze available data and request new data to create reports or dashboard.
Provide training to team members on newly developed reports and processes.
Collaborate with business partners to develop business requirements and other supporting report documentation.
Complete user acceptance testing with newly developed reports.

What are your skills and experience?
Bachelor’s degree (Computer Science, Business Systems, Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Statistics) or equivalent
3+ plus years of reporting and analytics experience preferably in the retail or consumer packaged goods (CPG)
Must be strong in Microsoft Excel, knowledge to develop and manipulate data and spreadsheets (intermediate/advance) including graphing, tabulating, summing, sorting, subtotaling, and formatting.
Working knowledge of BI Tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, etc.) preferred
Working knowledge with SAP/S4HANA, or other Enterprise Financial Systems
Strong analytics and big-data management capabilities
Understanding of procurement and supply chain management principles, such as Strategic Sourcing, Tail Spend, Requisition to Pay, Invoicing, etc

Job Title: IT Business Systems Consultant

Company
Entourage Health Corp. is the publicly traded parent company of Entourage Brands Corp. (formerly WeedMD RX Inc.) and CannTx Life Sciences Inc., licence holders producing and distributing cannabis products for both the medical and adult-use markets. The Company owns and operates a 158-acre state-of-the-art greenhouse and processing facility located in Strathroy, ON; a fully licensed 26,000 sq. ft. Aylmer, ON processing facility, specializing in cannabis extraction; and a micropropagation, tissue culture and genetics centre-of-excellence in Guelph, Ontario. With the addition of Starseed Medicinal, a medical-centric brand, Entourage has expanded its multi-channeled distribution strategy. Starseed’s industry-first, exclusive partnership with LiUNA, the largest construction union in Canada, along with employers and union groups complements Entourage’s direct sales to medical patients. Entourage’s elite adult-use product portfolio includes Color Cannabis, Saturday Cannabis and Royal City Cannabis Co. – sold across eight provincial distribution agencies. The Company also maintains strategic relationships in the seniors’ market and supply agreements with Shoppers Drug Mart. It is the exclusive Canadian producer and distributor of award-winning U.S.-based wellness brand Mary’s Medicinals sold in both medical and adult-use channels. Under a collaboration with The Boston Beer Company subsidiary, Entourage is also the exclusive distributor of cannabis-infused beverages in Canada, expected to launch in 2022.
About the Role
We are looking for an Operations Analyst to join the Finance team. This is an opportunity to partner with operations across all functional groups and verticals to drive forecasting, strategic planning, and data-driven decisions. This role reports directly to the Director, Strategic Analytics, however, this is highly visible role with the opportunity to engage with a wide variety of stakeholders in an innovative business at the forefront of a burgeoning industry.
As an Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for maintaining and creating financial and operational data sets/models to improve accuracy in areas such as costing, pricing, forecasting, financial modelling, sensitivity analysis, and other related focuses. In this role, you will need to leverage strong analytical and problem-solving skills to assist the finance team in strengthening existing processes and automating reports using data analytics techniques and process optimization improvements. Importantly, you will be counted on to identify risks and opportunities within data sets to help the organization meet it’s near and long-term objectives, lead cross-functional cost improvement iniatives, support the development of robust and methodical approaches to pricing new and existing products, and drive accountability across all business units.
Responsibilities
Prepare management reports, develop and monitor KPI’s and Power B.I dashboards; pivotally, you’ll be converting and integrating existing manual reports into dashboards
Partner with cross-functional data leads within the business units to derive a robust data lake tying together financial and operational data
Support forecasting and reporting processes, including forecast vs. actual analysis, re-forecasting, Management and Board of Directors reporting materials
Maintain and update financial and operational performance models and reports to understand performance and trends
Develop a robust process to structuring ad-hoc financial/business models
Showcase an ability to design assumptions around business cases with inbuilt sensitivities and what-if scenarios
Maintain and enhance the company’s external presentations for investors and potential partners
Partner with cross-functional data leads within the business units to derive a robust data lake tying together financial and operational data
About You
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or equivalent quantitative area
A professional designation (CA, CMA, CPA, CFA) or equivalent master’s degree is not required but considered an asset
1 – 3 years of financial planning and analysis experience, or relevant work experience in a finance/data analytics environment preferably in a consumer, retail, or manufacturing industry
Proven experience with Power BI, SQL, Python, and R or similar reporting platforms or data analytical software
Strong understanding of data analytics and statistical techniques
Strong financial and analytical skills with the ability to prioritize effectively and meet multiple deliverables with tight timelines
Exceptional cross functional relationship building and communication skills.
Proven ability to read and understand financial statements as well as to translate into a financial model / forecast
Strong financial acumen including experience with management reporting, variance analysis and other analyst support functions in forecasting
Ability to balance multiple, diverse priorities and produce high quality deliverables
Travel may be required from time to time to our other locations (London, Strathroy, Aylmer, Puslinch)

Description
The Senior Investment Risk Data Analyst (Risk Analyst III) will be part of a global team of investment risk professionals and reports to the Managing Director, Global Head of Investment Risk Oversight based in Toronto, Canada. GWAM Investment Risk Oversight is a second line of defense Risk function within clients Investment Management, Clients Global Wealth and Management Segment. The team promotes risk-conscious growth culture by independently profile and monitor market and liquidity risks of Investment to ensure alignment with client’s expectations.
As a Senior Investment Risk Data Analyst, you will:
Apply understanding of market and liquidity risk models to produce relevant and substantial analyses to support regional fund risk oversight.
Develop and implement highly effective data visualization tools for investment risk monitoring (eg. interactive dashboard, workflow, headmap, trend analysis) to illustrate risk trends and identify areas of concentration risks at different aggregation levels.
Perform sensitivity analysis on liquidity risk model inputs to explain of risk model performance.
Represent GWAM investment risk in end-to-end and continuous interaction with GWAM IT (Risk Data Engineering and Application Support) teams to automate investment risk monitoring and reporting processes.
Document risk analytics process workflows and perform user acceptance testing of deliverables.
Job Requirements:
5+ years working as an investment risk analyst or data analyst in portfolio management and securities firms for fixed income and equities.
Advanced SQL and Power BI programming skills (eg. DAX, SSIS, Microsoft Azure Analytics Platform), specialized in working with large data sets and experience with end-to-end data workflow design.
Strong interest in developing a career in quantitative finance and investment risk management. Experience with investment risk management for fixed income, equity and derivatives an asset.
Exposure to liquidity risk and market risk reporting modules from third-party investment risk systems (eg. MSCI RiskManager, Bloomberg) in meeting fund risk management and reporting requirements is an asset.
Strong computer programming and problem-solving skills in Python;
Experience in Agile methodology and framework (eg. Scrum, Kanban) is an asset.

Position Title: Real World Data Management Analyst
Department: Real World Evidence
Location: Toronto
About Sanofi:
We are an innovative global healthcare company, driven by one purpose: we chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. Our team, across some 100 countries, is dedicated to transforming the practice of medicine by working to turn the impossible into the possible. We provide potentially life-changing treatment options and life-saving vaccine protection to millions of people globally, while putting sustainability and social responsibility at the center of our ambitions.
Our vision for digital, data analytics and AI
Sanofi has recently embarked into a vast and ambitious digital transformation program. A cornerstone of this roadmap is the acceleration of its data transformation and of the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions, to accelerate R&D, manufacturing and commercial performance and bring better drugs and vaccines to patients faster, to improve health and save lives.
The Digital Team at Sanofi is a unique data-driven team. We pride ourselves on being data obsessed and highly focused on using state of the art processes along with global technologies to drive impact to our solutions. We measure our insights and products based on how they preform across the globe and hold ourselves to the highest regard as our solutions can impact millions of lives. When tackling a problem, we do not just ask how we will create a solution, but how we will create a solution that reaches across the world with the best possible societal outcome.
If you are passionate about improving the health and wellness of people across the globe using Data as your means, then you should look no farther than the Digital Team here at Sanofi. Join us on our journey in enabling Sanofi’s Digital Transformation through becoming an AI first organization. This means:
AI Factory - Versatile Teams Operating in Cross Functional Pods: Utilizing digital and data resources to develop AI products, bringing data management, AI and product development skills to products, programs and projects to create an agile, fulfilling and meaningful work environment.
Leading Edge Tech Stack: Experience build products that will be deployed globally on a leading-edge tech stack.
World Class Mentorship and Training: Working with renowned, published leaders and academics in machine learning to further develop your skillsets.
Location: The Sanofi Digital Data Team uses a hybrid working model combining remote and office-based work. The Canada Digital Data Hub offices will be located in the greater downtown area of Toronto.
Position Summary:
You are a dynamic Real World Data Management Analyst, interested in challenging the status quo, by having a deep understanding of managing and analyzing current and emerging person-level data opportunities with processes and value drivers for the business. You will contribute to solutions that derive insights from data and you will ensure the quality, usability and security of Sanofi’s real world data ecosystem. You are analytical, creative, and collaborative. You have keen attention to detail and take the time to understand our stakeholders’ data needs and challenges. You continually seek to improve your knowledge of new technologies and industry standards to drive the development of simple, yet effective solutions. You enjoy partnering with stakeholders to design and implement data management best practices and procedures. You are a self-starter, see challenges as opportunities, and are results oriented. You take pride knowing your work enables innovation and helping Sanofi build better solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop detailed knowledge of Sanofi’s data, data flows, and processes.
Perform data analysis and provide input to solution design and architecture to ensure the solution meets requirements.
Extract, aggregate, manipulate, categorize, clean, and transform data associated within an identified problem space.
Partner with stakeholders to get buy-in on, develop, and implement Sanofi’s data management standards, policies, and best practices.
Drive alignment across stakeholders on enterprise data models and definitions.
Develop and implement procedures for effective data management aligned with FAIR principles.
Perform exploratory data analysis and feature generation.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Recommend KPIs and develop reports to monitor adoption of and adherence to data management standards.
Share regular updates with stakeholders regarding proposed solutions, timelines, progress, and issues.
Participate in testing activities to ensure data integrations are properly implemented.
Develop and implement rules and procedures for data sharing, and ensure compliance with data usage policies.
Contribute changes and/or improvements to data governance processes.
Engage in and lead cross-functional project teams including technical and subject matter experts to execute data management projects.
Regularly evaluate health of data assets and identify potential impact on downstream analysis.
Key Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.
A minimum of 1+ years’ experience in data management
Understanding of privacy laws and regulations and experience working with private and sensitive personal information.
Strong understanding of databases and data structures.
Strong experience in SQL writing and profiling of Data via statistical methods.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify, quantify, and effectively raise business risks associated with data quality or non-compliance.
Expertise in Python or R.
Exposure to tools used to support data management, specifically business glossary and metadata management, data cataloging, and data quality.
Knowledge of Informatica Suite of Tools.
Experience developing best practices, policies, and/or procedures.
Accountable, Proactive, Collaborative and Agile.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to understand business needs. Strong capacity to develop consistent, clear analysis and report potential issues.
Action orientated with ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast-moving environment.
Self-starter with excellent problem-solving ability.
Ability to multi-task, takes initiatives and prioritize effectively.
Positive team player who demonstrates collaboration and teamwork with internal and external stakeholders at all levels within the organization.
