TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Reconciliations Team is a critical control function within TD Wealth Operations responsible for accounts that cover TD Wealth in Canada and the US. The Team is accountable for the overall governance of accounts to mitigate financial exposure and risk, and ensure superior client experiences. This involves oversight of accounts from multiple systems and across a range of Wealth products to ensure that breaks are being actively acquired, owned, investigated and resolved in a timely manner. In addition, the team works to investigate, improve, and optimize existing reconciliation processes and pain points within the entire Reconciliations control space.

Job Description
The primary accountability of the role is to complete and improve existing processes and while identifying and escalating risks of aged and high value breaks within the reconciliations control space. Your high energy and desire to improve process and mitigate risk will enable you to find creative solutions that not only optimize the efficiency of existing processes and controls but also improve employee engagement and satisfaction.
As a member of the Reconciliations Control team, you will also have a unique opportunity to positively impact the future state of a vital control function within TD Wealth. The Reconciliation Analyst will support, enhance and ultimately augment our existing Reconciliations team's processes, mandate and efficiencies.

Your high energy and desire to invoke change will enable you to find creative solutions using a variety of tools including excel VBAs, Alteryx and Tableau to optimize the efficiency of existing Reconciliation processes by automating functions such as data load and match rules to accurately identify and assign breaks for remediation.

You have a keen sense of finding the root cause of problems by analyzing and sifting through data. You are driven to succeed in a dynamic and changing environment to drive competitive advantage within the Operations functions at TD Wealth.

Job Requirements
Responsibilities:
Participate in the continuous improvement of current reconciliation - identify and bring forward opportunities to improve service delivery
Manage/monitor the Digital Worker (bots), review its performance and identify defects and support the Mutual Funds Reconciliation team to sort/analyse breaks and finding process improvements for the team.
Assist in data analysis and identify patterns where manual matching and break allocation is occurring and advance ideas to build automation rules.
Recommend and develop solutions to optimize process performance:
o Take a risk based approach in applying innovative solutions to unique problems in differing lines of business
o Liaise with multiple partners
o Recommend and summarize improvements
Using tools including Excel VBAs, Alteryx and Tableau, build workflows/processes that optimize the efficiency of existing Reconciliations by automating functions such as data load and match rules to accurately reconcile data, identify and assign breaks for remediation, management reporting using dashboards to highlight exposure and trends.
Develop, test, document and implement new and enhanced reconciliations, dashboards and breaks reports.
Work with project teams, to develop, maintain and test reconciliation between multiple sources of data.
Assist in analysis, development, testing and implementation of operational changes and process improvements.
Participate in completing daily reconciliation tasks while meeting or exceeding Service Level Agreement(s) requirements
Identify, record and investigate processes/exceptions arising from transactions / processes beyond first level operations service delivery
Refer or escalate processing or operational issues as needed based on a solid understanding of the issue, connect with the appropriate function / partner to facilitate resolution and ensure that service quality is maintained, and risk minimized.
Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork
Support team manager in managing team workload, demonstrating a proactive understanding of the changing landscape
Support the team by actively building operations knowledge, think critically about processes and opportunities for improvement, share ideas and transfer knowledge within the team, across the function, and with partners (e.g., audit, business insights)
Work collaboratively and develop good working relationships with all Reconciliations process partner teams
Contribute to the success of the team by willingly assisting others in the completion and performance of work activities; provide training, coaching and/or guidance as appropriate
Contribute to a fair, positive and equitable environment that supports an inclusive and diverse workforce

Participate in initiatives, ensure that changes to the systems and processes impacting reconciliation activity are addressed, and ensure that reconciliation controls remain effective.

Identifies key operational / reporting / process issues for own area

Provides thorough analysis and/or specialized reporting or operational/process support

Provide accurate and thorough analysis of key process drivers, root or systemic causes of cross functional operational issues, interpret findings and make recommendations

Additional Information
Other Qualifications/Skills/Experience:
3+ years' experience within a Wealth Business, Operations or other related industry
Highly proficient in Excel (advanced excel preferred). Knowledge of other programming language and familiarity with tools such as Alteryx/Python/Tableau are an asset.
Strong analytical skills applied towards sorting through large amounts of data to identify and resolve account outages, perform complex investigations and root cause analysis
Ability to work in a high pressure environment and ability to prioritize and manage the workflow of the team.
Self-motivated and dedicated teammate, who takes ownership and accountability, has strong organizational skills as well as the ability to effectively handle challenging

column2: Real World Data Privacy Analyst (All Genders)
column7:
About Sanofi:
We are an innovative global healthcare company, driven by one purpose: we chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. Our team, across some 100 countries, is dedicated to transforming the practice of medicine by working to turn the impossible into the possible. We provide potentially life-changing treatment options and life-saving vaccine protection to millions of people globally, while putting sustainability and social responsibility at the center of our ambitions.
Sanofi has recently embarked into a vast and ambitious digital transformation program. A cornerstone of this roadmap is the acceleration of its data transformation and of the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions, to accelerate R&D, manufacturing and commercial performance and bring better drugs and vaccines to patients faster, to improve health and save lives.
Who You Are:
You are a dynamic Real World Data (RWD) Privacy Analyst who is committed to ensuring that all citizen and patient data collected and used at Sanofi is protected, and our work complies with all applicable data protection legislation. You will improve our management of potentially sensitive information, carry out regular internal security audits, and act as the main point of contact for RWD privacy topics involving the Digital Data Office. As an analyst in privacy, you will promote a culture of data protection compliance within the organization through direct communication, training sessions and workshops. You have keen attention to detail and take the time to understand our stakeholders’ data privacy needs and challenges. You continually seek to improve your knowledge of new technologies and industry standards related to privacy so that we can drive the development of simple, yet effective solutions. You enjoy partnering with stakeholders to design and implement data privacy best practices and procedures. You are a self-starter, see challenges as opportunities, and are results oriented. You take pride knowing your work enables innovation and helping Sanofi build better solutions.
Our vision for digital, data analytics and AI
Join us on our journey in enabling Sanofi’s Digital Transformation through becoming an AI first organization. This means:
AI Factory - Versatile Teams Operating in Cross Functional Pods: Utilizing digital and data resources to develop AI products, bringing data management, AI and product development skills to products, programs and projects to create an agile, fulfilling and meaningful work environment.
Leading Edge Tech Stack: Experience build products that will be deployed globally on a leading-edge tech stack.
World Class Mentorship and Training: Working with renowned leaders and academics in machine learning to further develop your skillsets
Job Highlights:
Serve as the Digital RWD data privacy and protection analyst for all Digital RWD Data team members, and Digital Teams working with RWD.
Liaise with Sanofi global, local, and other functional data privacy teams on best practices and ways of working.
Provide the RWD perspective on company-wide protection and privacy initiatives led by the global, local, and functional privacy teams.
Ensure digital data collection policies and processes are in accordance with General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), Health Information Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and regional codes of practice in EU and North America
Develop and coordinate RWD protection and privacy training plans and provide training sessions and workshops for Digital RWD team members
Promote a culture of data protection compliance across all units of the digital data organization
Proactively conduct audits to ensure compliance and address potential issues
Maintain records of all RWD processing activities carried out by the organization
Collaborate with ITS Security to ensure alignment between security and privacy compliance programs including policies, practices, investigations, and acts as a liaison to the ITS department.
Key Functional Requirements & Qualifications:
Accountable, Proactive, Collaborative and Agile
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to understand business needs. Strong capacity to develop consistent, clear analysis and report potential issues
Action orientated with ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast-moving environment
Self-starter with excellent problem-solving ability
Ability to multi-task, takes initiatives and prioritize effectively
Positive team player who demonstrates collaboration and teamwork with internal and external stakeholders at all levels within the organization
Key Technical Requirements & Qualifications:
Strong knowledge and understanding of data protection principles.
Baccalaureate’s degree and a Minimum of three years of experience working in data protection compliance or a related field
Expertise in European data protection laws and practices including an in-depth understanding of the GDPR
Experience within a legal, audit and/or risk function department
Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.
Own your future. Make your move!

#Hybrid
#GIC

Background:
We are a group at gRED Data Science and Statistical Computation with a focus on developing methods and systems to support interactive analysis of genomic data. We have two overarching goals in the group: (a) enable Genentech science and discovery by building effective and efficient data analysis software systems; and (b) develop new cutting edge visualizations for genomic data analysis that we disseminate as open source software and publications in the scientific literature. We are looking for a Data Visualization software engineer to join our group to help with projects in large-scale cellular and tissue profiling initiatives using sequencing and imaging technologies.
Responsibilities
Creating effective, beautiful, and usable interactive data analysis interfaces to visualize, explore and interrogate integrated data from diverse technologies and biological systems, in particular spatial transcriptomics and other imaging based technologies.
Developing highly performant, responsive, interactive analysis software for large datasets
Work with business analysts, computational scientists, and other software engineers to understand and conceptualize the complex, emerging needs of our scientists, whether they are working at the keyboard or the bench.
Collaborate with local and off-shore engineering teams to support your software development efforts.
Contribute to the broader scientific community through open-source software development.
Skills required:
BS or higher in bioinformatics, computer science, mathematics or related fields.
5+ years’ experience (including any graduate school) developing tools for interactive data analysis and visualization. Seniority of position will depend on experience and other factors.
Expertise in modern JS (ES6) programming
Demonstrated expertise with JavaScript data visualization libraries, e.g., d3.js
Expertise with high performance web-based visualization technologies, e.g., WebGL
Knowledge of WebGPU is a plus but not a requirement
Familiarity with UI design best practices, usability testing and iterative design
Demonstrated adherence to best practices in software engineering, particularly usability, version control, testing, and appropriate use of abstraction.
Biological domain knowledge, specifically in single cell genomics, and basic data analysis skills are desirable but not required.
Familiarity with formal build/release/deploy and continuous integration frameworks is a plus.
Must Have Skills:
5+ years’ experience developing tools for interactive data analysis and visualizations
Expertise with high performance web-based visualization technologies, e.g., WebGL
Expertise with JavaScript (ES6) data visualization libraries, e.g., d3.js
Thanx and regards
Pinky

The Position

The Direct Fulfillment Supply Chain function is an emerging capability at The Home Depot. With the outstanding growth as an organization, Home Depot is positioned to become a leader in the Home Delivery business. As such, it is a function that will be in a mode of exciting and significant change over the next few years.

As a subject matter expert in Supply Chain principles and having an in depth knowledge of core supply chain or deliveries, the Business Analyst will be accountable for assisting the Manager, Direct Fulfillment with the execution of initiatives. They will work with cross functional partners to resolve specific business issues and will work with leaders and associates to development and implement key strategies. This includes executing advanced analysis, detailed process engineering and change management.

Responsibilities:
Leads change by example and drives project team work through ambiguity of new processes and systems
Works closely with DF operations teams, Store Ops, IT, and other appropriate cross functional partners to drive project deliverables
Act as the Lead of the team when Manager is unavailable.
Perform complex analytics and deliver recommendations based on sound Supply Chain principles
Use analytical methods to model/quantify current and future state performance and costs
Recommend and assist in the implementation of best practices within the team.
Use Lean/Six Sigma principles to identify savings opportunities within the supply chain
Provide process oversite for various delivery system procedures to ensure high quality process outputs
Facilitate discussions with key business stakeholders to generate solution ideas and provide status updates and reporting
Develop and manage action plans associated with improvement initiatives
Prepare and present project details/updates when necessary

Experience / Knowledge Required:
Internal Candidates: Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+, Meets expectation, Consistently demonstrates).
3-5 years of analytical experience (ideally in a retail environment) with emphasis on process improvement, replenishment, change management and data analysis
University or College Degree in business or engineering will be considered as a preferred qualification
Experience with Distribution, Transportation or a Home Delivery related field a definite asset
Experience with Six Sigma or other Process Improvement Methodology is preferred
Proficient in: Microsoft Office Suite including Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visual Basic, SQL, Word and Visio
Clarifies and resolves complex business issues by breaking them down into meaningful components to determine root cause and redesigning internal and external business processes
Strong analytical skills with the ability to extrapolate pertinent information from various sources (reports and spreadsheets) and analyze data for recommendations
Maturity in a changing environment and ability to go above & beyond a defined role
Strong relationship builder and has the ability to communicate effectively across different levels of the organization and external stakeholders
Ability to travel within Canada and or the U.S.A.

About Us
Echelon Insurance provides Personal and Commercial Specialty Insurance solutions to protect Canadian families and businesses across Canada, through our trusted network of Broker partners. Echelon is a member of the CAA Club Group of Companies, and is an equal opportunity employer who offers a professional environment that champions collaboration, trust, and growth to drive success. We cultivate a great working dynamic to help us deliver what is best for our associates, Brokers, and Customers.
Who we are
Get ready to drive your career forward. Life at Echelon is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development – and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results.
We are caring. We are leaders. We are innovators. We are collaborative.
We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it.

Support Managers and Directors across Echelon business lines and project teams, as needed, by addressing privacy-related queries in their areas

Excellent analytic and recent research skills

Our client is a dynamic, Toronto-based IT consulting boutique which strives for excellence in customer service and delivery in financial services and fintech industry. They focus on technology advisory, cloud computing, integration solutions, and enterprise data solutions and analytics. With a team of highly knowledgeable business and technical experts, they provide strategic, mission critical solutions to their clients.

The team has many years of business technology consulting experience and has delivered many successful projects in the financial and fintech industry. Their proven process and methodology together ensure quality service in a results-oriented environment.

Our client is looking for a Wealth Management/Commercial Banking Business Analyst who will work closely with their project teams to successfully deliver business and data analysis in operations or system integration projects in the Greater Toronto Area.

Responsibilities
Define scope and requirements for technology projects and information systems.
Gather functional, non-functional, and data requirements from various stakeholders and document them accurately and logically.
As a product owner, develop project vision for development team, manage product backlog, prioritize product needs, manage product roadmap, oversee development, and support agile development teams. Lead product functional design based on business and user knowledge. Translate product roadmap features into user stories and acceptance test criteria.
Develop specifications for business processes, processing workflows or data flows.
Verify the target solution and support the technology to ensure that the target system will meet the requirements.
Test the solution to validate the project requirements and objectives.
Develop effort estimation for requirements elicitation activities.
Facilitate meeting/interviews and communicate requirements to sponsors, stakeholders and project team members.
Investigate and assist in resolving data issues in risk systems.
Help and support other team members.
Requirements
Minimum Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or Mathematics.
Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) with experience as a product owner.
At least 5 years experiences of business and systems analysis in the Banking and Capital Markets areas.
At least 5 years in requirement management and planning, elicitation, facilitation and documentation.
Experience managing and delivering complex projects.
Strong communication skills with direct communication with senior business and technology executives
Proven track record of high customer satisfaction.
Ability to motivate and mentor team members.
Experiences working one or more of these functional areas: front office (trading process, market data), middle office (i.e. position, P&L attribution, cash flow monitoring, reporting), risk management (e.g. trading credit risk and market risk) and back office (reconciliation, clearing and settlement process).
Understanding and working knowledge of the financial asset classes (e.g. equities, fixed income, FX, commodity, and rates) and derivative products.
Understanding of SAP FI
Knowledge of relational data model and data manipulations using SQL.
Thorough understanding of both waterfall and agile methodologies and approaches.
Strong Microsoft Excel skills.
Excellent in technical and business writing.
Logical and analytical mindset.
Strong Communication skills.
Strong team player.

Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's toy, entertainment and digital gaming company?
At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!
Job Description:
What will you work on?

As a member of the Global Supply Chain Architecture Team, the Supply Chain Data Management Analyst will work in close partnership with our Demand and Supply Digital Transformation project team to execute data cleansing activities. The person will act as a dedicated resource to drive data transparency, make data more meaningful, ensure data accuracy, increase trust in data, and safeguard our information assets. You will operate across the people, process, and technology pillars of Supply Chain collaborating with subject matter experts including data stewards, data consumers, and producers to action data quality issues. The Supply Chain Data Management Analyst will be embedded in the project team to deliver data quality to ensure optimization of the performance within our planning tool. You will serve as the bridge between the project/business stakeholders and our IT Team.

How will you create impact?
Lead data cleansing activities to enhance supply chain data quality in core ERP system
Identify areas for data quality improvements and help to resolve data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement
Collaborate with Supply Architecture SMEs and our Data Governance IT Enterprise Applications Team to identify and meet data requirements.
Participate in discussions with business partners to identify, understand and document functional and non-functional requirements resulting in data acquisition or integration
Reference data dictionary to address supply chain data quality issues
Use prescribed standard data definition to ensure ongoing compliance
Ensure adherence to global defined data definitions
Maintain flexibility to perform additional duties as needed

How will you fit into the team?
Deep End-to-End understanding of Integrated Supply Chain Fundamentals
Deep understanding of core business Process and experience in process reengineering
Organizational Agility (i.e., Navigating the organization)
Comfort Around Higher Management
Cross-functional Partnerships
Business Analysis
Decision-making

Position Title: Real World Data Expansion Analyst
Department: Real World Evidence
About Sanofi:
We are an innovative global healthcare company, driven by one purpose: we chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. Our team, across some 100 countries, is dedicated to transforming the practice of medicine by working to turn the impossible into the possible. We provide potentially life-changing treatment options and life-saving vaccine protection to millions of people globally, while putting sustainability and social responsibility at the center of our ambitions.
Who You Are:
You are an experienced software engineer who is interested in designing and developing comprehensive solutions to support and facilitate business operations. You have a strong understanding of back-end and front-end technologies and have experience implementing highly functional solutions that can scale. You have a passion for good user experience and know how to ensure user needs are met through agile development and stakeholder engagement. You are an excellent communicator, and can work with subject matter experts, graphic designers, support teams and managers to deliver professional grade solutions.
Our vision for digital, data analytics and AI
Sanofi has recently embarked into a vast and ambitious digital transformation program. A cornerstone of this roadmap is the acceleration of its data transformation and of the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions. This has enabled us, to accelerate R&D, improve manufacturing and commercial performance, and bring novel drugs and vaccines to patients faster, all in order to improve health and save lives.
The Digital Team at Sanofi is a unique data-driven team. We pride ourselves on being data obsessed and highly focused on using state of the art processes along with global technologies to drive impact to our solutions. We measure our insights and products based on how they preform across the globe and hold ourselves to the highest regard as our solutions can impact millions of lives. When tackling a problem, we do not just ask how we will create a solution, but how we will create a solution that reaches across the world with the best possible societal outcome.
If you are passionate about improving the health and wellness of people across the globe using Data as your means, then you should look no farther than the Digital Team here at Sanofi. Join us on our journey in enabling Sanofi’s Digital Transformation through becoming an AI first organization. This means:
AI Factory - Versatile Teams Operating in Cross Functional Pods: Utilizing digital and data resources to develop AI products, bringing data management, AI and product development skills to products, programs and projects to create an agile, fulfilling and meaningful work environment.
Leading Edge Tech Stack: Experience build products that will be deployed globally on a leading-edge tech stack.
World Class Mentorship and Training: Working with renowned, published leaders and academics in machine learning to further develop your skillsets.
Location: The Sanofi Digital Data Team uses a hybrid working model combining remote and office-based work. The Canada Digital Data Hub offices will be located in the greater downtown area of Toronto.
Key Responsibilities:
RWD Expansion Analyst will be directly accountable and responsible to:
Scope data access strategy for real world healthcare and non-healthcare data to meet Sanofi strategic objectives.
Work with Digital, Data and Business stakeholders to elicit high-level requirements and capture business and end user needs; understand the customer journey, processes, data use, analysis, and quality - and define user requirements. Proactively monitor industry, functional, and technology trends with a focus on current and emerging data opportunities through builds, license, collaboration or partnership.
Create and maintain a comprehensive view of data assets in key regions.
Assess quality and fitness of data assets for Sanofi.
Analyze new and existing processes and propose process improvements that can increase accuracy, efficiency, and/or value.
Communicate solution tradeoffs to business stakeholders to frame and influence project decisions.
Identify and analyze business needs and coordinate between stakeholder groups to address them.
Assess the risks of various solutions and prioritize competing business demands based on business impact and Digital strategy.
Leverage data and facts to identify patterns, using judgment to form conclusions that may challenge conventional wisdom, and focuses on the issues to identify high leverage intervention points and strategies.
Collaborate with the Product Owner, business, digital and data teams. Including deep connections with legal, privacy, and procurement.
Support business case creation.
Ensure that data is managed / analyzed in compliance with applicable quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirements.
Key Requirements:
Accountable, Proactive, Collaborative and Agile.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to understand business needs. Strong capacity to develop consistent, clear analysis and report potential issues.
Action orientated with ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast-moving environment.
Self-starter with excellent problem-solving ability.
Ability to multi-task, takes initiatives and prioritize effectively.
Positive team player who demonstrates collaboration and teamwork with internal and external stakeholders at all levels within the organization.
Bachelor Degree in computer sciences, engineering, business, or equivalent degrees.
A minimum of 1+ years identifying, accessing, and analyzing person-level data from industries outside of healthcare.
Knowledge of privacy and consent regulations.
Project management & support Tools: JIRA projects & service desk, Confluence, Teams.

Position Purpose

The Direct Fulfillment Supply Chain function plays a leading role in ecommerce capabilities at The Home Depot. With the outstanding growth as an organization, Home Depot is positioned to become a leader in the Home Delivery business. As such, it is a function that will be in a mode of exciting and significant change over the next few years.

Direct Fulfillment Analysts will work closely with final mile service providers to ensure fastest delivery possible of ecommerce shipments across Canada. To that end this analyst role has a strong operator component to be able to hold service providers accountable for performance and troubleshoot delivery issues. They will also use sound analytical and continuous improvement methodologies to understand metrics and help enable change. They will support implementations, transitions and conversions as our delivery network expands through DFC’s, MDO’s and drop ship vendors. They will help to drive a customer delivery experience that is top notch within Canada!

Responsibilities
Liaise regularly with core courier service providers delivering final mile shipments to customers’ homes and business
Liaise regularly with stores impacted by BOSS orders that ecomm carriers deliver to stores
Regular communication with key internal business stakeholders to generate solution ideas and provide status updates and reporting
Identify savings opportunities within the DF network
Use analytical methods to review current and future state performance and costs
Facilitate discussions with key business stakeholders to generate solution ideas and provide status updates and reporting
Develop and manage action plans associated with improvement initiatives
Collection of data to support analyses, either systemically or by observational methods
Prepare and present project details/updates when necessary
Other duties as required.
Experience / Knowledge Required:
Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+)
2-4 years of experience in Supply Chain operations
Passionate about customer delivery experience
Able to multi-task and remain calm under pressure
Experience with Distribution, Transportation or a Home Delivery related field a definite asset
Proficient in: Microsoft Office Suite including Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Word and SAP. Tableau knowledge would be a bonus
Clarifies and resolves complex business issues by breaking them down into meaningful components to determine root cause and redesigning internal and external business processes when required
Strong analytical skills with the ability to extrapolate pertinent information from various sources (reports and spreadsheets) and analyze data for recommendations
Maturity in a changing environment and ability to go above & beyond a defined role
Strong relationship builder and has the ability to communicate effectively across different levels of the organization and external stakeholders

Shogun is on a mission to empower brands to create exceptional ecommerce experiences, and in the process, build the best remote company.
Since being in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, we've seen tremendous growth while intentionally creating a culture where people from all backgrounds belong. Our company and products are informed by diverse perspectives from the best talent around the world. We are fully remote, have no offices, and are looking for team members who are excited to work remotely.
We closed our Series A and B in 2020, and after raising a $67.5M Series C in 2021, we are scaling faster than ever. Some of our investors include Insight Partners, Initialized Capital, Accel, VMG Partners, and Y Combinator. Join us to grow your career with our rapidly growing company!
Location
For this position, we are looking for candidates located in the United States and Canada.
What You'll Do
As a Principal Data Analyst here at Shogun, you understand startups are chaotic and you kind of like it. You'll navigate and reign in the chaos to take ownership of our data analytics strategy and execution. By partnering directly with business stakeholders, you will work proactively to ensure the right questions are being answered. You use data to tell a story - one that will inform and influence Shogun's strategic and investment decisions.
You will also be Shogun's "data steward", ensuring both the integrity of our data, and access to it. Through your rigorous management of our data stack (SQL, Looker, dbt, Fivetran, Snowflake, Census and Salesforce) business leaders across the organization will have the right information when they need it.
Here you'll work at the intersection of quantitative analysis, data mining and presenting data to ensure our business uses data-informed strategies to grow and improve our product offerings.
What You'll Bring
Deep experience owning and leading the analytics function in an emerging environment
8+ years of data analytics experience with an emphasis on working cross-functionally throughout an organization
A strong ability to translate data into actionable insights—you are able to explain your findings in a comprehensible way, tailoring your message for your audience.
Complete comfort working with SQL, dbt and Looker
Experience working within a Product Led Growth strategy
A Note to Future Shogies
We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting potential Shogies. If you have relevant skills that are not reflected in your resume, we welcome your candidacy and encourage you to share more in an optional cover letter, even if your experience doesn't match our exact requirements. We are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace where everyone feels like they belong. We encourage you to apply if you feel this role is a good fit for you, and we look forward to hearing from you!

Our Values
Work in the open: Operate with high integrity and choose what's right over what's easy. Be transparent as a company and with each other
People are People: Treat yourself, colleagues, and customers with dignity, empathy, and respect. Start from a presumption of positive intent
Win and grow together: Strive to be the best, individually, and as a team. Support and encourage each other. Seek opportunities for growth

We currently have Temporary Full-time (until approx August 2023) opportunities for Data Analyst-Coder in Decision Support at our Bayview campus.
Hours of Work:

Weekdays: Days; 8hrs; As per schedule

Summary of Duties
The Data Analyst is responsible for the appropriate analysis, coding and abstracting of Inpatient discharges from the patient records into the Med2020 WinRecs information system. The position also ensures that information is submitted to the Canadian Institute for Health Information (CIHI) in a timely manner, according to guidelines set by CIHI/MOHLTC and the hospital. Specific tasks include:
Assigns ICD-10-CA/CCI codes related to Acute Care Discharges (DAD)
Applies ICD10-CA/CCI coding methodologies resulting in proper grouping outcomes
Abstracting information according to standards from MOHLTC/CIHI (DAD, NACRS), and hospital abstracting guidelines
Ensures that all visits to be coded are done and balance at the end of each month Document productivity in accordance with departmental protocols
Perform regular audits on coded/abstracted data to ensure quality of coded data and adherence to coding standards
Other related duties as assigned
Qualifications/Skills
Graduate from a recognized Health Information Management/Professional program.
Current active CHIMA member in good standing and maintained on an annual basis.
Certification with the Canadian Health Information Management Associate (CHIMA).
2 year previous experience in inpatient DAD coding
An in-depth knowledge and understanding of CMG's, HIG’s, ACW's, Case Mix Index (CMI) and expected length of stay
Demonstrated coding competency in Inpatient and Emergency patient records.
Demonstrated excellent organizational and communication skills.
Ability to work independently and exercise tact and discretion
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Proficient in Windows-based applications environment and keyboard speed of 40 wpm
Demonstrated ability to function in a changing and sometimes stressful work environment
Must be willing to travel between Sunnybrook campuses as required

In recognition of the growing volume and complexity of data and regulation, Exiger is committed to creating a more sustainable risk and compliance environment through its holistic and innovative approach to problem solving. Exiger's mission to make the world a safer place to do business drives its award-winning AI technology platform, DDIQ, built to anticipate the market's most pressing needs related to evolving ESG, cyber, financial crime, third-party and supply chain risk. Exiger has won 30+ AI, RegTech and Supply Chain partner awards.
Exiger’s core values are courage, excellence, expertise, innovation, integrity, teamwork and trust.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Job Description :
About Us

Amica Senior Lifestyles is setting a new standard for senior living in Canada by combining unparalleled premium hospitality and amenities with expert care and support to deliver a personalized senior living experience. Committed to enriching the lives of seniors now and as their needs change, Amica offers Independent Living (IL), Assisted Living (AL) and Memory Care (MC) lifestyle options. Established in 1996, the company owns and operates 33 residences in British Columbia, Alberta and Ontario, with plans to continue expansion in select markets.

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Senior Director of Finance, Corporate the Senior Analyst, Management Reporting is responsible for data analysis and reporting to help drive critical business decisions throughout the department. This individual will have stellar presentation skills and business acumen, articulating suggestions to c-suite stakeholders that provide insight into key data points. This role will also support other departments within Amica to understand results and provide input for them to reach goals through analysis. The Senior Analyst will develop, manage, and coach the accounting team with a focus on managing time and prioritizing projects to meet deadlines. This role will also look at integrating new processes and tools to achieve objectives and remain current with financial and business trends.

What you will be doing

Reporting and Analysis:

Board Reporting
Owner of the monthly and quarterly board reporting, including analysis and commentary
Preparation of reconciliations between board results and financial statements
Provide and implement innovative ideas to reduce time to close and improve efficiency while ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data is maintained

G&A Analysis
Lead the monthly G&A analysis, including working with department heads to understand results
Implement enhanced analytics over G&A, including new processes and tools
Lead the annual G&A budget and forecast process

Debt Compliance
Preparation of quarterly debt covenant calculations with supporting back-up

What you will bring
Canadian Accounting designation
Minimum four years in a Finance/Accounting role
Advanced Excel skills with a demonstrated ability to work with large datasets
Excellent interpersonal skills including written, verbal and presentation
Strong attention to detail & an ability to interpret results to support business growth
Demonstrated team leadership experience, including the ability to motivate and coach
An ability to build strong working relationships across the organization
Proven ability to succeed in a high-volume environment
Nice to Have:
Experience using Yardi
Experience using Onestream or Hyperion
Experience in similar industry

What you can expect from us
A diverse environment where individual differences are celebrated, and you’re encouraged to be your best self
Collaborative environment where we work together to succeed as a team
Learning opportunities to help you grow and support for professional development and designations
Comprehensive benefit package including RRSP matching
Office is centrally located in the financial district, on the PATH and the TTC subway line, and provides easy access to downtown amenities
Participation in Flex/Hybrid Model work allowing Team Members to work some days from home and some days in the office each week

At Amica Senior Lifestyles we are passionate about working together in a supportive and inclusive environment that fosters innovation and turns ideas into action. We remain committed to creating workplaces that reflect the communities in which we operate. We are actively seeking applicants from all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, Black, Indigenous, racialized people, and persons with disabilities and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for our positions.

Amica Senior Lifestyles recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, team members and visitors from COVID-19. Effective October 2021, a condition of employment is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

Reporting to the Director, Customer Success, the Customer Success Analyst will be responsible for managing customer inquiries, retention, and reporting, facilitating customer pulse checks and satisfaction ratings for the Customer Success pool in additional to supporting CSM portfolio management.
Prophix is currently offering employees a choice of work arrangement: work from our office, remote, or hybrid. We have invested in best-in-class tools, technology, and culture to ensure our team members are able to do their best work.
What You Will Do at Prophix
The successful candidate will communicate effectively and partner with Management, Sales, Marketing, Finance to drive process improvements, build and develop customer relationships, identify and address process gaps, and improve customer satisfaction with improved service delivery to pool customers through effective processes.
Contribute as a key touchpoint for customer escalations and inquiries, review and action customer requests.
Report and Analyze customer feedback through NPS, Web based surveys, telephone/in-person interviews, pulse checks etc. and present a comprehensive view of the customer experience.
Propose and implement solutions to retain clients outside of CSM portfolios.
Create and maintain dashboards for CSM team meetings and reporting provided to various stakeholders.
Work cross-functionally to help Product Adoption and Support teams meet objectives across the Customer Success team.
Monitor communication with customers – effectively triage and direct to appropriate process owners.
Manage client escalations from the CS team pool or sales team and direct it to the respective process owners.
Administer & create tech touch programs for portfolio and pooled customers, report on success of the program.
Identify and drive process improvement efforts aimed at increasing customer satisfaction.
Perform other related duties as required by the team.
What You Will Bring to Prophix
To shine in this role, you will bring a rare combination of experience, technology skills, personal qualities, and education.
Required Qualifications
Post-secondary education in Marketing, Computing, Business or Finance/Accounting.
Strong analytical skills and ability to analyze data sets to drive customer insights and address process gaps.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Confidence and ability to interface professionally across of levels of the organization.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple clients and/or projects concurrently.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Must be legally entitled to work in the country where the role is located. Must be able to travel to the United States, Canada and/or internationally, and have a valid passport.
Preferred Qualifications
Academic or practical knowledge of Accounting and/or Financial concepts (i.e. planning, budgeting, forecasting, or consolidation) is preferred.
NOTES
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background (work and education) verification with an external vendor.
We thank all those who apply, however, please be advised that only those candidates selected to move forward will be contacted.
DISCLAIMER
We have received several more reports of individuals impersonating Prophix employees with the intent to collect personal information through the recruitment process. We continue to take action against these fraudulent recruiters.
As a reminder, we will never ask for payment during your Prophix application process, and any email correspondence will come from a prophix.com address. Open roles will always be listed on our website: prophix.com/careers.
If you suspect any fraudulent activity, please let us know at careers@prophix.com.
ACCESSIBILITY & DIVERSITY

Job Description
About SS&C Technologies:
SS&C Technologies Holdings, Inc. is a global provider of financial services software and software-enabled services. Founded in 1986, SS&C has built the most comprehensive powerhouse of software technology in the financial services industry – technology that complements our unrivalled expertise and professionalism in fund administration, insurance and pension funds, and asset and wealth management accounting and operations. Named by Forbes as one of America’s best midsize employers, SS&C has more than 20,000 employees and 15,000 clients worldwide, and is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut, with offices throughout North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Africa, and Australia.
Position Overview:
Job Description – Senior Application Analyst
Role Overview:
The primary responsibility of this role is to work with the Product Owner to understand business requirements and work closely with the Scrum Team to ensure the requirements are clearly understood. This individual should have experience with requirements management, software development methodology and should have worked extensively with business users, programmers, and Quality Assurance. The associate must be self-motivated with strong analytical skills, excellent oral and written communication skills.
Primary Responsibilities
Work with Product Owner to understand high-level requirements and capture business needs.
Develop user stories and acceptance criteria in collaboration with Product Owner
Clearly articulate and document business requirements.
Work with the Scrum Team to build out the detailed user stories and acceptance criteria
Ensure user stories have enough clarity from the "what" point of view.
Ensure enough prioritized backlog is available for the team before the sprint starts.
Participates in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions.
Obtain key inputs from Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), Enterprise Architecture teams and identify solution interdependencies.
Engage with UX team to incorporate usability and user interface needs when designing systems
Give presentations/demonstrations of new product functionality to stakeholders and clients.
Coach Junior Application Analysts.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of work-related experience, or Master’s degree and 2 years of work-related experience, or 8 years equivalent work-related experience
Working in an agile environment
Sound knowledge of U. S. Retirement Industry and/or Mutual Fund Industry.
A passion for continuous learning as well as the ability to learn quickly and apply new skills.
Flexibility/Ability to be proactive possesses good problem-solving skills and the capability to find
solutions, and the ability to successfully meet deadlines
Essential
Domain Knowledge
Sound knowledge of U. S. Retirement Industry and/or Mutual Fund Industry.
Good knowledge of financial terms.
Skills & Experience
8 to 10 years of experience in software development
8+ years of experience as an application analyst
Experience in accurately gathering, translating, and documenting user requirements/designs to serve as functional specifications from which technical solutions can be developed.
Experience in creating business requirements, use cases, workflows, and documentation.
Strong analytical skills, interpersonal skills, able to manage multiple priorities, and have the ability to learn new concepts quickly.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work with internal technical teams as well as external clients.
Experience in developing prototypes
Experience with SQL
Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel
Prior work experience with Agile project methodology and knowledge of developing user stories
Desired
Experience with Mainframe or Java technologies
Understanding of XML, MS SQL, HTML
ADA compliance experience
Experience with data mapping and workflow diagrams
Familiarity with JIRA
Experience in working with multiple scrum teams as an analyst
Domain certifications in US Retirement/Mutual Financial Industry

Working at SS&C is balanced and fair – especially in challenging times. We offer flexible work schedules, time off, and so much more to keep you healthy, safe, and productive. SS&C offers:

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Enterprise Data Warehouse, the incumbent is responsible for the development, testing and maintenance of the core Business Intelligence components of the bank's Enterprise Data Warehouse, including but not limited to; ad-hoc reports, data extracts, and analytic cubes. The current core BI components are based in IBM technology, and include IBM Cognos, IBM Data Manager and IBM Campaign Manager, but additional technologies may be incorporated in the future, including, but not limited to; MicroStrategy or other OLAP solutions.

The Inventory analyst will perform Inventory Management analysis activities and be responsible for ensuring that optimized quantities of necessary items are held in inventory and replenished as needed to meet supply-chain targets and contractual service levels/agreements and accurate financial reporting through Fishbowl methodologies. This role will analyze business plans and utilize modeling techniques to set inventory targets and control levels, develop short and long-term supply plans and determine the impact of inventory control issues on service levels. The Inventory Analyst will also assess risks, identify trends and opportunities and make recommendations to develop inventory related contingency plans. The Inventory Analyst is responsible for the initiation and maintenance of inventory related physical location and system controls, standards and policies and procedures.
Accountable for perpetual inventory and physical counts; responsible for accurate monitoring of inventory of products. Works closely with various departments to ensure items are in stock. Makes efforts to reduce warehousing costs by implementing control procedures and maintaining policies and procedures to manage the flow of supplies. Identifies out of balance items and determines causes for discrepancies. Works independently to develop strategies and makes professional judgments based on industry standards and best practices.
PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
Coordinate and manage inventory of raw materials and finished products between departments and external suppliers and customers according to department and production schedules based on priority.
Ensure the completion of all inventory transactions in Fishbowl. Generate reports, reconcile results and make system adjustments.
Generate cycle count and able to resolve Inventory discrepancy.
Establish and maintain ABC inventory controls for raw material and finished product.
Create BOM on daily basis for finished product in FISHBOWL ERP system.
Record all incoming and in process materials and coordinate its disposition to appropriate departments in accordance with the company SOP.
Analyze results to determine root causes, gather statistics and recommend solutions. Manage and control strategic min/max initiatives.
Analyze product backorders and substitutions to identify problem products or categories and determine trends. Identify and document data for analysis to find efficiencies and to recommend improvements in a timely manner thereby avoiding increased costs and reduction in profitability.
Create and manage KPI metrics and reports based on inventory levels, valuation, activity, turns, obsolescence, purchase price variance, etc. Analyze the reports and make recommendations.
Coordinate month end system closing and reporting activities
Assist the Buyer/Planners and Procurement Manager with special projects and other duties as required.
Participate in meetings with functional departments to assess business unit requirements and review and evaluate current practices, identifying opportunities for improvement and coordinating appropriate actions.
SKILLS
· Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
· Excellent customer service skills and the ability to collaborate with all levels both inside and outside the organization
· Strong computer skills in MS Office
· Strong attention to detail with the ability to multi-task and handle fluctuating workloads
· Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills
· Excellent continuous improvement skills
· Proven ability to adhere to standards & procedures and maintain confidentiality
· Must have the ability to work independently, productively and effectively with initiative and drive under tight timelines while maintaining attention to detail and quality.
· Must be driven to improve processes and take initiative

About Apotex Inc.
Apotex Inc. is a proudly Canadian, global pharmaceutical company that produces high-quality, affordable medicines for patients around the world. Apotex employs almost 8,000 people worldwide in manufacturing, R&D, and commercial operations. Apotex Inc. exports to more than 100 countries and territories and operates in more than 45 countries, with a significant presence in Canada, the US, Mexico, and India. Through vertical integration, Apotex is comprised of multiple divisions and affiliates including Apotex Inc., focused on generics; Apobiologix, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on biosimilar development; Aveva, an affiliate of Apotex Inc. fully integrated global developer and manufacturer of complete transdermal solutions; Apotex Consumer Products, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on brand name products; and Global Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (GAPI), a division of Apotex Inc. focused on the manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for Apotex and third parties. For more information visit: www.apotex.com.
Job Summary
To work within the Traffic group to provide data analysis for transportation performance metrics, data creation and maintenance for transportation, and updating/developing flow charts for existing and newly created processes and projects relative to Transportation. In addition, the Co-op student will help gate keep pertinent information coming from Transportation Vendors, Operations, Launch, Finance and Commercial teams on a regular basis.
Job Responsibilities
Support the supplier relation management program (SRM) integrating with our Transprotation Vendors, Indirect procurement, Traffic, GSC Operations, IS and all other related partners to ensure the successful implementation of the SRM program.
Create flow charts and governance documents for processes and Traffic training plans.
Provide support to the monthly data creation and maintenance for the Traffic group.
Maintenance of information coming in from Transportation vendors and integrate with Operations, Launch, Finance and commercial time on a regular basis.
Gather, organize and analyze information pertinent to operations and supply chain and present summary information and recommendations in project reports.
Assist the Traffic group in evaluating data using spreadsheets and databases, and performing quantitative/qualitative analysis.
Liaison with internal customers, support groups and leadership to gather required information and provide pertinent analysis.
Works in a safe manner collaborating as a team member to achieve all outcomes.
Demonstrate Behaviours that exhibit our organizational Values: Collaboration, Courage, Perseverance, and Passion.
All other relevant duties as assigned.
Job Requirements
Education
Study Focus on Transportation Logistics Supply Chain or Operations Management
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Demonstrated Pharmaceutical interest is an asset.
Strong oral and written communication skills; must be able to communicate appropriately with other employees in different positions within the company (i.e. Technicians, Managers, Coordinators etc.).
Strong organizational skills.
Attention to detail.
Working knowledge of Word, Excel and Power Point are essential. SAP and MS Access would also be beneficial.
Experience
Intermediate to senior level student/ 2nd, 3rd or 4th year.

Apotex offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

We are seeking a Junior IT Business Systems Analyst to assist the implementation of a number of shop floor systems on a new pharmaceutical facility. The project includes the implementation and validation of Manufacturing Execution System (MES) and Data Historian System (DHS) with interfaces to a plant wide control systems and small equipment.
The resource who will work under the supervision of the MES project lead, support the implementation and validation of the MES and DHS systems within a dedicated infrastructure.
Deliverables (not limited to the following):
All documentation deliverables consistent with Corporate methodology and generally accepted industrial standards.
Meet with the project leads at least weekly to review deliverables, confirm expectations, and address issues / concerns.
Ensure changes are approved and documented as per project change control, and shall execute all tasks based on the project plan / validation plan
Ensure that the solution being provided follows standard pharmaceutical industry practices (e.g. GxP)
Report incidences having potential impact to security, IT services, health / safety, and GxP.
Adhere to code of ethics and other Corporate policy related to transparency and good corporate citizenship.
(Must Have) Skills, Experience, and Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in an IT or automation environment
Bachelor degree in Computer Engineer or Computer Science
Strong IT SDLC experience
Strong knowledge and experience in IT infrastructure (e.g. servers and network), databases, PL/SQL
Good technical writing skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work in a challenging and fast paced environment
Experience working with wide range of stakeholders (customers, end users, sponsor, vendor, project team, extended team, etc) to develop relationships, identify and define requirements/gaps, and educate users.
Demonstrated ability to deal with and report to different stakeholders, build relationship, host project meetings, deal with tension, deliver projects on time and on budget (must provide reference contacts to verify)
Good understanding of the IT Software Development Life Cycle (SLDC) and Project Management Methodologies
Strong understanding of risk analysis
Excellent analytical, prioritization, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
Strong team player, transparent, open, honest, confident (must provide reference contacts to verify)
Ability to adapt to changes and various paces within a project
Working experience with all the MS Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, Project, etc.)
(Nice to Have) Skills, Experience, and Qualifications:
Prior experience in Werum PAS-X or another MES system
Prior experience with SAP and interfacing with other systems
Experience using electronic document management systems (such as Documentum or SharePoint)
Note: This position requires to work onsite 90%. Therefore, applicant from Greater Toronto Area only.

Monday to Friday

technical documentation: 2 years (required)

Overview:
At KPMG, you’ll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.

Our Governance, Risk and Compliance Services (GRCS) team is growing and we are looking for a Senior Consultant – Data Analyst to join our team in Toronto.

Learn more about Risk Consulting here
Learn more about our Toronto office here
What you will do:
As a Senior Consultant, you’ll be learning from some of the best in the industry and growing your personal skillset by:
Work closely with clients and partners in understanding key business issues on digital opportunities
Gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutions
Utilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems to identify areas of risk, opportunities and recommend solutions for our clients. Leverage a diverse set of technologies and tools to deliver insights
Work in multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams to develop a strong experience in analytics, statistics, machine learning, data mining, data management, data governance, reporting, visualization and/or intelligent automation
Work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with both virtual and face-to-face interactions; utilize structured approaches to solving problems, managing risks, and documenting assumptions; communicate results and educate others through insightful visualizations, reports, and presentations
Work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured)
Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to data activities for stakeholder discussions
Bridge the gap between technical platform needs and business issues
Effectively communicate orally and written with peers within GRCS, KPMG and the client
What you bring to this role:
You have strong work experience and academic record and excel in an entrepreneurial environment. You’re highly motivated and passionate professional who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration, and has the ability to achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines.
Strong experience of 3-5 years, working with different kinds of messy, real-world data from a variety of databases
You’re a highly motivated and passionate professional who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration, and can achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines
Independent ability to review the data quality and data definitions and perform data cleansing and data management tasks
Strong knowledge and/or experience in the following: SQL, BI tools (like Tableau and PowerBI), Python, R, ETL, Alteryx and RPA tools (like Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere and UIPath)
Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team to tackle ambiguous data processing problems across a diverse range of industries
Experience in data governance, data quality, data processing, and data controls
Client-facing or consulting experience
Experience communicating insights or ideas through presentations and meetings
Certificate or degree in Computing or IT, with a focus on Business Systems Analysis, Business Intelligence, Data Analysis and Reporting, or similar, is an asset
Ability to explain data and analytics concepts to non-technical team members.
Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems.
Ability to understand and explain business value of data and analytics concepts
Strong relationship-building skills to interact with clients, colleagues, and the wider community.
Ability to provide crucial consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline drive environment with ambiguity.
Effectively work as part of a project team, and communicate findings of analysis, key implications, and recommendations in written and verbal formats.
Nice to have: Experience in data governance with tools such as Collibra and Informatica
Keys to your success:

KPMG individuals Deliver Impact | Seek Growth | Inspire Trust and understand that a diverse workforce enables us to deepen relationships and strengthen our business.

Providing you with the support you need to be at your best

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

Overview:
Imperial Dade Canada, leading national distributor, has a job open in Canada. The Inventory Performance Analyst needs to be an analytically skilled individual with strong attention to detail. The positions main responsibilities is in inventory analysis which includes managing inventory items, monitoring day-to-day inventory operations, and implementing inventory control protocols. Inventory analyst should be an individual who possess deep commercial awareness and should be able to interpret and implement data on consumer trends.

Imperial Dade is the leading distributor of foodservice packaging, facilities maintenance supplies and equipment in the U.S and Canada. As a provider of customized supply chain solutions, the company serves customers in many business-to-business market segments including supermarkets, healthcare facilities, universities, and restaurants. Founded in 1935 and headquartered in New Jersey, Imperial Dade serves more than 80,000 customers through a footprint of 80+ branches.
Responsibilities:
Maintaining and improving the company's inventory situation by analyzing inventory statistics to determine which products are selling and which are not
Recommend forecast and allocate inventory to the correct accounts
Performing extensive research on a wide range of inventory-related reports, from previous inventory reports to national purchasing trends
Directing buyers on demand trend in support of Program Management Team
Liaise with the warehouse to perform regular inventory counts.
Drafting inventory reports that document inventory counts, discrepancies, and other statistical data
Reporting inventory statistics to management and suggesting improvements to inventory control
Coordinating with key stakeholders to resolve discrepancies between inventory and revenue
Creating and maintaining inventory databases and systems for accurately managing inventory
Engage with Inventory Management to minimize excess inventory and maintain optimal inventory levels
Communicates effectively with both key internal and external stakeholders
Performs other related duties and responsibilities as required or assigned
Qualifications:
5 years of supply chain, inventory management or operations experience with a focus on improving processes and reducing working capital
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Must be flexible and deadline driven
Team player who will work effectively at all levels of the organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus
Strong analysis and decision making abilities
A broad enterprise-view of the business and varying degrees of appreciation for strategy, processes and capabilities, enabling technologies and governance
Experienced in MS Office Suite, Excel, Microsoft Access
At Imperial Dade, we offer an exciting environment in which to work, learn, and grow professionally. We are excited to continue to invite talented individuals with a passion for excellence to join our team. As a family-owned and operated company, we value our people and strive to create rewarding career opportunities by offering competitive salaries and benefits, Pension, Life Insurance, and a generous Paid Time Off Package.
Imperial Dade is an EEO Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, status as a parent, national origin, age, disability (physical or mental), family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, or other non-merit based factors.

The Data Quality Analyst will work alongside the data warehouse and engineering team to provide data related integration, support, data investigation, research, data management and data reporting. The Data Quality Analyst role will troubleshoot and investigate data anomalies and issues along with working directly with the data engineers to follow through and get the issues fixed. Why should you consider joining Auvik?
You want to work at a company that is building impactful, relevant technology. Auvik's network management software helps IT teams by automating time-consuming tasks, streamlining operations, and mitigating risk. It's more important than ever to be able to remotely monitor and manage network infrastructure, and with Auvik, IT professionals have that essential visibility and control.
You want to work with a leadership team who are transparent and trustworthy. Our senior leaders have a vision for Auvik. They are experienced, knowledgeable, approachable, and consistently working hard to drive success, both for the company and the team of people who make it happen.
You want to work with a product customers love. People rave about what we've built—our latest NPS was 57 (phenomenal!). Our customers are smart, aspirational, and highly technical. It pays to get the details right.
You want regular opportunities for learning and growth. With ongoing feedback from leadership, you'll find that Auvik encourages you to be your very best. Our onboarding process is thorough and informative because we want to make sure you're prepared to have a great work experience. We also have programs designed to help you take the next steps you want for your career.
You want the flexibility to manage your work, your way. We're a fully distributed team and we're prepared to continue to support working from home (or the space you choose!). When we're able, we'll have Auvik hubs in Waterloo and Barcelona for you to leverage if needed. We trust you to get the job done where you feel most comfortable and effective.
What's this role about?

We are looking for a talented and self-motivated Business Systems Analyst to assess and optimize our go-to-market business and systems operations. For this position, you will examine the existing systems for improvement, report common issues, evaluate go-to-market performance, and recommend new systems and procedures to support the goals of the Revenue Organization.
To excel in this position, you should be an experienced professional with in-depth knowledge of business processes and business system analysis techniques. The ideal candidate will have extensive knowledge in SaaS go-to-market organizations.
What will I be doing?
Manage cross-functional requirement gathering, user acceptance testing, and support implementation of new systems for the Revenue Organization
Work with internal system owners and Operations Leads to optimize usage and performance of existing GTM systems and processes
Collect requirements using a variety of techniques such as interviews, data analysis, workflow analysis, and more
Work with Revenue leaders to elicit and review business requirements and translate into functional requirements
Work with data and reporting teams to implement proactive systems monitoring
Support Operations Leads in improving and documenting GTM process and procedures
Support Operations Leads in tool administration
Research and estimate the ROI of new systems and processes
Perform other duties as assigned to support projects and department needs
Identify and document solutions for business software system issues
What are we looking for?
Ability to work with key stakeholders to understand core business objectives and propose solutions
Proven Research and Analytical skills
Proven blend of business acumen and technical savvy
Strong knowledge and experience in integrating enterprise systems using tools like Salesforce, LeanData, Salesloft, Marketo, etc
A self-starter who can take charge of tasks with minimal direction
Can multitask like a boss with the ability to manage several projects simultaneously while delivering high quality work to adapt to rapid changes in scope and agenda
Exposure to requirements gathering and solution design, implementation, testing, documentation and training
Bonus points:
Experience with Ecommerce platforms like Stripe or Shopify
Experience with Looker
About Auvik
Auvik makes network management easier. Our software provides the visibility and automation IT professionals need to focus on the work that delivers the greatest value to their organization. Today, Auvik helps IT teams manage more than four million devices on over 50,000 networks worldwide.
Auvik is one of the fastest growing North American technology companies, and is winner of the Deloitte Technology Fast 50, Deloitte Fast 500, and was recognized as the #1 ranked Canadian company in the FT Americas' Fastest Growing Companies list.
We're focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you're excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. We are happy to make any accommodations you may need throughout the interview process as well. Don't have a working webcam? We will help you find a space you can conduct your interview from Have kids or pets in the background? Don't worry about it. Just let us know what you need when we reach out to schedule and we will make it work!
Auvik is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law.

The professional we seek is a qualified Business Analyst and is a self-starter who works effectively with minimal supervision in a highly dynamic environment.

Excel at customer service and communication skills. Must be comfortable interacting with clients and internal staff.
Proactive, highly motivated, with the ability to work well independently and within a multi-cultural team environment
