Job Posting #907665
Position: Senior Business Analyst
Site: Hydro Building, 700 University Avenue
Department: Research Financial Services
Reports to: Manager
Status: Permanent Full-Time
University Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Senior Business Analyst in our Research Financial Services Department.
The Energy of the City. The Rewards of a Great Career.
The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto Rehabilitation Institute and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of ground-breaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 20,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.
As a Senior Business Analyst in the Research Financial Services department, some major responsibilities will include but not be limited to: supervising and leading the team to achieve departmental goals and objectives; working closely with individual researchers, research support staff, granting agencies and external organizations to account for and facilitate the administration of research grants; preparing monthly/quarterly/annual financial statements to granting agencies and other organizations in a timely manner; assisting manager to review current procedures and processes and to implement improvements; preparing necessary financial analysis to support decision making at various levels of management; performing cross-functional duties and other duties consistent with the job classification, as required.
Responsibilities:
Motivates team members to ensure all day-to-day activities run smoothly & accurately
Assists manager to implement measures for the team to achieve department’s goals & objectives
Meets with researchers and/or research support staff; contributes financial expertise to assist researchers’ decision making
Leads presentation/education session to keep researchers and /or research support staff informed of policies and procedures
Prepares significant volume of financial statements timely
Investigates and identifies significant variances & potential risks and proposes solutions to researchers
Identifies issues in current procedures and processes to manager and implements target condition in a timely manner, as approved by manager
Qualifications and Experiences:
University degree in Accounting, Business Administration or equivalent
Experience in an accounting or auditing environment with exposure to a range of accounting principles, practices and procedures required.
Experience with information technology control processes and systems required.
Experience with activity, workflow and organizational analysis for business/process re-engineering or efficiency improvements required.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent customer services skills.
Excellent organizational, time management and interpersonal skills.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
Ability to work accurately under stressful conditions and to meet tight deadlines.
Computer literacy with working knowledge of Access and Excellent knowledge of Excel required, with an aptitude for learning new computer applications quickly.
Adheres to confidentiality policy for sensitive financial data and information.
Experience in a healthcare environment preferred.
Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
If you are interested in making your contribution at UHN, please apply on-line. You will be asked to copy and paste as well as attach your resume and covering letter. You will also be required to complete some initial screening questions.
Posting Date: October 6, 2022 Closing Date: Until Filled
For current UHN employees, only those who have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, and possess all the required experience and qualifications should apply.
UHN thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. column7:

Our client, a Top 5 Bank is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join their team to support on a large regulatory initiative for the CFTC rules re-write.
As part of the Product Intake Team in Regulatory Reporting Services (RRS), this analyst will be expected to conduct effective impact assessments of triage items which may result in the creation of user stories and bug fixes that will be added to the RRS backlog or communicating to our partners your root cause analysis and recommendations for remediation.

Strong analytical problem solving and excellent communication skills.

This is a contract position for a Systems Analyst Senior for our client who is in the Broader Public Sector.

Good Compensation working on projects that will make a difference to the people of Ontario.

Responsibilities

Provide Data Science services including Data Cleansing and Data Analytics

If interested and qualified for this role, please apply today for immediate consideration!!!

column2: Senior Business Analyst, Identity & Access Management - (Vir...
column7:
250 Yonge Street Toronto Ontario,M5B 2L7
A centralized Enterprise Provisioning Utility (EPU) has been established with TORIC (Technology & Operations Risk Internal Controls) with the aim to consolidate, streamline and simplify user access and provisioning practices in the bank as well as ensure alignment with Identity Access Management (IAM) policy guidelines. To achieve the objectives of the centralized EPU, the User Provisioning Consolidation (UPC) project is currently underway which will consolidate the end-to end-provisioning function.
Our team of Business Analysts are responsible for reaching out to stakeholders in the bank and engaging them in conversations to transition the end to end provisioning functions of all applications with in the BMO Financial Group under Enterprise Provisioning Utility (EPU).
The Business Analysts, who make up the Business Integration Team, will lead the kick off meetings, review intake form(s) to identify FTE, understand and develop high-level requirements, organize demo session(s) with focal point(s) and verify the information provided to them. The team is responsible for creating the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) documents in MS Word, process details and maps in MS Excel and Visio and obtain concurrence / feedback from UPC subject matter experts and provisioning managers
The Key priorities for this role:
Work with business stakeholders to transition user access and provisioning activities into the centralized unit
Participate in kick off meetings, review/complete Intake form(s) to identify FTE, understand and develop high-level requirements, organize demo session(s) with focal point(s) and verify timing with the information provided with the Intake and FTE calculation
Create/ Amend Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) documents in MS Word, process details and maps in MS Excel and Visio and obtain concurrence / feedback from TORIC subject matter experts
Create an RACI (Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed) document . This is a document that explains who will be responsible for each/every part of provisioning.
Communicate overall progress of the initiative to Business Integration Manager, and/or the Director or/and other teams at regular intervals and Track and monitor the activities at all times
For any application that is guided by Policy; identify policy, work collaboratively with Policy Owner, discuss the OCM (Operations Change Management) and the rest of TORIC participants to determine impacts to Provisioning process

Identifies opportunities to strengthen business analysis capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks across BMO.

Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.

We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

What you will do:

As a Lead Data Analyst in Citi’s Compliance Trade Surveillance group, you will be responsible for end-to-end delivery of data projects by partnering with our business analyst and development teams to meet Independent Client Risk Management (ICRM) requirements. This role is heavily client-facing and requires a deep understanding of technology processes, financial products, and the business application of trade surveillance monitoring to identify market manipulation.
Key Responsibilities
Lead a team of technical PMs and data analysts to deliver our data book of work
Work directly with Independent Client Risk Management (ICRM) to understand data requirements and deliver to their specifications
Work with front, middle, and back office upstream technology systems to source, migrate, onboard, and resolve issues with data
Act as SME for each project by proactively learning the business application of the data requirements
Leverage JIRA and Microsoft Project to track statuses, timelines, and manage tasks for allocated resources
Act as a risk manager in all aspects - escalating any issues or roadblocks that may impact project delivery or the firm
Analyze technology processes and translate them to documented process flows and procedures
Perform data analysis on large datasets spanning all asset classes and regions, drawing conclusions, and summarizing for project and management reporting
Create presentations to reflect project status and data findings for senior management and ICRM clients
Interview candidates with a focus on resource potential and building a diverse team
Skillset Requirements
7+ years’ experience in data analysis (data migrations, acquisitions, decommissioning, gap analysis, mapping documentation, data quality validations, etc...)
5+ years experience using JIRA, Confluence
5+ years experience with SQL, working knowledge of Python
Solid foundation of financial products and the trading lifecycle
Project management (waterfall and agile) and organizational skills with a capability to handle multiple projects at one time.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and experience liaising between clients and technology teams – summarizing information as appropriate for the intended audience
Expert in Excel, proficient in other MS Office applications (PowerPoint, word, project, visio)
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s or equivalent experience. Discipline in Finance, MIS, or CS a plus

Who Are We?
Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That’s Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers – and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.
Job Category
Data Analytics
Target Openings
1
What Is the Opportunity?
Accountable for developing data analytics that supports growth and profitability in a region, or part of a region. These positions support the formulation and implementation of provincial, regional and countrywide strategies through analysis and focus on competitor behaviors, marketplace dynamics, pricing segmentation, and line and segment level analysis. These roles requires detailed analysis of product, pricing, and growth at a provincial, regional and countrywide level. This role will support a specific underwriting line of business.
What Will You Do?
Primary Accountabilities:Develop and implement regular pricing, filing and product strategies through:Monitoring competitor and industry trends – analyzing and articulating key areas of competitive price differences (territory, class plan) between Travelers and competitors.Analyzing profitability position, factoring in: production trends, loss experience, competitive position, underwriting/marketing programs, claim information, etc.Leveraging actuarial concepts combined with market knowledge to advise on rate filings and packages for the Provincial Regulator.Negotiating rate changes with key stakeholders and formulating requirements packages to document the rate changes so IT can build and test accordingly.Working closely with the regional sales team, building market intelligence, and educating on product and rate changes. Develop post-monitoring reports to track results of strategies through:Identifying out-of-pattern trends and communicating to management in a timely manner.Proactively identifying trends and root cause – demonstrating a strong understanding for how trends impact financial results.Presenting monthly financial results to sales teams, and senior management as required. Secondary Accountabilities:Developing and presenting business cases for future investments in product and pricing.Supporting annual planning/forecasting.Brainstorming, researching, testing and implementing new product opportunities.Recommending improvements to pricing process, procedures and workflow.
Perform other duties as assigned.
What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have?
Bachelors degree in business management, mathematics, management information, finance, actuarial science, economics or other related field.
Minimum of 3 years of business experience, insurance experience is preferred
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Access.
General knowledge of insurance products.
Knowledge of Pricing and Actuarial techniques.
Technical Knowledge/Critical Thinking:
Able to extract and analyze competitive data.
Team Orientation:
Ability to interact with the field sales team, work with DOI and brokers to gather competitive intelligence.
Planning and Project Management:
Strong organization and time management skills.
Communication Skills:
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Knowledge:
Understands basic actuarial concepts such as loss development and trending.
Understanding of basic ratemaking and its application, such as profitability, risk loads, etc.
Solid understanding of techniques and models used to forecast insurance financials.
Understands and is able to access available sources of Travelers and Industry trend information.
Solid understanding of and good working relationship with claim, business centers, call centers, and information technology. Understands the workflow and terminology of these areas and their impact on the business.
Solid knowledge of Excel, Access, and Word.
What is a Must Have?
Bachelors degree.
Minimum of 3 years of business experience, insurance experience is preferred
General Knowledge of Microsoft office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
What Is in It for You?
Health Insurance: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
Retirement: Travelers provides a core contribution of 3% of your total eligible earnings to your Deferred Profit Sharing Plan (“DPSP”). Travelers also matches your savings plan contribution dollar-for-dollar up to 5% of base pay.
Paid Time Off: Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off (“PTO”) annually, plus the opportunity to purchase additional days to allow for up to a total of 36 PTO days per year. You will also receive twelve paid company Holidays.
Wellness Program: The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals. In addition, our Life Balance program provides access to professional counseling services and other resources to support your daily life needs. Through Life Balance, you’re eligible for free counseling sessions with a licensed therapist.
Volunteer Encouragement: We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing accommodation to persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation during the recruitment or interview process we will work with you to accommodate your needs.
If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an
email
so we may assist you.

high-performance, people-focused culture
our commitment that equity, diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our work environment and business success, which helps employees feel valued and empowered to be their authentic selves
learning and development initiatives, including workshops, Speaker Series events and access to LinkedIn Learning, that support employees’ career growth

Job Summary:
As a member of the Business Solutions Group supporting the Investment Operations (Treasury and Securities Operations, Securities Lending and Collateral Management, Real Estate, Private Equity and Infrastructure), the Business Systems Consultant (Business Intelligence Consultant) demonstrates a passionate and proactive approach to problem solving. The Business Systems Consultant (Business Intelligence Consultant) is responsible for in-depth business process/reporting analysis, re-design, and translation of business-related requirements into functional specification resulting in configuration and development of effective solutions.
The Business Systems Consultant (Business Intelligence Consultant) is expected to have extensive knowledge of a broad range of financial investment products and associated operational workflows and should display initiative, creativity, out-of-the-box thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving. Driving the solution requires independent research and exploration of new technologies to adjust to revolving guidelines.
As the expert in Business Intelligence Reporting, Robotic Process Automation and other Business Self Service Model systems and applications, collaborate with teams across the organization (Finance, Investment Management and IT division). Provide timely and highly actionable reporting and insights, ensure business solution integration and alignment of process, system and information. Ensure adherence to industry best practice standards to create high quality and consistent deliverables across Investment Operations. This mandate will also include analysis and resolution of production issues and user support.
What you will do:
Lead Business Intelligence application solutions delivery: Research, design, build, support and enhance BI reporting and dashboard solutions to support core business processes with key business performance metrics and actionable insights.
Create data visualization and dashboards that present data in easy to understand formats that can be customized based on user preferences/data requirements.
Extract and consolidate data from multiple sources to conduct complex analysis and design robust reporting solutions.
Apply business process knowledge and data analytics to design and develop solutions that collect, transform, analyze and report internal and external data that drives business decisions and objectives (i.e., Investment decisions and/or opportunities).
Lead in process re-design and reengineering for the Investment Operations (Treasury and Securities Operations, Securities Lending and Collateral Management, Real Estate, Private Equity and Infrastructure). Ensure controls are considered and embedded in the processes, as well as ensuring process documentation is created and updated on an on-going basis.
Work closely with stakeholders in Investment Operations in order to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support robotic automation solutions to optimize and automate business processes to satisfy their process automation and optimization needs.
Collaborate with IT and Business Systems teams to increase automation as well as link other data sources to create more efficient and effective reporting.
As a subject matter expert, facilitate and advocate adoption of end user reporting (Tableau, Qlik), RPA, (UiPath and ABBYY) and reconciliation (IntelliMatch) throughout Finance.
Mentor and provide knowledge training to support BI architecture walkthrough, report design best practices, coding standards, and adherence to the system development life cycle best practices.
Work individually to research new technologies, alternative BI platforms, industry best practices for Robotic Process Automation and AI/ML. Propose innovation and make recommendations on application of new technologies.
Effectively communicates and builds rapport with team members, stakeholders and third-party vendors to gain maximum cooperation and buy in. Identify risks/issues, develop/recommend mitigation strategies and escalates them to the Management team or stakeholders.
What you bring:
Undergraduate degree with mix of technical and business discipline (i.e., Finance, Computer Science)
Professional designations – CFA, CMA, CA, CGA would be an asset
7+ Years of Investment Operations experience (Marketable Securities, Derivatives, Securities Lending, Collateral Management, Real Estate and Private Equity) directly related to work experience in Business Intelligence development and deployment
Proficient in SQL. Knowledge of Python would be an asset
Excellent knowledge of project management and system development life cycle
Knowledge of systems and relevant software applications (Tableau, Qlik, SimCorp Dimension, IntelliMatch, UiPath, ABBYY, Yardi, Investran, SAP Hana, Microsoft Suite)
Experience developing reports using Business Intelligence Tools (Tableau and QlikView/Qlik Sense), including the design and maintenance of underlying data models
Applies business analysis frameworks and looks across the organization to link and identify opportunities to align and streamline business process, organization, information and technology
Experience using UiPath and ABBYY to develop and support robotic process automation
Experience with data warehousing, data modelling, data mining, data QA, and comfortable working with structured and unstructured data from a wide range of systems and sources
Ability to think about issues from a business perspective with demonstrated ability to develop reports and analysis to meet business user’s needs.
High level of initiative, innovative and professionalism with enthusiasm and drive to succeed
Excellent analytical, problem solving and conflict resolution skills.
Ability to plan, organize and monitor work effectively to ensure standards of performance are adhered to
Attention to detail, accuracy, and completeness is very important along with the ability to handle multiple tasks efficiently
Ability to work independently with minimal direction.
Demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written) with the ability to work effectively with internal/external colleagues – possess the ability to influence negotiate and communicate with confidence
Identify and implement process improvements where necessary
A commitment to demonstrating HOOPP values

OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

Life At Opentext:

At OpenText and in IT, we believe in every employee having meaningful, purposeful work. By joining our team, you will join a community of supportive and collaborative peers focused on innovation, teamwork, and driving successful outcomes. You’ll be expected to bring with you an ideation and “Yes, if” mindset. And, as you build your network and demonstrate your professional excellence, you will have the opportunity to forge your own career path and professional growth.

The Opportunity:

OpenText is looking for a candidate with strong SAP master data background and data analysis skills to be part of a diverse team with a focus on projects relating to data governance, master data architecture and management.

As the Senior Data Analyst, your role is to be the expert in master data structure, design, governance and use across the organization. You will be working on data migration projects that deal with legacy master data from our acquired companies (M&A) into OpenText systems, ensuring business requirements are met and business processes are aligned. The primary objects you would focus on include Vendor master and its multiple attributes, banking rules, P2P processes. You will need to understand the flow and impact of master data objects to downstream systems and other transactional objects. You should be able to work with cross functional business as well as IT teams and be able to share the data analysis across these teams.

What You Will Do :

Deep understanding the SAP ERP master data ecosystem, including the fields, tables, and types of transactions which use the master data.
Understanding of data integrations, specifically how master data from SAP can impact downstream systems.
Understanding the Procure to Pay (P2P) is a must-have.
Experience with a Vendor Management System such as Ariba
Knowledge of Orders to Cash (O2C) and Record to Report (R2R) business streams is an asset.
Building and maintaining cross-functional relationships, including aligning opinions and approaches across disparate teams.
Using Excel for advanced data manipulations and analysis.
Assisting with designing business processes to be aligned to the master data
Creating or contributing to SOPs for the operational team.
Ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and completeness.

What It Takes:

8+ years working with SAP or a similar ERP for maintaining master data, OR, a combination of master data management/governance experience and experience within Procure to Pay (P2P), or Orders to Cash (O2C),Record to Report (R2R) business streams.
Experience with data migrations and integrations
Advanced Excel skills to perform data manipulations and analysis.
Knowledge and experience with master data tools such as SAP MDG, Data Services, Information Steward;
General understanding of project lifecycle & development
Excellent collaboration skills
Ensure adherence to change control process
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field or a combination of education and equivalent experience
7+ years of providing data solutions in a similar setting.
10+ years IT experience
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills

Job Description

Job Purpose:
This position works closely with leadership to ensure the accurate statement of inventory, provide analytical support to operations and perform month end analysis and reporting. This role will resolve complex issues by demonstrating extensive knowledge of system, department processes and accounting standards
Key Responsibilities:
Identify significant inventory risks, present to operational leadership, and partner with operational teams to minimize potential exposure.
Prepare consolidated cost of sales CFO presentation and provide explanation of variances versus forecast and prior year.
Own profit elimination analysis and book journal entries for interco sales and cogs reversal, profit release and currency translation adjustment.
Prepare inventory reconciliations from Microsoft Dynamics 365 to 3PL records.
Isolate root cause of inventory discrepancies and partners with cross-functional teams to resolve business process issues.
Responsible for preparing inventory continuity schedule for LE and budgeting with commentary on variances at month end.
Assist with standard cost update at the start of fiscal year partnering with sourcing and provide documentation to the audit process and SOX controls.
Attend and sample physical inventory counts semi-annually; support internal and external auditors for smooth process and answer all their concerns.
Prepare commentary for production related variances and cost drivers.
Support finance partners in process documentation identifying gaps, weaknesses, and opportunities for improvements.
Prepare intercompany profit provisions and supporting reports.
Analyze gross margin per SKU in all entities and provide management with reports that specify and compare factors which affect profitability of sales channel.
Work closely with Operations and Finance teams to build complete budget and forecast.
Create and maintain financial models to improve visibility and tracking of expenses.
Prepare balance sheet account reconciliations, journal entries, and reporting-related deliverables in accordance with month end deadlines.
Support project implementations with thorough knowledge of Operations Finance requirements.
Work closely with auditors and provides schedules and evidence as required for internal and external audit.
Experience, Education and Designations:
3+ years in a manufacturing environment
3+ years of relevant experience in an Operations Finance role
CPA or CMA preferred or working towards it
Experience in process improvement
Experience working in publicly traded companies
Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:
Well-versed in ERP systems, Microsoft Dynamics D365 preferred.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Excel.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Knowledge of reporting systems and data bases like Power BI and Microsoft Access.
Cross-departmental experience with the ability to develop strong business relationships.
High level of critical and logical thinking, analysis, and reasoning to identify underlying reasons or facts.
Ability to extract, manipulate and analyze data from multiple systems or sources.
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and consistently meet deadlines with accurate results.

Hybrid role

At Shoppers Drug Mart, we’re innovating health and wellness in Canada. From prescriptions to walk-in clinics, and a beloved loyalty program, we’re caring and supporting our customers in new ways every day.
With more than 1,300 locally owned and operated stores from coast to coast, the Shoppers Drug Mart network is more than a great place to shop, it’s a great place to work. We’re committed to building our talented team who champion collaboration, kindness and inclusivity. Join our team, and help recognize a healthy future for your career and for all Canadians.
Why this role is important?
Basic Function
The Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence position primary responsibility will be to help extract & analyze all patient assistance program data within core therapeutic areas and provide value add insight into therapeutic trends, opportunities and weaknesses. The Senior Analyst’s role is to assist the business users, and the Business Analyst, in getting raw data out of the system to turn into something meaningful for stakeholders. The reporting analyst will also act as a liaison for communication between the business end users and the developers.
Nature and Scope
The incumbent will work with internal staff to develop and maintain comprehensive reporting for SDM Specialty Health Network Management and external clients as contracts and requirements dictate.
What you will do
Act as a conduit between:
Client, SHN Sales & Marketing and Business Intelligence department to clarify and translate business and or operational requirements into documentation and conceptual report designs
Third party vendors, e.g. IQVIA and SHN
SHN internal clients and report writers to facilitate the development of reports
Develop financial analysis and reports designed to maximize profitability
Develop supporting invoice data and queries
Recommend and facilitate development of reports (regular & ad-hoc)
Run, validate and review reports, analyze trends, opportunities and weaknesses and summarize for report end users which includes internal employees and clients
Maintain business requirements, functional requirements and technical specification documentation for all reports
Participate Business Intelligence department for audits
Participate in Request for Proposal process related to specific therapeutic area of expertise
Assess impact to reports due to process changes
Create manufacturer service fee invoices
Provide supporting documentation for service fee invoices Document report errors
Perform Data Base Code Promotion regression testing
Report all Adverse Events (AE) and Product Technical Complaints (PTC) immediately or as soon as possible upon becoming aware of the event as per current policies and procedures
What you will need
Business/Computer Science/Engineering Degree or equivalent working experience
A minimum of 5-7 years’ experience preferably in a pharmaceutical industry
Strong knowledge and understanding of SQL language is a key skill
Effective organizational, communication and customer relations skills
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with CRM platforms (SalesForce, Siebel, PatientConnect, etc.)
Exceptional computer skills (MS Excel and quantitative analysis tools)
Experience with Business Intelligence Platforms (i.e. Qlik, Tableau, etc.) is a strong asset
Must be able manage time effectively through flexibility & prioritization
Must enjoy working in an environment of fast paced change and ambiguity
Why work at Shoppers Drug Mart?
Acting as consultants, supporting internal customers and the Associate-Owners, you will get experience unique to the retail industry while working for an award-winning national brand. Benefit from a purchase discount program, competitive pay and online learning through Academy .
Take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your work, co-workers, customers and community.
How You’ll Succeed:
At Shoppers Drug Mart Inc. , we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
Employment Type:
Full time
Type of Role:
Regular
Shoppers Drug Mart Inc. recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Requisition ID: 162351

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Senior Business Analyst, Client Services & Solutions, Global Business Payments - Scarborough, ON

Purpose:
As Senior Business Analyst, Global Business Payments, you'll work within the Client Services & Solutions, Operational Efficiency & Project department. You'll have the opportunity to work in a cross-departmental environment in order to assist with on-going projects, and to maintain and develop quality management processes.
In this role you'll ensure that all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures. You will responsible for identifying, implementing, and facilitating improvements to optimize execution of call handling, fulfillment and delivery of Customer Service.

Is this role right for you?
Champions a high performance environment to deepen client relationships, leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge and contribute to an inclusive work environment
Responsible for identifying, implementing and facilitating improvements to optimize execution of processes, tasks, analysis, and reporting
Potentially responsible for playing a key role as lead for CS&S in the Incident Management, Healthwatch and Scorecard processes
Responsible for proposing net new and managing existing Quality Assurance processes that reflect the mandate of operational excellence, research compliance, data integrity and security
Assessing and documenting business procedure to ensure completeness, correctness and to avoid any financial impact to both the client and Global Business Payments
Creating net new and maintaining reporting and tools in order to provide analysis, recommendations, identify trends and commentary for Senior Management
Proactively work to streamline processes and systems and identify areas for potential improvements via automation of manual and repetitive tasks
Work with Operational partners and other cross functional groups to identify and understand any potential and or existing procedural and operational opportunities
Identification of training opportunities to improve consistency and to enable operations to take a more proactive approach in continuous improvement
Conduct training sessions and facilitate a continuous learning environment
Understand the Bank’s risk appetite/risk culture in consideration of day-to-day activities and decisions
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of youf respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk

The Analyst, Customer Loyalty will maintain, develop, and implement customer experience/loyalty programs for the organization across multiple lines of business and delivery channels. Working with both the Customer Loyalty and cross functional teams, the incumbent will apply technical, business, and analytical knowledge together with a deep understanding of customer loyalty to assess and help improve customer loyalty programs across the organization. The role also requires that a strategic plan be maintained for setting priorities and effectively executing program deliverables.
SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES
Program Development and Management:
Build and enhance procedures and processes aimed at optimizing customer contact execution for loyalty programs across the organization - ensure all work is fully tested and vetted prior to implementation.
Create business and technical requirements and supporting documentation to facilitate loyalty program builds and knowledge retention.
Write, test, and manage the successful implementation of computer coding changes applied when fixing, updating, and/or creating net new programs.
Develop and maintain data quality procedures and processes aimed at ensuring the quality and currency of data and procedures used in loyalty programs is maintained and enhanced. Propose improvements as needed to ensure the most reliable and current information is utilized.
Perform complex manipulation of data to restructure data for analysis, create and maintain database tables, and create output files for vendors.
Ensure the ongoing successful execution of loyalty programs is maintained including the timely production and loading of all sample files and vendor response files.
Ensure governance and controls are in place to securely transmit and receive customer information to/from external vendors.
Cultivate strong working relationships with business and technical teams and leaders to ensure loyalty programs are maintained and developed successfully and are aligned with current and future business and technical needs.
Business Analytics and Insights:
Conduct data and business analysis of loyalty and customer data in order to generate insights and recommend potential improvements across programs.
Monitor and assess loyalty program data and performance to proactively identify trends, potential enhancements, and resolve any issues that may occur.
Provide thought and applied leadership on loyalty analysis and insights. Work with cross-functional teams to develop analysis of loyalty programs; work with these teams to leverage business knowledge and insights aimed at driving loyalty improvement for the organization.
Monitor and communicate loyalty program performance to business and technical stakeholders on a regular basis.
Strategy and Planning:
Maintain a strategic roadmap for loyalty/NPS program technical builds and analytical projects.
Work with data, technical, and business teams to develop data infrastructure and processes that support effective loyalty program execution, automation, and analytics.
Assess and prioritize the development and execution of loyalty programs while recognizing the integrated environment programs operate within. Ensure priorities align to organizational priorities.
Maintain a plan for migrating loyalty programs to email and SMS survey methodologies where necessary.
SUMMARY QUALIFICATIONS
Strong leadership, technical, functional and business skills to discuss, negotiate and influence at all levels in the organization.
Excellent relationship building skills at all levels within the organization.
Demonstrated expert in developing and managing programs, preferably in a complex organization with multiple lines of business.
Extensive experience in SAS program development and maintenance.
Experience with large transactional and customer-oriented relational databases. Familiarity across a broad range of data analysis, statistical analysis and programming tools, environments and techniques including SAS, SQL, Sybase, and Linux/Unix.
Ability to relate analytical expertise to business problems, formulate business recommendations and communicate effectively to a non-analytical audience.
Excellent time and resource management skills, flexibility and resourcefulness to interface and collaborate with internal and external groups.
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
Minimum Bachelor’s degree required in business, statistics, research, computer science or equivalent combination of education and experience.
3+ years of experience in analysis of loyalty and/or customer information.
3+ years of experience using SAS, SAS Macros, DBMS.
3+ years of hands-on technical and functional experience as a practitioner of analytics and statistical methodologies including regression analysis and customer segmentation.

We are seeking a resourceful and forward-thinking Senior IT Compliance Analyst who will perform testing of defined security and IT general computing controls across relevant applications, infrastructure and processes to verify that controls are sufficiently well crafted and operating efficiently to keep the risks that they mitigate within the company’s tolerance level. You are collaborative, believe in teamwork and are comfortable in a fast-paced environment.

What you’ll do
Delivery of controls testing activity as required, and support in the delivery of testing activity by other colleagues within the team including:
Development of test plans aligned with the IT and Business Protection Standards required controls and testing requirements
Perform walkthrough and sample-based testing (as needed)
Conclude on the design adequacy and the operating efficiency of the controls
Detail the assessment package (write-up and supporting evidence)
Reporting on the status of controls testing activity and on issues arising from this testing to colleagues at all levels.
Identify potential risks and issues and, where required, collaborate closely with Operational and Risk colleagues to formally raise these.
Support the remediation of control issues by providing input to appropriate partners in the development of actions.
Develop and maintain effective relationships with senior internal and external partners to ensure that IT risks are managed in line with risk appetite, strategy and objectives
Aid the development and continuous improvement of the information security mandatory controls framework and controls testing methodology.
Independently and optimally manage own workload and time, including maintenance/measuring of personal development plans and objectives.
Provide support, guidance and mentoring to junior peers and new recruits on technical aspects of testing. Be positively and actively engaged in the work of the function.
Perform review of third-party audit reports (SOC1).
Perform peer reviews on IT/BPS controls walkthrough, testing and documentation (Canada) to ensure quality levels are maintained and best practices are shared.
Coordinate mid-year and year end IT audit activities with external auditors.
Support the cultural change to fully embed Risk and Control ownership within IT

What you’ll bring:

Crucial Skills and Knowledge
A broad knowledge of IT systems, security and/or day to day IT Operations.
Solid understanding of security and IT general computing controls.
3+ years control testing experience in an IT environment or IT audit experience.
Strong analytical and writing skills.
Ability to plan, analyze data, and support conclusions.
A dedication to personal development and a desire to learn.
The ability to work actively and effectively as part of a distributed team to deliver results.
Superb communication and collaboration skills.

Desirable Knowledge and Qualifications
A degree in a technology related subject and/or relevant organizational and subject matter expertise (COBIT, COSO, ITIL).
Relevant industry qualification (e.g. CISA, CIA, CISSP, Certified Ethical Hacker).
Knowledge of the following: Windows Technologies, Unix, Linux, Oracle, Cloud Computing (AWS, Azure), Cryptography and System Architecture.

JOB POSTING #905277
Position: Epic Application Support Analyst - ClinDoc
Department: UHN Digital – Application Support
Location: Atrium on Bay
Hours: 37.5 hrs. /week
Status: Permanet Full-Time
Salary: $66,846 - $83,000 annually (based on experience and competencies)
-
Overview of Department
UHN Digital is one of the largest public sector health-care information management and information technology (IM/IT) service delivery organizations in Canada. As department of University Health Network (UHN), UHN Digital, is committed to its vision of transforming health-care delivery by improving the patient experience, addressing issues facing coordination of care and enhancing customer service and quality through outstanding project management and operational support.
Position Overview:
The Epic Application Support Analyst, ClinDoc, is an integral member of the Digital Clinical Support Services (DCSS) team. This position works closely with other members of the DCSS team to support identified applications for University Health Network (UHN) including both clinical and business applications. The Epic Application Support Analyst, ClinDoc will participate in support activities, system and business analysis, system upgrades and testing. The energy, enthusiasm, and dedication of this individual will allow the Digital Clinical Support Services team to contribute to the successes of the organization.
Primary Responsibilities:
This is a second level application support position that requires both a technical and business understanding of UHN Digital’s supported applications. This position requires that the candidate be on call, 24/7 on a rotational basis. The Application Support Analyst position entails duties such as but not limited to:
Day to day support of applications including working with customers, our HIS vendor Epic, and other vendors in troubleshooting and identifying options to resolve issues;
Application testing of new releases, upgrades, fixes and other product changes;
Participation in roadmap planning for application upgrades in conjunction with business users and vendors;
Periodic assignment to Digital projects e.g. Epic Optimization Phase demand items, new application implementation or integration;
Working with other Digital teams to ensure high service levels are maintained;
Provide customer service in the form of end user meetings (clinical or business); attend and/or facilitate monthly established end user meetings or ad hoc meetings;
Work closely with other Digital Application support teams to solve simple to complex production and operational problems for the applications supported by UHN Digital;
Document system problems and resolutions for future reference;
Exercise ITIL Change Management principles/techniques;
Participation in organizing and conducting weekly team meetings and huddles;
Work closely with the Project Management Office (PMO) and clinicians to implement the UHN Digital, Technology and Innovation portfolio strategy;
Other duties may be assigned consistent with the job classification.
Qualifications:
Undergraduate Degree required in Computer Science, Math, Health Informatics or related field or demonstrated mastery of the relevant material.
Certification in one or more of the following Epic applications is preferred: Beacon, ASAP, HIM, MyChart, Resolute Hospital Billing/Claims, Ambulatory EMR, Kaleidoscope, Inpatient EMR-Orders, Bugsy, Inpatient EMR-ClinDoc, Mental Health/Rehab, ESCA-EUD, OpTime. Other Epic certifications welcome.
2-3 years industry experience in 2nd level application support required
Experience with one or more clinical/business applications in a large healthcare organization required
Excellent customer service skills required
Excellent Incident and Problem management skills including analytical and problem solving skills
Able to effectively deal with high priority unscheduled tasks and problems
Excellent prioritization and organization skills
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Ability to perform standard application testing (unit testing), integrated testing, data analysis and/or system analysis
Working knowledge of HL7 standards and interfaces; or some other recognized industry standard an asset
Self-motivated team player who is able to work with minimal supervision on simple to moderately complex tasks
Able to work with multidisciplinary teams in a positive and productive manner
Experience with hardware and/or software vendor relations an asset
Experience working with interfaces an asset

Duties
Reporting to the technical unit supervisor, conducts complex diagnostic and/or research analytical procedures in food microbiology. Evaluates, reviews, and interprets analytical data. Troubleshoots, investigates, and solves performance issues with laboratory methods and equipment. Maintains comprehensive records of samples, observations, measurements, and tests conducted. Contributes to the laboratory quality assurance system and safety management system.
Work environment
We offer a bilingual, science-based environment, with excellent benefits, flexible hours, opportunities for advancement, an emphasis on learning and development, and a high level of employee satisfaction. Join a workforce that’s as diverse as the people it serves. The intent is to have an inventory of candidates to draw from when vacancies arise for current and future needs at the Greater Toronto Area (GTA) Laboratory. Applications will be accepted on an ongoing basis as long as the poster is active.

Job Description: Our team is growing and we are actively looking to hire Senior Analyst, Data Engineering to join our team! Reporting to the Manager, Data Engineering, you will be providing key technical expertise to acquire, investigate, manipulate, and analyze data and report to support Allstate Canada Group’s business plans and results.
Accountabilities:
Develop and maintain regular actuarial data base for use by other functions of ACG
Implement String matching algorithms in Python to maintain customer data.
Implement internal data process improvement: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, redesign/restructure database for more efficiency
Support data preprocessing and feature engineering for data science and modeling projects
Develop and maintain databases and build necessary data pipelines for projects and department functions.
Identify various manual processes and queries in the Data and BI areas, design and develop ETL Jobs to automate them.
Design and implement Data Integration and ETL processes with SSIS packages to make data available for reporting/analytics purpose
Responsible for monitoring and ensuring data quality of the curated data sets using proper reconciliation methods
Design integrated data pipelines to extract large volume of data from diverse data sources and deliver curated common data layers
Develop and improve SAS/SQL programs to perform various analysis.
Analyze change requests in the source systems or projects, assess their impact on existing data layers, and suggest and carry out the appropriate changes
Collaborate with DBAs, other IT teams, Architecture teams and vendor teams as required
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify needs and opportunities to build reports and dashboards
Design and build advanced data platform that supports 360-degree view of the customer and enable customer journey analysis
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree (Computer Science/Engineering/Math/Stats/Finance or similar) preferred
3-5 years of experience using Base SAS/EG, SAS Macro, SQL, SSIS & MS SQL Server
2-3 years of experience with data wrangling with Python specifically String-matching algorithms such as Fuzzy matching, hash functions and regular expressions.
Prior experience in the planning and execution of large-scale critical data transformation and enterprise data hub initiatives.
Strong data modeling fundamentals including experience with dimensional modeling, normalization, referential integrity, star, and snowflake schemas, etc.
Experience building and maintaining conceptual, logical, and physical data models for reporting and analytics use cases.
Experience with analytics platforms and methodologies (data lake, data warehouse, data marts, ETL, data modelling, data governance, etc.)
Experience in SAS/SQL programming for developing data, cleansing, performing data validation, required data integrity checks, auditing data and improve efficiency of programs
Experience in building ETL/ELT mappings, SSIS packages, data pipelines and Workflows
Strong knowledge of Enterprise automation software packages for data orchestration
Good understanding of SAS administration, maintenance, configuration, performance tuning and support
Experience in troubleshooting performance issues and errors while handling high volume of source data.
Ability to articulate ideas in both technical and business friendly language
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Access, VBA, and PowerPoint
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills; verbal and written communication skills; interpersonal and negotiation skills
Strong knowledge of Tableau and/or other visual analytics tools is preferred
Experience with insurance/actuarial data will be considered a plus
Allstate Canada Group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. If you require accommodation please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Monday to Friday

Markham, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

What are your salary expectations?

Our Story:
About You:
You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

About Us:
Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes Avison Young a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

Of course we love it here, but outsiders think we’re pretty great too: Avison Young was awarded the prestigious America’s Best Midsize Employers for 2022, presented by Forbes and Statista, Inc. We’re proud to be regularly recognized for our team, services and culture and our team members enjoy comprehensive compensation and benefit programs. Through our customized work options, we give our people the flexibility to create a work environment that puts their overall well-being first. After all, we are powered by people.
Overview:
This role will provide support for a broad portfolio of business applications with key focus on Yardi; primarily responsible for providing support to internal users while ensuring the optimal functioning and operations of Yardi and associated systems. The role will mainly focus on supporting the Property Management, Lease Administration, Accounting and Business Process teams.
Responsibilities:
Key responsibilities:
Perform Yardi Voyager system admin tasks such as account maintenance, role and permissions, password resets
Recommend, test and implement Yardi features, modules, plug-ins, enhancements, etc.
Assist in developing and coordinating Yardi training for existing employees and on-boarding new employees into the platform
Troubleshoot technical and data entry problems
Focus on advanced requests and incidents requiring a deeper level of knowledge
Maintain and develop custom Yardi work-flows and menu sets
Identify needs and develop programmatic solutions for Yardi users
Create custom SQL reports, correspondence, and reporting packages as needed for accounting and property management
Work with other 3rd party software and service providers to create automated data import/exports
Assist with Yardi conversions for new property acquisitions and set-ups
Performs additional duties or tasks as assigned by the Application Support Team
Create Yardi custom analytics based on user requests and manage work-flows
Other duties as required

Qualifications:
Minimum of 3 years’ expert knowledge of Yardi Voyager Core as well as Commercial module; knowledge of SQL Server database and queries
Ability to think independently and analytically and make recommendations based on observations.
Knowledge of basic accounting principles
Positive, friendly, and professional attitude with a strong customer service attitude
Must have good time management and critical thinking skills
Experience in Property Management and Lease Administration an asset

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment:
Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

column2: Senior QA Analyst - Market Risk (Python and SQL)
column7:
100 King Street West Toronto Ontario,M5X 1A1

Must have a development background
BMO currently looking for a Senior QA with strong analytical, organizational, problem-solving, and written communication skills. The successful candidate will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and be able to work collaboratively with technology and business stakeholders of the project.
Responsibilities
Effectively lead a team of testers to meet the product goals and thereby achieving the organizational goals that are derived
Preparation and Review of Test strategy, Test plan, Test schedule and Test Estimation based on the project requirements
Establishing QA processes and procedures and then overseeing the testing of a product.
Creation of test cases following the test process and approach, Review test cases to ensure coverage and traceability
Review the functional/non-functional requirements, user stories, technical design documents and other project artifacts to identify the testing scope and effort
Work on developing automation framework, creating and automating test cases using Robot Framework
Define test data and environment requirements as aligned with the project requirements or changes
Execution of test cases and documenting the test results and evidence in the identified test management tool
Log defects into defect management tool with clear description following documented process
Conduct regular test status calls for defect triage and tracking of test execution status
Identify risks & escalate issues in a timely manner. Communicate and address scope/schedule changes that will impact test cycles
Provide clear and concise Reporting on test status and defect metrics to management
Support business acceptance and user acceptance testing.
Work with Software Developers and Leads to understand project objectives and map out testing requirements for automation
Manage review and sign-off all QA documentation with business and technology stakeholders
Comply with BMO testing process including tools usage and test methodology
Required Skills:
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent
Must have Minimum of 5-7 years in IT, Banking/Financial industry
Must have minimum of 5 years of experience in Software QA, with a strong understanding of testing concepts, tools and methodologies
Must have knowledge of SDLC Waterfall and Agile models and role of QA in the project life cycle phases
Experienced in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases based on project requirements
Excellent analytical skills and great attention to detail
Able to do both manual and automated testing (End-to-end testing, System integration testing, Regression testing)
Understanding and planning for Automation scripts and frameworks and ability to customize or create new test scripts
Advanced knowledge of test management tools – HPALM/JIRA for Requirements, Test and Defect Management
Hands-on experience with SQL and ability to script complex queries to query large data sets using SQL
Advance knowledge in Microsoft Office products (particularly Excel and Word)
Experience testing Client/Server and web based applications
Knowledge of Databases (Oracle) and SQL, Unix/Linux, VBScript/Python, Interfaces, ETL, Financial data reconciliation and BI reporting
Strong experience capturing defect metrics, providing accurate test status and tracking
Experience working in cross functional teams and supporting multiple projects
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills
Willing and able to learn and adapt to new tools and technologies
Good to Have:
QA Automation using Robot Framework scripts.
Previous Capital Markets experience, preferably in Market Risk Area.
Experience testing applications in Cloud.
BMO experience is an asset.
Ensures the quality of the products that technology delivers, working closely with all applications, common services/middleware, and infrastructure teams throughout the development/engineering lifecycle. Designs, develops, executes, and maintains test plans of infrastructure, common services/middleware, data, and applications in various environments. Records and documents testing results (including anomalies and issues) and compares them to expected results. Detects solution failures so that defects may be discovered and corrected. Generates historical analysis of test results and maintains a list/repository of defects. Reviews and interprets all documentation related to testing, including business requirements and functional and design specifications, to provide input to the project team on the planning of testing activities. Provides immediate response to production program problems.
Provides guidance on reviewing, evaluating and driving requirements for testability to ensure review processes are adhered to.
Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.
Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
Leads initiatives. Able to coordinate resources and manage problems to resolution when necessary.
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Manages and leads the development and implementation of complete test strategies.
Designs and supports the implementation of best-in-class testing strategies for complex solutions, across multiple platforms and businesses/groups.
Performs analysis of test results and prepares comprehensive subsystem and/or system level evaluation reports which verify and validate system performance.
Creates discrepancy reports and performs integration regression testing to verify/validate incorporated fixes to software, components, subsystems and systems.
Reviews, evaluates, and derives requirements for testability.
Designs, develops, executes, and maintains testing strategies and plans to ensure stability and efficiency, enabling a seamless customer experience.
Executes and verifies test cases as part of the overall functional testing of Information Technology products as well as reporting defects and test results to the stakeholders.
Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and systems in the organization to improve overall efficiency and improve the bank.
Ensures the accuracy and consistency of test results through documentation processes. Follows BMO’s SDLC process.
Communicates the overall quality of a deliverable and ensures metrics are used to drive delivery and identify any areas of concern.
Participates in programs/projects across the enterprise.
Participates as an active stakeholder in every initiative, driving quality based on fact-based metrics.
Ensures development teams’ unit testing practices are in place and confirms core criteria met prior to integrated testing delivery.
Proactively provides improvement opportunities to the team to enhance the customer experience.
Drives the testing automation capabilities.
Identifies opportunities to strengthen the quality assurance capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks.
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically, 4-7 years of work experience in IT or business environment and/or BS/BA or MBA/MS in computer science, engineering, information systems, math or business.
Knowledge of the SDLC, testing concepts, methodologies, metrics, automated testing frameworks and BMO documentation standards.
Understanding of BMO applications and infrastructure components.
Problem solving skills including the ability to troubleshoot and identify problem areas throughout testing.
Collaborate well with others. Ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand terms.
Able to analyze data and use testing metrics to highlight improvement opportunities.
Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. column2: Market Data Operation and Engineering Analyst - Hybrid
column7:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Market Data Operation and Engineering Analyst - Hybrid
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
To provide solution and support for Market Data and Messaging Middleware platforms for RBC business users and applications globally. Contribute to the global technical strategies and engineering of those platforms. Liaison between developers, technology staff and management to ensure high quality requirements and engineering of Market Data and messaging platforms.
What will you do?
Provide services on all areas of Market Data technology –architecture, engineering, implementation and support.
Partner with application development team to ensure that market data/Messaging dependency risk are minimized and that needs are fully understood and met.
Participation from stakeholders beyond just the development and operation teams.
Responsible for the operational support of Market Data Monitoring systems. This includes assessment and communication of outages and incidents to the correct audience
Partner with ITRS monitoring team to ensure monitoring requirements are fully understood and met.
Ensure documentation on all systems in use for production and disaster recovery and regulatory purposes.
Ensure production problems, bugs, system problems/changes are documented and requests are acted upon promptly. Keep Senior Management advised of situations that may compromise agreed deliverables and/or affect production systems
Provide on-call support for global clients, rotating amongst all global engineers
What do you need to succeed?
Must Have
Experience of underlying networking and server technologies used in low latency infrastructures (10/40/100GbE, Linux, TCP/UDP Offloading cards, etc.)
Unix/Linux, Windows, Android, iOS, Database
Hands on knowledge of Symphony, Refinitiv TREP, Bloomberg BPIPE, DACS, Solace, Kafka, and/or other low latency Direct Exchange feed handlers and distribution platforms.
Understanding of Market Data concepts: Datafeeds, stock exchanges, Market Data and messaging middleware/distribution, IDBs and vendor reporting requirements.
Nice to Have
Programming knowledge and shell scripting
Programming with Messaging ChatBot
Knowledge of Exchange Datafeeds provided by the main North American Equity markets (NYSE, Nasdaq, BATS, DirectEdge, CME etc.) and the technologies used to deliver those feeds in both client and co-located facilities.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau and/or Grafana).
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada
City:
CAN-ON-TORONTO

Canada

37.5

Full time
Platform:
Capital Markets

Regular

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work.
