column2: Senior Business System Analyst - Mobile and Digital Banking
column7:
Senior Business System Analyst - Mobile and Digital Banking
Job Purpose & Summary
The Senior Business System Analyst - Mobile and Digital Banking provides complex system analysis, software deployment, testing and application support to facilitate a positive digital experience. This role will consult with business partners, vendors, and colleagues to identify user requirements, perform business processes and systems analysis, and help develop overall project solutions. The Senior Business System Analyst - Mobile and Digital Banking will work with other stakeholders to identify and maximize opportunities to utilize web and mobile technologies.

This role is considered a subject matter expert in the business processes(es) their assigned business system(s) support.

Key Accountabilities & Duties
Coordinate with business, vendor, and third-party stakeholders to develop and implement digital technical updates to business applications
Participate in mobile and web-based projects as an IT resource, complete IT-related takeaways and communicate updates and findings to stakeholders
Provide project-level analysis, producing required documentation deliverables such as business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) recommendations
Provide and support the implementation of business solutions, identifying business needs, determining, and carrying out necessary processes, practices, monitoring progress and results
Manage and prioritize the project queue of system development projects to support strategic business projects and business optimization
Lead meetings with various partners in the business and use business analyst techniques and methodologies to gather business and technical requirements for a project
Collaborate with business SMEs to ensure needs are being met based on project criteria
Understand and translate or clearly explain business and technical requirements to front-end developers, vendors, and executives
Perform data extraction and analysis from DUCA’s core banking system and other business applications
Maintain a foundational understanding of DUCA’s databases and record structure; advise DUCA executives on reporting and analytical capabilities
Manage DUCA’s internal change management processes for changes to assigned business systems
Work with project managers, business analysts, developers, and system architects to complete high-priority system technical issues
Manage system releases (content, organizational impacts, etc.) and release schedule
Work with the Quality Assurance team to ensure that application releases and updates are free from errors and satisfy end user requirements
Provide third level technical support for assigned business applications, including database updates and third-party interfaces

Occupational Experience & Education Requirements
Undergraduate degree in Business, Technology, or a related field
Business Analysis Training or Certification
5 years’ experience in a Banking System Analyst or Business Analyst role
2-3 years’ experience working with a banking system
Experience in a financial institution or credit union considered an asset

Knowledge, Skills & Attributes
Strong understanding of Business Process Management
Strong research and analytical skills
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Strong interpersonal skills and communication Skills
Proven problem-solving skills
Experience with requirements management
Experience with Account and/or Loan Origination Systems considered an asset
Keen to understand and learn unfamiliar processes
Good understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Good knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL)
Experience with Relational Databases
Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel
Experience with Web Service troubleshooting
Experience with Business Process Management tools (e.g.. Visio)
Experience supporting Central 1 Member Direct or another Online Banking System
Understanding of ITIL Framework
Understanding of application integration standards (e.g. ISO, SOAP, REST, XML)

Working Conditions
This position is required to work weekends and nights as necessary to ensure all business applications used in the end-to-end Member sales and services processes are available 24-7 and to support after regular business hours deployments of new systems, patches, fixes, and/or other enhancements.
Department: Information Technology
Primary Location: Corporate Office
Employment Status: Full-time
Hours per Week: 38
Job Grade Level: 7
About DUCA
DUCA exists to help people do more, be more and achieve more with their money and their lives. We’re driven by a co-operative philosophy that puts our Members (and Owners) at the centre of every decision we make, gives them a voice in how we’re run, and rewards them for their loyalty by sharing our profits.
At DUCA, we’re dedicated to creating a positive environment where our employees have growth and development opportunities, a healthy work/life balance, opportunities to give back to the community, and a focus on doing what is right for our Members. DUCA offers a competitive total compensation package including base salary, a short-term incentive (bonus) program, a comprehensive benefits program, pension plan, and employee banking benefits.
DUCA is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Recruitment related accommodations will be provided upon request.
Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit their application. Applications must include both a resume and cover letter.
We thank all applicants but only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

column2: Senior Supply Chain Planning Analyst I
column7:
Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? At Olympus, we help make people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling, every day.

Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.
Job Description
The Senior Demand and Supply Chain Planner is responsible for ensuring high service level to customers while achieving supply chain goals. They will work with marketing to forecast anticipated demand and partner with manufacturing to ensure that supply supports demand and achieves production efficiency. The DSCP is also responsible for maintaining an optimized inventory level that balances service level and cost.
Job Duties
Review statistical forecast and collaborate with regional marketing and finance to update forecast based on market intelligence and product life cycle.

Incorporate market event forecast not reflected in historical sales.

Understand new product and repair forecast drivers.

Ensure that key drivers and product cannibalization are incorporated into the forecast.

Support budgeting process by identifying drivers and reconciling discrepancies between actuals S&OP plans and Budget.

Perform analyses of trend data and adjust safety stocks as required consistent with established safety stock policy.

Provide weekly/monthly and quarterly inventory reports as needed.

Ensure all products have appropriate stock classification and ROP/min, max level to meet service level requirements.

Conduct regular proactive analysis on inventory accuracy, slow moving, excess, and obsolete inventory, propose proper actions to stakeholders and execute accordingly.

Develop and maintain regular cycle count procedure (initiate cycle counts, prepare variance reports, manage adjustments and provide monthly reports to management).

Process inventory adjustments and inventory reclassifications in SAP.

Review and report on inventory cost discrepancies and lot/serial number discrepancies and recommend and execute corrective actions as required.

Act as liaison between Marketing, customer service, vendors and logistics team.

Ensure high customer service level by projecting potential supply shortages and expedite delivery with manufacturing/suppliers to avoid backorder. Develop and track recovery plans.

Communicate supply issues and recovery to key internal stakeholders. Allocate inventory to downstream distribution centers as needed.

Perform analysis and provide input to launch supply strategy and decisions in partnership with global launch team and downstream supply chain.

Work with launch team to ensure that new product master data is setup and product released on time to support launch timeline.

Provide input to product rationalization analysis and manage Phase-in- phase-out.

Support continuous improvement initiatives to drive efficiency for SC group by optimizing system setup business processes and group reporting.

Write SOPs and perform training as required.

Perform all other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree required with a concentration in Supply Chain or Business required.

Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in demand planning and/or supply network planning.

Ability to work flexible hours

Hepatitis B vaccination is recommended for employees who are at risk for exposure to blood or other bodily fluids on the job. Service responsibilities include the handling of products and equipment that may have potentially come into contact with blood or bodily fluids.

OCI requires that all employees working in areas that may be exposed to this risk, either provide proof of the Twinrix (Hepatitis A and B) vaccination or sign a waiver accepting the possible risk of exposure from not being vaccinated. If you have severe allergies or ever had a severe allergic reaction to a vaccine please seek medical advice before taking this vaccine.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience utilizing ERP systems Oracle/SAP

Expert at utilizing statistical forecasting software.

Strong spreadsheet database and BI Reporting system skills.

Lean Sigma training/working knowledge would be an asset

#LI-KC1
We realize work isn’t just a job to you.

It’s a big part of your life, but not the only part. That’s why we offer competitive salaries, annual bonus program and comprehensive medical benefits, as well as tuition reimbursement, flexible schedules, parental and adoption leave, on-site services and Colleague Affinity Networks — so you can be ready for where life can take you.
Olympus is a global technology leader, crafting innovative optical and digital solutions in medical technologies; life sciences; industrial solutions; and cameras and audio products. Throughout our 100-year history, Olympus has focused on being true to society and making people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling.
Olympus Canada Inc. (OCI)—a subsidiary of Olympus Corporation of the Americas—manages the Company’s operations and workforce throughout Canada in roles such as sales, marketing, service, and support functions. Based in Richmond Hill, ON, OCI is committed to developing our employees and supporting our local communities. For more information, visit olympuscanada.com and truetolife.com.

Our Rogers Bank team is at the core of our organization, supporting all of our projects across every line of business. By providing financial support and guidance, our teams rely on our Finance partners to help make strategic, data-driven decisions that will have an impact on our growth and profitability for years to come.

Our Bank team is growing and is looking for like-minded thinkers who are passionate about telling stories through numbers to help take our investments in innovation to the next step. In turn, our Bank team is also committed to the growth and development of their team members. We offer advanced learning through Rogers Finance Transformation, support our colleagues in maintaining their professional designations, and offer a challenging work environment with fulfilling results to help balance both financial and business acumen.

Your journey is filled with limitless possibilities, Let’s make your possible.

Who we are

At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Our Banking team is growing and is looking for like-minded thinkers who are passionate about telling stories through numbers to help take our investments in innovation to the next step. In turn, our Banking team is also committed to the growth and development of their team members and offer a challenging work environment with fulfilling results to help balance both financial and business acumen.

The Senior Credit Risk Analyst will be part of a dynamic team supporting credit risk originations strategy and analytics for Rogers Bank. The incumbent will use a data driven approach to optimize the credit strategy for risk. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Credit Risk Acquisitions, this role will primarily support Credit Risk but will be part of cross-functional projects including but not limited to AML, Fraud, and Marketing.

What you'll do:
Conducting analytics and deriving insights to optimize the credit risk originations strategy for risk/reward
Providing analytical support for strategic initiatives to enhance the overall originations strategy in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders
Quantify impact in key revenue and loss metrics resulting from potential/actual changes to risk strategy and process
Reporting of performance of acquisition strategies
Contribute to business initiatives (marketing campaigns and new products) to ensure alignment with risk strategy
Summarize and communicate results of findings to different audiences with various levels of technical background
Lead and/or collaborate with the design of champion-challenger strategies, test case design, validation, implementation and monitoring
Contribute to execution of strategic cross-functional/organizational (client relationship, marketing, credit risk, operations) initiatives
Design and implement documentation and change management controls as required

What you'll bring:
Bachelor degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Business, Finance, Economics or equivalent quantitative field
2-4 years working within the consumer finance / credit card environment is preferred
Data analysis skills must include 3-5 years of experience using statistical programs such as SAS, Python, R, Knowledge Studio, or similar
Strong analytical and statistical knowledge with an ability to combine quantitative and common-sense problem solving skills
Highly proficient with the use of database querying tools such as SQL
Highly proficient with Microsoft office applications - advanced Excel (knowledge of macros-VBA and pivot tables)
Effective communication (written and verbal) and time management required
Self-starter, able to manage and prioritize multiple complex tasks with minimum supervision and strong attention to detail
Desire to learn and succeed in a challenging fast-paced environment
Experience with TSYS is an asset

Department Overview
The Enterprise Data Governance Office (EDGO) is TD Bank's leading authority on the governance and management of data and is part of TD's Risk Management organization. We have a vision that TD's data is understood, trusted, and valued as a critical asset and we are looking for transformative leaders to help us make that happen.

Job Description
The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for collecting data/information to interpret data, produce insights, create relevant collateral/ data visualization reports, and recommend actions on less complex issues to support business needs. The role provides consultative support, business insight, advice and expertise to guide decision making and/or strategic planning by leveraging and interpreting data and analytical models to provide business specific or broad strategic insight and using a variety of audience-specific communication techniques. This role will support Challenge and Oversight within the EDGO, developing strong relationships and working collaboratively with EDGO partners and other stakeholders to understand the data needs of the EDGO and risk partners, delivering on these needs timely.

Job Description Summary
Works independently as the senior analyst / subject matter expert and may coach and educate others
Considered a subject matter expert within a given area
Oversees and/or independently performs tasks from end to end
Focus on short to medium -term issues (e.g. monthly-quarterly)
Independently performs activities from end to end
Produces weekly or monthly visual dashboards which evaluate performance and effectiveness of tactics in all business lines supported
Analyzes trends, provide insights and recommendations.
Presents results, customer trends and other insight to business stakeholders and decision makers in a clear concise manner
Validates the quality and integrity of data in various bank systems and from external sources.
Works with business units and marketing partners to understand business drivers, definitions, metrics in order to interpret findings, take action and provide meaningful direction
Gathers, documents and designs data integration and visualization requirements for analytical projects
Contributes to review of processes and assist in identifying potential opportunities to improve operational efficiencies
Job Requirements
Undergraduate degree or specialization in one of the fields below
3 + years of relevant experience from an information management, statistical, mathematical, scientific or financial background or Graduate Degree and 1-3 years relevant experience.
Proficient PC skills including a strong competency in MS Excel and PowerPoint, and a variety of analytical and reporting software packages
Strong knowledge of programing languages (i.e. SAS/SQL/R, Visual Basic, Python)
Strong analytical and program solving skills are required to interpret data and draw conclusions
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Planning and organizational skills with a strong ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple deadlines and priorities
A team player with the ability to work independently and as part of a larger team with a proven track record of delivering results by demonstrating the ability to take independent action

C*ompany Overview*
Mi9 Retail software company is fully focused on the retail business vertical. We develop software to address challenging requirements faced by medium to large retail enterprises such as merchandise management, master data, inventory management, sales audit, purchasing and invoicing, retail analytics, and point of sale.
*
Role Overview: *
We are seeking a Functional Consultant/Business Analyst to make a positive impact with our enterprise clients as part of our Professional Services team. The Functional Consultant (FC) is a subject matter expert spanning the retail landscape from master data management to procurement to pricing and promos. As a key player on the Mi9 services team, the FC contributes to successful implementations of our enterprise retail software by working directly with our clients to define business requirements, map those specifications to our software solution capabilities, training clients on the Mi9 products, and supporting clients through the all the phases of the project towards completion.
_
We welcome all applicants in Ontario, Canada._
What you’ll be doing:
Be a part of our collaborative team implementing our software for enterprise clients
Lead business requirements workshops with our clients and project teams
Map client requirements to Mi9 Merchandising, Analytics, and Point of Sale capabilities
Translate client business needs and associated gaps into requirements - understanding data and process workflow interdependencies
Create high-quality documents such as design documents, estimates, and process documentation as needed for each project and its stakeholders for review and sign-off
Provide systems training to client users
Support user acceptance testing by investigating and if possible resolving defects while factoring in the project timeline
Provide initial hyper care post-go-live client support and subsequently train our support staff as part of the project handover to the support team
Foster productive cross-functional relationships with engineering, product, and support teams to ensure success for our customers
Effectively collaborate with Project Managers to align on project deliverables
Ensuring the adoption of the Mi9 Project Methodology Framework
The impact you will have
You will be contributing to the overall success of existing and newly acquired enterprise clients. Depending on your experience, you may also have opportunities to mentor other members of the team.
What you bring to the table:
Retail subject matter expertise
Superior attention to detail and focus on task completion to the requirement
Strong communication skills - both written, verbal, and presentation as well as excellent interpersonal skills
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
Enterprise software experience – working for a software company or implementing a major software package as a consultant or as a client
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
A demonstrated dedication to continuous learning
Knowledge of SQL Server is a strong plus
Experience with JIRA/Confluence is a plus
Familiarity with accounting and Stock Ledger is a plus
Ability to travel to client sites in US and Canada (when safe to do so)
Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience
Benefits and other perks
Our team works from home in the Eastern time zone
Vacation paid time off
Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) with company match 100%
Company-paid Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance for you and your dependents
100% Company-paid Life Insurance
Education & Learning stipend for personal growth and development
Must be legally authorized to work without visa sponsorship for employment.
Mi9 Retail is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
No phone calls, please.
Job Type: Full-time

column2: Senior Risk and Compliance Analyst, Regulatory Change
column7:
Position Overview
The primary responsibilities of this role are to support Richardson Wealth in researching, writing, and socializing robust policies and procedures in the management and operations supporting Regulatory Compliance. The Senior Risk and Compliance Analyst must have exceptional writing, communication and analytical skills and must be comfortable working with complex rules and requirements from Regulatory and other Legislative requirements.
Duties & Responsibilities
Work collaboratively with business and support teams to provide ongoing advice and guidance on risk and compliance implications related to new and ongoing policies, procedures and practices.
Communicate new and amended internal policies and regulatory requirements, and incorporate these updates/amendments within the policy and procedures manuals, create training and deliver succinct and relevant communications to the field.
Support the Vice President, Regulatory Change to ensure all policy and procedures manuals, testing and review procedures for advisor compliance, branch and compliance operations are updated within prescribed time frames, that they reflect current practices, and comply with all applicable regulatory requirements
Support the Risk and Compliance department by assisting in board reporting, PortfolioAid testing and acting in a back-up capacity for select Trade Desk supervision tasks.
Lead specific compliance related tool creation, implementation, training and adoption across both branch network and across Head Office based associates.
Support the VP, Regulatory Change in ensuring that the Compliance Manual and all related policies and procedures are up to date or otherwise tracked with action plans where changes are pending.
Co-ordinate and track upcoming and newly enacted policies, regulations and guidance notes. Provide summary briefs of changes, determine branch or firm impact and craft training and communication materials.
Conduct and support training on policy and procedures and on “hot” topics and on new/amended policies. Build Risk University content and training materials acting as subject matter and design expert. Manage registration and data analytics for required registrant courses.
Partner with Manager, Legislative Compliance to ensure all policy and procedures manuals, testing and review procedures for advisor compliance, branch and compliance operations are updated within prescribed time frames, that they reflect current practices, and comply with all applicable regulatory requirements
Participate in special projects as required
Skills & Qualifications
Knowledge and understanding of the Canadian securities regulatory landscape, and IIROC and CSA rules and legislation
Ability to educate, influence, negotiate and to work independently and within a larger team
Excellent skills in conceptual editing, copy editing and proof-reading
Strong understanding of front and back-office operations
Service-oriented with an ability to remain calm and professional under pressure
Sound judgment and integrity
Ability to think and act proactively
Self-motivated and interested in ongoing learning and professional development
Organized and ruthlessly efficient
Proficiency in website design an asset
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
Education
Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC), and Conduct and Practices Handbook Course (CPH)
Investment Dealers Supervisors Course an asset
Post-secondary degree

The Role:
In this role, you will work closely with product managers, project managers, developers, and operations to figure out quality control solutions to ensure the highest level of quality for new development and enhancements on Morningstar Direct.
Responsibilities
Develop test plans and test cases based on business requirements of functional and non-functional specifications
Review artifacts including spec, AC, test plan and test cases and clarify with BA and PO on any ambiguous information or unclear logic
Execute feature/regression/Ad hoc testing to ensure software work as expected
Identify, record, document thoroughly, and track bugs till closed
Write and deliver clear QA documentation including test plan, test cases, test progress, risk and test results
Provide support and communication for reported issues in the Live environment
Work with the Automation QA engineers on test cases selection, script developing, maintaining and execution
Mentor QA engineer to grow their product knowledge and testing skills
Requirements
Bachelor`s degree in Computer Science, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or related
4 + years of working experience in IT software testing with solid quality assurance knowledge
Strong attention to detail, excellent verbal, written, and analytical skills
Good sense to understand product from the client’s perspective, functional and non-functional, such as usability
Knowledge of tools, concepts, and methodologies of QA, as well as ensuring the technical translation of requirements into test plans
Clear communicator (written and verbal) – to ensure the ability to write test plans and test cases and the ability to work with a wide range of stakeholders
Ability to focus on deadlines and deliverables – ensures the ability to find the defects and bugs quickly, for validating deliverables to meet functional and design specifications and requirements
Skill in SQL /Python, Java or data analytics is a plus
Nice to Have
1 – 2 years of experience in writing automated tests, preferably using Python

As one of the world’s leading asset managers, we are solely dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. If you're looking for challenging work, smart colleagues, and a global employer with a social conscience, explore your potential at Invesco
The Department:
Global Portfolio Services (GPS) provides global end to end trade processing, portfolio administration/operation and data management support to Invesco. The group mission is to provide quality service with highly disciplined operations; deliver responsive portfolio support for investment process, new products, and instruments; be responsive to changing economic, regulatory and risk environment; manage and deliver quality data. The Support Services function within the Global Portfolio Services provides proactive, 6x24 follow-thesun first line support to business partners. The group ensures GPS data integrity and coordinates GPS response to new business as well as support requests. We provide proactive end-to-end support to our business partners throughout the day by ensuring all business as usual (BAU) requests are handled in a timely manner and in accordance with agreed SLA. We work with GPS functional teams to ensure items are resolved. Our data integrity measures include ensuring accuracy of data delivered by GPS and promptly communicating exceptions that impact our business partners. We liaise with business partners to capture new business requirements, coordinate GPS prioritization and responses; and work with GPS functional and strategic initiative groups on delivery of the business requirements. GPS Support Services operates under four functional areas:
First Line Support
Product Support
Data Integrity
Project & Process Integrity

Your Role:
Global Portfolio Services (GPS) provides global end to end trade processing, portfolio administration/operations, Corporate Actions, Securities Pricing and data management support to Invesco across various asset classes. GPS Support Services operates under four functional areas: First Line Support, Product Support, Data Integrity, Project & Process Integrity. The Senior Data Management Analyst is generally responsible for providing first line client support, product support as well as data, project & process integrity support. The incumbent primarily focuses on one of the four functional areas within GPS Support Services and is expected to spend no less than 70% of their time in the assigned focus area and up to 30% in the other three areas.

Responsibilities:
Acts as the point of contact for queries escalated within the team or from business partners. Proactively follows up; coordinates within GPS groups and ensures resolutions
Takes initiative to identify and raise issues on complex problems, formulates solutions independently and knows when to escalate
Proactively initiates, leads and participates in all stages of continuous improvement initiatives as well as new business requirements / projects
Acts as a subject matter expert on complex products and continue to stay current on industry trends and best practices
Mentors colleagues and provides training to the global team on new processes and procedures
First Line Support: Supports global operation by executing tasks outlined in the Service Catalogue accurately and in a timely manner that meets established SLA
Provides data support for security masters, brokers, and associated reference data
Validates and ensures data override requests conform to Invesco’s Data Standards; conducts research/analysis and escalates data standard concerns to appropriate Data Governance bodies
Takes ownership and performs independent analysis on complex escalated position, cash, coupon payment and security master related reconciliation breaks requiring non-standard research and problem-solving abilities
Takes ownership on cash management support and resolves all escalated position independently prior to market open and informs the investment teams
Maintains a good overall understanding of the assigned investment strategy
Product Support: Takes ownership in new instruments analysis to determine the associated data requirements and support procedures across all relevant systems
Lead the associated data and process flow end-to-end testing. Coordinates new instrument responses, testing and approval across GPS as needed
Coordinates Product Shelf changes and related activities
Acts as a subject matter expert in complex instruments. Documents complex instrument support procedures, shares knowledge and trains the global team
Leads and coordinates new data requests and data standards change requests. Analyze new data needs, recommends new and adjustment to data standards
Leads the research and analysis of GPS data in support of the creation/maintenance of Invesco specific data elements. Ensures data provided fits Invesco’s global needs
Data Integrity: Liaises with other GPS functions to ensure integrity of portfolio related data via reconciliation resolution as well as daily cash & claims management oversight, coordination, and escalation globally
Proactively monitors, identifies, and acts as an escalation point for critical GPS related reconciliation breaks. Engages and facilitates discussions with internal and external parties to expedite resolution on critical reconciliation items
Takes ownership in preparing management reports and executive level commentaries on the health of GPS reconciliation and other issues resolution
Escalates and keeps GPS Management Team informed of any critical reconciliation breaks and data issues globally
Informs stakeholders on critical data integrity issues that impact them in a timely manner
Supports reconciliation and audit process for specific accounts as per SLAs defined
Works closely with GRS and GPS functional teams to identify opportunities to streamline the overall reconciliation resolution process globally. Leads and facilitates cross-function discussions on reconciliation resolution process improvements identified
Project & Process Integrity: Proactively identifies and leads process integrity and effectiveness enhancement opportunities to completion. Takes ownership to develop new ways to identify and alert us of data quality issue pre-emptively
Leads prioritization, manages, organizes, and monitors business requests for Support Services globally
Leads process improvements and project coordination globally within Support Services
Takes ownership in the definition, delivery and the communication of efficiency and data quality measurements. Monitors and keeps Support Services Leadership Team inform on these measurements regularly
Proactively leads discussions and works with Support Services Leadership Team to identify and address root cause if measurement not meeting defined targets
Responsible for operation reviews and controls
Ensure all activities are in line with Invesco’s Conduct principles

The experience you bring:
Certified Financial Analyst (CFA) or Professional accounting designation (CMA, CGA, CA, CPA) an asset.
Require a University degree in Accounting, Finance, Math or business area of concentration (or an equivalent combination of education, training, experience that would provide the knowledge, skills and ability required)
MBA an asset
Excellent interpersonal, conflict resolution, written and verbal communication skills to effectively build strong business relationships with internal and external stakeholders at all levels.
Customer focus and with a keen interest in providing superior services to clients
Very strong organization skills, detail orientation, with an ability to understand the big picture and work under pressure with tight deadline.
Excellent research & analytical as well as problem solving skills.
Self-motivated and ability to work independently under general guidelines in a cross-functional global team environment is critical.
Must demonstrate good judgment, establish priorities and concentrate on detailed information under pressure daily. This includes the ability to handle time critical situations while meeting rigorous deadlines.
A self-established independent thinker with keen interest, curiosity, and strong desire to research problems, analyze issues, challenge status-quo...
Leads projects as well as the perseverance to bring issues to a satisfactory closure without close supervision
Aptitude for mathematical calculations and ability to analyze detailed numerical data.
Strong Microsoft Office skills – Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio.
Aptitude for learning new technology and adapting to rapid changes
Desire to learn new and complex financial instruments and processes
Value diversity of thoughts; participates in constructive debate and feedback.
Understand matrix related work and can translate data into story
Asks for and provides constructive feedback from/to others. Strives to become an informal leader
Extensive financial services industry experience in a data analysis capacity
Excellent knowledge of investment products and global security markets is required
Knowledge of market data services such as Bloomberg and Reuters is required
Must have previous knowledge and work experience with data management applications, order management systems, portfolio administration applications, fund accounting applications, reconciliation tools, and data warehouse platforms
System examples include: CADIS, Charles River, Aladdin, Eagles STAR, Eagle PACE, PAS, TLM
Must have a good understanding of the end-to-end investment services processes including but not limiting to:
Trade entry, trade process, settlement, security master set up/maintenance, valuation, corporate action processing, fund accounting and reconciliation resolution
Must have in-depth and strong understanding of the Invesco data flow and the impact of different characteristics of GPS owned data have on downstream data consumers and business functions
Understanding of Invesco’s marketplace and global reach and is mindful of the global nature of our business when conducting day to day activities. Understands Invesco’s primary product sets and operating model.

What’s in it for you?
Our people are at the very core of our success and we strive to provide employees with a competitive total rewards package which includes:
RRSP Contributions
Health & Wellness Benefits
Work flexibility Programs
Parental Leave Benefits
Study Support

Senior HR Business Solution Analyst

Job Description
The successful candidate will be reporting to Director, HR Optimization & Reporting and will work collaboratively leading optimization activities and enhancement of HR systems (Workday). They will be responsible for the effective communicator of enhancements, development, and solutions of Workday functionality to stakeholders. You are a self-starter who enjoys problem solving, finding innovative ways of working, and providing exceptional solutions.
This position will be located at our Head Office in Markham, Ontario and will have flexibility for both remote and in-office work based on our hybrid work model.

Accountabilities
Subject Matter Expert for all HR Information Systems (specifically Workday), and responsible for ensuring systems are optimally configured, maintained, and utilized.
Functional knowledge of the various HR disciplines and their data needs (e.g. HCM, payroll, benefits, absences, time tracking etc.), and knowledge of HR policies, procedures, and processes and work effectively with all types of highly confidential information.
Perform all regular system maintenance testing requirements for upgrades and enhancements, executing test cases against quality standard user acceptance and regression testing to maintain operational excellence.
Ensure business requirements are clearly defined, documented, communicated, implemented, and tested for all assigned projects
Remain current on Workday trends, issues and best practices through online reviews, Workday User Group meetings, contact with peers and attendance at seminars, training workshops and educational programs
Lead implementation efforts where appropriate, developing and delivering training to Human Resources staff on new functionality
Liaise between the Human Resources functional user groups and other stakeholders to help define, analyze, and validate functional business requirements, and be able to translate those requirements into effective technical solutions
Qualifications and Experience
Post-secondary degree or diploma in Information Systems, Business Administration, Human Resources, or equivalent work experience.
3 to 5+ years of HR system functional experience of system enhancements and implementations, preferably Workday.
1 to 2 years project experience both implementation and post go live.
Ability to interpret technical concepts, technologies, and complicated problems/solutions, and explain it in non-technical terms to all levels of the organization
Strong technical aptitude for HR systems functionality.
Able to work independently and deliver on self-directed results.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
What Extendicare has to offer:
At Extendicare, we believe that working as a team creates an environment that allows us to reach our potential. We value each employee, encourage equal opportunity for growth and recognize achievement. As a valued member of our team, you can expect:
Continuous mentorship, support for life-long learning and growth opportunities
Opportunities for advancement and career growth within the organization
A rewarding and meaningful work experience where you can enrich your life and the lives of others through your work.
Employee Family Assistance Program.
Robust benefits package.

Extendicare is a leading provider of care and services for seniors throughout Canada. Through our network of over 115 operated senior care and living centres, as well as our home health care operations, we are committed to delivering care throughout the health care continuum to meet the needs of a growing seniors’ population in Canada. Our qualified and highly trained workforce of 23,700 individuals are united by a dedication to quality care and by our vision of being the best provider of senior care and services in Canada.

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Extendicare's Policies on Accommodation, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of Extendicare’s hiring process.

nugget.ai is working in partnership with Planet4iT to recruit for our clients. nugget.ai and Planet4iT will be responsible for the application process, and our clients will be responsible for the interview and final selection processes.
We are looking to hire a Senior Analyst – Data Architecture to join our Data Architecture team.
You will take responsibility for managing our master data sets, developing reports, and troubleshooting data issues.
To do well in this role you need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and a deep understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases.
Responsibilities:
Performing analysis on data sets to submit findings and recommendations.
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
Suggesting potential improvements to the data capture process to increase operational efficiency.
Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
Managing master dataset, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Leveraging data to provide detailed analysis, develop next steps.
Tracking Performance and ROI by helping quantify the benefits.
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
Producing various analyses on several projects.
Requirements:
University degree in business, with specialization in business intelligence or finance, accounting or economics.
Ability to gather, analyze and synthesize data from various sources and efficiently present written assessments and communicate results and findings.
Passion for complex data analysis and reporting. Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.

TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
TDBG Canadian Retail Model Development (RMD) is responsible for the development of expected loss models, which is measuring credit risk in all TDBG retail credit products; and retail scoring models (i.e. scorecard models). These models cover the whole credit life cycle of the customer with the bank.

For expected loss models, it entails developing, implementing, and monitoring account-level retail credit risk rating, and parameter models (PD, EAD, and LGD); using these risk ratings and parameters to estimate and report the Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) as required under the Basel II Retail Advanced Internal-Ratings Based (AIRB) approach, and the minimum regulatory capital and economic capital that the Bank needs to allocate against the credit risk in its retail product portfolios; and estimating allowance for expected credit losses for performing and impaired assets.

For scorecard models, which are used extensively within Retail Risk Management strategies, including credit adjudication, account management, early stage and late stage collection strategies, it entails developing, implementing and monitoring account level scorecard models as well as analytical tools (prototyping as necessary) for retail credit products by leveraging state of arts predictive/analytical methodologies, such as machine learning (ML) algorithms.

The position is available in the Model Development Execution and Controls team which reviews the output of various credit risk expected loss and scorecard models used within the bank and establish adequate controls in place. The position will also involve analysis of macro and account level variables and their impact of expected losses.
Job Description
In this position, the individual will be responsible for validating and compiling different datasets related to different retail products and building dashboards over it to highlight the trends in expected credit losses and credit risk drivers. Using sound knowledge in scorecard models as well as advanced statistical tools, such as machine learning algorithms, to deliver innovative solutions for our stakeholders and add value in effective risk management process. This will entail extensive and deep interactions with TDBG Model Validation and Model Risk Management, TDBG retail risk management team, layer 6 and technology team to support model review and approval process and ensure model compliance with TDBG Model Risk Policy.

The position will work closely with and actively support TD Retail Risk Management, as well as retail credit product areas by providing extensive analysis of credit risk drivers for the respective product portfolios. This will include discussing with the retail credit product, finance, and risk management areas key observations and conclusions derived from the data analysis, modelling, and assisting in their use to manage product portfolio risk and profitability.

In this position, the individual will use leading-edge technologies and develop innovative solutions in the following areas:
Data mining – making sense of some very large databases of credit risk related historical data by leveraging state of art statistical technics, such as machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms
Predictive credit risk modelling based on rigorous statistical analysis of historical data that will assist our key business partners achieve growth and profitability targets while maintaining acceptable levels of risk within our lending portfolios
Assist in the validation and assessment of internally and third party developed predictive models, includes data extraction, data analysis, assisting in methodology development and documentation
To develop and maintain expertise with lending, credit scoring, behavior scoring, portfolio management and industry trends
To provide decision support, analytical, and statistical service through modeling and segmentation to help Lending BUs achieve business objectives.
This position provides excellent learning, working and career opportunities in a highly professional and motivated team environment, and exposure to a variety of high-paced and intensive modeling projects and to a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
Job Requirements
This position requires a combination of dedication, extremely hard work, and attention to detail, on one hand, and quick learning, creativity, and non-standard thinking; on the other hand. It also requires ability to work as a team, project management, communication, and presentation skills.

In terms of technical skills and experience, this position requires sound mathematical, statistical, computer science and computational mathematics background.

A successful candidate is expected to have:
2+ years of relevant working experience
Sound knowledge in industry best practices in predictive modelling, including machine learning algorithms
A university degree in quantitative discipline (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer mathematics, Econometrics, Operations Research); An advanced degree is an asset
Proficiency in programing using statistical analysis tools, such as SAS, Python/R, Scala, Spark etc., in the context of data manipulation, data mining, statistical analysis, and predictive modelling;
Proficiency in dashboard building tools like Tableau.
Proved to be a quick learner, strong problem-solving skills, ability to independently identify and solve problems in an effective and timely manner;
Strong project management skills, ability to successfully work with multiple stakeholders to achieve the project’s objectives;
Strong communication skills (both written and oral), ability to effectively present technical, business, and project management subjects to multiple stakeholders.
Knowledge in retail credit product an asset

C*ompany Overview*
Mi9 Retail software company is fully focused on the retail business vertical. We develop software to address challenging requirements faced by medium to large retail enterprises such as merchandise management, master data, inventory management, sales audit, purchasing and invoicing, retail analytics, and point of sale.
*
Role Overview: *
We are seeking a Functional Consultant/Business Analyst to make a positive impact with our enterprise clients as part of our Professional Services team. The Functional Consultant (FC) is a subject matter expert spanning the retail landscape from master data management to procurement to pricing and promos. As a key player on the Mi9 services team, the FC contributes to successful implementations of our enterprise retail software by working directly with our clients to define business requirements, map those specifications to our software solution capabilities, training clients on the Mi9 products, and supporting clients through the all the phases of the project towards completion.
_
We welcome all applicants in Ontario, Canada._
What you’ll be doing:
Be a part of our collaborative team implementing our software for enterprise clients
Lead business requirements workshops with our clients and project teams
Map client requirements to Mi9 Merchandising, Analytics, and Point of Sale capabilities
Translate client business needs and associated gaps into requirements - understanding data and process workflow interdependencies
Create high-quality documents such as design documents, estimates, and process documentation as needed for each project and its stakeholders for review and sign-off
Provide systems training to client users
Support user acceptance testing by investigating and if possible resolving defects while factoring in the project timeline
Provide initial hyper care post-go-live client support and subsequently train our support staff as part of the project handover to the support team
Foster productive cross-functional relationships with engineering, product, and support teams to ensure success for our customers
Effectively collaborate with Project Managers to align on project deliverables
Ensuring the adoption of the Mi9 Project Methodology Framework
*
The impact you will have*
You will be contributing to the overall success of existing and newly acquired enterprise clients. Depending on your experience, you may also have opportunities to mentor other members of the team.
What you bring to the table:
Retail subject matter expertise
Superior attention to detail and focus on task completion to the requirement
Strong communication skills - both written, verbal, and presentation as well as excellent interpersonal skills
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills

column2: Senior Business Insights Analyst, Performance Integrity & An...
column7:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Wealth Shared Services Business Governance & Control team is responsible for managing the overall risk management and governance for TD Wealth. The team is responsible for ensuring timely and consistent implementation – across the Wealth businesses - of all risk, control and governance programs, initiatives, policies and standards.

The Conduct Risk and Sales Practice team is responsible for promoting a sustained culture of integrity and ethics by embedding Conduct Risk management in TD Wealth business practices. Our team is responsible for the enabling and enhancing a conduct monitoring program with an end-to-end closed loop process to oversee, remediate and strengthen Conduct Risk and Sales Practices.

Job Description
The role reports to the Senior Manager, Performance Integrity & Analytics.
The Senior Business Insights Analyst is responsible for supporting the broader Performance Integrity team and is responsible for the sales practice and conduct risk monitoring. This role will provide the successful candidate with a unique opportunity to leverage their analytical skills, and participate in high profile Governance & Control initiatives, as well as interact with teams across the organization including Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and others. We are looking for a self-motivated and innovative individual who excels in a cross-functional and high impact team.

Primary Responsibilities

Lead investigations into potential performance integrity concerns. Use Wealth and enterprise data sources and systems to analyze data, identify trends, and communicate and report investigation results to help protect TD's customers, employees, and shareholders. Escalate concerns to the Performance Integrity management team as required
Translate complex scenarios into actionable data selection criteria to investigate potential issues.
Partner with Governance & Control and businesses to propose recommended changes to policies, procedures, and system enhancements to address potential gaps
Contribute to the development of Performance Integrity processes and controls; identify gaps and opportunities to further enhance controls
Provide reporting and recommendations to Wealth Governance & Control executives on Performance Integrity matters, identified gaps and any emerging trends across distribution channels
Partner with other stakeholders across TD Wealth and beyond to ensure a coordinated approach to managing and documenting performance integrity issues
Prepare high-quality presentation materials and reporting
Act as a subject matter expert on sales conduct and practice issues, and represent the Performance Integrity team on projects and initiatives
Effectively manage ad-hoc projects or tasks of varying complexities within established deadline
Foster an environment and culture that encourages productivity, innovation, process improvement, teamwork, and a high level of professionalism
Job Requirements
Qualifications / Skills / Experience:
The ideal candidate should have over 5+ year experience in wealth management businesses and their various products, systems, processes, and applications and/or a business analysis/reporting function would be assets
Strong analytically-anchored problem-solving skills, solid background working with data and conducting analysis or planning complex data flows and processes – a logical and strategic thinker with strong critical reasoning skills
Strong interpersonal skills, able to build relationships, effectively interact, influence, and motivate individuals at all levels of the organization to make an impact
Superior communication skills with proven ability to communicate quantitative/ qualitative information and key messages in a clear and compelling way (tell a story from the numbers) that is flexible to suit different audiences, from field-office to executive-level
Detail oriented with excellent organization skills and ability to effectively manage work under tight timelines and changing priorities
Self-motivated, resourceful team player with high energy and ability to work independently while handling high degree of ambiguity, changing priorities and timelines
Comfortable leading through transformational change and recognized as a champion for continuous improvement
Exceptional personal integrity in order to manage access to sensitive information about risks, results, people, and other

Education
Advanced university degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, or other analytically based discipline
A professional business designation (MBA, CFA, CA, etc.) is an asset

Technical Knowledge/Skills
Expert skills with mining, accessing, and analyzing large amounts of data and programming skills (e.g., SQL, Python, R, VBA, SAS, EDW) are an asset
Expert skills in Tableau and other visualization tools is considered an asset
Expert skills with Excel and other Microsoft products
Skills Category:

Analytical skills, Business intelligence, Computer skills, Effective communication, Interpersonal skills, Organizational intelligence, Relationship management, Time management
Additional Information
#LI-POST
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Provides end-to-end change management and transition support for BMO Funds and Institutional Client Accounts for internal and external stakeholders. Delivers operational processes and provides operational support to the personal wealth and asset management businesses and stakeholders.
Accountabilities
Change Management and Implementation
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of solutions.
Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy.
Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Communicates with internal business partners and external partners in response to standard and non-standard Change Management requests.
Breaks down strategic problems, analyze data and information to provide insights and recommendation.
Gathers and formats data into regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation, and sustainment of initiatives.
Leads or participates in defining the communication plan designed to positively influence or change behaviour; develops tailored messaging; and identifies appropriate distribution channels.
Primary contact to external brokers/dealers for onboarding of agreements in conjunction with legal team.
Coordinates and gathers onboarding criteria and documents for renewals of broker agreements; client/fund accounts.
Complete documentation request for various internal and third-party service providers.
Attends and acts as primary contact for Operations in project meetings on new product initiatives with the Product and Institutional Sales Teams.
Reporting, Research and Analysis
Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational and business programs.
May assist with activities such as coordination and scheduling of work, forecasting resources.
Fulfills routine and frequently non-routine transactions, responds to internal business partner and/or external customer inquiries requests, and/or audit/reconciliation activities.
Analyzes and resolve complex issues efficiently and effectively in accordance with Bank and industry standards.
Identifies business needs, designs/develops tools and training programs; may include delivery of training to audiences.
Provides input and analysis into the continuous improvement of business processes and procedures and participates in the planning, testing, and implementation of projects and new/revised products, services, or processes.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Relationship Management
Provides accurate and timely processing of transactions, activities, services, etc. to respond to stakeholder requests in compliance with regulatory and risk controls.
Provides accurate, consistent, and knowledgeable responses to internal/external stakeholder questions and requests.
Follows documented policies and procedures to execute day-to-day transactions, activities, processes and meet all Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
Governance reviews of Vendors and coordination of stakeholder risk assessments within BMO’s vendor management framework.
Checks and reconciles information and documentation to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Identifies and analyzes issues and problems and resolves in a timely manner or escalates as required.
Develops and maintains effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders to execute work and fulfill service delivery expectations.
Develops and maintains an understanding of the regulatory requirements and risks inherent in the operations to take appropriate actions and maintain operational integrity.
Collaborates in the development/implementation of new processes/systems and changes/improvements to existing systems and processes.
Supports the development of tools and delivery of training focused on delivering business results.
Exercise judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Qualifications:
Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Knowledge and understanding of the business unit’s key products and services, processes and controls – Good.
Knowledge of the risk and regulatory requirements of the business – Good.
Prioritization skills – Good.
Customer service skills – In-depth.
PC skills (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint) – In-depth.
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making.
Good to have experiences with Charles River, Custodial systems.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

The Position:

The Brand Advocate Analyst for assigned supplier brand is responsible for creating and executing the supplier project strategy, generating and presenting analytical data, and providing insightful digital content findings to propel the brand’s conversion online. The Brand Advocate Analyst is also responsible for developing strong supplier relationships, executing against quarterly action plans and effectively communicating successes / progress within the account. The Brand Advocate program is a unique vendor funded model that provides brands the ability to leverage dedicated in-house Home Depot Canada associates to perform and expedite white-glove content enrichment initiatives.

Responsibilities:
EXECUTE PROJECT STRATEGY
Complete data maintenance tasks in digital content systems to drive account strategy
Produce and track weekly, monthly and quarterly supplier specific status reports to communicate project status and track key metrics including add to cart, conversion rate, sales, views, enrichment, SEO Ranking against baseline
PRESENTATION DEVELOPMENT
Build power point decks to effectively communicate during engagement (e.g. kick-off, weekly, monthly, quarterly etc.)
Communicate effectively and confidently with suppliers and internal leadership
GENERATE ANALYTICAL REPORTING
Utilize test-control experimental group testing, heat mapping and other metrics to enhance prioritized supplier's presence on PIPs
Leverage online reviews and Q&A to drive improvements on supplier product pages
CATEGORY INSIGHTS & STRATEGY
Collaborate with merchant to gain understanding of the supplier and the line of business
Analyze supplier and department specific data in order explain trends, impacts and inform strategy
Build category knowledge to assist in identifying items and enrichments to prioritize in project work
Leverage online reviews and Q&A to drive improvements on supplier product pages
Promote supplier adoption for Q&A and future user-generated content programs
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
Data analysis
Experience in Ecommerce, data management, process analysis and improvement
Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Effective interpersonal and problem solving skills

Experience / Knowledge Required:
Internal Candidates: Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+, Meets expectation, Consistently demonstrates).
Strong decision making and problem solving skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Access
Strong organizational, analytical and customer service skills
Positive, upbeat, can-do, professional and responsible attitude, independent and self-directed yet also team oriented
Influential; practiced in negotiating with others in ways that result in win-win outcomes

Bursting Silver Background
Bursting Silver is a professional services company focused on delivering technical solutions to Canadian and US associations, unions, regulatory bodies and non-governmental agencies. Bursting Silver has staff across Canada and the United States. We pride ourselves on having fun while we work, and we are looking for team members who have a passion for technology, are driven by providing exceptional service to clients, and love to find creative solutions to solve tough problems. Our service offerings include mobile applications, web-based applications, IT strategy, business analysis, project management, data migrations, system upgrades and application support.

You are an ambitious and accountable person, who is driven by serving clients, have a passion for technology, and love to find creative solutions to solve tough problems.
You are smart, agile, and self-motivated and can take an assignment head-on and run with it.
You are a strong communicator (English) with a friendly and helping personality.
You have a disciplined “get it done” work ethic that will allow you to work productively in a variety of environments – whether at the office, a client’s office, at your home office desk/couch…or Starbucks.
You are all about Team. Although we may not always be at the same place or working on the same project at the same time – we are always connected and communicating with one another to support each other. We leverage technology to the max.
You care. About your clients, your team, and your community. Giving back is such an integral part of what we do.
If this list describes you, please read on:
Job Description
Bursting Silver is seeking an iMIS Consultant to join our team. This position will require excellent questioning and listening skills and experience in solving business requirements through best practice usage of iMIS and the ability to adjust their style to suit the customer culture and experience. This will include leading and documenting requirements gathering then aligning those requirements to the iMIS product suite or working as part of the project team during implementations, as well as providing training and guidance on the product.
Requirements, Technical Skills And Qualifications
Qualifications
Association Industry knowledge
Prior experience implementing and supporting iMIS or other association management systems
Outstanding customer service skills
Strong problem solving
Proficiency in creating queries & reports using IQA, crystal reports, and/or SSRS reports
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to be efficient and highly productive
Core Competencies
Communication
Assists in/leads the facilitation of team and client meetings.
Delivers informative, well-organized presentations.
Understands how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully.
Holds regular status meetings with the development team.
Keeps development team well informed of changes within the organization and general corporate news.
Resolves and/or escalates issues in a timely fashion.
Problem Solving
Identifies critical issues with ease.
Exhibits confidence and a knowledge of emerging industry practices when solving business problems.
Pushes creative thinking beyond the boundaries of existing industry practices and client mindsets.
Leadership
Generates enthusiasm among team members.
Proactively seeks opportunities to serve in leadership roles.
Challenges others to develop as leaders while serving as a role model.
Manages the process of innovative change.
Identifies opportunities for improvement and makes constructive suggestions for change
Remains on the forefront of emerging industry practices.
Teamwork
Facilitates effective team interaction.
Acknowledges and appreciates each team member’s contributions.
Keeps track of lessons learned and shares those lessons with team members.
Client Management
Develops relationships with client personnel that fosters client ties.
Communicates effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions with project management.
Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.
Manages client expectations effectively.
Communicates effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative technical solutions.
Builds a knowledge base of each client’s business, systems, and objectives.
What We Offer
Flexible work hours
Subsidized mobile phone
Flexible work locations (e.g. remote working from home)
Extra paid days between Christmas and New Year’s Day (not included as vacation hours)
Professional development fund
Annual retreat at an exciting destination
Opportunities for growth within the company
Start Date
As soon as possible
Next Steps
Please forward applications via email to msnell@burstingsilver.com. Include a cover letter and resume. In the e-mail subject line, please indicate the position title “iMIS Consultant / Business Analyst”. We thank all applicants for their interest, but we will only be able to contact individuals being invited for an interview.
