Description

Location: National and remote

Ready to drive innovation and efficiency to support awesome team member experiences?


Join our team


The People & Culture (P&C) Digital Strategy and Enablement team is passionate about providing our team members with positive experiences, from the minute they say ‘yes’ to the time when they leave. We want to be easier to do business with and we’re ready to innovate and elevate ourselves and our processes/tools to make that happen. This team has deep knowledge and experience and takes great pride in their delivery of services to our customer – the TELUS team.


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together!


As a Senior Business Systems Analyst you will make a difference in the way TELUS employees work. You will leverage your technical acumen, creative problem-solving, collaborating and interpersonal skills to take on a broad array of challenges and deliver operational and customer service excellence. You will be key to maintaining data integrity, functionality and enhancements within our SAP On-premise foot print, while contributing to the migration to SAP Employee Central and to the support after go-live.
Here's how

Act as a SME in SAP delivery
Be the lead on translating business requests into functional and technical requirements and seeing them through the phases of an agile project to delivery in SAP HCM
Ensure our SAP system (core HR, pay, benefits and time) are properly configured and according to legislation, collective agreement, internal policies and/or best practice
Support daily operations, priorities and escalation management, that includes reporting, analyzing and resolving issues
Create and execute detailed functional and UAT testing in our test and production environments, supporting all changes in your portfolio
Lead various projects and system changes.

Operate as a Trusted Advisor and Ambassador:
Own your relationship with our customers and be the point of contact for their requests
Collaborate with key stakeholders to recommend the best solutions and deliver various programs for our team members, with a slant towards the team member experience
Support incident/escalation processes to minimize system outage time and exceed the quality of service
Provide critical business insights and thought leadership
Build strong relationships across the P&C community and represent P&C Digital Strategy and Enablement team at meetings both internally and externally with vendor partners
Act as a HRIS subject matter expert and conduct systems analysis including recommendations that drive strategic solutions
Prioritize the customer experience above all else
Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and innovation to drive improved team member experiences

Qualifications

You're the missing piece of the puzzle

Valued for your 5+ years of systems delivery experience
Working knowledge and/or experience working in an HR environment supporting HR programs, policies and related processes
Noted as a solid communicator and collaborator who can build strong relationships
Recognized for managing numerous competing priorities and commitments with extremely high attention to detail, in an organized manner
Ability to work independently as the senior system analyst and coach or guide team
Experience and comfort level acting as a subject matter expert and consultant
Comfortable with high volume work and changing environments and priorities
Self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic who owns their deliverables
Talented at translating complicated and seemingly impossible asks into clear, easy to understand and doable actions to meet your customers’ requirements
Expert knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word and PowerPoint), along with Google suite (Drive, Docs, Sheets, Gmail and Chat)
University degree or college diploma, with a slant towards Human Resources or Systems; project management slant

Nice-to-haves

Experience in SAP On-premise and SuccessFactors
SF certification in Onboarding, Platform and/or Employee Central
Experience with SAP On-premise and EC SuccessFactors transformations
Experience working in a remote team environment
Able to support change management efforts including business readiness documentation, drafting communications and FAQ
Experience building, assigning and tracking testing scenarios in Jira
CHRP or Payroll designation
Previous work experience in a Human Resources or Payroll department
Bilingual in English and French, both written and oral

The Opportunity:
Analyze and investigate our existing vendor and internal data pipelines to identify any discrepancies between implementation and business requirements.
Review the data pipeline code and analyze the data and compare against documentation; for instance, review whether the data appends or overwrite; whether a full snapshot is loaded, or only the delta; review the business transformation logic; review whether all files or a subset from the vendor is being processed; review the JSON parsing logic to see if data attributes are correctly mapped; review attribute names against naming conventions, etc.
Work with Data Leads and Data Engineering to remediate any discrepancies – update requirements, make modifications to the pipeline code, or leave as is.
Manage and enhance investment data infrastructure through initiatives such as improving metadata and data integrity
Stay current with trends in the data and analytics space (e.g. data visualization techniques, Big Data, etc.)
Consider applying if you have most of the following:
A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or other quantitative discipline.
Minimum of 5 years of direct experience
Familiarity with financial data vendors such as Bloomberg, S&P and Refinitiv and their product offerings
Solid programming skills (ie. Python, pyspark, SQL) with professional programming experience in a data context is a must (e.g. data extraction, data manipulation, data analysis, etc.)
Good understanding of key financial data concepts such as financial statement data, pricing and market data, ESG data and security master data.
Strong analytical skills; detail oriented
Knowledge of visualization techniques would be an asset
Strong communication skills both written and verbal
Ability to work under pressure to deliver within time-sensitive deadlines
Demonstrated interest in financial markets; ability to interpret economic news and market conditions; a CFA is a plus
Passionate to learn new technology
Successful candidates must be team players and exemplify CPP Investment Board’s guiding principles of high performance, integrity, and partnership
Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

column2: Lead Product Analyst, Global Supplier Tech
column7:
Lead Product Analyst, Global Supplier Technology
Who We Are
Wayfair Analytics is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. We are excited to bring our aspiration of ‘the best two-sided marketplace for home’ to reality by connecting millions of customers and thousands of suppliers across the globe in new ways. This represents a step function change to our model, by unlocking highly motivated suppliers and delighting customers with a tighter, more immersive experience. We will be in a position to better serve our customers across a range of diverse categories, stores and geos, growing our market share substantially.
We are looking for a Lead Product Analyst to join the Partner Home organization, Wayfair’s supplier-facing user experience, supporting Wayfair and our many suppliers globally to reach their growth ambitions. In this role, you will directly partner with teams across Product, Engineering and UX to design on-site tests and analyze user behavior patterns to improve our supplier-facing sites
What You’ll Do
Work directly with the Engineering team to create entirely new supplier experiences and improve the existing ones.
Develop an understanding of how end users behave through data, using that understanding to define and track KPIs for our supplier experience.
Become the subject matter expert for data, analytics, and testing of our supplier-facing applications to ensure accurate and proper interpretation of core business metrics and supplier behavior.
Perform deep-dive analysis, including advanced analytical techniques, to solve some of the more critical and complex business problems including website funnel progression or user segmentation and targeting.
Shape the product roadmap and recommend improvements by analyzing data from our live products, identifying the most impactful ways for data and analytics to drive decision making and accelerate profitable growth.
Work alongside partner teams to implement your product recommendations.
Develop data visualizations, including reports, dashboards, and analyses to distribute data insights in an easily digestible manner to all relevant stakeholders and integration partners.
What You’ll Need
4+ years experience in an Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Science or Engineering role performing quantitative analysis.
Proficient knowledge of SQL (incl. aggregate functions, joins, etc.) or other structured programming language(s) (e.g. Python, R, JavaScript). Experience with GBQ is a plus.
Hands-on experience conducting quantitative analyses on large data sets. Experience with Google Data Studio, Looker and Google Analytics 360 a plus.
Experience designing and implementing complex and innovative analytics solutions that drive business decision making.
Excellent communication and data presentation skills covering objectives, plans, status, roadblocks and results.
Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, Management or other quantitative discipline field.
Previous Ecommerce or Retail Analytics experience is a plus.
About Wayfair Inc.
Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.
No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.
We are interested in retaining your data for a period of 12 months to consider you for suitable positions within Wayfair. Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (which can found here). If you have any questions regarding our processing of your personal data, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com. If you would rather not have us retain your data please contact us anytime at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

Job Type: Permanent
Reference code: 120424
Primary Location: Toronto, ON
All Available Locations: Toronto, ON

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.
-

Do you have a passion for unlocking the value of data? Keep reading!
What will your typical day look like?

As a Data Analyst in the Shared Technology Solutions Team, you will guide the creation of data-centric deliverables where your work will have a meaningful enterprise-wide impact. You will define integration patterns working with Cloud technologies. Working with internal stakeholders you will capture requirements, data mappings and business processes. You will influence design and enable the creation of solutions. Working with the delivery teams, you will maintain standards, best practices and methodologies and enable maturity of system engineering, quality assurance and analysis. You may produce conceptual and logical data models for enterprise subject areas. You will collaborate with Enterprise Architects as appropriate to ensure solutions fit into a larger picture. You will interact with Infrastructure, Portfolio, Business and IT leadership representatives. You have strong interpersonal skills and have a demonstrated ability to work with nuanced data concepts.
About the team

Our Team builds and maintains Enterprise Data Integration solutions required for the firm (Data Lake, MDM solution, RDM solution). Our onshore team is located within Toronto coupled with additional team-members within Hyderabad, India. We are part of the larger Solutions Delivery group within Deloitte’s ITS (National Information Technology Services).
Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone with:

University degree or equivalent work experience
Strong commitment to professional client service excellence
Demonstrated knowledge of agile project development methodology
5+ years' experience performing Data Analysis activity
Experience with producing conceptual and logical data models is an advantage
Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to effectively work with multiple stakeholders and lead others in teams
Superior verbal and written communications skills including oral presentation and building business case
Successful delivery utilizing offshore capabilities considered an asset

Our promise to our people: Deloitte is where potential comes to life.

Be yourself, and more.
We are a group of talented people who want to learn, gain experience, and develop skills. Wherever you are in your career, we want you to advance.
You shape how we make impact.
Diverse perspectives and life experiences make us better. Whoever you are and wherever you’re from, we want you to feel like you belong here. We provide flexible working options to support you and how you can contribute. Be the leader you want to be.
Be the leader you want to be
Some guide teams, some change culture, some build essential expertise. We offer opportunities and experiences that support your continuing growth as a leader.
Have as many careers as you want.
We are uniquely able to offer you new challenges and roles – and prepare you for them. We bring together people with unique experiences and talents, and we are the place to develop a lasting network of friends, peers, and mentors. Our TVP is about relationships – between leaders and their people, the firm and its people, peers, and within in our communities.

The next step is yours

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.
We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

CI Financial is an independent company offering global wealth management and asset management advisory services through a diverse group of financial services firms. Since 1965, we have consistently anticipated and responded to the changing needs of investors. We are driven by a commitment to provide individuals and institutions with the highest-quality investments and advice. Our commitment to the highest levels of performance means that whatever their position, CI employees must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment that will stretch them to tap into their highest potential. Employees that have a healthy dose of ambition, a desire to commit to a curious mindset for continuous learning, and a willingness to go the extra mile, thrive at CI.

At CI, we see a great place to work as one that is a safe place for everyone to have a voice, where people are empowered to take ownership over meaningful work, where there is opportunity to grow through stretching themselves, where they can work on innovative products and projects, and where employees are supported and engaged to do so.
JOB OVERVIEW

The Senior Analyst is a subject matter expert for advisor and client financial and non-financial business data assets with a focus on Assante Wealth Management. Leveraging this knowledge of corporate data, the Senior Analyst provides information, analysis, and/or data visualization support to business partners and stakeholders within and across the CI Financial group of companies for the purpose making high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Administration of Assante Reward and Recognition programs, including
Monthly preparation including acting as key contact gathering and providing information to/from external companies
Post processing review and testing of results to ensure accuracy
Providing results to fields teams and key branches
Responding to inquiries from advisors, assistants and field staff throughout the year
Maintenance & enhancements of intranet pages
Yearly preparation for final process and intensive testing of internal and external data
Track and register program participants
Provide guidance to relationship managers during practice and branch transitions
Provide senior management with results for sign off
Liaise with other departments for year-end and new program year launch
Develop reports, dashboards and perform ad-hoc queries as required using the appropriate reporting technologies
Interpret the data and help business units to understand and make use of the data
Create data visualizations that support decision making
Proactively identify, recommend and deliver automation and innovative reporting that is both effective and introduces efficiencies in process, where able
Understand how systems are used by operational teams in ways that impact data and identify data dependencies
Work with Data Governance to protect data assets
Where data is not readily available, support business needs by clarifying requirements and acting as a liaison between corporate departments and IT to obtain required information
Responsible for data quality and accuracy [system enhancements/upgrades]
Subject matter expert resource on data for projects assigned
Create and execute test plans and document project summaries
Key contact for internal and external sales sources, including sales and asset reporting from, dealership system reports
Monitor operational reports for consistency and accuracy
Prepare and maintain process documents to support reporting best practices
WHAT YOU WILL BRING:
Experience
3 + years related working experience in the Financial Services industry
3+ years working with Data, including reporting and testing
Education/Training
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Analytics or Statistics and/or equivalent applicable analysis experience
Certified Analytics Professional (CAP) designation and/or other related analytics education is an asset
Canadian Securities Course and/or IFIC Mutual Funds Course and/or other related industry education (i.e. CFP) is an asset
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills
Working knowledge of Salesforce Report and Dashboard functions an asset
SQL read and write skills an asset
Experience using SAP Business Objects, Microsoft Power BI, Tableau and/or other business intelligence tools an asset
Microsoft Office including advanced Excel skills
Knowledge of business processing systems
Strong time management and organization skills to manage multiple priorities skills
Strong technical knowledge in data mining, reporting tools
Strong attention to detail in large data sets; strong commitment to data accuracy and integrity
Strong process mapping skills
Good relationship management skills
Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US
Our dedication to the Employee Experience at CI is aimed at supporting, empowering and inspiring our talented team through:
Recognition & Compensation
Training & Development
Health & Well-being
Communication & Feedback

Job Number: 48343
Group: Magna Powertrain
Division: GO Concord
Job Type: Permanent/Regular
Location: Concord, Ontario/Aurora, Ontario

Group Introduction
Advancing mobility. Making automotive technology that is smarter, cleaner, and safer, while still fun to drive. And making it for everyone. That’s what we’re passionate about at Magna Powertrain. We do it by creating world-class powertrain solutions for conventional, hybrid, and pure electric vehicles. We’re making electrification more than a buzzword, we’re bringing it to the road. Innovation is what drives us and we drive innovation. Dream big and create the future of mobility at Magna Powertrain.

Role Summary
The Senior IT Analyst & Project Coordinator's role is to ensure that the performance obligations of in-house computing systems are met and are in line with the standards set by Magna Global IT. This includes gathering and analyzing data in support of systems management, maintenance, and performance. The Senior IT Analyst & Project Coordinator is also responsible for being the primary IT escalation point for the senior leadership team onsite, generating and compiling reports based on their findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues. This individual will be responsible for monitoring project progress and creating project status reports for project managers and stakeholders. Assisting with resource scheduling so that team members have the resources they need to complete their tasks. Scheduling stakeholder meetings and facilitating communication between the project manager and stakeholders throughout the project life cycle. Managing project management documents such as the project plan, budget, schedule or scope statement, as directed by the project manager. Executing a variety of project management administrative tasks, Support team members when implementing risk management strategies. Foster cross-team collaboration. This Individual will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve malfunctions and make the appropriate recommendations in order to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments.
Key Responsibilities
Provide guidance and/or instruction to all team members Be the IT point of escalation for senior leadership onsite Lead IT projects, audits and ensure security compliance.
Analyze day-to-day functions and processes of infrastructure, software and database resources to ensure they are performing within predetermined guidelines, limits, and specifications.
End User Support, ensure that local IT infrastructure is operational and performing well.
Support project managers, systems administrators, and end users to define systems goals, and identify and resolve systems issues.
Identify and establish scope and parameters of systems analysis in order to define outcome criteria and measure-taking actions.
Develop and document research, data retrieval, and data analysis methodologies for use by other personnel.
Conduct research on hardware and software products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts.
Create systems and performance models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to key systems staff.
Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in operating systems across the organization
Maintaining and monitoring project plans, project schedules, work hours, budgets, and expenditures.
Organizing, attending, and participating in stakeholder meetings.
Documenting and following up on important actions and decisions from meetings.
Preparing necessary presentation materials for meetings.
Ensuring project deadlines are met.
Determining project changes.
Providing administrative support as needed.
Undertaking project tasks as required.
Developing project strategies.
Ensuring projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project.
Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable.
Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution.
Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute minutes to all project team members.
Create a project management calendar for fulfilling each goal and objective.
Key Qualifications/Requirements
Knowledge and Education
Completion of community college or bachelor’s degree (computer science, information science, or management information systems); Project Management Professional (PMP) credentials after obtaining community college or bachelor's degree and experience-optional

Work Experience
Minimum of 7 years of work-related experience

Skills and Competencies
Strong customer service orientation
Teamwork and Collaboration
Proven experience in IT Operations processes and ITIL
Proven experience in end user support
Proven experience with Microsoft Office Suite including Office365
Extensive knowledge of Active Directory, Group Policy, and Organizational Units
Extensive knowledge supporting Microsoft Windows Operating Systems, both Server and Workstation
Extensive practical knowledge in importing data for use in report software, spreadsheets, graphs, and flow charts
Extensive experience with core software applications, knowledge of Matrix42 and Empirum would be an advantage
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and mathematical skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent listening and interpersonal skills
Excellent understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives
Knowledge on office information systems, relational database architectures, internet and intranet development
Knowledge on VMware vSphere ESX 4/ESXi 5/5.1/5.5/6.0, vCentre 4/5.5, vMotion.
Knowledge on networking technologies of routers, switches, VLAN management, and Wi-Fi
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
Proficiency in program management and database software programs
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of cross-cultural and international issues as well as in-country workplace norms and is able to learn and work with people from diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds
Demonstrate the ability to select and use appropriate technology to accomplish assigned tasks
Ability to manage and use data efficiently to solve problems and learn and adapt to new technologies effectively, in teams and individually
Ability to conduct research into systems issues and products as required
Ability to communicate ideas to technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to effectively troubleshoot Local Area Network issues as they arise
Logical and efficient
Highly self-motivated and directed
Keen attention to detail
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Perks and Benefits
Magna Powertrain offers a variety of competitive perks and benefits, including:

Hybrid work arrangement (remote work up to 2 days/week)
Brand new, modern, and collaborative work environment*
On-site cafeteria offering a variety of delicious menu options for breakfast and lunch
Social events, including summer BBQs, charity events and holiday events
Magna-owned Park (Simeon Park) offering basketball courts, volleyball courts, trails, swimming pool, etc.
3 (three) weeks vacation to start
Flexible benefits program (competitive coverage, flex-dollar option for services not covered in standard plan, like pet insurance)
Registered Retirement Savings Program (RRSP) employer match up to 3%
Profit Sharing Program with 3% Magna Base Contribution (MBC)
“Summer Fridays” (shorter working day on Fridays in the summer months)
Employee & Family Assistance Program
Employee Discount Program & Vehicle Purchase Incentive Program
Best Doctors by Teladoc Medical Experts Program
Comprehensive training program and reimbursement for courses and programs directly related to job

Magna Powertrain Group Office will be relocating to a new space located in Aurora, ON beginning October 2022.
Additional Information
Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.
Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.
At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

What makes us a different kind of employer?

As a national health solutions partner, Medavie is committed to improving the wellbeing of Canadians — and in our digital-first culture, technology is key to providing the products, services and solutions that increase access to care and improve health outcomes.

Our technology team is the backbone of our organization with over 500 employees and growing. We are constantly creating, testing, and learning to enable personalized, digital experiences in all we do.

When you join us, you’ll be part of an in-house, innovation led team focused on cutting edge digital health solutions that help provide the best care possible, when and where it’s needed.

Job Title:
Software System Analyst

Department:
External Facing Applications

Competition:
84591

Internal/External:
Internal/External

Employment Type:
Full Time, Permanent

Location:
Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, PEI, Newfoundland, Quebec, Ontario - Remote

Salary:
Competitive Compensation and Benefits

Reports To:
Manager



The Opportunity:

We’re looking for an outstanding Software System Analyst to join us in improving and revitalizing our client-facing applications. You’ll collaborate with the team to turn complex business needs and functional requirements into high-quality software solutions, while following departmental software engineering processes, methodologies and standards.

Our ideal candidate is collaborative and team-minded, while also being capable of independent self-direction. You're a great communicator, with a knack for innovative solutions and a keen interest in dynamic and emerging technologies. You see challenges as puzzles to be solved, not roadblocks. You are detail-oriented and organized, able to understand the big-picture goal while focusing on a complex timeline of tasks.

Your everyday with us will consist of:

Analyze requirements and conceptualize, define and document appropriate solution considering development and Quality Assurance
Analyze data and system integrations to understand underlying functional impacts introduced through business requirements
Troubleshoot defects in JAVA software solutions (front-end and back-end JAVA components) to determine root cause of a defect, including setup of data and application components in a development environment for the purpose of re-creating an issue and subsequently determining root cause
Estimate with high degree of accuracy the effort required to produce appropriate solution
Lead efforts to carry out appropriate solution with goal of fulfilling all business requirements
Assess business needs and document requirements
Transition and communicate problem solution to designers, developers and testers
Communicate and collaborate with business counterparts the solution status and plans
Advise, persuade &/or negotiate on problems or situations of a simple to complex nature
Manage multiple priorities and activities
Provide supervision, leadership, mentorship, coaching and guidance to any team members, coaching and guidance to any software development team members, ensuring all members follow the software development guidelines provided.
Plan and coordinate simple to complex projects and activities with software development team members and any stakeholders both internal to Medavie Blue Cross and external clients

What’s in it for you?


What makes us a different kind of employer? Our award-winning culture, a team who really cares, unmatched training and support are all dedicated to ensuring you are set up for success.

What we offer:


Permanent full-time position with opportunity to grow in a well-established organization
Flexible work arrangements and emphasis on work-life balance
Remote and hybrid work options
Comprehensive health, vision and dental plan that is 100% employer paid effective on your first day
100% employer-matched Defined Contribution Pension Plan
Annual Incentive Bonus which recognizes your contribution to our success.
In addition to paid vacation, we offer a gifted week of vacation in your first year and an optional Vacation Purchase Program.
An organization where we encourage personal learning and growth with opportunities for career development and advancement
Emphasis on work life balance, providing wellness benefits, health resources and fitness center discounts

What you need to succeed:

Education: University degree or college diploma in Computer Science or a similar program

Work Experience: 7+ years in a functional or system analyst role, and 3+ years hands-on JAVA software development experience

Work Status: Due to Security Clearance requirement, we need candidate to be in Canada for at least 5 years and their status should be Permanant Resident or Citizen now.

Language Skills: Proficiency in English is required (written & spoken). Proficiency in French would be an asset.

Skills : Hands on experience in technical solution design, software specifications, conceptualization and development of both front-end and back-end JAVA software components; software development experience with JAVAScript technologies such as Vue.js or Angular.js would be an asset; Hands on experience in agile projects; Customer oriented and focused on delivering high value innovative software solutions.

Job Number: 47769
Group: Magna Exteriors
Division: Rollstamp Manufacturing (Staffern)
Job Type: Permanent/Regular
Location: CONCORD

Group Description
The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.
Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

Role Summary
Develop, implement, and monitor all key functions related to inventory transactions to assure that they are accurate and timely.
Key Responsibilities
Coordinate a cycle count program in a perpetual inventory environment.
Coordinate the cycle count progress and results to identify necessary recounts and processes to be monitored and provide regular reports on the results
Perform thorough research and document inventory discrepancies using all available resources to identify root causes and supply possible solutions.
Work with key personnel to effectively implement process improvements to operational procedures in an effort to proactively optimize overall location and item level accuracy and maintain the highest possible productivity levels.
Coordinate the efforts of the cycle counts in an effort to identify and correct discrepancies on items at the location level as needed.
Key Responsibilities cont'd
Responsible for ensuring TRANS4M system inventory integrity. This includes:
Weekly cycle counts on all production parts as per Cycle Count Schedule.
The calculation of WIP,RAW & FINISHED GOODS cycle count accuracy on a monthly basis.
Printing and analyzing the “Negative Inventory” report daily.
Communicates and assists production personnel to resolve incorrect data entries or inventory discrepancies.
Tracks disagreements, graphs history, and publishes measurement results. Generates, distributes, and files Inventory Reports.
Coordinates Cycle Count scheduling with Cycle Counters. Responsible for maintaining and issuing cycle count sheet masters to Cycle Counters.
Responsible for root cause analysis of inventory discrepancies and implementing corrective actions to avoid re-occurrence.
Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.
Key Qualifications/Requirements
College or University graduate or equivalent.
Good understanding of production functions & inventory control
Automotive manufacturing background as well as familiarity with Automotive MRP Systems Inventory Control, Production Reporting.
Minimum of two years related experience preferred.
Familiarity with personal computers and Microsoft software.
Strong mathematical aptitude, good organizational skills and good English communication skills required (verbal and written).
Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.
At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Delbridge Solutions is growing!
Delbridge Solutions is one of North America’s fastest growing technology companies. With offices in Toronto, USA, and Europe, we provide world-class software solutions for Budgeting, Forecasting, Reporting, Business Intelligence, and Sales Performance Management. Majority of our clients are Fortune 1000 companies and trust Delbridge Solutions as a partner to support their business processes.
We are looking for creative, entrepreneurial, and ambitious individuals who share our passion for growth!
Who you are:
You are an experienced Business Systems Analyst who enjoys working with clients, understanding their needs and translating to technical specifications. You are comfortable with SQL. You want an opportunity to grow your technical expertise by learning new technologies. You want to be recognized for your innovation and your insights. As a client-focused, technologically astute problem solver, you are ready to join a rapidly scaling mid-sized company that is effectively carving out their share of the market. You are ambitious, and you want to join a company that is ready to invest in you the way you invest in them.
You want to:
Be recognized. You want to move up the ranks quickly. You want your achievements to be applauded and appreciated.
Be an innovator. You want to bring your ideas to the table and see them implemented.
Be a leader. You want to customize smart solutions and work in partnership with our clients. You want to mentor junior team members.
What you will be doing as our Business Systems Analyst:
Develop a deep, multilayered understanding of the business issues and the data challenges of the clients’ organizations and their industries.
Assist in ensuring requirements are clear and complete, eliminating uncertainties and ambiguities.
Assist in developing requirement matrices to identify any gaps.
Support the creation of detailed, functional and non-functional requirements documents.
Support the creation of test strategy/plans, execute test cases, regression testing and defect management.
Establish the quality of solutions through validation against the requirements.
Demonstrate collegial teamwork internally and with clients, by communicating clearly with all project team members to identify and resolve issues for delivery success.
Participate in the development of project plans to establish appropriate workload expectations and schedules.
What you will bring to the team and Delbridge Solutions:
Bachelor’ degree in Computer Science/ Engineering or a related field
Related experience as a business systems analyst in a business environment
Working with databases and/or BI tools
Familiarity with software development and project management lifecycle practices
Ability to write/execute basic to intermedial SQL and work with relational databases
Analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively to convey complex ideas, verbally and in writing, to both business/technical staff and customers.
Ability to effectively manage multiple projects/tasks varying in complexity, meet deadlines and work well under pressure
Well-developed organization and time management skills
A proactive attitude with a hunger for developing your knowledge
Why Delbridge Solutions:
As Delbridge Solutions grows, our leadership team is focused on:
Fostering a collaborative environment because we believe that everyone here has a valuable contribution to make, that together we can develop a deeper understanding of our position in the market and the needs of our clients.
Recognizing our people through quarterly rewards, performance bonuses and accelerated career paths. Whether you want to move up in Professional Services, across to Project Management, or Solution Architect, Delbridge Solutions wants to give you the chance to prove yourself - and we will recognize and rewards your efforts.

column2: Senior Analyst - Risk Modeling & Pricing Analytics
column7:
Job Description
Senior Risk Analyst
About Toyota Financial Services
Toyota Financial Services (TFS) provides retail, leasing and wholesale financial services to Toyota and Lexus dealerships and customers across Canada. TFS is a member of Toyota Financial Services Corporation (TFSC), a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation in Japan. The Canadian headquarters of TFS are in Markham, Ontario.
What Sets Us Apart?
At Toyota Financial Services (TFS), you will help create best in class customer experiences in an innovative, collaborative and team focused environment. TFS is an important part of the Toyota family, an award-winning global company, recognized worldwide for our technological leadership and superior standards of quality, continuous improvement and environmental responsibility.
TFS currently has an exciting full-time permanent opportunity as a Senior Analyst - Risk Modeling & Pricing Analytics, reporting to the Manager, Risk Management. This role resides in our Markham Office.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Developing and continuously improving predictive models used throughout the lending lifecycle, including custom credit scorecards, automated credit adjudication models and fraud detection rules.
Producing reports to senior management on the performance of the company’s retail loan and lease portfolios, including credit adjudication, originations, delinquency and credit losses.
Utilizing the company’s statistical models to prepare lending rate proposals and lease-end loss forecasts; contributing to the development and refinement of these models.
Supporting the company’s retail loan and lease pricing decisions by preparing and presenting lending rate proposals.
Producing and presenting proposals for the establishment of lease end residual values based on vehicle pricing and re-sale value data.
Producing various scheduled and ad hoc reports using database queries and reporting tools.
Assisting with the creation and modification of new business pricing, residual value and credit risk management policies and procedures, as well as process maps used to ensure risk control.
Contributing to the specification of requirements and participating in user acceptance testing of enhancements to the company’s data warehouse to meet risk management needs.
What You’ll Bring:
A bachelor's or master’s degree with a quantitative focus in an applied context, such as applied math, statistics, economics, engineering or finance.
At least 5-years’ experience as an analyst responsible for financial risk management.
Demonstrated experience in applying programming languages such as SQL and Python to the extraction, transformation and analysis of data.
Thorough understanding of how to develop and maintain machine learning models, preferably in a retail lending context.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and forecasting techniques such as regression analysis.
Thorough understanding of the concepts of financial accounting.
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
Automotive lending experience is preferred but not required.
What We’ll Bring:
Hybrid work environment
A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility and respect
Competitive salary including bonus
Health and dental benefits effective immediately.
Company pension plan with matched contribution
Associate vehicle discount program
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement
Fitness reimbursement
Great company culture-Respect for people and continuous improvement is at our core

Sability is honored to be named as the 2021 UKG HCM Services Partner of the year, for the second year in a row! Join our team and experience the culture of an award-winning team.

This position is remote within Canada; Ontario preferred. Travel up to 50% is required.

Job Description
Sability is looking for professionals to join our team. In this developmental position, the HCM Business Analyst/Junior Consultant is responsible for analyzing and developing client HR, workforce management (WFM) and payroll business processes, data models and requirements, documentation, validating and analyzing HR and payroll testing results, based on the project attachment. Consulting projects include best practice reviews, request for proposals, business case development, system implementations and compliance and control framework assessments. This is a great opportunity to expand your HR knowledge and career path within HR.

Responsibilities
Scribe and document business process review sessions and create Visio maps, RACI charts and other related documentation.
Analyze processes, develop process analytics/metrics, and identify best practice gaps.
Review legacy systems and supporting data conversions, including cleansing HR and payroll data.
Document business requirements, issues, and opportunities.
Conduct various testing cycles for system implementations.
Create and review documentation, user guides and job aides.
Skills/Requirements
Team oriented and excellent communicator.
Critical thinking and analytical skills.
Possess excellent written and oral communication skills.
Organized, detailed oriented, and thorough in creating high quality outputs.
Be highly proficient in the use of Microsoft Office (e.g., Excel, Word).
Have a working knowledge and general understanding of Human Resources, Workforce Management, and Payroll.
Have familiarity and or working experience with various HCM, HRIS and Payroll solutions (e.g., ADP, Workday, SAP, UKG, Ceridian, Payworks).
Bilingual candidates (English and French) are preferred.
Human Capital Management (HCM) system implementation and/or enrolled towards achieving a professional designation in HR and/or Payroll preferred.
Microsoft Visio experience is preferred.
Candidates should have a university/college degree in Human Resources, accounting, or business administration.
Career path
Business analysts/junior consultants begin their careers focusing on information research, interviews, and classical analysis. With a few years of experience under their belt, new opportunities arise, and they will be involved in larger, more complex files with an expectation of more thorough analyses.

About Sability
Sability is a Human Capital Management strategy and software services Consultancy. We specialize in HCM and WFM System Selection, Design, and Implementation. Sability is the Human Capital Management (HCM) industry’s premier UKG partner and a leading HCM strategy and advisory consulting firm. For nearly three decades, we have helped companies navigate HCM modernization, from strategy and planning to implementation and managed services.

Our mission is simple: we help our clients achieve their HCM goals

Our culture is unique: we have a t-shirt and jeans attitude, while providing white glove services.

Our results are undeniable: we measure our success by helping others.

Sability team members are known for their ability to leverage their knowledge to help our customers, stay calm in a crisis, and maintain confidence – while delivering services in highly visible situations. From sunny San Diego to bustling Toronto, and the beaches in Ft Lauderdale to the slopes of Vancouver, and everywhere in between, our award-winning team has a spot for you! Working remotely is nothing new to us, we’ve been doing it successfully for over 20 years.
Experienced HCM consultants choose Sability for our flexible work environment and sense of pride and ownership in the success of our clients. We offer virtual full-time employment opportunities across the US and Canada and are a five-time recipient of SHRM’s “When Work Works” award for workplace flexibility. As a high-growth company, we have also been recognized as a member of the Inc. 5000 and one of Inc. Magazine’s Best Workplaces. If you want to be a part of that, you’re at the right place. Sability is always on the move, and we’re always seeking the best talent and the most unique perspectives.

TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Building a World-Class Technology Team at TD

Our vision to be the Better Bank is grounded in our purpose-driven and forward-focused strategy. Amidst a rapidly changing landscape, we know that technology plays a critical role in achieving this vision and delivering on our strategy. It also signals the need to accelerate investment in emerging capabilities to adapt to the changes happening around us and respond to customer needs more quickly. To accomplish this, we're evolving our Platforms, introducing key enterprise Practices and re-imagining our customer Journeys as part of the Next Evolution of Work (NEW). The Data-as-a-Service Platform will provide data capabilities and assets focused on supporting Journeys, other Platforms, and our colleagues.
We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
TD Data and Information Management covers building, developing, designing, and implementing involved with tech data management solutions. Where do we begin? These experts analyze, design, develop and support TD's info management system; lead and support bank data curation; develop data road map and info management strategies; focus on complex data integration, and drive use of our data reference model. This area doesn't work in isolation. We love data and we feel the same about integration and our assignments prove it.
There's room to grow in all of it.
Job Description
About This Role

The Data as a Service (DaaS) Platform aims to develop a centralized data strategy and roadmap to enable TD to shift to a data-driven organization and help us extract value from the data we create, collect and consume to better serve our stakeholders. Our vision is to provide fast access to trusted data assets in the most cost-effective manner. As a colleague in the DaaS Platform you will play a critical role in helping TD to shift to an even more data-driven organization, democratizing data for strategic consumption and use, and helping us extract more value from the data we create, collect and consume to better serve our stakeholders. #TDData

We need someone to provide technical leadership covering a range of data analysis functions. These include data modeling, structured query language (SQL), data quality, data profiling, extract-transform-load (ETL), metadata enrichment and management, data provenance and lineage, report design and other specialized data management functions. You're a solid, independent, senior lead equipped to manage and direct activities related to analysis, design and support of technical data management solutions for larger projects.
Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:
Elicit, analyze, interpret business and data requirements to develop complete business solutions, includes data models (entity relationship diagrams, dimensional data models), ETL and business rules, data life cycle management, governance, lineage, metadata and reporting elements.
Apply automation and innovation on new and on-going data platforms for those development projects aligned to business or organizational strategies.
Design, implement reporting platforms (e.g. modeling, ETL, BI framework) and complex ETL frameworks that meet business requirements.
Work with technology/project teams to understand the business meaning of data, provide analysis and requirements so that data design is fully understood and the development initiatives are in line with intended design and standards.
Deliver business or enterprise data deliverables (that adhere to enterprise frameworks) for various platforms/servers/applications/systems.
Provide data analysis and requirements within enterprise platform (e.g. Hadoop).
Implement processes aligned to data management standards, ensure data quality and requirements are embedded in/adhered to within system development deliverables.
Develop, maintain knowledge of data available from upstream sources and data within various platforms.
Perform data profiling using TD tooling and ad hoc system query languages to validate data analysis.
Help development and testing teams resolve data issues.
Support the user community by helping them interpret data.
Engage with data managers, stewards and owners to implement, maintain, enhance data governance, quality and related policies, aligning with TD's standards and frameworks.
Ensure capture of requirements related to data privacy and security, governance and access controls.
Respect TD's technology delivery practices, standards, project management disciplines.
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:
Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.
5-7 years relevant experience.
Advanced knowledge of the technical environment/tools for own area .
Advanced knowledge of business processes and procedures on a broad, organizational level.
Sound to advanced knowledge of business, standards, infrastructure, architecture and technology from a design/support/ solutions perspective.
Consulted as expert subject matter expert in at least one area of discipline to support clients/or project teams with research, analysis, design, hardware/ software support, solutions development and testing.
History as a collaborative team player, strength in communicating clearly with partners to elicit information/data requirements.
Capacity and eagerness to work independently as a senior/lead role on multiple tasks, and also coach/educate/guide/direct others.
Ability to assume assignments that are moderate- to highly- complex and multi-faceted, to be performed under management guidance.
Additional Information
Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:
Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,

MRM creatively engineers total human experiences. Through purposeful, dynamic intersections between strategy, creative, technology and data sciences, MRM operates in a borderless, integrated way, to allow for greater collaboration and velocity— all to the service of helping businesses grow meaningful relationships with people. MRM has 35-plus offices across North America, Latin America, Europe, the Middle East and Asia Pacific. For more information, please visit www.mrm.com.

About the Role:
The Sr. Data Analyst role will be responsible for executing a wide variety of database focused analyses in support of a client that is looking for help to join disparate data sets and develop more automated reporting solutions. This role will support the Manager in understanding the client’s business and analytic needs, in terms of developing reporting that promotes decision making and insights that drive to recommended actions. This role will work alongside a global team of resources to automate data ingestion, data cleansing and data management. In this role, the senior analyst will have exposure to a wide variety of data analysis and Business Intelligence tools such as Azure Synapse, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Power BI and will be expected to apply these tools on a daily basis.

Responsibilities:
Plan, design, and have ongoing accountability for the creation of cutting-edge visualizations to meet our client’s needs
Assist in building state-of-the-art, multi-cloud capable products by:
Automating build and deployment processes
Creating solutions that include custom-made, open source and 3rd party solutions for solving pertinent business problems
Serve a multitude of functions including but not limited to: investigation of new product features, identifying new opportunities (in technology or to advance our client’s goals), creating internal processes for removing obstacles within the team
Responsible for creating documentation and educational materials that capture best practices for utilizing product, data governance and data management
Be an integral player in verification of enterprise databases to allow for confirmation of data integrity and investigation of any discrepancies
Utilize SQL (preferably MDX) to create new data engineering processes, perform database management, and identify best practices
Develop creative solutions in visualization, data management and automation that help drive our business forward
Continuously look for improvements, monitor quality levels, and manage quality problems
Lead client conversations related to ongoing initiatives where you embody our team’s “we’ll figure it out” mindset


Required Skills

Education and Experience
At least 3+ years of experience in data and analytics
Must demonstrate strong analytical skills
Highly accountable self-starter with the ability to work well within a group, as well as independently
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Information Technology preferred
Knowledge and experience with SQL (preferably in SQL Server) and MDX (preferred, not required) coding languages
Experience with ETL and ETL tools (SQL Server Integration Services is preferred, but other tools such as Airflow would work)
Demonstrated experience using Power BI (preferably with DAX experience) – with a keen eye towards industry trends in data visualization
Knowledge and experience within Azure preferred (Databricks or Data Factory to access Data Lakes, SSAS, Synapse and Function)
Certifications in Power BI and other tools listed above is desired
Some working business understanding, to help reclassify business data into usable format
Must have strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Must be able to handle multiple clients and projects simultaneously
Must be proficient in MS Office (Excel and PowerPoint); advanced Excel skills a plus
Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and evolve as business requirements change.

Summary: Onix is currently seeking a passionate, engaging and motivated individual to fill a position in the role of Salesforce Data/Reporting Analyst. This person will help to lead the ongoing development of reporting and analytics from our Salesforce environment that includes Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and FinancialForce. A successful candidate will have strong technical and data management skills as well as a good understanding of data structure and business processes. This individual should have a strong track record of executing well on daily tasks and have experience in importing, exporting, cleaning, transforming, validating, and modeling within the Salesforce.com environment. This candidate will also have a record of success in leveraging relevant Salesforce data in key executive KPI dashboards both internal and external to the Salesforce environment. The analyst will work closely with a Salesforce administrator, functional leaders, organizational units, and subject matter experts to identify, develop, and deploy new business processes including Marketing, Sales, Finance, Order Management, and our core program business processes.

Location: Remote-Nationwide, Remote-Ontario, Remote-Quebec

Scope/Level of Decision Making : This is a position responsible for driving the data and operational needs of Onix as a whole as it relates to Salesforce. In this position, you’ll be responsible for maintaining and enhancing a reporting environment to meet business requirements, ensuring that Salesforce data is properly represented in internal and external KPI dashboards, and establishing and maintaining data quality requirements. You’ll work with Sales and other Onix teams to ensure that the accurate information is going into Salesforce and that processes are being followed. As needed, you’ll work on projects and other initiatives being deployed within the Sales, back office teams, and other users of Salesforce.

Primary Responsibilities:
The Salesforce Data/Reporting Analyst is responsible for ensuring that correct processes are being followed and that a level of governance is consistent across all Onix teams within Salesforce. In this role, you will be responsible for Salesforce and other connected tools as well as how those tools integrate with each other. You will be responsible for the day-to-day management of these tools, creating reports/dashboards with them and providing overall support.
Accountable for executing and processing of data change requests
Responsible for maintenance, administration and support of data elements
Ensures metadata, reference documentation, data files and data flows are accurate and up to date
Create mappings between fields in the different sources/systems
Support with data validation, quality issues, integrity, accuracy, consistency and works to resolve impacting issues related to data elements; de-duplication and cleaning
Assisting with data analysis in Salesforce
Creation and generation of reports on various metrics both quantitative and qualitative in Excel, Salesforce and other systems/tools
Salesforce.com admin support: User access administration, regular data loads, data validation
Maintain user roles and profiles within Salesforce; ensure hierarchy is up to date
Perform special projects as needed
Work with our management team to establish suitable processes to support administrative, development, and change management activities
Assist in training of new users and grow the Salesforce skill set across the organization
Work independently from the user base to define and document development requirements
Required Skills and Experience:
3-5 years of experience in data management, operations or business analyst role
Salesforce.com data base knowledge required, Administrator or Developer certification is a plus
Salesforce Data/Reporting Analyst (ADM201 and ADM211) certified
Strong Data Quality, Data Governance and Data Management experience required; Database/SQL skills is a plus
Past experience with integration technologies i.e. ETL, data migration and packaged applications
Experience supporting a sales/account management organization
Detailed oriented with strong organizational skills
Effective prioritization, organization and multitasking skills
Ability to work in fast paced, dynamic environment, meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Professionalism in dealing with all levels of management and staff
Strong understanding of Salesforce best practices and functionality
Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and prioritize simultaneous requests
Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
Ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
Preferred Skills and Experience:
Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and/or Developer certifications
Experience with FinanceForce and Conga
Strong understanding of the platform, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views and/or other content of intermediate complexity
A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Experience with cloud technologies (SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS)
Experience managing multiple salesforce environments and migrating functions and code between sandbox and production environments
Understanding of cloud based application governance models and version control of application development

Education: Bachelor's Degree or relevant experience
Travel Expectation: 0-5% Domestic | 0-5% International

Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Senior Data Analyst
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
Acting as a Data Analyst within the Core Credit Systems, Retail Banking & Payments Technology group you will have the opportunity to perform end-to-end requirements analysis and complete documentation for development projects of various complexity impacting the portfolio of a variety of systems used to service the loan and mortgage credit product. You will have the opportunity to manage multiple priorities and time constraints while delivering high-quality requirements. You will also have the opportunity to partner with various IT and business stakeholders.
What will you do?
Plan and execute detailed system requirements phases and identify, track, and resolve business systems issues
Assess, research, analyze, and document stakeholder needs, using the recommended or selecting the appropriate information gathering and data modelling technique to elicit requirements
Contribute to successful completion of project objectives with high quality, within budget, and on time
Review test plans, scenarios, cases as needed
Support Development, Quality Assurance and User Acceptance Testing activities
Build and maintain a repository of reusable system documentation
Identifying risks, dependencies, assumptions and constraints
Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, stakeholders, and business unit partners through all project phases
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:
5+ years of experience as a data analyst
Hands-on RDBMS SQL experience
Hands-on data modelling experience
Hands-on data mapping, (Host side data elements will definitely add value) experience
Nice-to-have:
Understanding of API
Understanding of streaming platform (e.g. Kafka)
Knowledge of banking and credit product concepts
Working knowledge of Confluence
Experience in financial credit domain
Understanding of Data governance. Ideally should have worked on Data-governance tools such as Collibra.
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

About Convera Convera is the largest non-bank B2B cross-border payments company in the world. Formerly Western Union Business Solutions, we leverage decades of industry expertise and technology-led payment solutions to deliver smarter money movements to our customers – helping them capture more value with every transaction. Convera serves more than 30,000 customers ranging from small business owners to enterprise treasurers to educational institutions to financial institutions to law firms to NGOs. Our teams care deeply about the value we bring to our customers which makes Convera a rewarding place to work. This is an exciting time for our organization as we build our team with growth-minded, results-oriented people who are looking to move fast in an innovative environment. As a truly global company with employees in over 20 countries, we are passionate about diversity; we seek and celebrate people from different backgrounds, lifestyles, and unique points of view. We want to work with the best people and ensure we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging. We offer an abundance of competitive perks and benefits including: • Market competitive monthly gross salary. • Opportunity to earn an annual bonus (dependent on level) • Great career growth and development opportunities in a global organization • A flexible approach to work • Generous insurance (health, disability, life) and retirement programs • Paid holidays, time-off and leave policies for life events (maternity, paternity, adoption, bereavement, military) • Paid volunteering opportunities There are plenty of amazing opportunities at Convera for talented, creative problem solvers who never settle for good enough and are looking to transform Business to Business payments. Apply now if you’re ready to unleash your potential.

Taro Pharmaceuticals is a multinational, specialty pharmaceutical company with a vision of reaching people and touching lives globally as a leading provider of valued medicines. We are dedicated to meeting the needs of our customers and the overall community through the innovation, development, manufacturing and marketing of the highest quality healthcare products.
Established in 1950, Taro’s world class production facility is located in Brampton, Ontario, with a current team of over 600 Canadian employees. Our company’s focus on the dermatology sector has made us a leading manufacturer and supplier of specialized topical products with a diverse portfolio of creams, ointments, liquids, and gels.
With support from our parent company, Sun Pharma, one of the world’s largest specialty generic pharmaceutical companies, we are committed to providing a healthy, safe and rewarding environment for all of our employees.

Position Description:
Fulltime/ Permanent
Location – Toronto, ON

Ready to join an outstanding culture that cares about diversity and inclusion, corporate social responsibility and gives the freedom to innovate, influence decisions, and chart an exciting career?

CGI is more than just an IT company. Be part of a team that supports the local community with the ability draw on global best-in-class talent! Benefits include a share purchase program, profit sharing, wellness credits, training and development programs, and flexible work schedules and locations.

CGI is seeking a Salesforce Business (Systems) Analyst to join our team!

In this role, you will work directly with both technical and business personnel across functional areas of the business. You will be responsible for the recommendation of automation solutions within Salesforce as well as third party tools. You will also work with a cross-functional team of IT and business resources to design solutions and work through the development and launch phases. Working with leaders across the business, you will collect requirements and present strategies for the implementation of new programs/initiatives, as well as the presentation of solutions.
Your future duties and responsibilities:
This is an exciting time for CGI, and we want you to be part of it.
We are Canada's largest independent information technology services firm, and we're still growing! We're expanding in Toronto Canada and we need your skills, enthusiasm, and dedication as part of our team.

What success looks like in this role:

Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate
5-7 years relevant experience.
Experience in Agile Methodology
Experience in Mulesoft/Salesforce is mandatory for this role. Certifications are an asset.
Experience in platform integration is an asset
Experience in CRM, Sales Platform and applications – especially Salesforce Platform is an asset
Experience in the Financial industry is an asset
Advanced to Expert knowledge of system analysis process and techniques
Advanced to Expert knowledge of systems and applications supported by the team including system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows, and business rules

Advanced understanding of business supported
Works independently as the senior or lead system analyst and coaches/ guides members within area of expertise
Subject matter expert and consults with clients and/or project teams

Insights you can act on

While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today — one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.

Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI — where your ideas and actions make a difference.

Our Client:
This highly respected downtown company is looking for a Sr. Business Analyst (Risk Technology) on a permanent and full time position.

Responsibilities:
Be part of the IT Risk team and help guide the product direction and delivery
Guide and support the Product Owner and Solution Architect in developing and realizing the product vision (develop roadmaps, manage scope, define minimal viable products, prioritize backlog, create stories to incorporate user and technical feedback etc.)
Hands on analysis and delivery of complex Risk solutions across a comprehensive set of asset classes (Equity, Fixed Income, Credit, Derivatives, FX, OTC products etc.)
Lead product delivery within and across department
Research and bring new and innovative Risk and Technology ideas to the table
Develop and foster relationships with the IT Team, their business partners (Traders, Portfolio managers, Security Operations, Data Management) and other IT teams to capture requirements, prototype solutions, provide demos, test and support the final deliverable
Propose innovative workflows, technology, use cases
Connects across other IT Teams to find synergies and partnership opportunities
Requirements:
5+ years of experience within Capital Markets (Banks, Asset Management Firms) in risk measurement, reporting, statistical analysis and quantitative work

Professional background in Technology and/or Financial Risk Management and/or Quantitative Finance

Breadth and dept of Investment Product knowledge

Technical aptitude, including Python, SQL, data modelling/relational data

Good understanding of front-, middle- and back-office processes
